ï»¿ [THE WHITE PEACOCK]421-the white peacock

D. H. LAWRENCE

PART I

CHAPTER [I]0-i

THE PEOPLE OF [NETHERMERE]1-nethermere

[I]0-i stood watching the shadowy fish slide through the gloom of [the mill - pond]422-the mill - pond . [They]423-they were grey , descendants of the silvery things that had darted away from [the monks]424-the monks , in the young days when [the valley]425-the valley was lusty . [The whole place]426-the whole place was gathered in the musing of old age . The thick - piled trees on [the far shore]427-the far shore were too dark and sober to dally with the sun ; the weeds stood crowded and motionless . Not even a little wind flickered the willows of [the islets]428-the islets . [The water]429-the water lay softly , intensely still . Only the thin stream falling through [the mill - race]430-the mill - race murmured to itself of the tumult of life which had once quickened [the valley]425-the valley .

[I]0-i was almost startled into the water from [my]0-i perch on the alder roots by a voice saying :

" Well , what is there to look at ? "[432-my friend] [[My]0-i friend]432-my friend was [a young farmer]433-a young farmer , stoutly built , brown eyed , with a naturally fair skin burned dark and freckled in patches . [He]433-a young farmer laughed , seeing [me]0-i start , and looked down at [me]0-i with lazy curiosity .

" [I]433-a young farmer was thinking [the place]4141-the place seemed old , brooding over [its]4141-the place past . "[433-a young farmer]

[He]433-a young farmer looked at [me]0-i with a lazy indulgent smile , and lay down on [his]433-a young farmer back on [the bank]434-the bank , saying : " It 's all right for a doss here . "[433-a young farmer]

" [Your]433-a young farmer life is nothing else but a doss . [I]0-i shall laugh when [somebody]4142-somebody jerks [you]433-a young farmer awake , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .

[He]433-a young farmer smiled comfortably and put [his]433-a young farmer hands over [his]433-a young farmer eyes because of the light .

" Why shall [you]0-i laugh ? "[433-a young farmer] [he]433-a young farmer drawled .

" Because [you]433-a young farmer 'll be amusing , "[433-a young farmer] said I.

[We]435-we were silent for a long time , when [he]433-a young farmer rolled over and began to poke with [his]433-a young farmer finger in the bank .

" [I]433-a young farmer thought , "[433-a young farmer] [he]433-a young farmer said in [his]433-a young farmer leisurely fashion , " there was some cause for all this buzzing . "[433-a young farmer]

[I]0-i looked , and saw that [he]433-a young farmer had poked out an old , papery nest of those pretty field bees which seem to have dipped their tails into bright amber dust . Some agitated insects ran round the cluster of eggs , most of which were empty now , the crowns gone ; a few young bees staggered about in uncertain flight before [they]436-they could gather power to wing away in a strong course . [He]433-a young farmer watched the little ones that ran in and out among the shadows of the grass , hither and thither in consternation .

" Come here come here ! "[433-a young farmer] [he]433-a young farmer said , imprisoning [one poor little bee under a grass stalk]437-one poor little bee under a grass stalk , while with another stalk [he]433-a young farmer loosened the folded blue wings .

" Do n't tease [the little beggar]4143-the little beggar , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" It does n't hurt [him]4143-the little beggar [I]433-a young farmer wanted to see if it was because [he]4143-the little beggar could n't spread [his]4143-the little beggar wings that [he]4143-the little beggar could n't fly . There [he]4143-the little beggar goes no , [he]4143-the little beggar does n't . Let 's try another . "[433-a young farmer]

" Leave [them]4144-them alone , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " Let [them]4144-them run in the sun . [They]4144-them 're only just out of the shells . Do n't torment [them]4144-them into flight . "[0-i]

[He]433-a young farmer persisted , however , and broke the wing of the next .

" Oh , dear pity ! "[433-a young farmer] said [he]433-a young farmer , and [he]433-a young farmer crushed the little thing between [his]433-a young farmer fingers . Then [he]433-a young farmer examined the eggs , and pulled out some silk from round the dead larva , and investigated it all in a desultory manner , asking of [me]0-i all [I]0-i knew about the insects . When [he]433-a young farmer had finished [he]433-a young farmer flung the clustered eggs into the water and rose , pulling out [his]433-a young farmer watch from the depth of [his]433-a young farmer breeches ' pocket .

" [I]433-a young farmer thought it was about dinner - time , "[433-a young farmer] said [he]433-a young farmer , smiling at [me]0-i . " [I]433-a young farmer always know when it 's about twelve . Are [you]0-i coming in ? "[433-a young farmer]

" [I]0-i 'm coming down at any rate , "[0-i] said [I]0-i as [we]438-we passed along [the pond bank]439-the pond bank , and over the plank - bridge that crossed [the brow of [the falling sluice]441-the falling sluice]440-the brow of the falling sluice . [The bankside where [the grey orchard]443-the grey orchard twisted [its]443-the grey orchard trees]442-the bankside where the grey orchard twisted its trees , was a steep declivity , long and sharp , dropping down to [the garden]444-the garden .

The stones of [the large house]445-the large house were burdened with ivy and honey - suckle , and the great lilac - bush that had once guarded [the porch]446-the porch now almost blocked the doorway . [We]438-we passed out of [the front garden]447-the front garden into [the farm - yard]448-the farm - yard , and walked along [the brick path]449-the brick path to the back door .

" Shut the gate , will [you]0-i ? "[450-his] [he]450-his said to [me]0-i over [his]450-his shoulder , as [he]450-his passed on first .

[We]438-we went through the large scullery into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen . [The servant - girl]452-the servant - girl was just hurriedly snatching the table - cloth out of the table drawer , and [[his]450-his mother]453-his mother , [a quaint little woman with big , brown eyes]454-a quaint little woman with big , brown eyes , was hovering round the wide fireplace with a fork .

" Dinner not ready ? "[450-his] said [he]450-his with a shade of resentment .

" No , [George]108-george , "[453-his mother] replied [[his]450-his mother]453-his mother apologetically , " it is n't . The fire would n't burn a bit . [You]108-george shall have it in a few minutes , though . "[453-his mother]

[He]450-his dropped on the sofa and began to read a novel . [I]0-i wanted to go , but [[his]450-his mother]453-his mother insisted on [my]0-i staying .

" Do n't go , "[453-his mother] [she]453-his mother pleaded . " [Emily]109-emily will be so glad if [you]108-george stay , and [father]4145-father will , [I]453-his mother 'm sure . Sit down , now . "[453-his mother]

[I]0-i sat down on a rush chair by the long window that looked out into [the yard]457-the yard . As [he]450-his was reading , and as it took all [[his]450-his mother]453-his mother 's powers to watch the potatoes boil and the meat roast , [I]0-i was left to [my]0-i thoughts . [George]108-george , indifferent to all claims , continued to read . It was very annoying to watch [him]450-his pulling [his]450-his brown moustache , and reading indolently while the dog rubbed against [his]450-his leggings and against the knee of [his]450-his old riding - breeches . [He]450-his would not even be at the trouble to play with [Trip]110-trip 's ears , [he]450-his was so content with [his]450-his novel and [his]450-his moustache . Round and round twirled [his]450-his thick fingers , and the muscles of [his]450-his bare arm moved slightly under the red - brown skin . The little square window above [him]450-his filtered a green light from the foliage of the great horse - chestnut outside and the glimmer fell on [his]450-his dark hair , and trembled across the plates which [Annie]111-annie was reaching down from the rack , and across the face of the tall clock . [The kitchen]451-the kitchen was very big ; the table looked lonely , and the chairs mourned darkly for the lost companionship of the sofa ; the chimney was a black cavern away at the back , and the inglenook seats shut in another little compartment ruddy with fire - light , where [the mother]460-the mother hovered . It was rather [a desolate kitchen]461-a desolate kitchen , such a bare expanse of uneven grey flagstones , such far - away dark corners and sober furniture . The only gay things were the chintz coverings of the sofa and the arm - chair cushions , bright red in [the bare sombre room]462-the bare sombre room ; [some]463-some might smile at the old clock , adorned as it was with remarkable and vivid poultry ; in [me]0-i it only provoked wonder and contemplation .

In a little while [we]464-we heard the scraping of heavy boots outside , and [the father]465-the father entered . [He]465-the father was [a big burly farmer]466-a big burly farmer , with [his]465-the father half - bald head sprinkled with crisp little curls .

" [Hullo]112-hullo , [Cyril]113-cyril , "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said cheerfully . " [You]113-cyril 've not forsaken [us]464-we then , "[465-the father] and turning to [[his]465-the father son]467-his son :

" Have [you]467-his son many more rows in the coppice close ? "[465-the father]

" Finished ! "[108-george] replied [George]108-george , continuing to read .

" That 's all right [you]467-his son 've got on with 'em . The rabbits has bitten them turnips down , [mother]4146-mother . "[465-the father]

" [I]468-his wife expect so , "[468-his wife] replied [[his]465-the father wife]468-his wife , whose soul was in the saucepans . At last [she]468-his wife deemed the potatoes cooked and went out with the steaming pan .

The dinner was set on the table and [the father]465-the father began to carve . [George]108-george looked over [his]108-george book to survey the fare then read until [his]108-george plate was handed [him]108-george . [The maid]470-the maid sat at [her]470-the maid little table near the window , and [we]471-we began the meal . There came the treading of four feet along [the brick path]449-the brick path , and [a little girl]473-a little girl entered , followed by [[her]473-a little girl grown - up sister]474-her grown - up sister . [The child]475-the child 's long brown hair was tossed wildly back beneath [her]473-a little girl sailor hat . [She]473-a little girl flung aside this article of [her]473-a little girl attire and sat down to dinner , talking endlessly to [[her]473-a little girl mother]476-her mother . [The elder sister]477-the elder sister , [a girl of about twenty - one]478-a girl of about twenty - one , gave [me]0-i a smile and a bright look from [her]477-the elder sister brown eyes , and went to wash [her]477-the elder sister hands . Then [she]477-the elder sister came and sat down , and looked disconsolately at the underdone beef on [her]477-the elder sister plate .

" [I]477-the elder sister do hate this raw meat , "[477-the elder sister] [she]477-the elder sister said .

" Good for [you]0-i , "[479-her brother] replied [[her]477-the elder sister brother]479-her brother , who was eating industriously . " Give [you]0-i some muscle to wallop the nippers . "[479-her brother]

[She]477-the elder sister pushed it aside , and began to eat the vegetables . [[Her]477-the elder sister brother]479-her brother re - charged [his]479-her brother plate and continued to eat .

" Well , [[our]4147-our George]4148-our george , [I]114-meg do think [you]4148-our george might pass a body that gravy , "[114-meg] said [Mollie]114-meg , [the younger sister]481-the younger sister , in injured tones .

" Certainly , "[479-her brother] [he]479-her brother replied . " Wo n't [you]4148-our george have the joint as well ? "[479-her brother]

" No ! "[482-the young lady of twelve] retorted [the young lady of twelve]482-the young lady of twelve , " [I]482-the young lady of twelve do n't expect [you]4148-our george 've done with it yet . "[482-the young lady of twelve]

" Clever ! "[479-her brother] [he]479-her brother exclaimed across a mouthful .

" Do [you]4148-our george think so ? "[477-the elder sister] said [the elder sister]477-the elder sister [Emily]109-emily , sarcastically .

" Yes , "[479-her brother] [he]479-her brother replied complacently , " [you]109-emily 've made [her]4149-her as sharp as [yourself]109-emily , [I]479-her brother see , since [you]109-emily 've had [her]4149-her in Standard Six . [I]479-her brother 'll try a potato , [mother]4146-mother , if [you]109-emily can find one that 's done . "[479-her brother]

" Well , [George]108-george , [they]4151-they seem mixed , [I]114-meg 'm sure that was done that [I]114-meg tried . There [they]4151-they are mixed look at this one , it 's soft enough . [I]114-meg 'm sure they were boiling long enough . "[114-meg]

" Do n't explain and apologise to [him]479-her brother , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily irritably .

" Perhaps [the kids]4152-the kids were too much for [her]114-meg this morning , "[479-her brother] [he]479-her brother said calmly , to [nobody in particular]484-nobody in particular .

" No , "[114-meg] chimed in [Mollie]114-meg , ' [she]114-meg knocked [a lad]485-a lad across [his]485-a lad nose and made it bleed . "[114-meg]

" [Little wretch]4153-little wretch , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , swallowing with difficulty . " [I]109-emily 'm glad [I]109-emily did ! [Some of [[my]109-emily lads]4155-my lads]4154-some of my lads belong to to "[109-emily]

" To the devil , "[108-george] suggested [George]108-george , but [she]109-emily would not accept it from [him]108-george .

[[Her]109-emily father]486-her father sat laughing ; [[her]109-emily mother]476-her mother with distress in [her]476-her mother eyes , looked at [[her]476-her mother daughter]488-her daughter , who hung [her]476-her mother head and made patterns on the table - cloth with [her]476-her mother finger .

" Are they worse than the last lot ? "[460-the mother] asked [the mother]460-the mother , softly , fearfully .

" No nothing extra , "[460-the mother] was the curt answer .

" [She]488-her daughter merely felt like bashing ['em]4156-'em , "[108-george] said [George]108-george , calling , as [he]108-george looked at the sugar bowl and at [his]108-george pudding :

" Fetch some more sugar , [Annie]111-annie . "[108-george]

[The maid]470-the maid rose from [her]470-the maid little table in the corner , and [the mother]460-the mother also hurried to the cupboard . [Emily]109-emily trifled with [her]109-emily dinner and said bitterly to [him]108-george :

" [I]109-emily only wish [you]108-george had a taste of teaching , it would cure [your]108-george self - satisfaction . "[109-emily]

" Pf ! "[108-george] [he]108-george replied contemptuously , " [I]108-george could easily bleed the noses of [a handful of [kids]4158-kids]4157-a handful of kids . "[108-george]

" [You]108-george would n't sit there bleating like a fatted calf , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily continued .

This speech so tickled [Mollie]114-meg that [she]109-emily went off into a burst of laughter , much to the terror of [[her]109-emily mother]476-her mother , who stood up in trembling apprehension lest [she]460-the mother should choke .

" [You]109-emily made a joke , [Emily]109-emily , "[108-george] [he]108-george said , looking at [[his]108-george younger sister]493-his younger sister 's contortions .

[Emily]109-emily was too impatient to speak to [him]108-george further , and left the table . Soon [the two men]494-the two men went back to the fallow to the turnips , and [I]0-i walked along [the path]495-the path with [the girls]496-the girls as [they]494-the two men were going to [school]497-school .

" [He]108-george irritates [me]109-emily in everything [he]108-george does and says , "[109-emily] burst out [Emily]109-emily with much heat .

" [He]108-george 's [a pig]4159-a pig sometimes , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [He]108-george is ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily insisted . " [He]108-george irritates [me]109-emily past bearing , with [his]108-george grand know - all way , and [his]108-george heavy smartness [I]109-emily ca n't beat it . And the way [mother]4146-mother humbles [herself]4146-mother to [him]108-george ! "[109-emily]

" It makes [you]109-emily wild , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Wild ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily echoed , [her]109-emily voice vibrating with nervous passion . [We]498-we walked on in silence , till [she]109-emily asked .

" Have [you]0-i brought [me]109-emily those verses of [yours]0-i ? "[109-emily]

" No [I]109-emily 'm so sorry [I]109-emily 've forgotten them again . As a matter of fact , [I]109-emily 've sent them away . "[109-emily]

" But [you]0-i promised [me]109-emily . "[109-emily]

" [You]0-i know what [my]109-emily promises are . [I]109-emily 'm as irresponsible as a puff of wind . "[109-emily]

[She]109-emily frowned with impatience and [her]109-emily disappointment was greater than necessary . When [I]0-i left [her]109-emily at the corner of [the lane]499-the lane [I]0-i felt a sting of [her]109-emily deep reproach in [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i always felt the reproach when [she]109-emily had gone .

[I]0-i ran over [the little bright brook that came from [the weedy , bottom pond]501-the weedy , bottom pond]500-the little bright brook that came from the weedy , bottom pond . The stepping - stones were white in the sun , and the water slid sleepily among them . One or two butterflies , indistinguishable against the blue sky , trifled from flower to flower and led [me]0-i up [the hill]502-the hill , across [the field where the hot sunshine stood as in a bowl]503-the field where the hot sunshine stood as in a bowl , and [I]0-i was entering the caverns of [the wood]504-the wood , where the oaks bowed over and saved [us]505-us a grateful shade . Within , everything was so still and cool that [my]0-i steps hung heavily along [the path]495-the path . The bracken held out arms to [me]0-i , and the bosom of the wood was full of sweetness , but [I]0-i journeyed on , spurred by the attacks of an army of flies which kept up a guerrilla warfare round [my]0-i head till [I]0-i had passed the black rhododendron bushes in [the garden]444-the garden , where [they]508-they left [me]0-i , scenting no doubt [Rebecca]115-rebecca 's pots of vinegar and sugar .

[The low red house]509-the low red house , with [its]509-the low red house roof discoloured and sunken , dozed in sunlight , and slept profoundly in the shade thrown by the massive maples encroaching from the wood .

There was [no one]510-no one in [the dining - room]511-the dining - room , but [I]0-i could hear the whirr of a sewing - machine coming from [the little study]512-the little study , a sound as of some great , vindictive insect buzzing about , now louder , now softer , now settling . Then came a jingling of four or five keys at the bottom of the keyboard of the drawing - room piano , continuing till the whole range had been covered in little leaps , as if some very fat frog had jumped from end to end .

" That must be [mother]4146-mother dusting [the drawing - room]4162-the drawing - room , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought . The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled [me]0-i . The vocal chords behind the green silk bosom , [you]513-you only discovered it was not a bronze silk bosom by poking a fold aside , had become as thin and tuneless as [a dried old woman]514-a dried old woman 's . Age had yellowed the teeth of [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother 's little piano , and shrunken its spindle legs . Poor old thing , it could but screech in answer to [Lettie]116-lettie 's fingers flying across it in scorn , so the prim , brown lips were always closed save to admit the duster .

Now , however , [the little old maidish piano]516-the little old maidish piano began to sing a tinkling Victorian melody , and [I]0-i fancied it must be [some demure little woman with curls like bunches of hops on either side of [her]517-some demure little woman with curls like bunches of hops on either side of her face , who was touching it face , who was touching it]517-some demure little woman with curls like bunches of hops on either side of her face , who was touching it . The coy little tune teased [me]0-i with old sensations , but [my]0-i memory would give [me]0-i no assistance . As [I]0-i stood trying to fix [my]0-i vague feelings , [Rebecca]115-rebecca came in to remove the cloth from the table .

" Who is playing , [Beck]115-rebecca ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [[Your]115-rebecca mother]4163-your mother , [Cyril]113-cyril . "[115-rebecca]

" But [she]4163-your mother never plays . [I]115-rebecca thought [she]4163-your mother could n't . "[115-rebecca]

" Ah , "[115-rebecca] replied [Rebecca]115-rebecca , " [you]0-i forget when [you]0-i was a little thing sitting playing against [her]4163-your mother frock with the prayer - book , and [she]4163-your mother singing to [you]0-i . [You]0-i ca n't remember [her]4163-your mother when [her]4163-your mother curls was long like a piece of brown silk . [You]0-i ca n't remember [her]4163-your mother when [she]4163-your mother used to play and sing , before [Lettie]116-lettie came and [[your]0-i father]4164-your father was "[115-rebecca]

[Rebecca]115-rebecca turned and left [the room]518-the room . [I]0-i went and peeped in [the drawing - room]4162-the drawing - room . [Mother]117-mother sat before the little brown piano , with [her]117-mother plump , rather stiff fingers moving across the keys , a faint smile on [her]117-mother lips . At that moment [Lettie]116-lettie came flying past [me]0-i , and flung [her]116-lettie arms round [mother]4146-mother 's neck , kissing [her]4146-mother and saying :

" Oh , [[my]116-lettie Dear]4165-my dear , fancy [[my]116-lettie Dear]4165-my dear playing the piano ! Oh , [Little Woman]118-little woman , [we]4167-we never knew [you]118-little woman could ! "[116-lettie]

" Nor can [I]4146-mother , "[4146-mother] replied [mother]4146-mother laughing , disengaging [herself]4146-mother . " [I]4146-mother only wondered if [I]4146-mother could just strum out this old tune ; [I]4146-mother learned it when [I]4146-mother was quite [a girl]4168-a girl , on this piano . " But play again , [dearie]4169-dearie , do play again . It was like the clinking of lustre glasses , and [you]4169-dearie look so quaint at the piano . Do play , [[my]116-lettie dear]4165-my dear ! "[116-lettie] pleaded [Lettie]116-lettie .

" Only down to [Strelley Mill]2-strelley mill , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

Then [she]116-lettie tossed [her]116-lettie head , and all the fine hairs that were free from bonds made a mist of yellow light in the sun .

" [I]116-lettie think [I]116-lettie 'll wear the heliotrope though this sun will fade it , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said pensively . [She]116-lettie was tall , nearly six feet in height , but slenderly formed . [Her]116-lettie hair was yellow , tending towards a dun brown . [She]116-lettie had beautiful eyes and brows , but not a nice nose . [Her]116-lettie hands were very beautiful .

" Where are [you]116-lettie going ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

[She]116-lettie did not answer [me]0-i .

" Ooray ! "[0-i] said [I]0-i with fine irony .

[She]116-lettie laughed at [me]0-i , blushed , and ran [upstairs]532-upstairs .

Half an hour afterwards [she]116-lettie popped [her]116-lettie head in [the study]533-the study to bid [me]0-i good - bye , wishing to see if [I]0-i appreciated [her]116-lettie . [She]116-lettie was so charming in [her]116-lettie fresh linen frock and flowered hat , that [I]0-i could not but be proud of [her]116-lettie . [She]116-lettie expected [me]0-i to follow [her]116-lettie to the window , for from between the great purple rhododendrons [she]116-lettie waved [me]0-i a lace mitten , then glinted on like a flower moving brightly through the green hazels . [Her]116-lettie path lay through the wood in the opposite direction from [Strelley Mill]2-strelley mill , down [the red drive]534-the red drive across the tree - scattered space to [the highroad]535-the highroad . [This road]536-this road ran along the end of [[our]537-our lakelet]538-our lakelet , [Nethermere]1-nethermere , for about a quarter of a mile . [Nethermere]1-nethermere is the lowest in [a chain of [three ponds]540-three ponds]539-a chain of three ponds . The other two are [the upper and lower mill ponds]541-the upper and lower mill ponds at [Strelley]4-strelley : this is [the largest and most charming piece of water]542-the largest and most charming piece of water , a mile long and about a quarter of a mile in width . [[Our]537-our wood]543-our wood runs down to [the water]429-the water 's edge . On the opposite side , on [a hill beyond the farthest corner of [the lake]546-the lake]545-a hill beyond the farthest corner of the lake , stands Highclose . [It]547-it looks across [the water]429-the water at [us]537-our in Woodside with one eye as it were , while [[our]537-our cottage]549-our cottage casts a sidelong glance back again at [the proud house]550-the proud house , and peeps coyly through the trees .

[I]0-i could see [Lettie]116-lettie like a distant sail stealing along [the water]429-the water 's edge , [her]116-lettie parasol flowing above . [She]116-lettie turned through [the wicket under the pine clump]552-the wicket under the pine clump , climbed [the steep field]553-the steep field , and was enfolded again in the trees beside Highclose .

[Leslie]121-leslie was sprawled on a camp - chair , under a copper beech on [the lawn]554-the lawn , [his]121-leslie cigar glowing . [He]121-leslie watched the ash grow strange and grey in the warm daylight , and [he]121-leslie felt sorry for [poor [Nell Wycherley]122-poor nell wycherley , whom he had driven that morning to the station , whom [he]121-leslie had driven that morning to [the station]555-the station]122-poor nell wycherley , whom he had driven that morning to the station , for would [she]122-poor nell wycherley , whom he had driven that morning to the station not be frightfully cut up as [the train]556-the train whirled [her]122-poor nell wycherley , whom he had driven that morning to the station further and further away ? [These girls]557-these girls are so daft with [a fellow]558-a fellow ! But [she]122-poor nell wycherley , whom he had driven that morning to the station was a nice little thing [he]121-leslie 'd get [Marie]114-meg to write to [her]122-poor nell wycherley , whom he had driven that morning to the station .

At this point [he]121-leslie caught sight of a parasol fluttering along [the drive]559-the drive , and immediately [he]121-leslie fell into a deep sleep , with just a tiny slit in [his]121-leslie slumber to allow [him]121-leslie to see [Lettie]116-lettie approach . [She]116-lettie , finding [[her]116-lettie watchman]560-her watchman ungallantly asleep , and [his]121-leslie cigar , instead of [his]121-leslie lamp untrimmed , broke off a twig of syringa whose ivory buds had not yet burst with luscious scent . [I]0-i know not how the end of [his]121-leslie nose tickled in anticipation before [she]116-lettie tickled [him]121-leslie in reality , but [he]121-leslie kept bravely still until the petals swept [him]121-leslie . Then , starting from [his]121-leslie sleep , [he]121-leslie exclaimed : " [Lettie]116-lettie ! [I]121-leslie was dreaming of kisses ! "[121-leslie]

" On the bridge of [your]121-leslie nose ? "[116-lettie] laughed [she]116-lettie " But whose were the kisses ? "[121-leslie]

" [Who produced the sensation]4181-who produced the sensation ? "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie smiled .

" Since [I]121-leslie only tapped [your]116-lettie nose [you]116-lettie should dream of "[121-leslie]

" Go on ! "[121-leslie] said [he]121-leslie , expectantly .

" No [your]121-leslie nose is quite classic , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie answered , giving [him]121-leslie one of those brief intimate glances with which [women]561-women flatter [men]562-men so cleverly . [He]121-leslie radiated with pleasure .

CHAPTER II

DANGLING THE APPLE

The long - drawn booming of the wind in the wood and the sobbing and moaning in the maples and oaks near [the house]563-the house , had made [Lettie]116-lettie restless . [She]116-lettie did not want to go anywhere , [she]116-lettie did not want to do anything , so [she]116-lettie insisted on [my]0-i just going out with [her]116-lettie as far as [the edge of [the water]429-the water]564-the edge of the water . [We]566-we crossed the tangle of fern and bracken , bramble and wild raspberry canes that spread in the open space before [the house]563-the house , and [we]566-we went down [the grassy slope]568-the grassy slope to [the edge of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]569-the edge of nethermere . The wind whipped up noisy little wavelets , and the cluck and clatter of these among the pebbles , the swish of the rushes and the freshening of the breeze against [our]566-we faces , roused [us]566-we .

[The tall meadow - sweet]570-the tall meadow - sweet was in bud along [the tiny beach]571-the tiny beach and [we]566-we walked knee - deep among [it]570-the tall meadow - sweet , watching the foamy race of the ripples and the whitening of the willows on [the far shore]427-the far shore . At [the place where [Nethermere]1-nethermere narrows to the upper end , and receives [the brook]574-the brook from [Strelley]4-strelley]573-the place where nethermere narrows to the upper end , and receives the brook from strelley , the wood sweeps down and stands with its feet washed round with waters . [We]566-we broke [our]566-we way along [the shore]575-the shore , crushing the sharp - scented wild mint , whose odour checks the breath , and examining here and there among the marshy places ragged nests of water - fowl , now deserted . Some slim young lap - wings started at [our]566-we approach , and sped lightly from [us]566-we , [their]576-they necks outstretched in straining fear of that which could not hurt [them]576-they . One , two , fled cheeping into cover of the wood ; almost instantly [they]576-they coursed back again to where [we]566-we stood , to dart off from [us]566-we at an angle , in an ecstasy of bewilderment and terror .

" What has frightened the crazy little things ? "[116-lettie] asked [Lettie]116-lettie .

" [I]116-lettie do n't know . [They]576-they 've cheek enough sometimes ; then [they]576-they go whining , skelping off from a fancy as if [they]576-they had a snake under [their]576-they wings . "[116-lettie]

[Lettie]116-lettie however paid small attention to [my]0-i eloquence . [She]116-lettie pushed aside an elder bush , which graciously showered down upon [her]116-lettie myriad crumbs from its flowers like slices of bread , and bathed [her]116-lettie in a medicinal scent . [I]0-i followed [her]116-lettie , taking [my]0-i dose , and was startled to hear [her]116-lettie sudden , " Oh , [Cyril]113-cyril ! "[116-lettie]

On the bank before [us]566-we lay a black cat , both hindpaws torn and bloody in a trap . [It]577-her had no doubt been bounding forward after its prey when it was caught . [It]577-her was gaunt and wild ; no wonder it frightened the poor lap - wings into cheeping hysteria . [It]577-her glared at [us]566-we fiercely , growling low .

" How cruel oh , how cruel ! "[116-lettie] cried [Lettie]116-lettie , shuddering .

[I]0-i wrapped [my]0-i cap and [Lettie]116-lettie 's scarf over [my]0-i hands and bent to open the trap . The cat struck with [her]577-her teeth , tearing the cloth convulsively . When it was free , it sprang away with one bound , and fell panting , watching [us]566-we .

[I]0-i wrapped the creature in [my]0-i jacket , and picked [her]577-her up , murmuring :

" [Poor Mrs. Nickie Ben]124-poor mrs. nickie ben [we]566-we always prophesied it of [you]577-her . "[0-i]

" What will [you]0-i do with it ? "[116-lettie] asked [Lettie]116-lettie .

" [It]577-her is one of [the Strelley Mill cats]4183-the strelley mill cats , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and so [I]0-i 'll take [her]577-her [home]4184-home . "[0-i]

The poor animal moved and murmured and [I]0-i carried [her]577-her , but [we]566-we brought [her]577-her [home]4184-home . [They]579-they stared , on seeing [me]0-i enter [the kitchen]451-the kitchen coatless , carrying a strange bundle , while [Lettie]116-lettie followed [me]0-i .

" [I]0-i have brought [poor Mrs. Nickie Ben]124-poor mrs. nickie ben , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , unfolding [my]0-i burden .

" Oh , what a shame ! "[109-emily] cried [Emily]109-emily , putting out [her]109-emily hand to touch the cat , but drawing quickly back , like the pee - wits .

" This is how [they]579-they all go , "[460-the mother] said [the mother]460-the mother .

" [I]114-meg wish [keepers]4185-keepers had to sit two or three days with [their]4185-keepers bare ankles in a trap , "[114-meg] said [Mollie]114-meg in vindictive tones .

[We]566-we laid [the poor brute]582-the poor brute on the rug , and gave [it]582-the poor brute warm milk . [It]582-the poor brute drank very little , being too feeble , [Mollie]114-meg , full of anger , fetched [Mr. Nickie Ben]125-mr. nickie ben , another fine black cat , to survey [[his]125-mr. nickie ben crippled mate]583-his crippled mate . [Mr. Nickie Ben]125-mr. nickie ben looked , shrugged [his]125-mr. nickie ben sleek shoulders , and walked away with high steps . There was a general feminine outcry on masculine callousness .

[George]108-george came in for hot water . [He]108-george exclaimed in surprise on seeing [us]566-we , and [his]108-george eyes became animated .

" Look at [Mrs. Nickie Ben]124-poor mrs. nickie ben , "[114-meg] cried [Mollie]114-meg . [He]125-mr. nickie ben dropped on [his]125-mr. nickie ben knees on the rug and lifted the wounded paws .

" Broken , "[125-mr. nickie ben] said [he]125-mr. nickie ben .

" How awful ! "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , shuddering violently , and leaving [the room]518-the room .

" Both ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Only one look ! "[460-the mother]

" [You]116-lettie are hurting [her]124-poor mrs. nickie ben ! "[116-lettie] cried [Lettie]116-lettie .

" It 's no good , "[125-mr. nickie ben] said [he]125-mr. nickie ben .

[Mollie]114-meg and [the mother]460-the mother hurried out of [the kitchen]451-the kitchen into [the parlour]587-the parlour .

" What are [you]116-lettie going to do ? "[116-lettie] asked [Lettie]116-lettie .

" Put [her]124-poor mrs. nickie ben out of [her]124-poor mrs. nickie ben misery , "[125-mr. nickie ben] [he]125-mr. nickie ben replied , taking up the poor cat . [We]588-we followed [him]125-mr. nickie ben into [the barn]589-the barn .

" The quickest way , "[125-mr. nickie ben] said [he]125-mr. nickie ben , " is to swing [her]124-poor mrs. nickie ben round and knock [her]124-poor mrs. nickie ben head against the wall . "[125-mr. nickie ben]

" [You]116-lettie make [me]116-lettie sick , "[116-lettie] exclaimed [Lettie]116-lettie .

" [I]125-mr. nickie ben 'll drown [her]124-poor mrs. nickie ben then , "[125-mr. nickie ben] [he]125-mr. nickie ben said with a smile . [We]588-we watched [him]125-mr. nickie ben morbidly , as [he]125-mr. nickie ben took a length of twine and fastened a noose round the animal 's neck , and near it an iron goose ; [he]125-mr. nickie ben kept a long piece of cord attached to the goose .

" [You]116-lettie 're not coming , are [you]116-lettie ? "[125-mr. nickie ben] said [he]125-mr. nickie ben . [Lettie]116-lettie looked at [him]125-mr. nickie ben ; [she]116-lettie had grown rather white .

" It 'll make [you]116-lettie sick , "[125-mr. nickie ben] [he]125-mr. nickie ben said . [She]116-lettie did not answer , but followed [him]125-mr. nickie ben across [the yard]457-the yard to [the garden]444-the garden . On [the bank of [the lower mill - pond]593-the lower mill - pond]592-the bank of the lower mill - pond [he]125-mr. nickie ben turned again to [us]588-we and said :

" Now for it ! [you]588-we are [chief mourners]4186-chief mourners . "[125-mr. nickie ben] As [neither of [us]588-we]594-neither of us replied , [he]125-mr. nickie ben smiled , and dropped the poor writhing cat into the water , saying , " Good - bye , [Mrs. Nickie Ben]124-poor mrs. nickie ben . "[125-mr. nickie ben]

[We]588-we waited on [the bank]434-the bank some time . [He]125-mr. nickie ben eyed [us]588-we curiously .

" [Cyril]113-cyril , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie quietly , " is n't it cruel ? is n't it awful ? "[116-lettie]

[I]0-i had nothing to say .

" Do [you]108-george mean [me]108-george ? "[108-george] asked [George]108-george .

" Not [you]108-george in particular everything ! If [we]588-we move the blood rises in [our]588-we heel - prints . "[125-mr. nickie ben]

[He]125-mr. nickie ben looked at [her]116-lettie seriously , with dark eyes .

" [I]125-mr. nickie ben had to drown [her]116-lettie out of mercy , "[125-mr. nickie ben] said [he]125-mr. nickie ben , fastening the cord [he]125-mr. nickie ben held to an ash - pole . Then [he]125-mr. nickie ben went to get a spade , and with it , [he]125-mr. nickie ben dug a grave in the old black earth .

" If , "[125-mr. nickie ben] said [he]125-mr. nickie ben , " the poor old cat had made [a prettier corpse]4187-a prettier corpse , [you]108-george 'd have thrown violets on [her]116-lettie . "[125-mr. nickie ben]

[He]125-mr. nickie ben had struck the spade into the ground , and hauled up the cat and the iron goose .

" Well , "[125-mr. nickie ben] [he]125-mr. nickie ben said , surveying the hideous object , " have n't [her]116-lettie good looks gone ! [She]116-lettie was a fine cat . "[125-mr. nickie ben]

" Bury it and have done , "[116-lettie] [Lettie]116-lettie replied .

[He]125-mr. nickie ben did so asking : " Shall [you]116-lettie have bad dreams after it ? "[125-mr. nickie ben]

" Dreams do not trouble [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie answered , turning away .

[We]596-we went indoors , into [the parlour]587-the parlour , where [Emily]109-emily sat by a window , biting [her]109-emily finger . [The room]518-the room was long and not very high ; there was a great rough beam across the ceiling . On the mantel - piece , and in the fireplace , and over the piano were wild flowers and fresh leaves plentifully scattered ; [the room]518-the room was cool with the scent of [the woods]600-the woods .

" Has [he]125-mr. nickie ben done it ? "[109-emily] asked [Emily]109-emily " and did [you]116-lettie watch [him]125-mr. nickie ben ? If [I]109-emily had seen it [I]109-emily should have hated the sight of [him]125-mr. nickie ben , and [I]109-emily 'd rather have touched a maggot than [him]125-mr. nickie ben . "[109-emily]

" [I]116-lettie should n't be particularly pleased if [he]125-mr. nickie ben touched [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie .

" There is something so loathsome about callousness and brutality , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily . " [He]125-mr. nickie ben fills [me]109-emily with disgust . "[109-emily]

" Does [he]125-mr. nickie ben ? "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , smiling coldly . [She]116-lettie went across to the old piano . " [He]125-mr. nickie ben 's only healthy . [He]125-mr. nickie ben 's never been sick , not anyway , yet . "[116-lettie] [She]116-lettie sat down and played at random , letting the numbed notes fall like dead leaves from the haughty , ancient piano .

[Emily]109-emily and [I]0-i talked on by the window , about books and [people]601-people . [She]116-lettie was intensely serious , and generally succeeded in reducing [me]0-i to the same state .

After a while , when the milking and feeding were finished , [George]108-george came in . [Lettie]116-lettie was still playing the piano . [He]108-george asked [her]116-lettie why [she]116-lettie did n't play something with a tune in it , and this caused [her]116-lettie to turn round in [her]116-lettie chair to give [him]108-george a withering answer . [His]108-george appearance , however , scattered [her]116-lettie words like startled birds . [He]108-george had come straight from washing in [the scullery]602-the scullery , to [the parlour]587-the parlour , and [he]108-george stood behind [Lettie]116-lettie 's chair unconcernedly wiping the moisture from [his]108-george arms . [His]108-george sleeves were rolled up to the shoulder , and [his]108-george shirt was opened wide at the breast . [Lettie]116-lettie was somewhat taken aback by the sight of [him]108-george standing with legs apart , dressed in dirty leggings and boots , and breeches torn at the knee , naked at the breast and arms .

" Why do n't [you]116-lettie play something with a tune in it ? "[108-george] [he]108-george repeated , rubbing the towel over [his]108-george shoulders beneath the shirt .

" A tune ! "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie echoed , watching the swelling of [his]108-george arms as [he]108-george moved them , and the rise and fall of [his]108-george breasts , wonderfully solid and white . Then having curiously examined the sudden meeting of the sunhot skin with the white flesh in [his]108-george throat , [her]116-lettie eyes met [his]108-george , and [she]116-lettie turned again to the piano , while the colour grew in [her]116-lettie ears , mercifully sheltered by a profusion of bright curls .

" What shall [I]116-lettie play ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie asked , fingering the keys somewhat confusedly .

[He]108-george dragged out a book of songs from a little heap of music , and set it before [her]116-lettie .

" Which do [you]108-george want to sing ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie asked thrilling a little as [she]116-lettie felt [his]108-george arms so near [her]116-lettie .

" Anything [you]108-george like . "[108-george]

" A love song ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said .

" If [you]116-lettie like yes , a love song "[108-george] [he]108-george laughed with clumsy insinuation that made [the girl]604-the girl writhe .

[She]116-lettie did not answer , but began to play [Sullivan]126-sullivan 's " Tit [Willow]127-willow . "[108-george] [He]108-george had a passable bass voice , not of any great depth , and [he]108-george sang with gusto . Then [she]116-lettie gave [him]108-george " Drink to [me]116-lettie only with thine eyes . "[116-lettie] At the end [she]116-lettie turned and asked [him]108-george if [he]108-george liked the words . [He]108-george replied that [he]108-george thought [them]605-them rather daft . But [he]108-george looked at [her]116-lettie with glowing brown eyes , as if in hesitating challenge .

" That 's because [you]108-george have no wine in [your]108-george eyes to pledge with , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie replied , answering [his]108-george challenge with a blue blaze of [her]116-lettie eyes . Then [her]116-lettie eyelashes drooped on to [her]116-lettie cheek . [He]108-george laughed with a faint ring of consciousness , and asked [her]116-lettie how could [she]116-lettie know .

" Because , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said slowly , looking up at [him]108-george with pretended scorn , " because there 's no change in [your]108-george eyes when [I]116-lettie look at [you]108-george . [I]116-lettie always think [people who are worth much talk]4188-people who are worth much talk with [their]4188-people who are worth much talk eyes . That 's why [you]108-george are forced to respect [many quite uneducated people]4189-many quite uneducated people . [Their]4189-many quite uneducated people eyes are so eloquent , and full of knowledge . "[116-lettie] [She]116-lettie had continued to look at [him]108-george as [she]116-lettie spoke watching [his]108-george faint appreciation of [her]116-lettie upturned face , and [her]116-lettie hair , where the light was always tangled , watching [his]108-george brief self - examination to see if [he]108-george could feel any truth in [her]116-lettie words , watching till [he]108-george broke into a little laugh which was rather more awkward and less satisfied than usual . Then [she]116-lettie turned away , smiling also .

" There 's nothing in this book nice to sing , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , turning over the leaves discontentedly . [I]0-i found [her]116-lettie a volume , and [she]116-lettie sang " Should [he]108-george upbraid . "[116-lettie] [She]116-lettie had a fine soprano voice , and the song delighted [him]108-george . [He]108-george moved nearer to [her]116-lettie , and when at the finish [she]116-lettie looked round with a flashing , mischievous air , [she]116-lettie found [him]108-george pledging [her]116-lettie with wonderful eyes .

" [You]108-george like that , "[116-lettie] said [she]116-lettie with the air of superior knowledge , as if , dear [me]0-i , all [one]606-one had to do was to turn over to the right page of the vast volume of [one]606-one 's soul to suit [these people]608-these people .

" [I]108-george do , "[108-george] [he]108-george answered emphatically , thus acknowledging [her]116-lettie triumph .

" [I]116-lettie 'd rather ' dance and sing ' round ' wrinkled care ' than carefully shut the door on [him]108-george , while [I]116-lettie slept in [the chimney]4190-the chimney would n't [you]108-george ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie asked .

[He]108-george laughed , and began to consider what [she]116-lettie meant before [he]108-george replied .

" As [you]108-george do , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie added .

" What ? "[108-george] [he]108-george asked .

" Keep half [your]116-lettie senses asleep half alive . "[116-lettie]

" Do [I]108-george ? "[108-george] [he]108-george asked .

" Of course [you]116-lettie do ; ' bos - bovis ; an ox . ' [You]116-lettie are like a stalled ox , food and comfort , no more . Do n't [you]108-george love comfort ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie smiled .

" Do n't [you]116-lettie ? "[108-george] [he]108-george replied , smiling shamefaced .

" Of course . Come and turn over for [me]116-lettie while [I]116-lettie play this piece . Well , [I]116-lettie 'll nod when [you]116-lettie must turn bring a chair . "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie began to play a romance of [Schubert]128-schubert 's . [He]108-george leaned nearer to [her]116-lettie to take hold of the leaf of music ; [she]116-lettie felt [her]116-lettie loose hair touch [his]108-george face , and turned to [him]108-george a quick , laughing glance , while [she]116-lettie played . At the end of the page [she]116-lettie nodded , but [he]108-george was oblivious ; " Yes ! "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , suddenly impatient , and [he]108-george tried to get the leaf over ; [she]116-lettie quickly pushed [his]108-george hand aside , turned the page [herself]116-lettie and continued playing .

" Sorry ! "[108-george] said [he]108-george , blushing actually .

" Do n't bother , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , continuing to play without observing [him]108-george . When [she]116-lettie had finished :

" There ! "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , " now tell [me]116-lettie how [you]108-george felt while [I]116-lettie was playing . "[116-lettie]

" Oh [a fool]4191-a fool ! "[108-george] [he]108-george replied , covered with confusion .

" [I]116-lettie 'm glad to hear it , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said " but [I]116-lettie did n't mean that . [I]116-lettie meant how did the music make [you]108-george feel ? "[116-lettie]

" [I]108-george do n't know whether it made [me]108-george feel anything , "[108-george] [he]108-george replied deliberately , pondering over [his]108-george answer , as usual .

" [I]116-lettie tell [you]108-george , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie declared , " [you]108-george 're either asleep or stupid . Did [you]108-george really see nothing in the music ? But what did [you]108-george think about ? "[116-lettie]

[He]108-george laughed and thought awhile and laughed again .

" Why ! "[108-george] [he]108-george admitted , laughing , and trying to tell the exact truth , " [I]108-george thought how pretty [your]116-lettie hands are and what they are like to touch and [I]108-george thought it was a new experience to feel [somebody]4142-somebody 's hair tickling [my]108-george cheek . "[108-george] When [he]108-george had finished [his]108-george deliberate account [she]116-lettie gave [his]108-george hand a little knock , and left [him]108-george saying :

" [You]108-george are worse and worse . "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie came across [the room]518-the room to the couch where [I]0-i was sitting talking to [Emily]109-emily , and put [her]116-lettie arm around [my]0-i neck .

" Is n't it time to go [home]4184-home , [Pat]129-pat ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie asked .

" Half past eight quite early , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Do n't go , "[108-george] said [he]108-george .

" Why ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Stay to supper , "[109-emily] urged [Emily]109-emily .

" But [I]116-lettie believe "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie hesitated .

" [She]116-lettie has another fish to fry , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" [I]116-lettie am not sure "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie hesitated again . Then [she]116-lettie flashed into sudden wrath , exclaiming , " Do n't be so mean and nasty , [Cyril]113-cyril ! "[116-lettie]

" Were [you]116-lettie going somewhere ? "[108-george] asked [George]108-george humbly .

" Why no ! "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , blushing .

" Then stay to supper will [you]116-lettie ? "[108-george] [he]108-george begged . [She]116-lettie laughed , and yielded . [We]610-we went into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen . [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton was sitting reading . [Trip]110-trip , the big bull terrier , lay at [his]110-trip feet pretending to sleep ; [Mr. Nickie Ben]125-mr. nickie ben reposed calmly on the sofa ; [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton and [Mollie]114-meg were just going to bed . [We]610-we bade [them]612-them good - night , and sat down . [Annie]111-annie , [the servant]613-the servant , had gone [home]4184-home , so [Emily]109-emily prepared the supper .

" [Nobody]4176-nobody can touch that piano like [you]109-emily , "[130-mr. saxton] said [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton to [Lettie]116-lettie , beaming upon [her]116-lettie with admiration and deference . [He]130-mr. saxton was proud of the stately , mumbling old thing , and used to say that it was full of music for [those that liked to ask for it]615-those that liked to ask for it . [Lettie]116-lettie laughed , and said that [so few folks]616-so few folks ever tried it , that [her]116-lettie honour was not great .

" What do [you]109-emily think of [our]4196-our [George]108-george 's singing ? "[465-the father] asked [the father]465-the father proudly , but with a deprecating laugh at the end .

" [I]116-lettie tell [him]108-george , when [he]108-george 's in love [he]108-george 'll sing quite well , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said .

" When [he]108-george 's in love ! "[465-the father] echoed [the father]465-the father , laughing aloud , very pleased .

" Yes , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , " when [he]108-george finds out something [he]108-george wants and ca n't have . "[116-lettie]

[George]108-george thought about it , and [he]108-george laughed also .

[Emily]109-emily , who was laying the table said , " There is hardly any water in the pippin , [George]108-george . "[109-emily]

" Oh , dash ! "[108-george] [he]108-george exclaimed , " [I]108-george 've taken [my]108-george boots off . "[108-george]

" Why could n't [Annie]111-annie fetch it what 's [she]111-annie here for ? "[108-george] [he]108-george said angrily .

[Emily]109-emily looked at [us]620-us , tossed [her]109-emily head , and turned [her]109-emily back on [him]108-george .

" [I]465-the father 'll go , [I]465-the father 'll go , after supper , "[465-the father] said [the father]465-the father in a comforting tone .

" After supper ! "[109-emily] laughed [Emily]109-emily .

[George]108-george got up and shuffled out . [He]108-george had to go into the spinney near [the house]563-the house to [a well]623-a well , and being warm disliked turning out .

[We]620-us had just sat down to supper when [Trip]110-trip rushed barking to the door . " Be quiet , "[110-trip] ordered [the father]465-the father , thinking of those in bed , and [he]465-the father followed the dog .

It was [Leslie]121-leslie . [He]121-leslie wanted [Lettie]116-lettie to go [home]4184-home with [him]121-leslie at once . This [she]116-lettie refused to do , so [he]121-leslie came [indoors]626-indoors , and was persuaded to sit down at table . [He]121-leslie swallowed a morsel of bread and cheese , and a cup of coffee , talking to [Lettie]116-lettie of a garden party which was going to be arranged at Highclose for the following week .

" What is it for then ? "[130-mr. saxton] interrupted [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton .

" For ? "[121-leslie] echoed [Leslie]121-leslie .

" Is it for [the missionaries]4197-the missionaries , or [the unemployed]4198-the unemployed , or something ? "[130-mr. saxton] explained [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton .

" It 's a garden - party , not [a bazaar]4199-a bazaar , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie .

" Oh a private affair . [I]116-lettie thought it would be some church matter of [[your]121-leslie mother]4163-your mother 's . [She]4163-your mother 's very big at [the church]4201-the church , is n't [she]4163-your mother ? "[116-lettie]

" [She]4163-your mother is interested in [the church]4201-the church yes ! "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie , then proceeding to explain to [Lettie]116-lettie that [he]121-leslie was arranging a tennis tournament in which [she]116-lettie was to take part . At this point [he]121-leslie became aware that [he]121-leslie was monopolising the conversation , and turned to [George]108-george , just as [the latter]627-the latter was taking a piece of cheese from [his]108-george knife with [his]108-george teeth , asking :

" Do [you]121-leslie play tennis , [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton ? [I]627-the latter know [Miss Saxton]4203-miss saxton does not . "[627-the latter]

" No , "[108-george] said [George]108-george , working the piece of cheese into [his]108-george cheek . " [I]108-george never learned [any ladies]4204-any ladies ' accomplishments . "[108-george]

[Leslie]121-leslie turned to [Emily]109-emily , who had nervously been pushing two plates over a stain in the cloth , and who was very startled when [she]109-emily found [herself]109-emily addressed .

" [[My]109-emily mother]515-my mother would be so glad if [you]121-leslie would come to the party , [Miss Saxton]4206-miss saxton . "[109-emily]

" [I]109-emily can not . [I]109-emily shall be at [school]497-school . Thanks very much . "[109-emily]

" Ah it 's very good of [you]121-leslie , "[465-the father] said [the father]465-the father , beaming . But [George]108-george smiled contemptuously .

When supper was over [Leslie]121-leslie looked at [Lettie]116-lettie to inform [her]116-lettie that [he]121-leslie was ready to go . [She]116-lettie , however , refused to see [his]121-leslie look , but talked brightly to [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton , who was delighted . [George]108-george , flattered , joined in the talk with gusto . Then [Leslie]121-leslie 's angry silence began to tell on [us]629-us all . After a dull lapse , [George]108-george lifted [his]108-george head and said to [[his]108-george father]630-his father :

" Oh , [I]108-george should n't be surprised if that little red [heifer]4208-heifer calved to - night . "[108-george]

[Lettie]116-lettie 's eyes flashed with a sparkle of amusement at this thrust .

" No , "[465-the father] assented [the father]465-the father , " [I]465-the father thought so [myself]465-the father . "[465-the father]

After a moment 's silence , [George]108-george continued deliberately , " [I]108-george felt [her]4208-heifer gristles "[108-george]

" [George]108-george ! "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily sharply .

" [We]4209-we will go , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie .

[George]108-george looked up sideways at [Lettie]116-lettie and [his]108-george black eyes were full of sardonic mischief .

" Lend [me]116-lettie a shawl , will [you]109-emily , [Emily]109-emily ? "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie . " [I]116-lettie brought nothing , and [I]116-lettie think the wind is cold . "[116-lettie]

[Emily]109-emily , however , regretted that [she]109-emily had no shawl , and so [Lettie]116-lettie must needs wear a black coat over [her]116-lettie summer dress . It fitted so absurdly that [we]632-we all laughed , but [Leslie]121-leslie was very angry that [she]116-lettie should appear ludicrous before [them]632-we . [He]121-leslie showed [her]116-lettie all the polite attentions possible , fastened the neck of [her]116-lettie coat with [his]121-leslie pearl scarf - pin , refusing the pin [Emily]109-emily discovered , after some search . Then [we]632-we sallied forth .

When [we]632-we were outside , [he]121-leslie offered [Lettie]116-lettie [his]121-leslie arm with an air of injured dignity . [She]116-lettie refused it and [he]121-leslie began to remonstrate .

" [I]121-leslie consider [you]116-lettie ought to have been [home]4184-home as [you]116-lettie promised . "[121-leslie]

" Pardon [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie replied , " but [I]116-lettie did not promise . "[116-lettie]

" But [you]116-lettie knew [I]121-leslie was coming , "[121-leslie] said [he]121-leslie .

" Well [you]121-leslie found [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie retorted .

" Yes , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie assented . " [I]121-leslie did find [you]116-lettie ; flirting with [a common fellow]4211-a common fellow , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie sneered .

" Well , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie returned . " [He]4211-a common fellow did it is true call a heifer , a heifer . "[116-lettie]

" And [I]121-leslie should think [you]116-lettie liked it , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie said .

" [I]116-lettie did n't mind , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , with galling negligence .

" [I]121-leslie thought [your]116-lettie taste was more refined , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie replied sarcastically . " But [I]121-leslie suppose [you]116-lettie thought it romantic . "[121-leslie]

" Very ! Ruddy , dark , and really thrilling eyes , "[116-lettie] said [she]116-lettie .

" [I]121-leslie hate to hear [a girl]4168-a girl talk rot , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie . [He]121-leslie [himself]121-leslie had crisp hair of the " ginger "[121-leslie] class .

" But [I]116-lettie mean it , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie insisted , aggravating [his]121-leslie anger .

[Leslie]121-leslie was angry . " [I]121-leslie 'm glad [he]121-leslie amuses [you]121-leslie ! "[121-leslie]

" Of course , [I]116-lettie 'm not hard to please , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said pointedly . [He]121-leslie was stung to the quick .

" Then there 's some comfort in knowing [I]121-leslie do n't please [you]116-lettie , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie said coldly .

" Oh ! but [you]121-leslie do ! [You]121-leslie amuse [me]116-lettie also , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said .

After that [he]121-leslie would not speak , preferring , [I]0-i suppose , not to amuse [her]116-lettie .

[Lettie]116-lettie took [my]0-i arm , and with [her]116-lettie disengaged hand held [her]116-lettie skirts above the wet grass . When [he]121-leslie had left [us]633-us at the end of the riding in [the wood]504-the wood , [Lettie]116-lettie said :

" What [an infant]4213-an infant [he]121-leslie is ! "[116-lettie]

" A bit of [an ass]4214-an ass , "[0-i] [I]0-i admitted .

" But really ! "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , " [he]121-leslie 's more agreeable on the whole than than [my]116-lettie Taurus . "[116-lettie]

" [Your]116-lettie bull ! "[0-i] [I]0-i repeated laughing .

CHAPTER III

A VENDOR OF VISIONS

The Sunday following [Lettie]116-lettie 's visit to [the mill]635-the mill , [Leslie]121-leslie came up in the morning , admirably dressed , and perfected by a grand air . [I]0-i showed [him]121-leslie into [the dark drawing - room]636-the dark drawing - room , and left [him]121-leslie . Ordinarily [he]121-leslie would have wandered to the stairs , and sat there calling to [Lettie]116-lettie ; to - day [he]121-leslie was silent . [I]0-i carried the news of [his]121-leslie arrival to [[my]0-i sister]637-my sister , who was pinning on [her]637-my sister brooch .

" And how is [the dear boy]4215-the dear boy ? "[637-my sister] [she]637-my sister asked . " [I]637-my sister have not inquired , "[637-my sister] said I. [She]637-my sister laughed , and loitered about till it was time to set off for [church]638-church before [she]637-my sister came [downstairs]639-downstairs . Then [she]637-my sister also assumed the grand air and bowed to [him]121-leslie with a beautiful bow . [He]121-leslie was somewhat taken aback and had nothing to say . [She]637-my sister rustled across [the room]518-the room to the window , where the white geraniums grew magnificently . " [I]637-my sister must adorn [myself]637-my sister , "[637-my sister] [she]637-my sister said .

It was [Leslie]121-leslie 's custom to bring [her]637-my sister flowers . As [he]121-leslie had not done so this day , [she]637-my sister was piqued . [He]121-leslie hated the scent and chalky whiteness of the geraniums . So [she]637-my sister smiled at [him]121-leslie as [she]637-my sister pinned them into the bosom of [her]637-my sister dress , saying : " They are very fine , are they not ? "[637-my sister] [He]121-leslie muttered that they were . [Mother]117-mother came [downstairs]639-downstairs , greeted [him]121-leslie warmly , and asked [him]121-leslie if [he]121-leslie would take [her]637-my sister to [church]638-church .

" If [you]4146-mother will allow [me]121-leslie , "[121-leslie] said [he]121-leslie .

" [You]121-leslie are modest to - day , "[4146-mother] laughed [mother]4146-mother .

" [I]4146-mother hate modesty in [a young man]4216-a young man , "[4146-mother] said [mother]4146-mother " Come , [we]646-we shall be late . "[4146-mother] [Lettie]116-lettie wore the geraniums all day till evening . [She]116-lettie brought [Alice Gall]218-alice [home]4184-home to tea , and bade [me]0-i bring up " Mon Taureau , "[4146-mother] when [his]218-alice farm work was over .

The day had been hot and close . The sun was reddening in the west as [we]646-we leaped across [the lesser brook]647-the lesser brook . The evening scents began to awake , and wander unseen through the still air . An occasional yellow sunbeam would slant through the thick roof of leaves and cling passionately to the orange clusters of mountain - ash berries . [The trees]648-the trees were silent , drawing together to sleep . Only a few pink orchids stood palely by [the path]495-the path , looking wistfully out at the ranks of red - purple bugle , whose last flowers , glowing from the top of the bronze column , yearned darkly for the sun .

[We]646-we sauntered on in silence , not breaking the first hush of [the woodlands]650-the woodlands . As [we]646-we drew near [home]4184-home [we]646-we heard a murmur from among the trees , from [the lover]652-the lover 's seat , where a great tree had fallen and remained mossed and covered with fragile growth . There a crooked bough made a beautiful seat for two .

" Fancy being in love and making a row in such a twilight , "[0-i] said [I]0-i as [we]646-we continued [our]646-we way . But when [we]646-we came opposite the fallen tree , [we]646-we saw [no lovers there]653-no lovers there , but [a man]654-a man sleeping , and muttering through [his]654-a man sleep . The cap had fallen from [his]654-a man grizzled hair , and [his]654-a man head leaned back against a profusion of the little wild geraniums that decorated the dead bough so delicately . [The man]655-the man 's clothing was good , but slovenly and neglected . [His]655-the man face was pale and worn with sickness and dissipation . As [he]655-the man slept , [his]655-the man grey beard wagged , and [his]655-the man loose unlovely mouth moved in indistinct speech . [He]655-the man was acting over again some part of [his]655-the man life , and [his]655-the man features twitched during the unnatural sleep . [He]655-the man would give a little groan , gruesome to hear and then talk to [some woman]656-some woman . [His]655-the man features twitched as if with pain , and [he]655-the man moaned slightly .

The lips opened in a grimace showing the yellow teeth behind the beard . Then [he]655-the man began again talking in [his]655-the man throat , thickly , so that [we]646-we could only tell part of what [he]655-the man said . It was very unpleasant . [I]0-i wondered how [we]646-we should end it . Suddenly through the gloom of [the twilight - haunted woods]657-the twilight - haunted woods came the scream of a rabbit caught by a weasel . "[655-the man]

" [I]695-she believe it 's in [Liverpool]5-liverpool , the picture , "[695-she] [she]695-she contrived to say .

[Their]697-they eyes met in the briefest flash of a glance , then [both]700-both turned [their]697-they faces aside . Thus averted , one from the other , [they]697-they made talk . At last [she]695-she rose , gathered the books together , and carried [them]701-them off . At the door [she]695-she turned . [She]695-she must steal another keen moment : " Are [you]693-he admiring [my]695-she strength ? "[695-she] [she]695-she asked . [Her]695-she pose was fine . While [she]695-she was out , [he]693-he sat twisting [his]693-he moustache . [She]695-she came back along [the hall]703-the hall talking madly to [herself]695-she in French . Having been much impressed by [Sarah Bernhardt]154-sarah bernhardt 's " Dame aux Camelias "[695-she] and " [Adrienne Lecouvreur]155-adrienne lecouvreur , "[695-she] [Lettie]116-lettie had caught something of the weird tone of [this great actress]704-this great actress , and [her]695-she raillery and mockery came out in little wild waves . Whatever [he]693-he said to [her]695-she , [she]695-she answered in the same mad clatter of French , speaking high and harshly . The sound was strange and uncomfortable . " [I]693-he have supped full "[693-he] [he]693-he began , [his]693-he eyes dancing with a smile as [he]693-he ventured upon a quotation . [He]693-he was very much excited .

" Of horrors ! "[695-she] [she]695-she cried completing it . " Now that is worse than anything [I]695-she have given [you]693-he . "[695-she]

" Good - bye , "[695-she] [she]695-she said , holding out [her]695-she hand . [Her]695-she voice was full of insurgent tenderness . [He]693-he looked at [her]695-she again , [his]693-he eyes flickering . Then [he]693-he took [her]695-she hand . [She]695-she pressed [his]693-he fingers , holding them a little while . Then ashamed of [her]695-she display of feeling , [she]695-she looked down . [He]693-he had a deep cut across [his]693-he thumb .

" What a gash ! "[695-she] [she]695-she exclaimed , shivering , and clinging a little tighter to [his]693-he fingers before [she]695-she released them . [He]693-he gave a little laugh .

" Does it hurt [you]693-he ? "[695-she] [she]695-she asked very gently .

[He]693-he laughed again " No ! "[693-he] [he]693-he said softly , as if [his]693-he thumb were not worthy of consideration .

[They]708-they smiled again at [each other]4254-each other , and , with a blind movement , [he]693-he broke the spell and was gone .

CHAPTER IV

THE FATHER

Autumn set in , and the red dahlias which kept the warm light alive in [their]708-they bosoms so late into the evening died in the night , and the morning had nothing but brown balls of rottenness to show .

[They]710-they called [me]0-i as [I]0-i passed [the post - office door in [Eberwich]6-eberwich]711-the post - office door in eberwich one evening , and [they]710-they gave [me]0-i a letter for [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother . The distorted , sprawling handwriting perplexed [me]0-i with a dim uneasiness ; [I]0-i put the letter away , and forgot it . [I]0-i remembered it later in the evening , when [I]0-i wished to recall something to interest [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother . [She]515-my mother looked at the handwriting , and began hastily and nervously to tear open the envelope ; [she]515-my mother held it away from [her]515-my mother in the light of the lamp , and with eyes drawn half closed , tried to scan it . So [I]0-i found [her]515-my mother spectacles , but [she]515-my mother did not speak [her]515-my mother thanks , and [her]515-my mother hand trembled . [She]515-my mother read the short letter quickly ; then [she]515-my mother sat down , and read it again , and continued to look at it .

" What is it [mother]4146-mother ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

[She]515-my mother did not answer , but continued staring at the letter . [I]0-i went up to [her]515-my mother , and put [my]0-i hand on [her]515-my mother shoulder , feeling very uncomfortable . [She]515-my mother took no notice of [me]0-i , beginning to murmur : " [Poor Frank Poor Frank]157-poor frank poor frank . "[515-my mother] That was [[my]0-i father]4253-my father 's name .

" But what is it [mother]4146-mother ? tell [me]515-my mother what 's the matter ! "[515-my mother]

[She]515-my mother turned and looked at [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were [a stranger]715-a stranger ; [she]515-my mother got up , and began to walk about [the room]518-the room ; then [she]515-my mother left [the room]518-the room , and [I]0-i heard [her]515-my mother go out of [the house]563-the house .

The letter had fallen on to the floor . [I]0-i picked it up . The handwriting was very broken . The address gave [a village some few miles away]719-a village some few miles away ; the date was three days before .

" [[My]515-my mother Dear]4165-my dear Lettice :[515-my mother]

" [You]4165-my dear will want to know [I]515-my mother am gone . [I]515-my mother can hardly last a day or two [my]515-my mother kidneys are nearly gone .[515-my mother]

" [I]515-my mother came over one day . [I]515-my mother did n't see [you]4165-my dear , but [I]515-my mother saw [the girl by the window]4272-the girl by the window , and [I]515-my mother had a few words with [the lad]4273-the lad . [He]4273-the lad never knew , and [he]4273-the lad felt nothing . [I]515-my mother think [the girl]604-the girl might have done . If [you]4165-my dear knew how awfully lonely [I]515-my mother am , [Lettice]158-lettice how awfully [I]515-my mother have been , [you]4165-my dear might feel sorry .[515-my mother]

" [I]0-i have saved what [I]0-i could , to pay [you]4165-my dear back . [I]0-i have had the worst of it [Lettice]158-lettice , and [I]0-i 'm glad the end has come . [I]0-i have had the worst of it .[0-i]

" Good - bye for ever [[your]4165-my dear husband]4275-your husband ,[515-my mother]

" [FRANK BEARDSALL]159-frank beardsall . "[0-i]

[I]0-i was numbed by this letter of [[my]0-i father]4253-my father 's . With almost agonised effort [I]0-i strove to recall [him]4253-my father , but [I]0-i knew that [my]0-i image of [a tall , handsome , dark man with pale grey eyes]721-a tall , handsome , dark man with pale grey eyes was made up from [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother 's few words , and from a portrait [I]0-i had once seen .

The marriage had been unhappy . [[My]0-i father]4253-my father was of frivolous , rather vulgar character , but plausible , having a good deal of charm . [He]4253-my father was [a liar]724-a liar , without notion of honesty , and [he]4253-my father had deceived [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother thoroughly . One after another [she]515-my mother discovered [his]4253-my father mean dishonesties and deceits , and [her]515-my mother soul revolted from [him]4253-my father , and because the illusion of [him]4253-my father had broken into a thousand vulgar fragments , [she]515-my mother turned away with the scorn of [a woman who finds [her]726-a woman who finds her romance romance]726-a woman who finds her romance has been a trumpery tale . When [he]4253-my father left [her]515-my mother for other pleasures [Lettie]116-lettie being [a baby of three years]727-a baby of three years , while [I]0-i was five [she]515-my mother rejoiced bitterly . [She]515-my mother had heard of [him]4253-my father indirectly and of [him]4253-my father nothing good , although [he]4253-my father prospered but [he]4253-my father had never come to see [her]515-my mother or written to [her]515-my mother in all the eighteen years .

In a while [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother came in . [She]515-my mother sat down , pleating up the hem of [her]515-my mother black apron , and smoothing it out again .

" [You]0-i know , "[515-my mother] [she]515-my mother said , " [he]4253-my father had a right to [the children]4276-the children , and [I]515-my mother 've kept them all the time . "[515-my mother]

" [He]4253-my father could have come , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [I]515-my mother set [them]4276-the children against [him]4253-my father , [I]515-my mother have kept [them]4276-the children from [him]4253-my father , and [he]4253-my father wanted [them]4276-the children . [I]515-my mother ought to be by [him]4253-my father now [I]515-my mother ought to have taken [you]0-i to [him]4253-my father long ago . "[515-my mother]

" But how could [you]515-my mother , when [you]515-my mother knew nothing of [him]4253-my father ? "[515-my mother]

" [He]4253-my father would have come [he]4253-my father wanted to come [I]515-my mother have felt it for years . But [I]515-my mother kept [him]4253-my father away . [I]515-my mother know [I]515-my mother have kept [him]4253-my father away . [I]515-my mother have felt it , and [he]4253-my father has . [Poor Frank]157-poor frank poor frank [he]4253-my father 'll see [his]4253-my father mistakes now . [He]4253-my father would not have been as cruel as [I]515-my mother have been "[515-my mother]

" Nay , [mother]4146-mother , it is only the shock that makes [you]4146-mother say so . "[515-my mother]

" This makes [me]515-my mother know . [I]515-my mother have felt in [myself]515-my mother a long time that [he]4253-my father was suffering ; [I]515-my mother have had the feeling of [him]4253-my father in [me]515-my mother . [I]515-my mother have had the feeling of [him]4253-my father upon [me]515-my mother this last three months especially . . . [I]515-my mother have been cruel to [him]4253-my father . "[515-my mother]

" Well [we]4278-we 'll go to [him]4253-my father now , shall [we]4278-we ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" To - morrow to - morrow , "[729-she] [she]729-she replied , noticing [me]0-i really for the first time . " [I]729-she go in the morning . "[729-she]

" And [I]0-i 'll go with [you]729-she . "[0-i]

" Yes in the morning . [Lettie]116-lettie has [her]116-lettie party to [Chatsworth]7-chatsworth do n't tell [her]116-lettie [we]4278-we wo n't tell [her]116-lettie . "[729-she]

" No , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

Shortly after , [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother went [upstairs]532-upstairs . [Lettie]116-lettie came in rather late from [Highclose]8-highclose ; [Leslie]121-leslie did not come in . In the morning [they]732-they were going with a motor party into [Matloch]9-matloch and [Chatsworth]7-chatsworth , and [she]116-lettie was excited , and did not observe anything .

After all , [mother]4146-mother and [I]0-i could not set out until the warm tempered afternoon . The air was full of a soft yellowness when [we]734-we stepped down from [the train]556-the train at [Cossethay]10-cossethay . [[My]0-i mother]515-my mother insisted on walking the long two miles to [the village]737-the village . [We]734-we went slowly along [the road]738-the road , lingering over the little red flowers in the high hedge - bottom up [the hillside]739-the hillside . [We]734-we were reluctant to come to [our]734-we destination . As [we]734-we came in sight of [the little grey tower of [the church]4201-the church]740-the little grey tower of the church , [we]734-we heard the sound of braying , brassy music . Before [us]734-we , filling [a little croft]742-a little croft , [the Wakes]743-the wakes was in full swing .

Some wooden horses careered gaily round , and [the swingboats]744-the swingboats leaped into the mild blue sky . [We]734-we sat upon the stile , [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother and [I]0-i , and watched . There were [booths]746-booths , and cocoanut shies and round - abouts scattered in [the small field]747-the small field . [Groups of children]748-groups of children moved quietly from attraction to attraction . [A deeply tanned man]749-a deeply tanned man came across [the field]4259-the field swinging two dripping buckets of water . [Women]561-women looked from the doors of [[their]561-women brilliant caravans]752-their brilliant caravans , and lean dogs rose lazily and settled down again under the steps . [The fair]753-the fair moved slowly , for all its noise . [A stout lady , with a husky masculine voice]754-a stout lady , with a husky masculine voice invited [the excited children]755-the excited children into [her]754-a stout lady , with a husky masculine voice peep show . [A swarthy man]756-a swarthy man stood with [his]756-a swarthy man thin legs astride on the platform of [the roundabouts]757-the roundabouts , and sloping backwards , [his]756-a swarthy man mouth distended with a row of fingers , [he]756-a swarthy man whistled astonishingly to the coarse row of the organ , and [his]756-a swarthy man whistling sounded clear , like the flight of a wild goose high over the chimney tops , as [he]756-a swarthy man was carried round and round . [A little fat man with an ugly swelling on [his]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest chest]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest stood screaming from a filthy booth to [a crowd of urchins]759-a crowd of urchins , bidding [them]759-a crowd of urchins challenge [a big , stolid young man who stood with folded arms , [his]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest fists pushing out [his]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest biceps]760-a big , stolid young man who stood with folded arms , his fists pushing out his biceps . On being asked if [he]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest would undertake any of these prospective challenges , [this young man]761-this young man nodded , not having yet attained a talking stage : yes [he]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest would take two at a time , screamed [the little fat man with the big excrescence on [his]758-a little fat man with an ugly swelling on his chest chest , pointing at [the cowering lads]763-the cowering lads and [girls]764-girls]762-the little fat man with the big excrescence on his chest , pointing at the cowering lads and girls . Further off , [Punch]160-punch 's quaint voice could be heard when [the cocoanut man]765-the cocoanut man ceased grinding out screeches from [his]765-the cocoanut man rattle . [The cocoanut man]765-the cocoanut man was wroth , for [these youngsters]767-these youngsters would not risk a penny shy , and the rattle yelled like [a fiend]768-a fiend . [A little girl]473-a little girl came along to look at [us]770-we , daintily licking an ice - cream sandwich . [We]770-we were uninteresting , however , so [she]473-a little girl passed on to stare at [the caravans]771-the caravans .

[We]770-we had almost gathered courage to cross [the wakes]743-the wakes , when the cracked bell of [the church]4201-the church sent its note falling over the babble .

" One two three "[776-the husky woman] had it really sounded three ! Then it rang on a lower bell " One two three . "[515-my mother] A passing bell for [a man]654-a man ! [I]0-i looked at [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother [she]515-my mother turned away from [me]0-i .
