[The mother]460-the mother swept to the sofa , poked out the bread and butter , pushed [her]460-the mother finger into [the baby]1267-the baby 's throat , lifted [the child]475-the child up , punched its back , and was highly relieved when it began to yell . Then [she]460-the mother administered a few sound spanks to the naked buttocks of the crammer . [He]1256-a swarthy urchin with a shockingly short shirt began to howl , but stopped suddenly on seeing [us]1257-us laughing . On the sack - cloth which served as hearth rug sat [a beautiful child]1269-a beautiful child washing the face of a wooden doll with tea , and wiping it on [her]1269-a beautiful child nightgown . At the table , [an infant in a high chair]1270-an infant in a high chair sat sucking a piece of bacon , till the grease ran down [his]1270-an infant in a high chair swarthy arms , oozing through [his]1270-an infant in a high chair fingers . [An old lad]1271-an old lad stood in the big arm - chair , whose back was hung with a calf - skin , and was industriously pouring the dregs of the teacups into a basin of milk . [The mother]460-the mother whisked away the milk , and made a rush for [the urchin]1273-the urchin , [the baby]1267-the baby hanging over [her]460-the mother arm the while .

" [I]460-the mother could half kill [thee]1256-a swarthy urchin with a shockingly short shirt , "[460-the mother] [she]460-the mother said , but [he]1256-a swarthy urchin with a shockingly short shirt had slid under the table , and sat serenely unconcerned .

" Could [you]460-the mother "[0-i] [I]0-i asked when [the mother]460-the mother had put [[her]460-the mother bonny baby]1276-her bonny baby again to [her]460-the mother breast " could [you]460-the mother lend [me]460-the mother a knitting needle ? "[460-the mother]

" [Our]4428-thy S'r Ann , wheer 's [thy]4428-thy knittin ' needles ? "[813-the woman] asked [the woman]813-the woman , wincing at the same time , and putting [her]813-the woman hand to the mouth of [the sucking child]1278-the sucking child . Catching [my]0-i eye , [she]813-the woman said :

" [You]0-i would n't credit how [he]475-the child bites . ' [E]4428-thy 's nobbut two teeth , but they like six needles . "[813-the woman] [She]813-the woman drew [her]813-the woman brows together and pursed [her]813-the woman lips , saying to [the child]475-the child , " [Naughty lad]4429-naughty lad , [naughty lad]4429-naughty lad ! Tha ' shanna hae it , no , not if [ter]4428-thy bites [[thy]4428-thy mother]4431-thy mother like that . "[813-the woman]

The family interest was now divided between [us]1280-us and the private concerns in process when [we]1280-us entered ; save , however , that [the bacon sucker]1281-the bacon sucker had sucked on stolidly , immovable , all the time .

" [[Our]1280-us [Sam]193-sam]4432-our sam , wheer 's [my]111-annie knittin ' , tha 's ' ad it ? "[111-annie] cried [S'r Ann]111-annie after a little search .

" ' A ' e na , "[193-sam] replied [Sam]193-sam from under the table .

" Yes , [tha ' ' as]4433-tha ' ' as , "[460-the mother] said [the mother]460-the mother , giving a blind prod under the table with [her]460-the mother foot .

" ' A ' e na then ! "[193-sam] persisted [Sam]193-sam .

[The mother]460-the mother suggested various possible places of discovery , and at last the knitting was found at the back of the table drawer , among forks and old wooden skewers .

" [I]460-the mother ' an ter tell [yer]193-sam wheer ivrythink is , "[460-the mother] said [the mother]460-the mother in mild reproach . [S'r Ann]111-annie , however , gave no heed to [[her]111-annie parent]1285-her parent . [Her]111-annie heart was torn for [her]111-annie knitting , the fruit of [her]111-annie labours ; it was a red woollen cuff for the winter ; a corkscrew was bored through the web , and the ball of red wool was bristling with skewers .

" It 's a ' [thee]193-sam , [[our]4434-our [Sam]193-sam]4432-our sam , "[111-annie] [she]111-annie wailed . " [I]111-annie know it 's a ' [thee]193-sam an ' [thy]193-sam A. B. C. "[111-annie]

[Samuel]193-sam , under the table , croaked out in a voice of fierce monotony :

" P. is for Porkypine , whose bristles so strong Kill the bold lion by pricking ' is tongue . "[193-sam]

[The mother]460-the mother began to shake with quiet laughter .

" [[His]193-sam father]630-his father learnt [him]193-sam that made it all up , "[460-the mother] [she]460-the mother whispered proudly to [us]1287-us and to [him]193-sam .

" Tell [us]1287-us what ' B ' is [Sam]193-sam . "[460-the mother]

" [Shonna]194-shonna , "[193-sam] grunted [Sam]193-sam .

" Go on , there 's [a duckie]4437-a duckie ; an ' [I]460-the mother 'll [ma ' ' e a treacle puddin ']4438-ma ' ' e a treacle puddin ' . "[460-the mother]

" Today ? "[111-annie] asked [S'r Ann]111-annie eagerly .

" Go on , [Sam]193-sam , [my]460-the mother duck , "[460-the mother] persisted [the mother]460-the mother .

" Tha ' ' as [na]4439-na got no treacle , "[193-sam] said [Sam]193-sam conclusively .

The needle was in the fire ; [the children]4276-the children stood about watching .

" Will [you]109-emily do it [yourself]109-emily ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [Emily]109-emily .

" [I]109-emily ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily exclaimed , with wide eyes of astonishment , and [she]109-emily shook [her]109-emily head emphatically .

" Then [I]0-i must . "[0-i] [I]0-i took out the needle , holding it in [my]0-i handkerchief . [I]0-i took [her]109-emily hand and examined the wound . But when [she]109-emily saw the hot glow of the needle , [she]109-emily snatched away [her]109-emily hand , and looked into [my]0-i eyes , laughing in a half - hysterical fear and shame . [I]0-i was very serious , very insistent . [She]109-emily yielded [me]0-i [her]109-emily hand again , biting [her]109-emily lips in imagination of the pain , and looking at [me]0-i . While [my]0-i eyes were looking into hers [she]109-emily had courage ; when [I]0-i was forced to pay attention to [my]0-i cauterising , [she]109-emily glanced down , and with a sharp " Ah ! "[109-emily] ending in a little laugh , [she]109-emily put [her]109-emily hands behind [her]109-emily , and looked again up at [me]0-i with wide brown eyes , all quivering with apprehension , and a little shame , and a laughter that held much pleading .

[One of [the children]4276-the children]1290-one of the children began to cry .

" It is no good , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , throwing the fast cooling needle on to the hearth .

[I]0-i gave [the girls]496-the girls all the pennies [I]0-i had then [I]0-i offered [Sam]193-sam , who had crept out of the shelter of the table , a sixpence .

" Shonna a'e that , "[193-sam] [he]193-sam said , turning from the small coin .

" Well [I]193-sam have no more pennies , so nothing will be [your]0-i share . "[193-sam]

[I]0-i gave [the other boy]1293-the other boy a rickety knife [I]0-i had in [my]0-i pocket . [Sam]193-sam looked fiercely at [me]0-i . Eager for revenge , [he]193-sam picked up the " porkypine quill "[193-sam] by the hot end . [He]193-sam dropped it with a shout of rage , and , seizing a cup off the table , flung it at [the fortunate Jack]195-the fortunate jack . It smashed against the fire - place . [The mother]460-the mother grabbed at [Sam]193-sam , but [he]193-sam was gone . [A girl]4168-a girl , [a little girl]473-a little girl , wailed , " Oh , that 's [my]4168-a girl rosey mug [my]4168-a girl rosey mug . "[4168-a girl] [We]1297-we fled from the scene of confusion . [Emily]109-emily had hardly noticed it . [Her]4168-a girl thoughts were of [herself]4168-a girl , and of [me]0-i .

" [I]4168-a girl am [an awful coward]4440-an awful coward , "[4168-a girl] said [she]4168-a girl humbly .

" But [I]4168-a girl ca n't help it "[4168-a girl] [she]4168-a girl looked beseechingly .

" Never mind , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" All [my]4168-a girl flesh seems to jump from it . [You]4168-a girl do n't know how [I]4168-a girl feel . "[4168-a girl]

" Well never mind . "[0-i]

" [I]4168-a girl could n't help it , not for [my]4168-a girl life . "[4168-a girl]

" [I]0-i wonder , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " if anything could possibly disturb [that young bacon - sucker]4441-that young bacon - sucker ? [He]4441-that young bacon - sucker did n't even look round at the smash . "[0-i]

" No , "[4168-a girl] said [she]4168-a girl , biting the tip of [her]4168-a girl finger moodily .

Further conversation was interrupted by howls from the rear . Looking round [we]1298-we saw [Sam]193-sam careering after [us]1298-we over [the close - bitten turf]1299-the close - bitten turf , howling scorn and derision at [us]1298-we . " Rabbit - tail , rabbit - tail , "[193-sam] [he]193-sam cried , [his]193-sam bare little legs twinkling , and [his]193-sam little shirt fluttering in the cold morning air . Fortunately , at last [he]193-sam trod on a thistle or a thorn , for when [we]1298-we looked round again to see why [he]193-sam was silent , [he]193-sam was capering on one leg , holding [his]193-sam wounded foot in [his]193-sam hands .

CHAPTER VII

[LETTIE]116-lettie PULLS DOWN THE SMALL GOLD GRAPES

During the falling of the leaves [Lettie]116-lettie was very wilful . [She]116-lettie uttered many banalities concerning [men]562-men , and love , and marriage ; [she]116-lettie taunted [Leslie]121-leslie and thwarted [his]121-leslie wishes . At last [he]121-leslie stayed away from [her]116-lettie . [She]116-lettie had been several times down to [the mill]635-the mill , but because [she]116-lettie fancied [they]1302-they were very familiar , receiving [her]116-lettie on to [their]1302-they rough plane like one of [themselves]1302-they , [she]116-lettie stayed away . Since the death of [[our]1303-us father]921-our father [she]116-lettie had been restless ; since inheriting [her]116-lettie little fortune [she]116-lettie had become proud , scornful , difficult to please . Difficult to please in every circumstance ; [she]116-lettie , who had always been so rippling in thoughtless life , sat down in the window sill to think , and [her]116-lettie strong teeth bit at [her]116-lettie handkerchief till it was torn in holes . [She]116-lettie would say nothing to [me]0-i ; [she]116-lettie read all things that dealt with [modern women]1305-modern women .

One afternoon [Lettie]116-lettie walked over to [Eberwich]6-eberwich . [Leslie]121-leslie had not been to see [us]1303-us for a fortnight . It was a grey , dree afternoon . The wind drifted a clammy fog across [the hills]1056-the hills , and [the roads]1307-the roads were black and deep with mud . The trees in the wood slouched sulkily . It was a day to be shut out and ignored if possible . [I]0-i heaped up the fire , and went to draw the curtains and make perfect [the room]518-the room . Then [I]0-i saw [Lettie]116-lettie coming along [the path]495-the path quickly , very erect . When [she]116-lettie came in [her]116-lettie colour was high .

" Tea not laid ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said briefly .

" [Rebecca]115-rebecca has just brought in the lamp , "[116-lettie] said I.

[Lettie]116-lettie took off [her]116-lettie coat and furs , and flung them on the couch . [She]116-lettie went to the mirror , lifted [her]116-lettie hair , all curled by the fog , and stared haughtily at [herself]116-lettie . Then [she]116-lettie swung round , looked at the bare table , and rang the bell .

It was so rare a thing for [us]1303-us to ring the bell from [the dining - room]511-the dining - room , that [Rebecca]115-rebecca went first to the outer door . Then [she]115-rebecca came in [the room]518-the room saying :

" Did [you]116-lettie ring ? "[115-rebecca]

" [I]116-lettie thought tea would have been ready , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie coldly . [Rebecca]115-rebecca looked at [me]0-i , and at [her]116-lettie , and replied :

" It is but half - past four . [I]115-rebecca can bring it in . "[115-rebecca]

[Mother]117-mother came down hearing the clink of the tea - cups .

" Well , "[117-mother] [she]117-mother said to [Lettie]116-lettie , who was unlacing [her]116-lettie boots , " and did [you]116-lettie find it a pleasant walk ? "[117-mother]

" Except for the mud , "[117-mother] was the reply .

" Ah , [I]117-mother guess [you]116-lettie wished [you]116-lettie had stayed at [home]4184-home . What a state for [your]116-lettie boots ! and [your]116-lettie skirts too , [I]117-mother know . Here , let [me]117-mother take them into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen . "[117-mother]

" Let [Rebecca]115-rebecca take them , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie but [mother]4146-mother was out of [the room]518-the room .

When [mother]4146-mother had poured out the tea , [we]1315-we sat silently at table . It was on the tip of [our]1315-we tongues to ask [Lettie]116-lettie what ailed [her]116-lettie , but [we]1315-we were experienced and [we]1315-we refrained . After a while [she]116-lettie said :

" Do [you]116-lettie know , [I]116-lettie met [Leslie Tempest]121-leslie . "[116-lettie]

" Oh , "[4146-mother] said [mother]4146-mother tentatively , " Did [he]121-leslie come along with [you]116-lettie ? "[116-lettie]

" [He]121-leslie did not look at [me]116-lettie . "[116-lettie]

" Oh ! "[4146-mother] exclaimed [mother]4146-mother , and it was speaking volumes ; then , after a moment , [she]116-lettie resumed :

" Perhaps [he]121-leslie did not see [you]116-lettie . "[116-lettie]

" Or was it [a stony Britisher]4444-a stony britisher ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [He]121-leslie saw [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] declared [Lettie]116-lettie , " or [he]121-leslie would n't have made such a babyish show of being delighted with [Margaret Raymond]196-margaret raymond . "[116-lettie]

" It may have been no show [he]121-leslie still may not have seen [you]116-lettie . "[116-lettie]

" [I]116-lettie felt at once that [he]121-leslie had ; [I]116-lettie could see [his]121-leslie animation was extravagant . [He]121-leslie need not have troubled [himself]121-leslie , [I]116-lettie was not going to run after [him]121-leslie . "[116-lettie]

" [You]116-lettie seem very cross , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Indeed [I]116-lettie am not . But [he]121-leslie knew [I]116-lettie had to walk all this way [home]4184-home , and [he]121-leslie could take up [Margaret]196-margaret raymond , who has only half the distance . "[116-lettie]

" Was [he]121-leslie driving ? "[116-lettie]

" In [the dog - cart]4446-the dog - cart . "[1318-she] [She]1318-she cut [her]1318-she toast into strips viciously . [We]1319-we waited patiently .

" It was mean of [him]121-leslie , was n't it [mother]4146-mother ? "[116-lettie]

" Well , [[my]116-lettie girl]4448-my girl , [you]0-i have treated [him]121-leslie badly . "[116-lettie]

" What [a baby]4449-a baby ! What [a mean , manly baby]4450-a mean , manly baby ! [Men]562-men are [great infants]4452-great infants . "[116-lettie]

" And [girls]764-girls , "[4146-mother] said [mother]4146-mother , " do not know what [they]562-men want . "[4146-mother]

" [A grown - up quality]4454-a grown - up quality , "[0-i] [I]0-i added .

" Nevertheless , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , " [he]121-leslie is [a mean fop]4455-a mean fop , and [I]116-lettie detest [him]121-leslie . "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie rose and sorted out some stitchery . [Lettie]116-lettie never stitched unless [she]116-lettie were in a bad humour . [Mother]117-mother smiled at [me]0-i , sighed , and proceeded to [Mr. Gladstone]197-mr. gladstone for comfort ; [her]117-mother breviary and missal were [Morley]198-morley 's Life of [Gladstone]197-mr. gladstone .

[I]0-i had to take a letter to Highclose to [Mrs. Tempest]199-mrs. tempest from [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother , concerning a bazaar in process at [the church]4201-the church . " [I]0-i will bring [Leslie]121-leslie back with [me]0-i , "[0-i] said [I]0-i to [myself]0-i .

The night was black and hateful . The lamps by [the road]738-the road from [Eberwich]6-eberwich ended at [Nethermere]1-nethermere ; their yellow blur on the water made the cold , wet inferno of the night more ugly .

[Leslie]121-leslie and [Marie]114-meg were both in [the library]1324-the library half [a library]1325-a library , half [a business office]1326-a business office ; used also as [a lounge room]1327-a lounge room , being cosy . [Leslie]121-leslie lay in a great armchair by the fire , immune among clouds of blue smoke . [Marie]114-meg was perched on the steps , a great volume on [her]114-meg knee . [Leslie]121-leslie got up in [his]121-leslie cloud , shook hands , greeted [me]0-i curtly , and vanished again . [Marie]114-meg smiled [me]0-i a quaint , vexed smile , saying :

" Oh , [Cyril]113-cyril , [I]114-meg 'm so glad [you]113-cyril 've come . [I]114-meg 'm so worried , and [Leslie]121-leslie says [he]121-leslie 's not [a pastry cook]4456-a pastry cook , though [I]114-meg 'm sure [I]114-meg do n't want [him]121-leslie to be one , only [he]121-leslie need not be a bear . "[114-meg]

" What 's the matter ? "[114-meg]

[She]114-meg frowned , gave the big volume a little smack and said :

" Why , [I]114-meg do so much want to make some of those Spanish tartlets of [[your]113-cyril mother]4163-your mother 's that are so delicious , and of course [Mabel]200-mabel knows nothing of them , and they 're not in [my]114-meg cookery book , and [I]114-meg 've looked through page upon page of the encyclopedia , right through ' [Spain]21-spain , ' and there 's nothing yet , and there are fifty pages more , and [Leslie]121-leslie wo n't help [me]114-meg , though [I]114-meg 've got a headache , because [he]121-leslie 's frabous about something . "[114-meg] [She]114-meg looked at [me]0-i in comical despair .

" Do [you]0-i want them for the bazaar ? "[114-meg]

" Yes for to - morrow . [Cook]4458-cook has done the rest , but [I]114-meg had fairly set [my]114-meg heart on these . Do n't [you]0-i think they are lovely ? "[114-meg]

" Exquisitely lovely . Suppose [I]114-meg go and ask [mother]4146-mother . "[114-meg]

" If [you]0-i would . But no , oh no , [you]0-i ca n't make all that journey this terrible night . [We]4460-we are simply besieged by mud . [The men]1214-the men are both out [William]183-william has gone to meet [father]4145-father and [mother]4146-mother has sent [George]108-george to carry some things to [the vicarage]4464-the vicarage . [I]114-meg ca n't ask one of [the girls]496-the girls on a night like this . [I]114-meg shall have to let it go and the cranberry tarts too it can not be helped . [I]114-meg am so miserable . "[114-meg]

" Ask [Leslie]121-leslie , "[1328-he] said [I.]1328-he

" [He]1328-he is too cross , "[1329-she] [she]1329-she replied , looking at [him]1328-he .

[He]1328-he did not deign a remark .

" Will [you]0-i [Leslie]121-leslie ? "[114-meg]

" What ? "[114-meg]

" Go across to [Woodside]22-woodside for [me]114-meg ? "[114-meg]

" What for ? "[114-meg]

" A recipe . Do , there 's [a dear boy]4466-a dear boy . "[114-meg]

" Where are [the men]1214-the men ? "[114-meg]

" [They]1214-the men are both engaged [they]1214-the men are out . "[114-meg]

" Send [a girl]4168-a girl , then . "[114-meg]

" At night like this ? Who would go ? "[114-meg]

" [Cissy]201-cissy . "[114-meg]

" [I]114-meg shall not ask [her]201-cissy . Is n't [he]1328-he mean , [Cyril]113-cyril ? [Men]562-men are mean . "[114-meg]

" [I]1330-i will come back , "[1330-i] said [I.]1330-i " There is nothing at [home]4184-home to do . [Mother]117-mother is reading , and [Lettie]116-lettie is stitching . The weather disagrees with [her]116-lettie , as it does with [Leslie]121-leslie . "[1330-i]

" But it is not fair "[1331-she] [she]1331-she said , looking at [me]0-i softly . Then [she]1331-she put away the great book and climbed down .

" Wo n't [you]1332-he go , [Leslie]121-leslie ? "[1331-she] [she]1331-she said , laying [her]1331-she hand on [his]1332-he shoulder .

" [Women]561-women ! "[1332-he] [he]1332-he said , rising as if reluctantly . " There 's no end to [their]561-women wants and [their]561-women caprices . "[1332-he]

" [I]1331-she thought [he]1332-he would go , "[1331-she] said [she]1331-she warmly . [She]1331-she ran to fetch [his]1332-he overcoat . [He]1332-he put one arm slowly in the sleeve , and then the other , but [he]1332-he would not lift the coat on to [his]1332-he shoulders .

" Well ! "[1331-she] [she]1331-she said , struggling on tiptoe , " [You]121-leslie are [a great creature]4472-a great creature ! Ca n't [you]121-leslie get it on , [naughty child]4473-naughty child ? "[1331-she]

" Give [her]1331-she a chair to stand on , "[1332-he] [he]1332-he said .

[She]1331-she shook the collar of the coat sharply , but [he]1332-he stood like a sheep , impassive .

" [Leslie]121-leslie , [you]121-leslie are too bad . [I]1331-she ca n't get it on , [you stupid boy]4474-you stupid boy . "[1331-she]

[I]0-i took the coat and jerked it on .

" There , "[1331-she] [she]1331-she said , giving [him]1332-he [his]1332-he cap . " Now do n't be long . "[1331-she]

" What a damned dirty night ! "[1332-he] said [he]1332-he , when [we]1333-we were out .

" It is , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [The town]4475-the town , anywhere 's better than [this hell of]4476-this hell of [a country]4477-a country . "[1331-she]

" Ha ! How did [you]4474-you stupid boy enjoy [yourself]4474-you stupid boy ? "[1332-he]

[He]1332-he began a long history of three days in [the metropolis]1334-the metropolis . [I]0-i listened , and heard little . [I]0-i heard more plainly the cry of some night birds over [Nethermere]1-nethermere , and the peevish , wailing , yarling cry of some beast in the wood . [I]0-i was thankful to slam the door behind [me]0-i , to stand in the light of [the hall]703-the hall .

" [Leslie]121-leslie ! "[4146-mother] exclaimed [mother]4146-mother , " [I]4146-mother am glad to see [you]121-leslie . "[4146-mother]

" Thank [you]4146-mother , "[1332-he] [he]1332-he said , turning to [Lettie]116-lettie , who sat with [her]116-lettie lap full of work , [her]116-lettie head busily bent .

" [You]1332-he see [I]116-lettie ca n't get up , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , giving [him]1332-he [her]116-lettie hand , adorned as it was by the thimble . " How nice of [you]1332-he to come ! [We]4478-we did not know [you]1332-he were back . "[116-lettie]

" But ! "[1332-he] [he]1332-he exclaimed , then [he]1332-he stopped .

" [I]116-lettie suppose [you]1332-he enjoyed [yourself]1332-he , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie went on calmly .

" Immensely , thanks . "[116-lettie]

Snap , snap , snap went [her]116-lettie needle through the new stuff . Then , without looking up , [she]116-lettie said :

" Yes , no doubt . [You]1332-he have the air of [a man who has been enjoying [himself]4479-a man who has been enjoying himself]4479-a man who has been enjoying himself . "[116-lettie]

" How do [you]1332-he mean ? "[116-lettie]

" A kind of guilty or shall [I]116-lettie say embarrassed look . Do n't [you]1332-he notice it [mother]4146-mother ? "[116-lettie]

" [I]515-my mother do ! "[515-my mother] said [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother .

" [I]116-lettie suppose it means [we]4481-we may not ask [him]1338-he questions , "[116-lettie] [Lettie]116-lettie concluded , always very busily sewing .

[He]1338-he laughed . [She]116-lettie had broken [her]116-lettie cotton , and was trying to thread the needle again .

" What have [you]116-lettie been doing this miserable weather ? "[1338-he] [he]1338-he enquired awkwardly .

The next day , Sunday , broke wet and dreary . Breakfast was late , and about ten o'clock [we]1343-our stood at the window looking upon the impossibility of [our]1343-our going to [church]638-church .

There was a driving drizzle of rain , like a dirty curtain before the landscape . The nasturtium leaves by [the garden walk]1345-the garden walk had gone rotten in a frost , and the gay green discs had given place to the first black flags of winter , hung on flaccid stalks , pinched at the neck . The grass plot was strewn with fallen leaves , wet and brilliant : scarlet splashes of Virginia creeper , golden drift from the limes , ruddy brown shawls under the beeches , and away back in the corner , the black mat of maple leaves , heavy soddened ; they ought to have been a vivid lemon colour . Occasionally one of these great black leaves would loose its hold , and zigzag down , staggering in the dance of death .

" There now ! "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie suddenly .

Whirled down the sky like black maple leaves caught up aloft , came two more crows . [They]1350-they swept down and clung hold of the trees in front of [the house]563-the house , staying near [the old forerunner]1352-the old forerunner . [I]0-i sat by [my]0-i window and watched the low clouds reel and stagger past . It seemed as if everything were being swept along [I]0-i [myself]0-i seemed to have lost [my]0-i substance , to have become detached from concrete things and the firm trodden pavement of everyday life . Onward , always onward , not knowing where , nor why , the wind , the clouds , the rain and the birds and the leaves , everything whirling along why ?

All this time the old crow sat motionless , though the clouds tumbled , and were rent and piled , though the trees bent , and the window - pane shivered with running water . Then [I]0-i found it had ceased to rain ; that there was a sickly yellow gleam of sunlight , brightening on some great elm - leaves near at hand till they looked like ripe lemons hanging . [He]1371-he looked proudly , thinking [she]1372-she referred to the earnestness of [her]1372-she love .

In the wood the wind rumbled and roared hoarsely overhead , but not a breath stirred among the saddened bracken . An occasional raindrop was shaken out of the trees ; [I]0-i slipped on [the wet paths]1373-the wet paths . Black bars striped the grey tree - trunks , where water had trickled down ; the bracken was overthrown , its yellow ranks broken . [I]0-i slid down the steep path to the gate , out of the wood .

Armies of cloud marched in rank across the sky , heavily laden , almost brushing the gorse on [the common]956-the common . The wind was cold and disheartening . The ground sobbed at every step . [The brook]574-the brook was full , swirling along , hurrying , talking to itself , in absorbed intent tones . The clouds darkened ; [I]0-i felt the rain . Careless of the mud , [I]0-i ran , and burst into [the farm kitchen]1376-the farm kitchen .

[The children]4276-the children were painting , and [they]4276-the children immediately claimed [my]0-i help .

" [Emily]109-emily and [George]108-george are in [the front room]4539-the front room , "[460-the mother] said [the mother]460-the mother quietly , for it was Sunday afternoon . [I]0-i satisfied [the little ones]1379-the little ones ; [I]0-i said a few words to [the mother]460-the mother , and sat down to take off [my]0-i clogs .

In [the parlour]587-the parlour , [the father]465-the father , big and comfortable , was sleeping in an arm - chair . [Emily]109-emily was writing at the table [she]109-emily hurriedly hid [her]109-emily papers when [I]0-i entered . [George]108-george was sitting by the fire , reading . [He]108-george looked up as [I]0-i entered , and [I]0-i loved [him]108-george when [he]108-george looked up at [me]0-i , and as [he]108-george lingered on [his]108-george quiet " Hullo ! "[108-george] [His]108-george eyes were beautifully eloquent as eloquent as a kiss .

[We]1383-we talked in subdued murmurs , because [the father]465-the father was asleep , opulently asleep , [his]465-the father tanned face as still as a brown pear against the wall . The clock itself went slowly , with languid throbs . [We]1383-we gathered round the fire , and talked quietly , about nothing blissful merely in the sound of [our]1383-we voices , a murmured , soothing sound a grateful , dispassionate love trio .

At last [George]108-george rose , put down [his]108-george book looked at [[his]108-george father]630-his father and went out .

In [the barn]589-the barn there was a sound of the pulper crunching the turnips . The crisp strips of turnip sprinkled quietly down onto a heap of gold which grew beneath the pulper . The smell of pulped turnips , keen and sweet , brings back to [me]0-i the feeling of many winter nights , when frozen hoof - prints crunch in [the yard]457-the yard , and [Orion]276-orion is in [the south]1388-the south ; when a friendship was at its mystical best .

" Pulping on Sunday ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed .

" [Father]165-father did n't do it yesterday ; it 's [his]165-father work ; and [I]0-i did n't notice it . [You]0-i know [Father]165-father often forgets [he]165-father does n't like to have to work in the afternoon , now . "[0-i]

The cattle stirred in [their]1389-their stalls ; the chains rattled round the posts ; a cow coughed noisily . When [George]108-george had finished pulping , and it was quiet enough for talk , just as [he]108-george was spreading the first layers of chop and turnip and meal in ran [Emily]109-emily , with [her]109-emily hair in silken , twining confusion , [her]109-emily eyes glowing to bid [us]1390-us go in to tea before the milking was begun . It was the custom to milk before tea on Sunday but [George]108-george abandoned it without demur [[his]108-george father]630-his father willed it so , and [[his]108-george father]630-his father was [master]1393-master , not to be questioned on farm matters , however [one]606-one disagreed .

The last day in October had been dreary enough ; the night could not come too early . [We]1390-us had tea by lamplight , merrily , with [the father]465-the father radiating comfort as the lamp shone yellow light . Sunday tea was imperfect without [a visitor]1396-a visitor ; with [me]0-i , [they]1397-they always declared , it was perfect . [I]0-i loved to hear [them]1397-they say so . [I]0-i smiled , rejoicing quietly into [my]0-i teacup when [the Father]465-the father said :

" It seems proper to have [Cyril]113-cyril here at Sunday tea , it seems natural . "[465-the father]

[He]465-the father was most loath to break the delightful bond of the lamp - lit tea - table ; [he]465-the father looked up with a half - appealing glance when [George]108-george at last pushed back [his]108-george chair and said [he]108-george supposed [he]108-george 'd better make a start .

" Ay , "[465-the father] said [the father]465-the father in a mild , conciliatory tone , " [I]465-the father 'll be out in a minute . "[465-the father]

The lamp hung against [the barn]589-the barn - wall , softly illuminating the lower part of [the building]1401-the building , where bits of hay and white dust lay in the hollows between the bricks , where the curled chips of turnip scattered orange gleams over the earthen floor ; the lofty roof , with [its]1402-its swallows ' nests under the tiles , was deep in shadow , and the corners were full of darkness , hiding , half hiding , the hay , [the chopper]1403-the chopper , [the bins]1404-the bins . The light shone along the passages before [the stalls]1405-the stalls , glistening on the moist noses of the cattle , and on the whitewash of the walls .

[George]108-george was very cheerful ; but [I]0-i wanted to tell [him]108-george [my]0-i message . When [he]108-george had finished the feeding , and had at last sat down to milk , [I]0-i said :

" [I]0-i told [you]108-george [Leslie Tempest]121-leslie was at [[our]4540-our house]1058-our house when [I]0-i came away . "[0-i]

" [They]4542-they are practically engaged now , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

[The cow]1407-the cow looked round and stirred uneasily . [He]108-george began to draw the milk , and then to milk mechanically . [I]0-i watched the movement of [his]108-george hands , listening to the rhythmic clang of the jets of milk on the bucket , as a relief . " [She]1407-the cow has really said yes ? "[108-george]

" And what does [[your]108-george mother]4163-your mother say ? "[0-i]

" [She]1407-the cow is pleased . "[0-i]

[He]108-george began to milk again . The cow stirred uneasily , shifting [her]1407-the cow legs . [He]108-george looked at [her]1407-the cow angrily , and went on milking . Then , quite upset , [she]1407-the cow shifted again , and swung [her]1407-the cow tail in [his]108-george face .

CHAPTER VIII

THE RIOT OF CHRISTMAS

For some weeks , during the latter part of November and the beginning of December , [I]0-i was kept [indoors]626-indoors by a cold . At last came a frost which cleared the air and dried the mud . On the second Saturday before Christmas [the world]1209-the world was transformed ; tall , silver and pearl - grey trees rose pale against a dim - blue sky , like trees in [some rare , pale Paradise]1419-some rare , pale paradise ; [the whole woodland]1420-the whole woodland was as if petrified in marble and silver and snow ; the holly - leaves and long leaves of the rhododendron were rimmed and spangled with delicate tracery .

When the night came clear and bright , with a moon among the hoar - frost , [I]0-i rebelled against confinement , and [the house]563-the house . No longer the mists and dank weather made the home dear ; tonight even the glare of [the distant little iron works]1422-the distant little iron works was not visible , for the low clouds were gone , and pale stars blinked from beyond the moon .

[Lettie]116-lettie was staying with [me]0-i ; [Leslie]121-leslie was in [London]23-london again . [She]116-lettie tried to remonstrate in a sisterly fashion when [I]0-i said [I]0-i would go out .

" Only down to [the Mill]635-the mill , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i Then [she]116-lettie hesitated a while said [she]116-lettie would come too . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i looked at [her]116-lettie curiously , for [she]116-lettie said :

" Oh if [you]0-i would rather go alone ! "[116-lettie]

" Come come yes , come ! "[0-i] said [I]0-i , smiling to [myself]0-i .

[Lettie]116-lettie was in [her]116-lettie old animated mood . [She]116-lettie ran , leaping over rough places , laughing , talking to [herself]116-lettie in French . [We]1423-we came to [the Mill]635-the mill . [Gyp]185-gyp did not bark . [I]0-i opened the outer door and [we]1423-we crept softly into [the great dark scullery]1425-the great dark scullery , peeping into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen through the crack of the door .

[The mother]460-the mother sat by the hearth , where was a big bath half full of soapy water , and at [her]460-the mother feet , warming [his]1428-his bare legs at the fire , was [David]150-david , who had just been bathed . [The mother]460-the mother was gently rubbing [his]1428-his fine fair hair into a cloud . [Mollie]114-meg was combing out [her]114-meg brown curls , sitting by [[her]114-meg father]486-her father , who , in the fire - seat , was reading aloud in a hearty voice , with quaint precision . At the table sat [Emily]109-emily and [George]108-george : [she]109-emily was quickly picking over a pile of little yellow raisins , and [he]1428-his , slowly , with [his]1428-his head sunk , was stoning the large raisins . [David]150-david kept reaching forward to play with the sleepy cat interrupting [[his]150-david mother]453-his mother 's rubbing . There was no sound but the voice of [the father]465-the father , full of zest ; [I]0-i am afraid [they]1433-they were not all listening carefully . [I]0-i clicked the latch and entered .

" [Lettie]116-lettie ! "[108-george] exclaimed [George]108-george .

" [Cyril]113-cyril ! "[109-emily] cried [Emily]109-emily .

" [Cyril]113-cyril , ' ooray ! "[150-david] shouted [David]150-david .

" Hullo , [Cyril]113-cyril ! "[114-meg] said [Mollie]114-meg .

Six large brown eyes , round with surprise , welcomed [me]0-i . [They]1434-they overwhelmed [me]0-i with questions , and made much of [us]1435-we . At length [they]1434-they were settled and quiet again .

" Yes , [I]116-lettie am [a stranger]715-a stranger , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , who had taken off [her]116-lettie hat and furs and coat . " But [you]0-i do not expect [me]116-lettie often , do [you]0-i ? [I]116-lettie may come at times , eh ? "[116-lettie]

" [We]1435-we are only too glad , "[460-the mother] replied [the mother]460-the mother . " Nothing all day long but the sound of the sluice and mists , and rotten leaves . [I]460-the mother am thankful to hear a fresh voice . "[460-the mother]

" Is [Cyril]113-cyril really better , [Lettie]116-lettie ? "[109-emily] asked [Emily]109-emily softly .

" [He]113-cyril 's [a spoiled boy]4556-a spoiled boy [I]460-the mother believe [he]113-cyril keeps a little bit ill so that [we]1435-we can cade [him]113-cyril . Let [me]460-the mother help [you]116-lettie let [me]460-the mother peel the apples yes , yes [I]460-the mother will . "[460-the mother]

[She]109-emily went to the table , and occupied one side with [her]109-emily apple - peeling . [George]108-george had not spoken to [her]109-emily . So [she]109-emily said :

" [I]109-emily wo n't help [you]108-george [George]108-george , because [I]109-emily do n't like to feel [my]109-emily fingers so sticky , and because [I]109-emily love to see [you]108-george so domesticated . "[109-emily]

" [You]116-lettie 'll enjoy the sight a long time , then , for these things are numberless . "[109-emily]

" [You]116-lettie should eat one now and then [I]109-emily always do . "[109-emily]

" If [I]109-emily ate one [I]109-emily should eat the lot . "[109-emily]

" Then [you]116-lettie may give [me]108-george [your]116-lettie one . "[108-george]

[He]108-george passed [her]109-emily a handful without speaking .

" That is too many , [[your]116-lettie mother]4163-your mother is looking . Let [me]109-emily just finish this apple . There , [I]109-emily 've not broken the peel ! "[109-emily]

[She]109-emily stood up , holding up a long curling strip of peel .

" How many times must [I]109-emily swing it , [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton ? "[109-emily]

" Three times but it 's not All Hallows ' Eve . "[465-the father]

" Never mind ! Look ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily carefully swung the long band of green peel over [her]109-emily head three times , letting it fall the third . The cat pounced on it , but [Mollie]114-meg swept [him]108-george off again .

" What is it ? "[116-lettie] cried [Lettie]116-lettie , blushing .

" G , "[465-the father] said [the father]465-the father , winking and laughing [the mother]460-the mother looked daggers at [him]465-the father .

" It is n't nothink , "[150-david] said [David]150-david naively , forgetting [his]150-david confusion at being in the presence of [a lady in [his]150-david shirt]1439-a lady in his shirt . [Mollie]114-meg remarked in [her]114-meg cool way :

" It might be a ' hess ' if [you]0-i could n't write . "[114-meg]

" Or an ' L ' , "[0-i] [I]0-i added . [Lettie]116-lettie looked over at [me]0-i imperiously , and [I]0-i was angry .

" What do [you]0-i say , [Emily]109-emily ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie asked .

" Nay , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , " It 's only [you]0-i can see the right letter . "[109-emily]

" Tell [us]4558-us what 's the right letter , "[108-george] said [George]108-george to [her]109-emily .

" [I]116-lettie ! "[116-lettie] exclaimed [Lettie]116-lettie , " who can look into the seeds of Time ? "[116-lettie]

" [Those who have set 'em and watched 'em sprout]4559-those who have set 'em and watched 'em sprout , "[116-lettie] said I.

[She]116-lettie flung the peel into the fire , laughing a short laugh , and went on with [her]116-lettie work .

[Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton leaned over to [[her]131-mrs. saxton daughter]488-her daughter and said softly , so that [he]108-george should not hear , that [George]108-george was pulling the flesh out of the raisins .

" [George]108-george ! "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily sharply , " [You]108-george 're leaving nothing but the husks . "[109-emily]

[He]108-george too was angry :

" ' And [he]108-george would fain fill [his]108-george belly with the husks that [the swine]4560-the swine did eat . ' "[108-george] [he]108-george said quietly , taking a handful of the fruit [he]108-george had picked and putting some in [his]108-george mouth . [Emily]109-emily snatched away the basin :

" It is too bad ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said .

" Here , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , handing [him]108-george an apple [she]116-lettie had peeled . " [You]108-george may have an apple , [greedy boy]4561-greedy boy . "[116-lettie]

[He]108-george took it and looked at it . Then a malicious smile twinkled round [his]108-george eyes , as [he]108-george said :

" If [you]116-lettie give [me]108-george the apple , to whom will [you]116-lettie give the peel ? "[108-george]

" [The swine]4560-the swine , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , as if [she]116-lettie only understood [his]108-george first reference to [the Prodigal Son]1441-the prodigal son . [He]108-george put the apple on the table .

" Do n't [you]108-george want it ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said .

" [Mother]4146-mother , "[108-george] [he]108-george said comically , as if jesting . " [She]116-lettie is offering [me]108-george the apple like [Eve]210-eve . "[108-george]

[She]116-lettie missed , and [the father]465-the father leaned forward and picked it off the hob , saying :

" The pigs may as well have it . [You]108-george were slow , [George]108-george when [a lady]4564-a lady offers [you]108-george a thing [you]108-george do n't have to make mouths . "[465-the father]

" A ce qu'il parait , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie cried , laughing now at [her]116-lettie ease , boisterously :

" Is [she]4564-a lady making love , [Emily]109-emily ? "[465-the father] asked [the father]465-the father , laughing suggestively .

" [She]4564-a lady says it too fast for [me]109-emily , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily .

[George]108-george was leaning back in [his]108-george chair , [his]108-george hands in [his]108-george breeches pockets .

" [He]108-george likes [his]108-george comfort , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , with irony .

" The picture of content solid , healthy , easy - moving content "[116-lettie] continued [Lettie]116-lettie . As [he]108-george sat thus , with [his]108-george head thrown back against the end of the ingle - seat , coatless , [his]108-george red neck seen in repose , [he]108-george did indeed look remarkably comfortable .

" [I]108-george shall never fret [my]108-george fat away , "[108-george] [he]108-george said stolidly .

" No [you]109-emily and [I]116-lettie [we]4567-we are not like [Cyril]113-cyril . [We]4567-we do not burn [our]4567-we bodies in [our]4567-we heads or [our]4567-we hearts , do [we]4567-we ? "[116-lettie]

[Lettie]116-lettie went on with the paring and coring of [her]116-lettie apples then [she]116-lettie took the raisins . Meanwhile , [Emily]109-emily was making the house ring as [she]109-emily chopped the suet in a wooden bowl . [The children]4276-the children were ready for bed . [They]4276-the children kissed [us]1445-us all " Good - night "[4276-the children] save [George]108-george . At last [they]4276-the children were gone , accompanied by [[their]4276-the children mother]1446-their mother . [Emily]109-emily put down [her]109-emily chopper , and sighed that [her]109-emily arm was aching , so [I]0-i relieved [her]109-emily . The chopping went on for a long time , while [the father]465-the father read , [Lettie]116-lettie worked , and [George]108-george sat tilted back looking on . When at length the mincemeat was finished [we]1445-us were all out of work . [Lettie]116-lettie helped to clear away sat down talked a little with effort jumped up and said :

" Oh , [I]116-lettie 'm too excited to sit still it 's so near [Christmas]216-christmas let [us]1445-us play at something . "[116-lettie]

" A dance ? "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily .

" A dance a dance ! "[116-lettie]

[He]108-george suddenly sat straight and got up :

" Come on ! "[108-george] [he]108-george said .

[He]108-george kicked off [his]108-george slippers , regardless of the holes in [his]108-george stocking feet , and put away the chairs . [He]108-george held out [his]108-george arm to [her]109-emily [she]109-emily came with a laugh , and away [they]1448-they went , dancing over [the great flagged kitchen]1449-the great flagged kitchen at an incredible speed . [Her]109-emily light flying steps followed [his]108-george leaps ; [you]1450-you could hear the quick light tap of [her]109-emily toes more plainly than the thud of [his]108-george stockinged feet . [Emily]109-emily and [I]0-i joined in . [Emily]109-emily 's movements are naturally slow , but [we]1451-we danced at great speed . [I]0-i was hot and perspiring , and [she]109-emily was panting , when [I]0-i put [her]109-emily in a chair . But [they]1448-they whirled on in the dance , on and on till [I]0-i was giddy , till [the father]465-the father laughing , cried that [they]1448-they should stop . But [George]108-george continued the dance ; [her]109-emily hair was shaken loose , and fell in a great coil down [her]109-emily back ; [her]109-emily feet began to drag ; [you]1450-you could hear a light slur on the floor ; [she]109-emily was panting [I]0-i could see [her]109-emily lips murmur to [him]465-the father , begging [him]465-the father to stop ; [he]465-the father was laughing with open mouth , holding [her]109-emily tight ; at last [her]109-emily feet trailed ; [he]465-the father lifted [her]109-emily , clasping [her]109-emily tightly , and danced twice round [the room]518-the room with [her]109-emily thus . Then [he]465-the father fell with a crash on the sofa , pulling [her]109-emily beside [him]465-the father . [His]465-the father eyes glowed like coals ; [he]465-the father was panting in sobs , and [his]465-the father hair was wet and glistening . [She]109-emily lay back on the sofa , with [his]465-the father arm still around [her]109-emily , not moving ; [she]109-emily was quite overcome . [Her]109-emily hair was wild about [her]109-emily face . [Emily]109-emily was anxious ; [the father]465-the father said , with a shade of inquietude :

" [You]109-emily 've overdone it it is very foolish . "[465-the father]

When at last [she]109-emily recovered [her]109-emily breath and [her]109-emily life , [she]109-emily got up , and laughing in a queer way , began to put up [her]109-emily hair . [She]109-emily went into [the scullery]602-the scullery where were the brush and combs , and [Emily]109-emily followed with a candle . When [she]109-emily returned , ordered once more , with a little pallor succeeding the flush , and with a great black stain of sweat on [her]109-emily leathern belt where [his]465-the father hand had held [her]109-emily , [he]465-the father looked up at [her]109-emily from [his]465-the father position on the sofa , with a peculiar glance of triumph , smiling .

" [You]465-the father great brute , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , but [her]109-emily voice was not as harsh as [her]109-emily words . [He]465-the father gave a deep sigh , sat up , and laughed quietly .

" Another ? "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said .

" Will [you]109-emily dance with [me]109-emily ? "[109-emily]

" At [your]109-emily pleasure . "[109-emily]

" Come then a minuet . "[109-emily]

" Do n't know it . "[109-emily]

[He]465-the father reared up , and walked to [her]109-emily side . [She]109-emily put [him]465-the father through the steps , even dragging [him]465-the father round the waltz . It was very ridiculous . When it was finished [she]109-emily bowed [him]465-the father to [his]465-the father seat , and , wiping [her]109-emily hands on [her]109-emily handkerchief , because [his]465-the father shirt where [her]109-emily hand had rested on [his]465-the father shoulders was moist , [she]109-emily thanked [him]465-the father .

" [I]465-the father hope [you]109-emily enjoyed it , "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said .

" Ever so much , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily replied .

" [You]465-the father made [me]465-the father look [a fool]4191-a fool so no doubt [you]465-the father did . "[465-the father]

" Do [you]465-the father think [you]465-the father could look [a fool]4191-a fool ? Why [you]465-the father are ironical ! Ca marche ! In other words , [you]465-the father have come on . But it is a sweet dance . "[465-the father]

[He]465-the father looked at [her]109-emily , lowered [his]465-the father eyelids , and said nothing .

" Ah , well , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily laughed , ' some are bred for the minuet , and some for "[465-the father]

" Ah [you]109-emily call it tomfoolery because [you]109-emily can not do it . [Myself]465-the father , [I]465-the father like it so "[465-the father]

" And [I]109-emily ca n't do it ? "[109-emily]

" Sort of [Clarence MacFadden]217-clarence macfadden , "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said , lighting a pipe as if the conversation did not interest [him]465-the father .

' [Clarence MacFadden]217-clarence macfadden [he]217-clarence macfadden wanted to dance But [his]217-clarence macfadden feet were not gaited that way . . . '

" [I]465-the father remember [we]4570-we sang it after one corn harvest [we]4570-we had a fine time . "[465-the father]

" When ? Who 's coming ? "[1456-she]

" The twenty - sixth . Oh ! only [the old people]4571-the old people [Alice Tom Smith]218-alice Fanny those from Highclose . "[465-the father]

" And what will [you]465-the father do ? "[1456-she]

" Polka ? "[1456-she]

" And minuets and [valetas]4572-valetas . Come and dance [a valeta]4573-a valeta , [Cyril]113-cyril . "[465-the father]

[She]1456-she made [me]0-i take [her]1456-she through a valeta , a minuet , a mazurka , and [she]1456-she danced elegantly , but with a little of [Carmen]219-carmen 's ostentation [her]1456-she dash and devilry . When [we]1457-we had finished , [the father]465-the father said :

" Very pretty very pretty , indeed ! [They]4574-they do look nice , do n't [they]4574-they , [George]108-george ? [I]465-the father wish [I]465-the father was young . "[465-the father]

" As [I]108-george am "[108-george] said [George]108-george , laughing bitterly .

" Show [me]109-emily how to do them some time , [Cyril]113-cyril , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , in [her]109-emily pleading way , which displeased [Lettie]116-lettie so much .

" Why do n't [you]109-emily ask [me]627-the latter ? "[627-the latter] said [the latter]627-the latter quickly .

" Well but [you]109-emily are not often here . "[109-emily]

" [I]116-lettie am here now . Come "[116-lettie] and [she]116-lettie waved [Emily]109-emily imperiously to the attempt .

[Lettie]116-lettie , as [I]0-i have said , is tall , approaching six feet ; [she]116-lettie is lissome , but firmly moulded , by nature graceful ; in [her]116-lettie poise and harmonious movement are revealed the subtle sympathies of [[her]116-lettie artist]1460-her artist 's soul . The other is shorter , much heavier . In [her]116-lettie every motion [you]1461-you can see the extravagance of [her]116-lettie emotional nature . [She]116-lettie quivers with feeling ; emotion conquers and carries havoc through [her]116-lettie , for [she]116-lettie has not a strong intellect , nor a heart of light humour ; [her]116-lettie nature is brooding and defenceless ; [she]116-lettie knows [herself]116-lettie powerless in the tumult of [her]116-lettie feelings , and adds to [her]116-lettie misfortunes a profound mistrust of [herself]116-lettie .

As [they]1462-they danced together , [Lettie]116-lettie and [Emily]109-emily , [they]1462-they showed in striking contrast . [[My]0-i sister]637-my sister 's ease and beautiful poetic movement was exquisite ; [the other]689-the other could not control [her]116-lettie movements , but repeated the same error again and again . [She]109-emily gripped [Lettie]116-lettie 's hand fiercely , and glanced up with eyes full of humiliation and terror of [her]109-emily continued failure , and passionate , trembling , hopeless desire to succeed . To show [her]109-emily , to explain , made matters worse . As soon as [she]109-emily trembled on the brink of an action , the terror of not being able to perform it properly blinded [her]109-emily , and [she]109-emily was conscious of nothing but that [she]109-emily must do something in a turmoil . At last [Lettie]116-lettie ceased to talk , and merely swung [her]109-emily through the dances haphazard . This way succeeded better . So long as [Emily]109-emily need not think about [her]109-emily actions , [she]109-emily had a large , free grace ; and the swing and rhythm and time were imparted through [her]109-emily senses rather than through [her]109-emily intelligence .

It was time for supper . [The mother]460-the mother came down for a while , and [we]1466-we talked quietly , at random . [Lettie]116-lettie did not utter a word about [her]116-lettie engagement , not a suggestion . [She]116-lettie made it seem as if things were just as before , although [I]0-i am sure [she]116-lettie had discovered that [I]0-i had told [George]108-george . [She]116-lettie intended that [we]1466-we should play as if ignorant of [her]116-lettie bond .

After supper , when [we]1466-we were ready to go [home]4184-home , [Lettie]116-lettie said to [him]108-george :

" By the way [you]108-george must send [us]1466-we some mistletoe for the party with plenty of berries , [you]108-george know . Are there many berries on [your]108-george mistletoe this year ? "[116-lettie]

" [I]108-george do not know [I]108-george have never looked . [We]1466-we will go and see if [you]108-george like , "[108-george] [George]108-george answered . " But will [you]108-george come out into the cold ? "[108-george] [He]108-george pulled on [his]108-george boots , and [his]108-george coat , and twisted a scarf round [his]108-george neck . The young moon had gone . It was very dark the liquid stars wavered . The great night filled [us]1466-we with awe . [Lettie]116-lettie caught hold of [my]0-i arm , and held it tightly . [He]108-george passed on in front to open the gates . [We]1466-we went down into [the front garden]447-the front garden , over the turf bridge where the sluice rushed coldly under , on to [the broad slope of the bank]1469-the broad slope of the bank . [We]1466-we could just distinguish the gnarled old appletrees leaning about [us]1466-we . [We]1466-we bent [our]1466-we heads to avoid the boughs , and followed [George]108-george . [He]108-george hesitated a moment , saying :

" Let [me]108-george see [I]108-george think [they]4575-they are there the two trees with mistletoe on . "[108-george]

[We]1466-we again followed silently .

" Yes , "[108-george] [he]108-george said , " Here they are ! "[108-george]

[We]1466-we went close and peered into the old trees . [We]1466-we could just see the dark bush of the mistletoe between the boughs of the tree . [Lettie]116-lettie began to laugh .

" Have [we]1466-we come to count the berries ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said . " [I]116-lettie ca n't even see the mistletoe . "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie leaned forwards and upwards to pierce the darkness ; [he]108-george , also straining to look , felt [her]116-lettie breath on [his]108-george cheek , and turning , saw the pallor of [her]116-lettie face close to [his]108-george , and felt the dark glow of [her]116-lettie eyes . [He]108-george caught [her]116-lettie in [his]108-george arms , and held [her]116-lettie mouth in a kiss . Then , when [he]108-george released [her]116-lettie , [he]108-george turned away , saying something incoherent about going to fetch the lantern to look . [She]116-lettie remained with [her]116-lettie back towards [me]0-i , and pretended to be feeling among the mistletoe for the berries . Soon [I]0-i saw the swing of the hurricane lamp below .

" [He]108-george is bringing the lantern , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

When [he]108-george came up , [he]108-george said , and [his]108-george voice was strange and subdued :

" Now [we]1470-they can see what it 's like . "[108-george]

[He]108-george went near , and held up the lamp , so that it illuminated both [their]1470-they faces , and the fantastic boughs of the trees , and the weird bush of mistletoe sparsely pearled with berries . Instead of looking at the berries [they]1470-they looked into [each other]4254-each other 's eyes ; [his]108-george lids flickered , and [he]108-george flushed , in the yellow light of the lamp looking warm and handsome ; [he]108-george looked upwards in confusion and said : " There are plenty of berries . "[108-george]

As a matter of fact there were very few .

[She]116-lettie too looked up , and murmured [her]116-lettie assent . The light seemed to hold [them]1470-they as in a globe , in another world , apart from the night in which [I]0-i stood . [He]108-george put up [his]108-george hand and broke off a sprig of mistletoe , with berries , and offered it to [her]116-lettie . [They]1470-they looked into [each other]4254-each other 's eyes again . [She]116-lettie put the mistletoe among [her]116-lettie furs , looking down at [her]116-lettie bosom . [They]1470-they remained still , in the centre of light , with the lamp uplifted ; the red and black scarf wrapped loosely round [his]108-george neck gave [him]108-george a luxurious , generous look . [He]108-george lowered the lamp and said , affecting to speak naturally :

" Yes there is plenty this year . "[108-george]

" [You]108-george will give [me]116-lettie some , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie replied , turning away and finally breaking the spell .

" When shall [I]108-george cut it ? "[108-george] [He]108-george strode beside [her]116-lettie , swinging the lamp , as [we]1473-we went down [the bank]434-the bank to go [home]4184-home . [He]108-george came as far as [the brooks]1476-the brooks without saying another word . Then [he]108-george bade [us]1473-we good - night . When [he]108-george had lighted [her]116-lettie over the stepping - stones , [she]116-lettie did not take [my]0-i arm as [we]1473-we walked [home]4184-home .

During the next two weeks [we]1473-we were busy preparing for Christmas , ranging [the woods]600-the woods for the reddest holly , and pulling the gleaming ivy - bunches from the trees . From [the farms]1479-the farms around came the cruel yelling of pigs , and in the evening later , was a scent of pork - pies . Far - off on the high - way could be heard the sharp trot of ponies hastening with Christmas goods .

There [the carts of [the hucksters]1481-the hucksters]1480-the carts of the hucksters dashed by to [the expectant villagers]1482-the expectant villagers , triumphant with great bunches of light foreign mistletoe , gay with oranges peeping through the boxes , and scarlet intrusion of apples , and wild confusion of cold , dead poultry . [The hucksters]1481-the hucksters waved [their]1481-the hucksters whips triumphantly , the little ponies rattled bravely under the sycamores , towards [Christmas]216-christmas .

In the late afternoon of the 24th , when dust was rising under the hazel brake , [I]0-i was walking with [Lettie]116-lettie . All among the mesh of twigs overhead was tangled a dark red sky . The boles of the trees grew denser almost blue .

Tramping down [the riding]1484-the riding [we]1473-we met [two boys]1485-two boys , fifteen or sixteen years old . [Their]1485-two boys clothes were largely patched with tough cotton moleskin ; scarves were knotted round [their]1485-two boys throats , and in [their]1485-two boys pockets rolled tin bottles full of tea , and the white knobs of [their]1485-two boys knotted snap - bags .

" Why ! "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie . " Are [you]0-i going to work on Christmas eve ? "[116-lettie]

" It looks like it , do n't it ? "[1486-the elder] said [the elder]1486-the elder .

" And what time will [you]0-i be coming back ? "[116-lettie]

" About ' [alf]4576-alf past tÅ²w . "[116-lettie]

" Christmas morning ! "[116-lettie]

" [You]0-i 'll be able to look out for [the herald Angels]4577-the herald angels and the Star , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [They]1485-two boys 'd think [we]1473-we was [two dirty little uns]4578-two dirty little uns , "[1487-the younger lad] said [the younger lad]1487-the younger lad , laughing .

" [They]1485-two boys 'll ' appen ' a done before [we]1473-we get up ter th ' top , "[1488-the elder boy] added [the elder boy]1488-the elder boy " an ' [they]1485-two boys 'll none venture down [th ' shaft]4579-th ' shaft . "[1488-the elder boy]

" If [they]1485-two boys did , "[689-the other] put in [the other]689-the other , " [You]0-i 'd ha'e ter bath 'em after . [I]689-the other 'd gi'e 'em a bit o ' [my]689-the other pasty . "[689-the other]

" Come on , "[1486-the elder] said [the elder]1486-the elder sulkily .

[They]1491-they tramped off , slurring [their]1491-they heavy boots .

" Merry Christmas ! "[0-i] [I]0-i called after [them]1491-they .

" In th ' mornin ' , "[1486-the elder] replied [the elder]1486-the elder .

" Same to [you]0-i , "[1493-the younger] said [the younger]1493-the younger , and [he]1493-the younger began to sing with a tinge of bravado .

" In [the fields]955-the fields with [[their]1491-they flocks]4581-their flocks abiding . [They]1491-they lay on [the dewy ground]4582-the dewy ground "[1493-the younger]

" [Fancy]220-fancy , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , " [those boys]4583-those boys are working for [me]116-lettie ! "[116-lettie]

[We]1494-we were all going to the party at Highclose . [I]0-i happened to go into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen about half past seven . The lamp was turned low , and [Rebecca]115-rebecca sat in the shadows . On the table , in the light of the lamp , [I]0-i saw a glass vase with five or six very beautiful Christmas roses .

" [Hullo]112-hullo , [Becka]221-becka , who 's sent [you]221-becka these ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [They]4583-those boys 're not sent , "[115-rebecca] replied [Rebecca]115-rebecca from the depth of the shadow , with suspicion of tears in [her]115-rebecca voice .

At Highclose [Lettie]116-lettie made a stir . CHAPTER IX

[LETTIE COMES OF AGE

Lettie]116-lettie was twenty - one on the day after Christmas . [She]116-lettie woke [me]0-i in the morning with cries of dismay . There was a great fall of snow , multiplying the cold morning light , startling the slow - footed twilight . [The lake]546-the lake was black like the open eyes of a corpse ; [the woods]600-the woods were black like the beard on the face of a corpse . A rabbit bobbed out , and floundered in much consternation ; little birds settled into the depth , and rose in a dusty whirr , much terrified at the universal treachery of [the earth]1097-the earth . The snow was eighteen inches deep , and drifted in places .

" [They]1516-our two boys will never come ! "[116-lettie] lamented [Lettie]116-lettie , for it was the day of [her]116-lettie party .

" At any rate [Leslie]121-leslie will , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" One ! "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie exclaimed .

" [That one]4604-that one is all , is n't it ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " And for sure [George]108-george will come , though [I]0-i 've not seen [him]108-george this fortnight . [He]108-george 's not been in one night , [they]1521-they say , for a fortnight . "[0-i]

" Why not ? "[0-i]

" [I]0-i can not say . "[0-i]

[Lettie]116-lettie went away to ask [Rebecca]115-rebecca for the fiftieth time if [she]115-rebecca thought [they]1521-they would come . At any rate [the extra woman]1522-the extra woman - help came .

It was not more than ten o'clock when [Leslie]121-leslie arrived , ruddy , with shining eyes , laughing like [a boy]4230-a boy . There was much stamping in [the porch]446-the porch , and knocking of leggings with [his]121-leslie stick , and crying of [Lettie]116-lettie from [the kitchen]451-the kitchen to know who had come , and loud , cheery answers from [the porch]446-the porch bidding [her]116-lettie come and see . [She]116-lettie came , and greeted [him]121-leslie with effusion .

" Ha , [[my]121-leslie little woman]4605-my little woman ! "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie said kissing [her]116-lettie . " [I]121-leslie declare [you]116-lettie are [a woman]881-a woman . [He]121-leslie made a movement of pleasure . [She]116-lettie looked up , laughing breathlessly at [him]121-leslie .

" Now ! "[121-leslie] said [he]121-leslie , in tones of finality .

[He]121-leslie caught [her]116-lettie in [his]121-leslie arms .

[They]1548-they continued to talk half nonsense , making [themselves]1548-they eloquent by quick looks and gestures , and communion of warm closeness . The ironical tones went out of [Lettie]116-lettie 's voice , and [they]1548-they made love .

[Marie]114-meg drew [me]0-i away into [the dining room]1549-the dining room , to leave [them]1548-they alone .

[Marie]114-meg is [a charming little maid , whose appearance is neatness , whose face is confident little goodness]1550-a charming little maid , whose appearance is neatness , whose face is confident little goodness . [Her]114-meg hair is dark , and lies low upon [her]114-meg neck in wavy coils . [She]114-meg does not affect the fashion in coiffure , and generally is a little behind the fashion in dress . Indeed [she]114-meg is a half - opened bud of [a matron]1551-a matron , conservative , full of proprieties , and of gentle indulgence . [She]114-meg now smiled at [me]0-i with a warm delight in the romance upon which [she]114-meg had just shed [her]114-meg grace , but [her]114-meg demureness allowed nothing to be said . " Ay , "[108-george] [he]108-george agreed , but doubtfully .

" [I]116-lettie wonder where it will end , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said .

" [Lettie]116-lettie ! "[108-george] [he]108-george cried , and [his]108-george hand closed in a grip on [her]116-lettie 's .

" Do n't do n't say anything it 's no good now , it 's too late . It 's done ; and what is done , is done . If [you]116-lettie talk any more , [I]108-george shall say [I]108-george 'm tired and stop the dance . Do n't say another word . "[108-george]

[He]108-george did not at least to [her]116-lettie . [Their]1618-their dance came to an end . Then [he]108-george took [Marie]114-meg who talked winsomely to [him]108-george . As [he]108-george waltzed with [Marie]114-meg [he]108-george regained [his]108-george animated spirits . [He]108-george was very lively the rest of the evening , quite astonishing and reckless . At supper [he]108-george ate everything , and drank much wine .

" Have some more turkey , [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton . "[114-meg]

" Thanks but give [me]114-meg some of that stuff in brown jelly , will [you]108-george ? It 's new to [me]114-meg . "[114-meg]

After supper was over , [Alice]218-alice cried :

" [Georgie]108-george , dear have [you]108-george finished ? do n't die the death of [a king]4717-a king [King John]225-john [I]218-alice ca n't spare [you]108-george , [pet]4718-pet . "[218-alice]

" [I]1619-i would , "[1619-i] said [he]1619-i .

When the cart came , and [Alice]218-alice , [Madie]238-madie , [Tom]218-alice and [Will]244-will departed , [Alice]218-alice bade [Lettie]116-lettie a long farewell blew [Georgie]108-george many kisses promised to love [him]108-george faithful and true and was gone .

[George]108-george and [Emily]109-emily lingered a short time .

Now [the room]518-the room seemed empty and quiet , and all the laughter seemed to have gone . The conversation dribbled away ; there was an awkwardness .

" Well , "[108-george] said [George]108-george heavily , at last . " To - day is nearly gone it will soon be tomorrow . [I]108-george feel a bit drunk ! [We]1621-we had a good time to - night . "[108-george]

" [I]116-lettie am glad , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie .

[They]1621-we put on [their]1621-we clogs and leggings , and wrapped [themselves]1621-we up , and stood in [the hall]703-the hall .

" [We]1621-we must go , "[108-george] said [George]108-george , " before the clock strikes , like [Cinderella]262-cinderella look at [my]108-george glass slippers "[108-george] [he]108-george pointed to [his]108-george clogs . " Midnight , and rags , and fleeing . Very appropriate . [I]108-george shall call [myself]108-george [Cinderella]262-cinderella who would n't fit . [I]108-george believe [I]108-george 'm a bit drunk [the world]1209-the world looks funny . "[108-george]

[We]1621-we looked out at the haunting wanness of [the hills beyond [Nethermere]1-nethermere]1623-the hills beyond nethermere . " Good - bye , [Lettie]116-lettie ; good - bye . "[1621-we]

[They]1621-we were out in the snow , which peered pale and eerily from the depths of the black wood .

" Good - bye , "[108-george] [he]108-george called out of the darkness . [Leslie]121-leslie slammed the door , and drew [Lettie]116-lettie away into [the drawing - room]4162-the drawing - room . The sound of [his]108-george low , vibrating satisfaction reached [us]1621-we , as [he]108-george murmured to [her]116-lettie , and laughed low . Then [he]108-george kicked the door of [the room]518-the room shut . [Lettie]116-lettie began to laugh and mock and talk in a high strained voice . The sound of [their]1621-we laughter mingled was strange and incongruous . Then [her]116-lettie voice died down .

[Marie]114-meg sat at the little piano which was put in [the dining - room]511-the dining - room strumming and tinkling the false , quavering old notes . It was a depressing jingling in the deserted remains of the feast , but [she]114-meg felt sentimental , and enjoyed it .

This was a gap between to - day and tomorrow , a dreary gap , where [one]606-one sat and looked at the dreary comedy of yesterdays , and the grey tragedies of dawning tomorrows , vacantly , missing the poignancy of an actual to - day .

[The cart]1628-the cart returned .

" [Leslie]121-leslie , [Leslie]121-leslie , [John]225-john is here , come along ! "[114-meg] called [Marie]114-meg .

There was no answer .

" [Leslie John]121-leslie is waiting in the snow . "[108-george]

" All right . "[116-lettie]

" But [you]108-george must come at once . "[114-meg] [She]114-meg went to the door and spoke to [him]108-george . Then [he]108-george came out looking rather sheepish , and rather angry at the interruption . [Lettie]116-lettie followed , tidying [her]116-lettie hair . [She]116-lettie did not laugh and look confused , as [most girls]1629-most girls do on similar occasions ; [she]116-lettie seemed very tired .

At last [Leslie]121-leslie tore [himself]121-leslie away , and after more returns for a farewell kiss , mounted [the carriage]1535-the carriage , which stood in a pool of yellow light , blurred and splotched with shadows , and drove away , calling something about tomorrow .

PART II

CHAPTER I

[STRANGE BLOSSOMS AND STRANGE NEW BUDDING

Winter]264-strange blossoms and strange new budding winter lay a long time prostrate on [the earth]1097-the earth . [The men in [the mines of [Tempest]120-mr. tempest]1633-the mines of tempest , [Warrall]32-warrall and [Co.]265-co.]1632-the men in the mines of tempest , warrall and co. came out on strike on a question of the rearranging of the working system down below . The distress was not awful , for [the men]1214-the men were on [the whole wise and well - conditioned]1635-the whole wise and well - conditioned , but there was a dejection over the face of [the country - side]1636-the country - side , and [some]463-some suffered keenly . Everywhere , along [the lanes]1638-the lanes and in [the streets]1639-the streets , loitered gangs of [men , unoccupied and spiritless]1640-men , unoccupied and spiritless . Week after week went on , and [[the agents of the Miner]1641-the agents of the miner 's Union]1642-the agents of the miner 's union held great meetings , and [the ministers]1643-the ministers held prayer - meetings , but the strike continued . There was no rest . Always [the crier]1644-the crier 's bell was ringing in [the street]1645-the street ; always [the servants of the company]1646-the servants of the company were delivering handbills , stating the case clearly , and always [the people]1647-the people talked and filled the months with bitter , and then hopeless , resenting . [Schools]1648-schools gave breakfasts , [chapels]1649-chapels gave soup , [well - to - do people]1650-well - to - do people gave teas [the children]4276-the children enjoyed it . But [we]1652-we , who knew the faces of [the old men]1653-the old men and the privations of [the women]669-the women , breathed a cold , disheartening atmosphere of sorrow and trouble .

Determined poaching was carried on in [the [Squire]266-squire 's woods and warrens]1655-the squire 's woods and warrens . [Annable]184-annable defended [his]1656-his game heroically . [One man]1657-one man was at [home]4184-home with a leg supposed to be wounded by a fall on [the slippery roads]1659-the slippery roads but really , by a man - trap in [the woods]600-the woods . Then [Annable]184-annable caught [two men]1661-two men , and [they]1661-two men were sentenced to two months ' imprisonment .

On both [the lodge gates of Highclose on [our]1652-we side]1662-the lodge gates of highclose on our side and on [the far [Eberwich]6-eberwich side]1663-the far eberwich side were posted notices that [trespassers on the drive]1664-trespassers on the drive or in [the grounds]1665-the grounds would be liable to punishment . These posters were soon mudded over , and fresh ones fixed .

[The men loitering on [the road]738-the road by [Nethermere]1-nethermere]1666-the men loitering on the road by nethermere , looked angrily at [Lettie]116-lettie as [she]116-lettie passed , in [her]116-lettie black furs which [Leslie]121-leslie had given [her]116-lettie , and [their]1666-the men loitering on the road by nethermere remarks were pungent . [She]116-lettie heard them , and they burned in [her]116-lettie heart . From [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother [she]515-my mother inherited democratic views , which [she]515-my mother now proceeded to debate warmly with [[her]515-my mother lover]1513-her lover .

Then [she]515-my mother tried to talk to [Leslie]121-leslie about the strike . [He]121-leslie heard [her]515-my mother with mild superiority , smiled , and said [she]515-my mother did not know . [Women]561-women jumped to conclusions at the first touch of feeling ; [men]562-men must look at a thing all round , then make a decision nothing hasty and impetuous careful , long - thought - out , correct decisions . [Women]561-women could not be expected to understand these things , business was not for [them]561-women ; in fact , [their]561-women mission was above business etc . , etc . , Unfortunately [Lettie]116-lettie was [the wrong woman]1673-the wrong woman to treat thus .

" So ! "[116-lettie] said [she]116-lettie , with a quiet , hopeless tone of finality .

" There now , [you]116-lettie understand , do n't [you]116-lettie , [Minnehaha]247-minnehaha , [my]116-lettie Laughing Water So laugh again , [darling]4721-darling , and do n't worry about these things . [We]4722-we will not talk about them any more , eh ? "[116-lettie]

" No more . "[116-lettie]

" No more that 's right [you]116-lettie are as wise as [an angel]4723-an angel . Come here pooh , the wood is thick and lonely ! Look , there is [nobody]4176-nobody in [the world]1209-the world but [us]4722-we , and [you]116-lettie are [my]116-lettie heaven and earth ! "[116-lettie]

" And hell ? "[116-lettie]

" Ah if [you]116-lettie are so cold how cold [you]116-lettie are ! it gives [me]116-lettie little shivers when [you]116-lettie look so and [I]116-lettie am always hot [Lettie]116-lettie ! "[116-lettie]

" Well ? "[116-lettie]

" [You]116-lettie are cruel ! Kiss [me]116-lettie now No , [I]116-lettie do n't want [your]116-lettie cheek kiss [me]116-lettie [yourself]116-lettie . Why do n't [you]116-lettie say something ? "[116-lettie]

" What for ? What 's the use of saying anything when there 's nothing immediate to say ? "[116-lettie]

" [You]116-lettie are offended ! "[116-lettie]

" It feels like snow to - day , "[1674-she] [she]1674-she answered .

At last , however , winter began to gather [her]1674-she limbs , to rise , and drift with saddened garments northward .

The strike was over . [The men]1214-the men had compromised . It was a gentle way of telling [them]1214-the men [they]1214-the men were beaten . But the strike was over .

The birds fluttered and dashed ; the catkins on the hazel loosened [their]1676-their winter rigidity , and swung soft tassels . All through the day sounded long , sweet whistlings from the brushes ; then later , loud , laughing shouts of bird triumph on every hand .

[I]0-i remember a day when the breast of [the hills]1056-the hills was heaving in a last quick waking sigh , and the blue eyes of [the waters]1678-the waters opened bright . Across the infinite skies of [March]33-march great rounded masses of cloud had sailed stately all day , domed with a white radiance , softened with faint , fleeting shadows as if companies of angels were gently sweeping past ; adorned with resting , silken shadows like those of a full white breast . All day the clouds had moved on to their vast destination , and [I]0-i had clung to [the earth]1097-the earth yearning and impatient . [I]0-i took a brush and tried to paint them , then [I]0-i raged at [myself]0-i . [I]0-i wished that in all [the wild valley]1680-the wild valley where cloud shadows were travelling like [pilgrims]1681-pilgrims , something would call [me]0-i forth from [my]0-i rooted loneliness . Through all the grandeur of the white and blue day , the poised cloud masses swung [their]1676-their slow flight , and left [me]0-i unnoticed .

At evening [they]1676-their were all gone , and the empty sky , like a blue bubble over [us]1682-we , swam on its pale bright rims .

[Leslie]121-leslie came , and asked [[his]121-leslie betrothed]1683-his betrothed to go out with [him]121-leslie , under the darkening wonderful bubble . [She]1683-his betrothed bade [me]0-i accompany [her]1683-his betrothed , and , to escape from [myself]0-i , [I]0-i went .

It was warm in the shelter of the wood and in [the crouching hollows of [the hills]1056-the hills]1684-the crouching hollows of the hills . But over the slanting shoulders of [the hills]1056-the hills the wind swept , whipping the redness into [our]1682-we faces .

" Get [me]116-lettie some of those alder catkins , [Leslie]121-leslie , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , as [we]1682-we came down to [the stream]1113-the stream .

" Yes , those , where they hang over [the brook]574-the brook . They are ruddy like new blood freshening under the skin . Look , tassels of crimson and gold ! "[116-lettie] [She]116-lettie pointed to the dusty hazel catkins mingled with the alder on [her]116-lettie bosom . Then [she]116-lettie began to quote [Christina Rossetti]267-christina rossetti 's " A Birthday . "[116-lettie]

" [I]116-lettie 'm glad [you]0-i came to take [me]116-lettie a walk , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie continued " Does n't [Strelley Mill]2-strelley mill look pretty ? " The daylight will be gone if [we]1682-we do . It is half past five more ! [I]116-lettie saw [him]4727-he [the son]4728-the son the other morning . "[116-lettie]

" Where ? "[116-lettie]

" [He]4727-he was carting manure [I]116-lettie made haste by . "[116-lettie]
