" No , [he]4727-he said nothing . [I]116-lettie glanced at [him]4727-he [he]4727-he 's just the same , brick colour stolid . Mind that stone it rocks . [I]116-lettie 'm glad [you]116-lettie 've got strong boots on . "[116-lettie]

" Seeing that [I]116-lettie usually wear them "[116-lettie]

[She]1688-she stood poised a moment on a large stone , [the fresh spring brook]1689-the fresh spring brook hastening towards [her]1688-she , deepening , sidling round [her]1688-she .

" [You]1690-he wo n't call and see [them]4729-them , then ? "[1688-she] [she]1688-she asked .

" No . [I]1690-he like to hear [the brook]574-the brook tinkling , do n't [you]1688-she ? "[1690-he] [he]1690-he replied .

" Ah , yes it 's full of music . "[0-i]

" Shall [we]4731-we go on ? "[1690-he] [he]1690-he said , impatient but submissive .

" [I]0-i 'll catch up in a minute , "[0-i] said I.

[I]0-i went in and found [Emily]109-emily putting some bread into the oven .

" Come out for a walk , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Now ? Let [me]109-emily tell [mother]4146-mother [I]109-emily was longing "[109-emily]

[She]109-emily ran and put on [her]109-emily long grey coat and [her]109-emily red tam - o - shanter . As [we]1691-we went down [the yard]457-the yard , [George]108-george called to [me]0-i .

" [I]0-i 'll come back , "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted .

[He]108-george came to [the crew - yard]1693-the crew - yard gate to see [us]1691-we off . When [we]1691-we came out onto [the path]495-the path , [we]1691-we saw [Lettie]116-lettie standing on the top bar of the stile , balancing with [her]116-lettie hand on [Leslie]121-leslie 's head . [She]116-lettie saw [us]1691-we , [she]116-lettie saw [George]108-george , and [she]116-lettie waved to [us]1691-we . [Leslie]121-leslie was looking up at [her]116-lettie anxiously . [She]116-lettie waved again , then [we]1691-we could hear [her]116-lettie laughing , and telling [him]108-george excitedly to stand still , and steady [her]116-lettie while [she]116-lettie turned . [She]116-lettie turned round , and leaped with a great flutter , like a big bird launching , down from the top of the stile to the ground and into [his]108-george arms . Then [we]1691-we climbed [the steep hill - side [Sunny Bank]34-sunny bank]1695-the steep hill - side sunny bank , that had once shone yellow with wheat , and now waved black tattered ranks of thistles where the rabbits ran . [We]1691-we passed [the little cottages in [the hollow scooped out of [the hill]502-the hill]1697-the hollow scooped out of the hill]1696-the little cottages in the hollow scooped out of the hill , and gained [the highlands that look out over [Leicestershire]35-leicestershire to [Charnwood]36-charnwood on the left , and away into [the mountain knob of [Derbyshire]37-derbyshire]1700-the mountain knob of derbyshire]1699-the highlands that look out over leicestershire to charnwood on the left , and away into the mountain knob of derbyshire straight in front and towards the right .

[The upper road]1701-the upper road is all grassy , fallen into long disuse . [It]1701-the upper road used to lead from [the Abbey]1173-the abbey to [the Hall]703-the hall ; but now [it]1701-the upper road ends blindly on [the hill - brow]1704-the hill - brow . Half way along is [the old White House farm]1705-the old white house farm , with [its]1705-the old white house farm green mounting steps mouldering outside . [Ladies]1706-ladies have mounted here and ridden towards [the Vale of [Belvoir]38-belvoir]1707-the vale of belvoir but now [a labourer]1708-a labourer holds [the farm]1000-the farm .

[We]1710-we came to [the quarries]4418-the quarries , and looked in at [the lime - kilns]1712-the lime - kilns .

" Let [us]1710-we go right into the wood out of [the quarry]1228-the quarry , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie . " [I]121-leslie have not been since [I]121-leslie was [a little lad]4734-a little lad . "[121-leslie]

" It is trespassing , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily .

" [We]1710-we do n't trespass , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie replied grandiloquently .

So [we]1710-we went along by [the hurrying brook]1713-the hurrying brook , which fell over little cascades in its haste , never looking once at the primroses that were glimmering all along [its]1713-the hurrying brook banks . [We]1710-we turned aside , and climbed [the hill]502-the hill through [the woods]600-the woods . Velvety green sprigs of dog - mercury were scattered on the red soil . [We]1710-we came to the top of [a slope]1716-a slope , where the wood thinned . As [I]0-i talked to [Emily]109-emily [I]0-i became dimly aware of a whiteness over [the ground]4248-the ground . [She]109-emily exclaimed with surprise , and [I]0-i found that [I]0-i was walking , in the first shades of twilight , over clumps of snowdrops . The hazels were thin , and only here and there an oak tree uprose . All the ground was white with snowdrops , like drops of manna scattered over the red earth , on the grey - green clusters of leaves . There was a deep little dell , sharp sloping like a cup , and white sprinkling of flowers all the way down , with white flowers showing pale among the first inpouring of shadow at the bottom . [The earth]1097-the earth was red and warm , pricked with the dark , succulent green of bluebell sheaths , and embroidered with grey - green clusters of spears , and many white flowerets . High above , above the light tracery of hazel , the weird oaks tangled in the sunset . Below , in the first shadows , drooped hosts of little white flowers , so silent and sad ; it seemed like a holy communion of pure wild things , numberless , frail , and folded meekly in the evening light . [Other flower companies]1719-other flower companies are glad ; stately barbaric hordes of bluebells , [merry - headed cowslip groups , even light , tossing wood - anemones]1720-merry - headed cowslip groups , even light , tossing wood - anemones ; but snowdrops are sad and mysterious . [We]1710-we have lost [their]1719-other flower companies meaning . [They]1719-other flower companies do not belong to [us]1710-we , who ravish [them]1719-other flower companies . [The girls]496-the girls bent among [them]1719-other flower companies , touching [them]1719-other flower companies with [their]496-the girls fingers , and symbolising the yearning which [I]0-i felt . Folded in the twilight , these conquered flowerets are sad like [forlorn little friends of dryads]1722-forlorn little friends of dryads .

" What do [they]1719-other flower companies mean , do [you]0-i think ? "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie in a low voice , as [her]116-lettie white fingers touched the flowers , and [her]116-lettie black furs fell on them .

" There are not so many this year , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie .

" [They]1719-other flower companies remind [me]109-emily of mistletoe , which is never [ours]1710-we , though [we]1710-we wear it , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily to [me]0-i .

" What do [you]0-i think [they]1719-other flower companies say what do [they]1719-other flower companies make [you]0-i think , [Cyril]113-cyril ? "[116-lettie] [Lettie]116-lettie repeated .

" [I]116-lettie do n't know . [Emily]109-emily says [they]1719-other flower companies belong to some old wild lost religion . [They]1719-other flower companies were the symbol of tears , perhaps , to [some strange hearted Druid folk before [us]1710-we]4735-some strange hearted druid folk before us . "[116-lettie]

" More than tears , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie . " More than tears , they are so still . Something out of an old religion , that [we]1710-we have lost . [They]1719-other flower companies make [me]116-lettie feel afraid . "[116-lettie]

" What should [you]121-leslie have to fear ? "[121-leslie] asked [Leslie]121-leslie .

" If [I]116-lettie knew [I]116-lettie should n't fear , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie answered . " Look at all the snowdrops "[116-lettie] they hung in dim , strange flecks among the dusky leaves " look at [them]1719-other flower companies closed up , retreating , powerless . [They]1719-other flower companies belong to some knowledge [we]1710-we have lost , that [I]116-lettie have lost and that [I]116-lettie need . [I]116-lettie feel afraid . [They]1719-other flower companies seem like something in fate . Do [you]121-leslie think , [Cyril]113-cyril , [we]1710-we can lose things off the earth like mastodons , and those old monstrosities but things that matter wisdom ? "[116-lettie]

" It is against [my]1723-my creed , "[1723-my] said [I.]1723-my

" [I]116-lettie believe [I]116-lettie have lost something , "[116-lettie] said [she]116-lettie .

" Come , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie , " do n't trouble with fancies . Come with [me]121-leslie to the bottom of this cup , and see how strange it will be , with the sky marked with branches like a filigree lid . "[121-leslie]

[She]116-lettie rose and followed [him]121-leslie down the steep side of [the pit]1063-the pit , crying , " Ah , [you]121-leslie are treading on the flowers . "[116-lettie]

" No , "[121-leslie] said [he]121-leslie , " [I]121-leslie am being very careful . "[121-leslie]

[They]1725-they sat down together on a fallen tree at the bottom . [She]116-lettie leaned forward , [her]116-lettie fingers wandering white among the shadowed grey spaces of leaves , plucking , as if it were a rite , flowers here and there . [He]121-leslie could not see [her]116-lettie face .

" Do n't [you]116-lettie care for [me]121-leslie ? "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie asked softly .

" [You]116-lettie ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie sat up and looked at [him]121-leslie , and laughed strangely . " [You]121-leslie do not seem real to [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie replied , in a strange voice .

[Lettie]116-lettie was thoughtful , and [I]0-i smiled .

It was a beautiful evening , still , with red , shaken clouds in the west . The moon in heaven was turning wistfully back to the east . Dark purple woods lay around [us]1741-we , painting out the distance . [The near , wild , ruined land]1742-the near , wild , ruined land looked sad and strange under the pale afterglow . [The turf path]1743-the turf path was fine and springy .

" Let [us]1741-we run ! "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , and joining hands [we]1741-we raced wildly along , with a flutter and a breathless laughter , till [we]1741-we were happy and forgetful . When [we]1741-we stopped [we]1741-we exclaimed at once , " Hark ! "[1741-we]

" [A child]1035-a child ! "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie .

" At [the Kennels]4421-the kennels , "[1741-we] said I.

[We]1741-we hurried forward . From [the house]563-the house came the mad yelling and yelping of [children]1260-children , and the wild hysterical shouting of [a woman]881-a woman .

" Tha ' little devil tha ' little devil tha ' shanna that tha ' shanna ! "[881-a woman] and this was accompanied by the hollow sound of blows , and a pandemonium of howling . [We]1741-we rushed in , and found [the woman]813-the woman in a tousled frenzy belabouring [a youngster]1748-a youngster with an enamelled pan . [The lad]4273-the lad was rolled up like [a young hedgehog]1750-a young hedgehog [the woman]813-the woman held [him]4273-the lad by the foot , and like a flail came the hollow utensil thudding on [his]4273-the lad shoulders and back . [He]4273-the lad lay in the firelight and howled , while scattered in various groups , with the leaping firelight twinkling over [their]1260-children tears and [their]1260-children open mouths , were [the other children]1752-the other children , crying too . [The mother]460-the mother was in a state of hysteria ; [her]460-the mother hair streamed over [her]460-the mother face , and [her]460-the mother eyes were fixed in a stare of overwrought irritation . Up and down went [her]460-the mother long arm like a windmill sail . [I]0-i ran and held it . When [she]460-the mother could hit no more , [the woman]813-the woman dropped the pan from [her]813-the woman nerveless hand , and staggered , trembling , to the squab . [She]460-the mother looked desperately weary and fordone [she]460-the mother clasped and unclasped [her]460-the mother hands continually . [Emily]109-emily hushed [the children]4276-the children , while [Lettie]116-lettie hushed [the mother]460-the mother , holding [her]460-the mother hard , cracked hands as [she]460-the mother swayed to and fro . Gradually [the mother]460-the mother became still , and sat staring in front of [her]460-the mother ; then aimlessly [she]460-the mother began to finger the jewels on [Lettie]116-lettie 's finger .

[Emily]109-emily was bathing the cheek of [a little girl]473-a little girl , who lifted up [her]473-a little girl voice and wept loudly when [she]473-a little girl saw the speck of blood on the cloth . But presently [she]473-a little girl became quiet too , and [Emily]109-emily could empty the water from the late instrument of castigation , and at last light the lamp .

[I]0-i found [Sam]193-sam under the table in a little heap . [I]0-i put out [my]0-i hand for [him]193-sam , and [he]193-sam wriggled away , like a lizard , into [the passage]1759-the passage . After a while [I]0-i saw [him]193-sam in a corner , lying whimpering with little savage cries of pain . [I]0-i cut off [his]193-sam retreat and captured [him]193-sam , bearing [him]193-sam struggling into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen . Then , weary with pain , [he]193-sam became passive .

[We]1761-themselves undressed [him]193-sam , and found [his]193-sam beautiful white body all discoloured with bruises . [The mother]460-the mother began to sob again , with a chorus of [babies]1763-babies . " It 's [a lovely old place]4839-a lovely old place ! "[116-lettie] exclaimed [Lettie]116-lettie , and [we]1789-we passed out of hearing .

[We]1789-we stumbled over [the rough path]1790-the rough path . The moon was bright , and [we]1789-we stepped apprehensively on the shadows thrown from the trees , for they lay so black and substantial . Occasionally a moonbeam would trace out a suave white branch that the rabbits had gnawed quite bare in the hard winter . [We]1789-we came out of [the woods]600-the woods into the full heavens . The northern sky was full of a gush of green light ; in front , [eclipsed Orion]276-orion leaned over [his]276-orion bed , and the moon followed .

" When the northern lights are up , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , " [I]109-emily feel so strange half eerie they do fill [you]0-i with awe , do n't [they]4840-they ? "[109-emily]

" Yes , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [they]4840-they make [you]109-emily wonder , and look , and expect something . "[0-i]

" What do [you]0-i expect ? "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said softly , and looked up , and saw [me]0-i smiling , and [she]109-emily looked down again , biting [her]109-emily lips .

When [we]1789-we came to the parting of [the roads]1307-the roads , [Emily]109-emily begged [them]1793-them just to step into [the mill]635-the mill just for a moment and [Lettie]116-lettie consented .

The kitchen window was uncurtained , and [the blind]1795-the blind , as usual , was not drawn . [We]1789-we peeped in through the cords of budding honeysuckle . [George]108-george and [Alice]218-alice were sitting at the table playing chess ; [the mother]460-the mother was mending a coat , and [the father]465-the father , as usual , was reading . [Alice]218-alice was talking quietly , and [George]108-george was bent on the game . [His]108-george arms lay on the table .

[We]1789-we made a noise at the door , and entered . [George]108-george rose heavily , shook hands , and sat down again .

" [Hullo]112-hullo , [Lettie Beardsall]116-lettie , [you]465-the father are [a stranger]715-a stranger , "[218-alice] said [Alice]218-alice . " Are [you]465-the father so much engaged ? "[218-alice]

" Ay [we]1789-we do n't see much of [her]4842-her nowadays , "[465-the father] added [the father]465-the father in [his]465-the father jovial way .

" And is n't [she]4842-her [a toff]4843-a toff , in [her]4842-her fine hat and furs and snowdrops . Look at [her]4842-her , [George]108-george , [you]108-george 've never looked to see what a toff [she]4842-her is . "[465-the father]

[He]465-the father raised [his]465-the father eyes , and looked at [her]1799-her apparel and at [her]1799-her flowers , but not at [her]1799-her face :

" Ay , [she]4842-her is fine , "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said , and returned to the chess .

" [We]4844-we have been gathering snowdrops , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , fingering the flowers in [her]1799-her bosom .

" [They]4845-they are pretty give [me]218-alice some , will [you]108-george ? "[218-alice] said [Alice]218-alice , holding out [her]1799-her hand . [Lettie]116-lettie gave [her]1799-her the flowers .

" Check ! "[108-george] said [George]108-george deliberately .

" Get out ! " If [you]108-george like what for ? "[1799-her]

[Lettie]116-lettie laughed with a strained little laugh :

[Presently Meg]283-meg came down , and [I]0-i rose and said [we]1861-we must be going .

" [I]1866-i 'll just come an ' lock the door after [you]108-george , "[1866-i] said [she]1866-i , standing uneasily waiting .

[She]283-meg looked at [him]108-george , half - smiling , half doubtful . [He]108-george put [his]108-george arm round [her]283-meg and looking down into [her]283-meg eyes , with [his]108-george face very close to [hers]283-meg , said :

" [I]108-george 'm going to marry [thee]283-meg , "[108-george] [he]108-george said .

" Go on ! "[283-meg] [she]283-meg replied , softly , half glad , half doubtful .

" [I]108-george am an ' all , "[108-george] [he]108-george repeated , pressing [her]283-meg more tightly to [him]108-george .

[I]0-i went down [the passage]1759-the passage , and stood in the open doorway looking out into the night . It seemed a long time . Then [I]0-i heard the thin voice of [the old woman at the top of the stairs]1868-the old woman at the top of the stairs :

" [Meg]283-meg ! [Meg]283-meg ! Send ' [i]1868-the old woman at the top of the stairs m off now . Come on ! "[1868-the old woman at the top of the stairs]

In the silence that followed there was a murmur of voices , and then [they]1869-they came into [the passage]1759-the passage .

" Good - night , [[my]1869-they lad]4342-my lad , good luck to [thee]4342-my lad ! "[1869-they] cried the voice like a ghoul from [upper regions]1871-upper regions .

[He]108-george kissed [[his]108-george betrothed]1683-his betrothed a rather hurried good - night at the door .

" Good - night , "[1683-his betrothed] [she]1683-his betrothed replied softly , watching [him]108-george retreat . Then [we]1873-we heard [her]1683-his betrothed shoot the heavy bolts .

" [You]0-i know , "[108-george] [he]108-george began , and [he]108-george tried to clear [his]108-george throat . [His]108-george voice was husky and strangulated with excitement . [He]108-george tried again :

" [You]0-i know [she]1683-his betrothed [she]1683-his betrothed 's a clinker . "[108-george]

[I]0-i did not reply , but [he]108-george took no notice .

" Damn ! "[108-george] [he]108-george ejaculated . " What did [I]108-george let [her]1683-his betrothed go for ! "[108-george]

[We]1873-we walked along in silence [his]108-george excitement abated somewhat .

" It 's the way [she]1683-his betrothed swings [her]1683-his betrothed body an ' the curves as [she]1683-his betrothed stands . It 's when [you]0-i look at [her]1683-his betrothed [you]0-i feel [you]0-i know . "[108-george]

[I]0-i suppose [I]0-i knew , but it was unnecessary to say so .

" [You]0-i know if ever [I]0-i dream in the night of [women]561-women [you]0-i know it 's always [Meg]283-meg ; [she]1683-his betrothed seems to look so soft , and to curve [her]1683-his betrothed body "[0-i]

Gradually [his]108-george feet began to drag . When [we]1873-we came to [the place where [the colliery railway]1875-the colliery railway crossed [the road]738-the road]1874-the place where the colliery railway crossed the road , [he]108-george stumbled , and pitched forward , only just recovering [himself]108-george . [I]0-i took hold of [his]108-george arm .

" [Good Lord]284-good lord , [Cyril]113-cyril , am [I]108-george drunk ? "[108-george] [he]108-george said .

" Not quite , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" No , "[108-george] [he]108-george muttered , " could n't be . "[108-george]

But [his]108-george feet dragged again , and [he]108-george began to stagger from side to side . [I]0-i took hold of [his]108-george arm . [He]108-george murmured angrily then , subsiding again , muttered , with slovenly articulation :

" [I]108-george [I]108-george feel fit to drop with sleep . "[108-george]

Along [the dead , silent roadway]1877-the dead , silent roadway , and through the uneven blackness of the wood , [we]1878-we lurched and stumbled . [He]108-george was very heavy and difficult to direct . When at last [we]1878-we came to [the brook]574-the brook [we]1878-we splashed straight through [the water]429-the water . [I]0-i urged [him]108-george to walk steadily and quietly across [the yard]457-the yard . [He]108-george did [his]108-george best , and [we]1878-we made a fairly still entry into [the farm]1000-the farm . [He]108-george dropped with all [his]108-george weight on the sofa , and leaning down , began to unfasten [his]108-george leggings . In the midst of [his]108-george fumblings [he]108-george fell asleep , and [I]0-i was afraid [he]108-george would pitch forward on to [his]108-george head . [I]0-i took off [his]108-george leggings and [his]108-george wet boots and [his]108-george collar . Then , as [I]0-i was pushing and shaking [him]108-george awake to get off [his]108-george coat , [I]0-i heard a creaking on the stairs , and [my]0-i heart sank , for [I]0-i thought it was [[his]108-george mother]453-his mother . But it was [Emily]109-emily , in [her]109-emily long white nightgown . [She]109-emily looked at [us]1884-us with great dark eyes of terror , and whispered : " What 's the matter ? "[109-emily]

[I]0-i shook [my]0-i head and looked at [him]108-george . [His]108-george head had dropped down on [his]108-george chest again .

" Is [he]108-george hurt ? "[109-emily] [she]109-emily asked , [her]109-emily voice becoming audible , and dangerous . [He]108-george lifted [his]108-george head , and looked at [her]109-emily with heavy , angry eyes .

" [George]108-george ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said sharply , in bewilderment and fear . [His]108-george eyes seemed to contract evilly .

" Is [he]108-george drunk ? "[109-emily] [she]109-emily whispered , shrinking away , and looking at [me]0-i . " Have [you]0-i made [him]108-george drunk [you]0-i ? "[109-emily]

[I]0-i nodded . [I]0-i too was angry .

" Oh , if [mother]4146-mother gets up ! [I]0-i must get [him]108-george to bed ! Oh , how could [you]109-emily ! "[0-i]

This sibilant whispering irritated [him]108-george , and [me]0-i . [I]0-i tugged at [his]108-george coat . [He]108-george snarled incoherently , and swore . [She]109-emily caught [her]109-emily breath . [He]108-george looked at [her]109-emily sharply , and [I]0-i was afraid [he]108-george would wake [himself]108-george into a rage .

" Go [upstairs]532-upstairs ! "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered to [her]109-emily . [She]109-emily shook [her]109-emily head . [I]0-i could see [him]108-george taking heavy breaths , and the veins of [his]108-george neck were swelling . [I]0-i was furious at [her]109-emily disobedience .

" Go at once , "[0-i] [I]0-i said fiercely , and [she]109-emily went , still hesitating and looking back .

[I]0-i had hauled off [his]108-george coat and waistcoat , so [I]0-i let [him]108-george sink again into stupidity while [I]0-i took off [my]0-i boots . Then [I]0-i got [him]108-george to [his]108-george feet , and , walking behind [him]108-george , impelled [him]108-george slowly [upstairs]532-upstairs . [I]0-i lit a candle in [[his]108-george bedroom]1886-his bedroom . There was no sound from [the other rooms]1887-the other rooms . So [I]0-i undressed [him]108-george , and got [him]108-george in bed at last , somehow . [I]0-i covered [him]108-george up and put over [him]108-george the calf - skin rug , because the night was cold . Almost immediately [he]108-george began to breathe heavily . [I]0-i dragged [him]108-george over to [his]108-george side , and pillowed [his]108-george head comfortably . [He]108-george looked like [a tired boy]1888-a tired boy , asleep .

[I]0-i stood still , now [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i alone , and looked round . Up to the low roof rose the carven pillars of dark mahogany ; there was a chair by the bed , and a little yellow chest of drawers by the windows , that was all the furniture , save the calf - skin rug on the floor . In the drawers [I]0-i noticed a book . It was a copy of [Omar Khayyam]285-omar khayyam , that [Lettie]116-lettie had given [him]108-george in [her]116-lettie Khayyam days , a little shilling book with coloured illustrations .

[I]0-i blew out the candle , when [I]0-i had looked at [him]108-george again . As [I]0-i crept on to [the landing]1889-the landing , [Emily]109-emily peeped from [[her]109-emily room]1890-her room , whispering , " Is [he]108-george in bed ? "[109-emily]

[I]0-i nodded , and whispered good - night . Then [I]0-i went [home]4184-home , heavily .

After the evening at [the farm]1000-the farm , [Lettie]116-lettie and [Leslie]121-leslie drew closer together . [They]1893-they eddied unevenly down the little stream of courtship , jostling and drifting together and apart . [He]108-george was unsatisfied and strove with every effort to bring [her]109-emily close to [him]108-george , submissive . Gradually [she]109-emily yielded , and submitted to [him]108-george . [She]109-emily folded round [her]109-emily and [him]108-george the snug curtain of the present , and [they]1893-they sat like [children playing a game behind the hangings of an old bed]1894-children playing a game behind the hangings of an old bed . [She]109-emily shut out all distant outlooks , as [an Arab]1895-an arab unfolds [[his]1895-an arab tent]1896-his tent and conquers the mystery and space of [the desert]1897-the desert . So [she]109-emily lived gleefully in [a little tent of present pleasures]1898-a little tent of present pleasures and fancies .

Occasionally , only occasionally , [she]109-emily would peep from [[her]109-emily tent]1899-her tent into [the out space]1900-the out space . Then [she]109-emily sat poring over books , and nothing would be able to draw [her]109-emily away ; or [she]109-emily sat in [[her]109-emily room]1890-her room looking out of the window for hours together . [She]109-emily pleaded headaches ; [mother]4146-mother said liver ; [he]1895-an arab , angry like [a spoilt child]1903-a spoilt child denied [his]1895-an arab wish , declared it moodiness and perversity .

CHAPTER II

A SHADOW IN SPRING

With spring came trouble . [The Saxtons]286-the saxtons declared [they]286-the saxtons were being bitten off [the estate]1051-the estate by rabbits . Suddenly , in a fit of despair , [the father]465-the father bought a gun . Although [he]465-the father knew that [the Squire]1080-the squire would not for one moment tolerate the shooting of [that manna]1907-that manna , the rabbits , yet [he]465-the father was out in the first cold morning twilight banging away . At first [he]465-the father but scared [the brutes]1908-the brutes , and brought [Annable]184-annable on the scene ; then , blooded by the use of the weapon , [he]465-the father played havoc among the furry beasts , bringing [home]4184-home [some eight or nine couples]1910-some eight or nine couples .

[George]108-george entirely approved of this measure ; it rejoiced [him]108-george even ; yet [he]108-george had never had the initiative to begin the like [himself]108-george , or even to urge [[his]108-george father]630-his father to it . [He]108-george prophesied trouble , and possible loss of [the farm]1000-the farm . It disturbed [him]108-george somewhat , to think [they]1913-they must look out for another place , but [he]108-george postponed the thought of the evil day till the time should be upon [him]108-george .

A vendetta was established between [the Mill]635-the mill and [the keeper]1156-the keeper , [Annable]184-annable . [The latter]627-the latter cherished [his]465-the father rabbits :

" Call 'em vermin ! "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said . " [I]465-the father only know one sort of vermin and that 's the talkin sort . "[465-the father] So [he]108-george set [himself]108-george to thwart and harass [the rabbit slayers]1917-the rabbit slayers .

It was about this time [I]0-i cultivated the acquaintance of [the keeper]1156-the keeper . All [the world]1209-the world hated [him]108-george to [the people in [the villages]1921-the villages]1920-the people in the villages [he]108-george was like [a devil of [the woods]600-the woods]1922-a devil of the woods . [Some miners]1924-some miners had sworn vengeance on [him]108-george for having caused [their]1924-some miners committal to gaol . But [he]108-george had a great attraction for [me]0-i ; [his]108-george magnificent physique , [his]108-george great vigour and vitality , and [his]108-george swarthy , gloomy face drew [me]0-i .

[He]108-george was [a man of one idea]1925-a man of one idea : that all civilisation was the painted fungus of rottenness . [He]108-george hated any sign of culture . [I]0-i won [his]108-george respect one afternoon when [he]108-george found [me]0-i trespassing in [the woods]600-the woods because [I]0-i was watching some maggots at work in a dead rabbit . That led [us]1927-us to a discussion of life . [He]108-george was [a thorough materialist]1928-a thorough materialist [he]108-george scorned religion and all mysticism . [He]108-george spent [his]108-george days sleeping , making intricate traps for [weasels]1929-weasels and [men]562-men , putting together a gun , or doing some amateur forestry , cutting down timber , splitting it in logs for use in [the hall]703-the hall , and planting young trees . When [he]108-george thought , [he]108-george reflected on the decay of mankind the decline of [the human race]1932-the human race into folly and weakness and rottenness . " Be a good animal , true to [your]0-i animal instinct , "[108-george] was [his]108-george motto . With all this , [he]108-george was fundamentally very unhappy and [he]108-george made [me]0-i also wretched . It was this power to communicate [his]108-george unhappiness that made [me]0-i somewhat dear to [him]108-george , [I]0-i think . [He]108-george treated [me]0-i as [an affectionate father]1933-an affectionate father treats [a delicate son]1934-a delicate son ; [I]0-i noticed [he]108-george liked to put [his]108-george hand on [my]0-i shoulder or [my]0-i knee as [we]1935-we talked ; yet withal , [he]108-george asked [me]0-i questions , and saved [his]108-george thoughts to tell [me]0-i , and believed in [my]0-i knowledge like [any acolyte]1936-any acolyte .

[I]0-i went up to [the quarry woods]1937-the quarry woods one evening in early April , taking a look for [Annable]184-annable . [I]0-i could not find [him]108-george , however , in [the wood]504-the wood . So [I]0-i left [the wildlands]1939-the wildlands , and went along by the old red wall of [the kitchen garden]1940-the kitchen garden , along [the main road]1941-the main road as far as [the mouldering church which stands high on a bank by [the road]738-the road - side]1942-the mouldering church which stands high on a bank by the road - side , just where the trees tunnel the darkness , and the gloom of [the highway]941-the highway startles [the travellers]1945-the travellers at noon . Great trees growing on [the banks]1946-the banks suddenly fold over everything at this point in [the swinging road]1947-the swinging road , and in the obscurity rots [the Hall church]1948-the hall church , black and melancholy above the shrinking head of [the traveller]1949-the traveller .

[The grassy path to [the churchyard]1951-the churchyard]1950-the grassy path to the churchyard was still clogged with decayed leaves . [The church]4201-the church is abandoned . As [I]0-i drew near an owl floated softly out of [the black tower]1953-the black tower . [Grass]287-grass overgrew the threshold . [I]0-i pushed open the door , grinding back a heap of fallen plaster and rubbish and entered [the place]4141-the place . In the twilight the pews were leaning in ghostly disorder , the prayer - books dragged from their ledges , scattered on the floor in the dust and rubble , torn by mice and birds . Birds scuffled in the darkness of the roof . [I]0-i looked up . In the upward well of [the tower]1955-the tower [I]0-i could see a bell hanging . [I]0-i stooped and picked up a piece of plaster from the ragged confusion of feathers , and broken nests , and remnants of dead birds . Up into [the vault]1956-the vault overhead [I]0-i tossed pieces of plaster until one hit the bell , and it " tonged "[0-i] out its faint remonstrance . There was a rustle of many birds like spirits . [I]0-i sounded the bell again , and dark forms moved with cries of alarm overhead , and something fell heavily . [I]0-i shivered in the dark , evil - smelling place , and hurried to get out of doors . [I]0-i clutched [my]0-i hands with relief and pleasure when [I]0-i saw the sky above [me]0-i quivering with the last crystal lights , and the lowest red of sunset behind the yew - boles . [I]0-i drank the fresh air , that sparkled with the sound of the blackbirds and thrushes whistling [their]1957-their strong bright notes .

[I]0-i strayed round to where the headstones , from [their]1957-their eminence leaned to look on [the Hall below]1958-the hall below , where great windows shone yellow light on to [the flagged court - yard]1959-the flagged court - yard , and [the little fish pool]1960-the little fish pool . [A stone staircase]1961-a stone staircase descended from [the graveyard]1962-the graveyard to [the court]1963-the court , between stone balustrades whose pock - marked grey columns still swelled gracefully and with dignity , encrusted with lichens . [The staircase]858-the staircase was filled with ivy and rambling roses impassable . Ferns were unrolling round [the big square halting place]1965-the big square halting place , half way down where the stairs turned .

A peacock , startled from [the back premises of [the Hall]703-the hall]1966-the back premises of the hall , came flapping up [the terraces]1968-the terraces to [the churchyard]1951-the churchyard . Then a heavy footstep crossed the flags . It was [the keeper]1156-the keeper . [I]0-i whistled the whistle [he]1156-the keeper knew , and [he]1156-the keeper broke [his]1156-the keeper way through the vicious rose - boughs up the stairs . The peacock flapped beyond [me]0-i , on to the neck of [an old bowed angel , rough and dark]1971-an old bowed angel , rough and dark , an angel which had long ceased sorrowing for [the lost Lucy]288-lucy , and had died also . The bird bent its voluptuous neck and peered about . Then it lifted up its head and yelled . The sound tore the dark sanctuary of twilight . The old grey grass seemed to stir , and [I]0-i could fancy the smothered primroses and violets beneath it waking and gasping for fear .

[The keeper]1156-the keeper looked at [me]0-i and smiled . [He]1156-the keeper nodded [his]1156-the keeper head towards the peacock , saying :

" Hark at that damned thing ! "[1156-the keeper]

Again the bird lifted its crested head and gave a cry , at the same time turning awkwardly on its ugly legs , so that it showed [us]1973-us the full wealth of its tail glimmering like a stream of coloured stars over the sunken face of [the angel]1974-the angel .

" [The proud fool]4888-the proud fool ! look at it ! Perched on [an angel]4723-an angel , too , as if it were a pedestal for vanity . That 's the soul of [a woman]881-a woman or it 's [the devil]4305-the devil . "[1156-the keeper]

[He]1156-the keeper was silent for a time , and [we]1973-us watched the great bird moving uneasily before [us]1973-us in the twilight .

" That 's the very soul of [a lady]4564-a lady , "[1156-the keeper] [he]1156-the keeper said , " the very , very soul . Damn the thing , to perch on [that old angel]4893-that old angel . [I]1156-the keeper should like to wring [its]4893-that old angel neck . "[1156-the keeper]

Again the bird screamed , and shifted awkwardly on its legs ; it seemed to stretch its beak at [us]1973-us in derision . [Annable]184-annable picked up a piece of sod and flung it at the bird , saying :

" Get out , [you]4893-that old angel screeching devil ! [God]171-god ! "[1156-the keeper] [he]1156-the keeper laughed . " There must be plenty of hearts twisting under here , "[1156-the keeper] and [he]1156-the keeper stamped on [a grave]1975-a grave , " when [they]4894-they hear that row . "[1156-the keeper]

[He]1156-the keeper kicked another sod from [a grave]1975-a grave and threw at the big bird . The peacock flapped away , over [the tombs]1977-the tombs , down [the terraces]1968-the terraces .

" Just look ! "[1156-the keeper] [he]1156-the keeper said , " [the miserable brute]4895-the miserable brute has dirtied [that angel]4896-that angel . [A woman to the end]4897-a woman to the end , [I]1156-the keeper tell [you]0-i , all vanity and screech and defilement . "[1156-the keeper]

[He]1156-the keeper sat down on [a vault]1979-a vault and lit [his]1156-the keeper pipe . But before [he]1156-the keeper had smoked two minutes , it was out again . [I]0-i had not seen [him]1156-the keeper in a state of perturbation before .

" [The church]4201-the church , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " is rotten . [I]0-i suppose [they]4201-the church 'll stand all over [the country]1079-the country like this , soon with peacocks trailing [the graveyards]4900-the graveyards . "[0-i]

" Ay , "[1156-the keeper] [he]1156-the keeper muttered , taking no notice of [me]0-i .

" This stone is cold , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , rising .

[He]1156-the keeper got up too , and stretched [his]1156-the keeper arms as if [he]1156-the keeper were tired . It was quite dark , save for the waxing moon which leaned over [the east]1980-the east .

" It is a very fine night , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Do n't [you]1156-the keeper notice a smell of violets ? "[0-i]

" Ay ! The moon looks like [a woman with child]4901-a woman with child . [I]1156-the keeper wonder what Time 's got in [her]4901-a woman with child belly . "[1156-the keeper]

" [You]1156-the keeper ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [You]1156-the keeper do n't expect anything exciting do [you]1156-the keeper ? "[0-i]

" Exciting ! No about as exciting as [this rotten old place]4902-this rotten old place just rot off Oh , [[my]1156-the keeper God]4903-my god ! [I]1156-the keeper 'm like [a good house]4904-a good house , built and finished , and left to tumble down again with [nobody]4176-nobody to live in [it]4904-a good house . "[1156-the keeper]

" Why what 's up really ? "[0-i]

[He]1156-the keeper laughed bitterly , saying , " Come and sit down . "[1156-the keeper]

[He]1156-the keeper led [me]0-i off to a seat by the north door , between two pews , very black and silent . There [we]1981-we sat , [he]1156-the keeper putting [his]1156-the keeper gun carefully beside [him]1156-the keeper . [He]1156-the keeper remained perfectly still , thinking .

" Whot 's up ? "[1156-the keeper] [he]1156-the keeper said at last , " Why [I]1156-the keeper 'll tell [you]0-i . [I]1156-the keeper went to [Cambridge]41-cambridge [[my]1156-the keeper father]4253-my father was [a big cattle dealer]4907-a big cattle dealer [he]4253-my father died bankrupt while [I]1156-the keeper was in college , and [I]1156-the keeper never took [my]1156-the keeper degree . [They]4908-they persuaded [me]1156-the keeper to be [a parson]4909-a parson , and [a parson [I]1156-the keeper was]4910-a parson i was .[1156-the keeper]

[I]0-i went [a curate]1982-a curate to [a little place in [Leicestershire]35-leicestershire [a bonnie place with [not many people]1985-not many people]1984-a bonnie place with not many people , and [a fine old church]1986-a fine old church , and [a great rich parsonage]1987-a great rich parsonage]1983-a little place in leicestershire a bonnie place with not many people , and a fine old church , and a great rich parsonage . [I]0-i had n't overmuch to do , and [the rector]1988-the rector [he]1988-the rector was [the son of [an Earl]1990-an earl]1989-the son of an earl was generous . [He]1988-the rector lent [me]0-i a horse and would have [me]0-i hunt like [the rest]4676-the rest . [I]0-i always think of [that place]1992-that place with a smell of honeysuckle while the grass is wet in the morning . It was fine , and [I]0-i enjoyed [myself]0-i , and did the parish work all right . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i was pretty good .

[A cousin of [the rector]1988-the rector 's]1993-a cousin of the rector 's used to come in the hunting season [a [Lady Crystabel]289-lady crystabel , lady in [her]289-lady crystabel own right]1995-a lady crystabel , lady in her own right . The second year [I]0-i was [there]1189-there [she]1993-a cousin of the rector 's came in June . There was n't much company , so [she]1993-a cousin of the rector 's used to talk to [me]0-i [I]0-i used to read then and [she]1993-a cousin of the rector 's used to pretend to be so childish and unknowing , and would get [me]0-i telling [her]1993-a cousin of the rector 's things , and talking to [her]1993-a cousin of the rector 's , and [I]0-i was hot on things . [We]1997-we must play tennis together , and ride together , and [I]0-i must row [her]1993-a cousin of the rector 's down [the river]1998-the river . [She]1993-a cousin of the rector 's said [we]1997-we were in [the wilderness]1089-the wilderness and could do as [we]1997-we liked . [She]1993-a cousin of the rector 's made [me]0-i wear flannels and soft clothes . [She]1993-a cousin of the rector 's was very fine and frank and unconventional ripping , [I]0-i thought [her]1993-a cousin of the rector 's . All the summer [she]1993-a cousin of the rector 's stopped on . [I]0-i went out of [the churchyard]1951-the churchyard feeling a sullen resentment against the tousled graves that lay inanimate across [my]0-i way . Over [the hill]502-the hill , the big flushed face of the moon poised just above the treetops , very majestic , and far off yet imminent . [I]0-i turned with swift sudden friendliness to the net of elm - boughs spread over [my]0-i head , dotted with soft clusters winsomely . [I]0-i jumped up and pulled the cool soft tufts against [my]0-i face for company ; and as [I]0-i passed , still [I]0-i reached upward for the touch of this budded gentleness of the trees . The wood breathed fragrantly , with a subtle sympathy . The firs softened their touch to [me]0-i , and [the larches]2036-the larches woke from the barren winter - sleep , and put out velvet fingers to caress [me]0-i as [I]0-i passed . Only the clean , bare branches of the ash stood emblem of the discipline of life . [I]0-i looked down on the blackness where trees filled [the quarry]1228-the quarry and [the valley bottoms]2038-the valley bottoms , and it seemed that [the world]1209-the world , [[my]0-i own home - world]2040-my own home - world , was strange again .

Some four or five days after [Annable]184-annable had talked to [me]0-i in [the churchyard]1951-the churchyard , [I]0-i went out to find [him]2042-he again . It was Sunday morning . [The larch - wood]2043-the larch - wood was afloat with clear , lyric green , and some primroses scattered whitely on the edge under the fringing boughs . It was a clear morning , as when the latent life of [the world]1209-the world begins to vibrate afresh in the air . The smoke from [the cottage]1252-the cottage rose blue against the trees , and thick yellow against the sky . The fire , it seemed , was only just lighted , and the wood - smoke poured out .

[Sam]193-sam appeared outside [the house]563-the house , and looked round . Then [he]2042-he climbed the water - trough for a better survey . " [He]2042-he is going for [[his]2042-he father]630-his father , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i left [the path]495-the path to follow [him]2042-he down hill across [the waste meadow]2050-the waste meadow , crackling the blanched stems of last year 's thistles as [I]0-i went , and stumbling in rabbit holes . [He]2042-he reached the wall that ran along [the quarry 's edge]2051-the quarry 's edge , and was over [it]2052-it in a twinkling .

When [I]0-i came to [the place]4141-the place , [I]0-i was somewhat nonplussed , for sheer from the stone fence , the quarry - side dropped for some twenty or thirty feet , piled up with unmortared stones . [I]0-i looked round there was a plain dark thread down [the hillside]739-the hillside , which marked a path to [this spot]2055-this spot , and the wall was scored with the marks of heavy boots . Then [I]0-i looked again down [the quarry - side]2056-the quarry - side , and [I]0-i saw how could [I]0-i have failed to see ? stones projecting to make an uneven staircase , such as is often seen in the Derbyshire fences . [I]0-i saw this ladder was well used , so [I]0-i trusted [myself]0-i to it , and scrambled down , clinging to the face of the quarry wall . Once down , [I]0-i felt pleased with [myself]0-i for having discovered and used the unknown access , and [I]0-i admired the care and ingenuity of [the keeper]1156-the keeper , who had fitted and wedged the long stones into the uncertain pile .

It was warm in [the quarry]1228-the quarry : there the sunshine seemed to thicken and sweeten ; there the little mounds of overgrown waste were aglow with very early dog - violets ; there the sparks were coming out on the bits of gorse , and among the stones the colt - foot plumes were already silvery . Here was spring sitting just awake , unloosening [her]2059-her glittering hair , and opening [her]2059-her purple eyes .

[I]0-i went across [the quarry]1228-the quarry , down to where [the brook]574-the brook ran murmuring a tale to the primroses and the budding trees . [I]0-i was startled from [my]0-i wandering among the fresh things by a faint clatter of stones .

" What 's [that young rascal]4918-that young rascal doing ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , setting forth to see . [He]193-sam was hidden by a great bush of sallow catkins , all yellow , and murmuring with bees , warm with spice . [They]2084-they decided at the inquest that the death came by misadventure . But there were vague rumours in [the village]737-the village that this was revenge which had overtaken [the keeper]1156-the keeper .

[They]2084-they decided to bury [him]1156-the keeper in [[our]2082-us churchyard]2087-our churchyard at [Greymede]39-greymede under the beeches ; [the widow]1823-the widow would have it so , and nothing might be denied [her]1823-the widow in [her]1823-the widow state .

It was a magnificent morning in early spring when [I]0-i watched among the trees to see [the procession]2089-the procession come down [the hillside]739-the hillside . The upper air was woven with the music of the larks , and [my]0-i whole world thrilled with the conception of summer . The young pale wind - flowers had arisen by the wood - gale , and under the hazels , when perchance the hot sun pushed [his]1156-the keeper way , new little suns dawned , and blazed with real light . There was a certain thrill and quickening everywhere , as [a woman]881-a woman must feel when [she]881-a woman has conceived . A sallow tree in a favoured spot looked like a pale gold cloud of summer dawn ; nearer it had poised [a golden , fairy busby on every twig]2092-a golden , fairy busby on every twig , and was voiced with a hum of bees , like [any sacred golden bush]2093-any sacred golden bush , uttering its gladness in the thrilling murmur of bees , and in warm scent . Birds called and flashed on every hand ; they made off exultant with streaming strands of grass , or wisps of fleece , plunging into the dark spaces of the wood , and out again into the blue .

[A lad]485-a lad moved across [the field]4259-the field from [the farm below]2096-the farm below with a dog trotting behind [him]485-a lad , a dog , no , a fussy , black - legged lamb trotting along on its toes , with its tail swinging behind . [They]2097-they were going to the mothers on the common , who moved like little grey clouds among the dark grose .

[I]0-i can not help forgetting , and sharing the spink 's triumph , when [he]485-a lad flashes past with a fleece from a bramble bush . It will cover the bedded moss , it will weave among the soft red cow - hair beautifully . It is a prize , it is an ecstasy to have captured it at the right moment , and the nest is nearly ready .

Ah , but the thrush is scornful , ringing out [his]485-a lad voice from the hedge ! [He]1156-the keeper sets [his]1156-the keeper breast against the mud , and models it warm for the turquoise eggs blue , blue , bluest of eggs , which cluster so close and round against the breast , which round up beneath the breast , nestling content . [You]2098-you should see the bright ecstasy in the eyes of a nesting thrush , because of the rounded caress of the eggs against [her]485-a lad breast !

What a hurry the jenny wren makes hoping [I]0-i shall not see [her]485-a lad dart into the low bush . [I]0-i have a delight in watching [them]2097-they against [their]2097-they shy little wills . But [they]2097-they have all risen with a rush of wings , and are gone , the birds . The air is brushed with agitation . There is no lark in the sky , not one ; [the heaven]2099-the heaven is clear of wings or twinkling dot .

Till [the heralds]2100-the heralds come till [the heralds]2100-the heralds wave like shadows in the bright air , crying , lamenting , fretting forever . Rising and falling and circling round and round , [the slow - waving peewits]2102-the slow - waving peewits cry and complain , and lift [their]2102-the slow - waving peewits broad wings in sorrow . [They]2102-the slow - waving peewits stoop suddenly to the ground , the lapwings , then in another throb of anguish and protest , [they]2102-the slow - waving peewits swing up again , offering a glistening white breast to the sunlight , to deny it in black shadow , then a glisten of green , and all the time crying and crying in despair .

The pheasants are frightened into cover , [they]2102-the slow - waving peewits run and dart through the hedge . [The cold cock]2103-the cold cock must fly in [his]2103-the cold cock haste , spread [himself]2103-the cold cock on [his]2103-the cold cock streaming plumes , and sail into [the wood]504-the wood 's security .

There is a cry in answer to the peewits , echoing louder and stronger the lamentation of the lapwings , a wail which hushes the birds . [The men]1214-the men come over [the brow of [the hill]502-the hill]948-the brow of the hill , slowly , with [the old squire]2108-the old squire walking tall and straight in front ; [six bowed men bearing the coffin on [their]2109-six bowed men bearing the coffin on their shoulders , treading heavily and cautiously , under the great weight of the glistening white coffin shoulders , treading heavily and cautiously , under the great weight of the glistening white coffin]2109-six bowed men bearing the coffin on their shoulders , treading heavily and cautiously , under the great weight of the glistening white coffin ; six men following behind , ill at ease , waiting [their]2109-six bowed men bearing the coffin on their shoulders , treading heavily and cautiously , under the great weight of the glistening white coffin turn for the burden . The coffin is of new unpolished wood , gleaming and glistening in the sunlight ; [the men who carry it]2111-the men who carry it remember all [their]2111-the men who carry it lives after the smell of new , warm elm - wood .

Again a loud cry from [the hill - top]2112-the hill - top . [The woman]813-the woman has followed thus far , [the big , shapeless woman]2114-the big , shapeless woman , and [she]2114-the big , shapeless woman cries with loud cries after the white coffin as it descends [the hill]502-the hill , and [the children]4276-the children that cling to [her]2114-the big , shapeless woman skirts weep aloud , and are not to be hushed by [the other woman]2117-the other woman , who bends over [them]4276-the children , but does not form one of [the group]2118-the group . How the crying frightens the birds , and the rabbits ; and [the lambs away there]2119-the lambs away there run to [[their]2119-the lambs away there mothers]2120-their mothers . But [the peewits]2121-the peewits are not frightened , [they]2121-the peewits add [their]2121-the peewits notes to the sorrow ; [they]2121-the peewits circle after the white , retreating coffin , [they]2121-the peewits circle round [the woman]813-the woman ; it is [they]2121-the peewits who forever " keen "[2121-the peewits] the sorrows of [this world]2123-this world . [They]2121-the peewits are like [priests]2124-priests in [their]2121-the peewits robes , more black than white , more grief than hope , driving endlessly round and round , turning , lifting , falling and crying always in mournful desolation , repeating [their]2121-the peewits last syllables like the broken accents of despair .

[The bearers]2125-the bearers have at last sunk between the high banks , and turned out of sight . [The big woman]2126-the big woman can not see [them]2125-the bearers , and yet [she]2126-the big woman stands to look . [She]2126-the big woman must go [home]4184-home , there is nothing left .

[They]2125-the bearers have rested the coffin on the gate posts , and [the bearers]2125-the bearers are wiping the sweat from [their]2125-the bearers faces . [They]2125-the bearers put [their]2125-the bearers hands to [their]2125-the bearers shoulders on the place where the weight has pressed .

[The other six]2129-the other six are placing the pads on [their]2129-the other six shoulders , when [a girl]4168-a girl comes up with a jug and a blue pot . [The squire]1080-the squire drinks first , and fills for the rest . Meanwhile [the girl]604-the girl stands back under the hedge , away from the coffin which smells of new elm - wood . In imagination [she]604-the girl pictures [the man]655-the man shut up there in close darkness , while the sunlight flows all outside , and [she]604-the girl catches [her]604-the girl breast with terror . [She]604-the girl must turn and rustle among the leaves of the violets for the flowers [she]604-the girl does not see . Then , trembling , [she]604-the girl comes to [herself]604-the girl , and plucks a few flowers and breathes them hungrily into [her]604-the girl soul , for comfort . [The men]1214-the men put down the pots beside [her]604-the girl , with thanks , and [the squire]1080-the squire gives the word . [The bearers]2125-the bearers lift up the burden again , and the elm - boughs rattle along the hollow white wood , and the pitiful red clusters of elm - flowers sweep along it as if [they]1214-the men whispered in sympathy " [We]1214-the men are so sorry , so sorry "[1214-the men] ; always the compassionate buds in [their]1214-the men fulness of life bend down to comfort [the dark man shut up there]2137-the dark man shut up there . " Perhaps , "[604-the girl] [the girl]604-the girl thinks , " [he]2137-the dark man shut up there hears [them]1214-the men , and goes softly to sleep . "[604-the girl] [She]604-the girl shakes the tears out of [her]604-the girl eyes on to the ground , and , taking up [her]604-the girl pots , goes slowly down , over [the brooks]1476-the brooks .

In a while , [I]0-i too got up and went down to [the mill]635-the mill , which lay red and peaceful , with the blue smoke rising as winsomely and carelessly as ever . On [the other side of [the valley]425-the valley]2141-the other side of the valley [I]0-i could see a pair of horses nod slowly across the fallow . [A man]654-a man 's voice called to [them]2144-them now and again with a resonance that filled [me]0-i with longing to follow [my]0-i horses over the fallow , in [the still , lonely valley]2145-the still , lonely valley , full of sunshine and eternal forgetfulness . The day had already forgotten . [The water]429-the water was blue and white and dark - burnished with shadows ; two swans sailed across the reflected trees with perfect blithe grace . The gloom that had passed across was gone . [I]0-i watched the swan with [his]2147-his ruffled wings swell onwards ; [I]0-i watched [his]2147-his slim consort go peeping into corners and under bushes ; [I]0-i saw [him]2147-his steer clear of the bushes , to keep full in view , turning [his]2147-his head to [me]0-i imperiously , till [I]0-i longed to pelt [him]2147-his with the empty husks of last year 's flowers , knap - weed and scabius . [I]0-i was too indolent , and [I]0-i turned instead to [the orchard]1040-the orchard .

There the daffodils were lifting [their]2149-their heads and throwing back their yellow curls . At the foot of each sloping , grey old tree stood a family of flowers , some bursten with golden fulness , some lifting [their]2150-their heads slightly , to show a modest , sweet countenance , others still hiding [their]2150-their faces , leaning forward pensively from the jaunty grey - green spears ; [I]0-i wished [I]0-i had [their]2151-their language , to talk to [them]2151-their distinctly .

Overhead , the trees , with lifted fingers shook out [their]2151-their hair to the sun , decking [themselves]2151-their with buds as white and cool as a water - nymphs breasts .

[I]0-i began to be very glad . The colts - foot discs glowed and laughed in a merry company down [the path]495-the path ; [I]0-i stroked the velvet faces , and laughed also , and [I]0-i smelled the scent of black - currant leaves , which is full of childish memories .

[The house]563-the house was quiet and complacent ; [it]563-the house was peopled with ghosts again ; but the ghosts had only come to enjoy [the warm place]2154-the warm place once more , carrying sunshine in [their]2151-their arms and scattering it through the dusk of [gloomy rooms]2155-gloomy rooms .

CHAPTER III

THE IRONY OF INSPIRED MOMENTS

It happened , the next day after the funeral , [I]0-i came upon reproductions of [Aubrey Beardsley]292-aubrey beardsley 's " Atalanta , "[0-i] and of the tail - piece " Salome , "[0-i] and others . [I]0-i sat and looked and [my]0-i soul leaped out upon the new thing . [I]0-i was bewildered , wondering , grudging , fascinated . [I]0-i looked a long time , but [my]0-i mind , or [my]0-i soul , would come to no state of coherence . [I]0-i was fascinated and overcome , but yet full of stubbornness and resistance .

[Lettie]116-lettie was out , so , although it was dinner - time , even because it was dinner - time , [I]0-i took the book and went down to [the mill]635-the mill .

The dinner was over ; there was the fragrance of cooked rhubarb in [the room]518-the room . [I]0-i went straight to [Emily]109-emily , who was leaning back in [her]109-emily chair , and put the Salome before [her]109-emily .

" Look , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " look here ! "[0-i]

[She]109-emily looked ; [she]109-emily was short - sighted , and peered close . [I]0-i was impatient for [her]109-emily to speak . [She]109-emily turned slowly at last and looked at [me]0-i , shrinking , with questioning .

" Well ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Is n't it fearful ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily replied softly .

" No ! why is it ? "[108-george]

" It makes [you]109-emily feel Why have [you]109-emily brought it ? "[108-george]

" [I]108-george wanted [you]109-emily to see it . "[108-george]

" [Good Lord]284-good lord ! "[108-george] [he]108-george drawled , half amused . [The children]4276-the children came crowding to see , and [Emily]109-emily closed the book .

" [I]109-emily shall be late Hurry up , [Dave]150-david ! "[109-emily] and [she]109-emily went to wash [her]109-emily hands before going to [school]497-school .

[Lettie]116-lettie continued to play for some time , after which [she]2194-she went up to [[her]2194-she own room]2199-her own room .

[Leslie]121-leslie did not return to [us]2200-us the next day , nor the day after . The first day [Marie]114-meg came and told [us]2200-us [he]121-leslie had gone away to [Yorkshire]49-yorkshire to see about [the new mines that were being sunk [there]1189-there]2201-the new mines that were being sunk there , and was likely to be absent for a week or so . These business visits to [the north]2203-the north were rather frequent . [The firm]2204-the firm , of which [Mr. Tempest]120-mr. tempest was [director and chief shareholder]2205-director and chief shareholder , were opening [important new mines in [the other county]2207-the other county]2206-important new mines in the other county , as the seams at [home]4184-home were becoming exhausted or unprofitable . It was proposed that [Leslie]121-leslie should live in [Yorkshire]49-yorkshire when [he]121-leslie was married , to superintend [the new workings]2209-the new workings . [He]121-leslie at first rejected the idea , but [he]121-leslie seemed later to approve of it more .

During the time [he]121-leslie was away [Lettie]116-lettie was moody and cross - tempered . [She]116-lettie did not mention [George]108-george nor [the mill]635-the mill ; indeed , [she]116-lettie preserved [her]116-lettie best , most haughty and ladylike manner .

On the evening of the fourth day of [Leslie]121-leslie 's absence [we]2211-we were out in [the garden]444-the garden . The trees were " uttering joyous leaves . "[515-my mother] [[My]0-i mother]515-my mother was in the midst of [[her]515-my mother garden]2214-her garden , lifting the dusky faces of the auriculas to look at the velvet lips , or tenderly taking a young weed from the black soil . The thrushes were calling and clamouring all round . The japonica flamed on the wall as the light grew thicker ; the tassels of white cherry - blossom swung gently in the breeze .

" What shall [I]116-lettie do , [mother]4146-mother ? "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , as [she]116-lettie wandered across the grass to pick at the japonica flowers . " What shall [I]116-lettie do ? There 's nothing to do . "[116-lettie]

" Well , [[my]4146-mother girl]4448-my girl what do [you]4448-my girl want to do ? [You]4448-my girl have been moping about all day go and see [somebody]4142-somebody . "[4146-mother]

" It 's such a long way to [Eberwich]6-eberwich . "[116-lettie]

" Is it ? Then go somewhere nearer . "[4146-mother]

[Lettie]116-lettie fretted about with restless , petulant indecision .

" [I]116-lettie do n't know what to do , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , " And [I]116-lettie feel as if [I]116-lettie might just as well never have lived at all as waste days like this . "[116-lettie]

" [I]4146-mother ca n't help it , [[my]4146-mother dear]4165-my dear [you]4165-my dear must do something for [yourself]4165-my dear . "[4146-mother]

" And what can [I]116-lettie do ? [I]116-lettie can do nothing . "[116-lettie]

" Then [I]4146-mother 'd go to bed . "[4146-mother]

" That [I]116-lettie wo n't with the dead weight of a wasted day on [me]116-lettie . [I]116-lettie feel as if [I]116-lettie 'd do something desperate . "[116-lettie]

" Very well , then , "[4146-mother] said [mother]4146-mother , " do it , and have done . "[4146-mother]

" Oh , it 's no good talking to [you]0-i [I]4146-mother do n't want "[4146-mother] [She]4146-mother turned away , went to the laurestinus , and began pulling off it the long red berries . [I]0-i expected [she]4146-mother would fret the evening wastefully away . [I]0-i noticed all at once that [she]4146-mother stood still . It was the noise of [a motor - car]2216-a motor - car running rapidly down [the hill]502-the hill towards [Nethermere]1-nethermere a light , quick - clicking sound . [I]0-i listened also . [I]0-i could feel the swinging drop of [the car]2218-the car as it came down [the leaps of [the hill]502-the hill]2219-the leaps of the hill . [We]2221-we could see the dust trail up among the trees . [Lettie]116-lettie raised [her]116-lettie head and listened expectantly . [The car]2218-the car rushed along the edge of [Nethermere]1-nethermere then there was the jar of brakes , as the machine slowed down and stopped . In a moment with a quick flutter of sound , it was passing [the lodge - gates]2223-the lodge - gates and whirling up [the drive]559-the drive , through the wood , to [us]2221-we . [Lettie]116-lettie stood with flushed cheeks and brightened eyes . [She]116-lettie went towards the bushes that shut off [the lawn]554-the lawn from [the gravelled space in front of [the house]563-the house]2226-the gravelled space in front of the house , watching . [A car]2228-a car came racing through the trees . It was [the small car [Leslie]121-leslie used on [the firm]2204-the firm 's business]2229-the small car leslie used on the firm 's business now it was white with dust . [Leslie]121-leslie suddenly put on the brakes , and tore to a standstill in front of [the house]563-the house . [He]121-leslie stepped to the ground . There [he]121-leslie staggered a little , being giddy and cramped with the long drive . [His]121-leslie motor - jacket and cap were thick with dust .

[Lettie]116-lettie called to [him]121-leslie , " [Leslie]121-leslie ! "[116-lettie] and flew down to [him]121-leslie . [He]121-leslie took [her]116-lettie into [his]121-leslie arms , and clouds of dust rose round [her]116-lettie . [He]121-leslie kissed [her]116-lettie , and [they]2232-they stood perfectly still for a moment . [She]116-lettie looked up into [his]121-leslie face then [she]116-lettie disengaged [her]116-lettie arms to take off [his]121-leslie disfiguring motor - spectacles . After [she]116-lettie had looked at [him]121-leslie a moment , tenderly , [she]116-lettie kissed [him]121-leslie again . [He]121-leslie loosened [his]121-leslie hold of [her]116-lettie , and [she]116-lettie said , in a voice full of tenderness :

" [You]121-leslie are trembling , [dear]4347-dear . "[116-lettie]

" It 's the ride . [I]116-lettie 've never stopped . "[116-lettie]

Without further words [she]116-lettie took [him]121-leslie into [the house]563-the house .

" How pale [you]121-leslie are see , lie on the couch never mind the dust . All right , [I]116-lettie 'll find [you]121-leslie a coat of [Cyril]113-cyril 's . O , [mother]4146-mother , [he]121-leslie 's come all those miles in [the car]2218-the car without stopping make [him]121-leslie lie down . "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie ran and brought [him]121-leslie a jacket , and put the cushions round , and made [him]121-leslie lie on the couch . [He]121-leslie lay watching [her]116-lettie all the time ; [he]121-leslie was white with fatigue and excitement .

" [I]121-leslie wonder if [I]121-leslie shall be had up for scorching [I]121-leslie can feel the road coming at [me]121-leslie yet , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie said .

" Why were [you]116-lettie so headlong ? "[116-lettie]

" [I]116-lettie felt as if [I]116-lettie should go wild if [I]116-lettie did n't come if [I]116-lettie did n't rush . [I]116-lettie did n't know how [you]116-lettie might have taken [me]116-lettie , [Lettie]116-lettie when [I]116-lettie said what [I]116-lettie did . "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie went to [him]2234-i and sat down by [him]2234-i , smoothing [his]2234-i hair from [his]2234-i forehead , kissing [him]2234-i , [her]116-lettie attitude tender , suggesting tears , [her]116-lettie movements impulsive , as if with a self - reproach [she]116-lettie would not acknowledge , but which [she]116-lettie must silence with lavish tenderness . [He]2234-i drew [her]116-lettie to [him]2234-i , and [they]2235-they remained quiet for some time , till it grew dark .

The noise of [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother stirring in [the next room]2237-the next room disturbed [them]2235-they . [Lettie]116-lettie rose , and [he]2234-i also got up from the couch .

" [I]2234-i suppose , "[2234-i] [he]2234-i said , " [I]2234-i shall have to go [home]4184-home and get bathed and dressed though , "[2234-i] [he]2234-i added in tones which made it clear [he]2234-i did not want to go , " [I]2234-i shall have to get back in the morning [I]2234-i do n't know what [they]2235-they 'll say . " [I]515-my mother 'll ask [her]4163-your mother . "[515-my mother]

[He]2241-he wanted to stay far more than [she]2241-he wished it , so it was [she]2241-he who put down [his]2241-he opposition and triumphed .

" It is neither meanness nor grundyishness "[515-my mother]

[Lettie]116-lettie went out a little impatient at [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother 's unwillingness , but [Leslie]121-leslie stayed , nevertheless .

In a few moments [Lettie]116-lettie was up in [the spare bedroom]2245-the spare bedroom , arranging and adorning , and [Rebecca]115-rebecca was running with hot - water bottles , and hurrying down with clean bed - clothes . [Lettie]116-lettie hastily appropriated [my]0-i best brushes which [she]116-lettie had given [me]0-i and took the suit of pajamas of the thinnest , finest flannel and discovered a new tooth - brush and made selections from [my]0-i shirts and handkerchiefs and underclothing and directed [me]0-i which suit to lend [him]2246-he . Altogether [I]0-i was astonished , and perhaps a trifle annoyed , at [her]116-lettie extraordinary thoughtfulness and solicitude .

[He]2246-he came down to supper , bathed , brushed , and radiant . [He]2246-he ate heartily and seemed to emanate a warmth of physical comfort and pleasure . The colour was flushed again into [his]2246-he face , and [he]2246-he carried [his]2246-he body with the old independent , assertive air . [I]0-i have never known the time when [he]2246-he looked handsomer , when [he]2246-he was more attractive . There was a certain warmth about [him]2246-he , a certain glow that enhanced [his]2246-he words , [his]2246-he laughter , [his]2246-he movements ; [he]2246-he was [the predominant person]2247-the predominant person , and [we]2248-we felt a pleasure in [his]2246-he mere proximity . [[My]0-i mother]515-my mother , however , could not quite get rid of [her]515-my mother stiffness , and soon after supper [she]515-my mother rose , saying [she]515-my mother would finish [her]515-my mother letter in [the next room]2237-the next room , bidding [him]2246-he good - night , as [she]515-my mother would probably not see [him]2246-he again . The cloud of this little coolness was the thinnest and most transitory . [He]2246-he talked and laughed more gaily than ever , and was ostentatious in [his]2246-he movements , throwing back [his]2246-he head , taking little attitudes which displayed the broad firmness of [his]2246-he breast , the grace of [his]2246-he well - trained physique . [I]0-i left [them]2251-them at the piano ; [he]2246-he was sitting pretending to play , and looking up all the while at [her]515-my mother , who stood with [her]515-my mother hand on [his]2246-he shoulder .

In the morning [he]2246-he was up early , by six o'clock [downstairs]639-downstairs and attending to [the car]2218-the car . When [I]0-i got down [I]0-i found [him]2246-he very busy , and very quiet .

" [I]2246-he know [I]2246-he 'm [a beastly nuisance]4994-a beastly nuisance , "[2246-he] [he]2246-he said , " but [I]2246-he must get off early . "[2246-he]

[Rebecca]115-rebecca came and prepared breakfast , which [we]2254-we two ate alone . [He]2246-he was remarkably dull and wordless .

" It 's a wonder [Lettie]116-lettie has n't got up to have breakfast with [you]2246-he [she]116-lettie 's such a one for raving about the perfection of the early morning it 's purity and promises and so forth , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

[He]2246-he broke [his]2246-he bread nervously , and drank some coffee as if [he]2246-he were agitated , making noises in [his]2246-he throat as [he]2246-he swallowed .

" It 's too early for [her]116-lettie , [I]2246-he should think , "[2246-he] [he]2246-he replied , wiping [his]2246-he moustache hurriedly . Yet [he]2246-he seemed to listen for [her]115-rebecca . [[Lettie]116-lettie 's bedroom]2255-lettie 's bedroom was over [the study]533-the study , where [Rebecca]115-rebecca had laid breakfast , and [he]2246-he listened now and again , holding [his]2246-he knife and fork suspended in [their]2257-their action . Then [he]2246-he went on with [his]2246-he meal again .

When [he]2246-he was laying down [his]2246-he serviette , the door opened . [He]2246-he pulled [himself]2246-he together , and turned round sharply . It was [mother]4146-mother . When [she]4146-mother spoke to [him]2246-he , [his]2246-he face twitched with a little frown , half of relief , half of disappointment .

" [I]2246-he must be going now , "[2246-he] [he]2246-he said " thank [you]4146-mother very much [Mother]117-mother . "[4146-mother]

" [You]2246-he are [a harum - scarum boy]4995-a harum - scarum boy . [I]4146-mother wonder why [Lettie]116-lettie does n't come down . [I]4146-mother know [she]116-lettie is up . "[4146-mother]

" Yes , "[2246-he] [he]2246-he replied . " Yes , [I]2246-he 've heard [her]116-lettie . Perhaps [she]116-lettie is dressing . [I]2246-he must get off . "[2246-he]

" [I]4146-mother 'll call [her]116-lettie . "[4146-mother]

" No do n't bother [her]116-lettie [she]116-lettie 'd come if [she]116-lettie wanted "[2246-he]

But [mother]4146-mother had called from the foot of the stairs .

" [Lettie]116-lettie , [Lettie]116-lettie [he]2262-he 's going . "[4146-mother]

" All right , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie , and in another minute [she]116-lettie came [downstairs]639-downstairs . [She]116-lettie was dressed in dark , severe stuff , and [she]116-lettie was somewhat pale . [She]116-lettie did not look at any of [us]2261-us , but turned [her]116-lettie eyes aside .

" Good - bye , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said to [him]2262-he , offering [him]2262-he [her]116-lettie cheek . [He]2262-he kissed [her]116-lettie , murmuring : " Good - bye [[my]2262-he love]4516-my love . "[2262-he]

[He]2262-he stood in the doorway a moment , looking at [her]116-lettie with beseeching eyes . [She]116-lettie kept [her]116-lettie face half averted , and would not look at [him]2262-he , but stood pale and cold , biting [her]116-lettie underlip . [He]2262-he turned sharply away with a motion of keen disappointment , set the engines of [the car]2218-the car into action , mounted , and drove quickly away .

[Lettie]116-lettie stood pale and inscrutable for some moments .

Then [she]116-lettie went in to breakfast and sat toying with [her]116-lettie food , keeping [her]116-lettie head bent down , [her]116-lettie face hidden .

In less than an hour [he]2262-he was back again , saying [he]2262-he had left something behind . [He]2262-he ran [upstairs]532-upstairs , and then , hesitating , went into [the room where [Lettie]116-lettie was still sitting at table]2265-the room where lettie was still sitting at table .

" [I]2262-he had to come back , "[2262-he] [he]2262-he said .

[She]116-lettie lifted [her]116-lettie face towards [him]2262-he , but kept [her]116-lettie eyes averted , looking out of the window . [She]116-lettie was flushed .

" What had [you]2262-he forgotten ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie asked .

" [I]2262-he 'd left [my]2262-he cigarette case , "[2262-he] [he]2262-he replied .

There was an awkward silence .

" But [I]2262-he shall have to be getting off , "[2262-he] [he]2262-he added .

" Yes , [I]116-lettie suppose [you]2262-he will , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie replied .

After another pause , [he]2262-he asked :

" Wo n't [you]116-lettie just walk down the path with [me]2262-he ? "[2262-he]

[She]116-lettie rose without answering . [He]2262-he took a shawl and put it round [her]116-lettie carefully . [She]116-lettie merely allowed [him]2262-he . [They]2266-they walked in silence down [the garden]444-the garden .

" [You]116-lettie are [you]116-lettie are [you]116-lettie angry with [me]2262-he ? "[2262-he] [he]2262-he faltered .

" What did [you]2262-he come back for ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said , averting [her]116-lettie face from [him]2262-he . [He]2262-he looked at [her]116-lettie .

" Why did n't [you]2262-he go away ? "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said impulsively . [He]2262-he hung [his]2262-he head and was silent .

" [I]2262-he do n't see why why it should make trouble between [us]4997-us , [Lettie]116-lettie , "[2262-he] [he]2262-he faltered . " [You]2262-he make [my]116-lettie hands [my]116-lettie very hands disclaim [me]116-lettie , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie struggled to say .

" But , "[2262-he] [he]2262-he began , much troubled .

" But surely , [Lettie]116-lettie , there 's no need if [you]2262-he love [me]116-lettie "[116-lettie]

[She]116-lettie seemed to wince . [He]2262-he waited , puzzled and miserable .

[She]116-lettie stood with averted face , and did not reply . [His]2262-he forehead was twitching in a puzzled frown .

" [Lettie]116-lettie ! "[2262-he] [he]2262-he said .

[She]116-lettie did not move or answer , but remained with [her]116-lettie face turned full away , so that [he]2262-he could see only the contour of [her]116-lettie cheek . After waiting awhile , [he]2262-he flushed , turned swiftly and set [his]2262-he machine rattling . In a moment [he]2262-he was racing between the trees .

[CHAPTER IV

KISS]50-chapter iv kiss WHEN [SHE]116-lettie 'S RIPE FOR TEARS

It was the Sunday after [Leslie]121-leslie 's visit . [We]2268-us had had a wretched week , with [everybody]1611-everybody mute and unhappy .

Though Spring had come , [none of [us]2268-us]2270-none of us saw it . Afterwards it occurred to [me]0-i that [I]0-i had seen all the ranks of poplars suddenly bursten into a dark crimson glow , with a flutter of blood - red where the sun came through the leaves ; that [I]0-i had found high cradles where [the swan]2271-the swan 's eggs lay by [the waterside]2272-the waterside ; that [I]0-i had seen the daffodils leaning from the moss - grown wooden walls of [the boat - house]2273-the boat - house , and all , moss , daffodils , water , scattered with the pink scarves from the elm buds ; that [I]0-i had broken the half - spread fans of the sycamore , and had watched the white cloud of sloe - blossom go silver grey against the evening sky : but [I]0-i had not perceived it , and [I]0-i had not any vivid spring - pictures left from the neglected week .

It was Sunday evening , just after tea , when [Lettie]116-lettie suddenly said to [me]0-i :

" Come with [me]116-lettie down to [Strelley Mill]2-strelley mill . "[116-lettie]

[I]0-i was astonished , but [I]0-i obeyed unquestioningly . On the threshold [we]2268-us heard a chattering of [girls]764-girls , and immediately [Alice]218-alice 's voice greeted [us]2268-us :

" Hello , [Sybil]133-sybil , love ! Hello , [Lettie]116-lettie ! Come on , here 's a gathering of [the goddesses]4999-the goddesses . Come on , [you]116-lettie just make [us]2268-us right . [You]116-lettie 're [Juno]301-juno , and here 's [Meg]114-meg , [she]114-meg 's [Venus]302-venus , and [I]218-alice 'm here , [somebody]4142-somebody , who am [I]218-alice , tell [us]2268-us quick did [you]116-lettie say [Minerva]303-minerva , [Sybil]133-sybil dear ? Well [you]116-lettie ought , then ! Now [Paris]169-paris , hurry up . [He]5001-he 's putting [his]5001-he Sunday clothes on to take [us]2268-us a walk [Laws]304-laws , what a time it takes [him]5001-he !
