[I]218-alice wonder if [he]5001-he wants [me]218-alice to go and tie [his]5001-he tie . Oh , [Glory]305-glory where on earth did [you]116-lettie get that antimacassar ? "[218-alice]

" In [Nottingham]16-nottingham do n't [you]116-lettie like it ? "[108-george] said [George]108-george referring to [his]108-george tie . " Hello , [Lettie]116-lettie have [you]116-lettie come ? "[108-george]

" What apple ? "[108-george]

" If [you]306-lum like . "[108-george]

" Come on , then . Where 's [the Abode of Love]5005-the abode of love ? Look at [Lettie]116-lettie looking shocked . Awfully sorry , [old girl]5006-old girl thought love agreed with [you]306-lum . "[108-george]

" Did [you]306-lum say love ? "[108-george] inquired [George]108-george .

" Yes , [I]108-george did ; did n't [I]108-george , [Meg]114-meg ? And [you]114-meg say ' Love ' as well , do n't [you]114-meg ? "[108-george]

" [I]114-meg do n't know what it is , "[114-meg] laughed [Meg]114-meg , who was very red and rather bewildered .

"[108-george]

" What do [you]108-george want [me]108-george to do , [Meg]114-meg ? "[108-george] [he]108-george asked .

" [I]108-george 'm not going to [church]638-church . "[108-george]

[Emily]109-emily frowned and bit [her]109-emily finger .

" Come on , [Georgie]108-george . [You]108-george look like the finger of a pair scales between two weights . Which'll draw ? "[109-emily]

" The heavier , "[108-george] [he]108-george replied , smiling , and looking neither at [Meg]114-meg or [Lettie]116-lettie .

" Then it 's [Meg]114-meg , "[218-alice] cried [Alice]218-alice . " Oh , [I]218-alice wish [I]218-alice was fleshy [I]218-alice 've no chance with [Syb]204-syb against [Pem]307-pem . "[218-alice]

[Emily]109-emily flashed looks of rage ; [Meg]114-meg blushed and felt ashamed ; [Lettie]116-lettie began to recover from [her]116-lettie first outraged indignation , and smiled .

Thus [we]2275-we went a walk , in two trios .

Unfortunately , as the evening was so fine , [the roads]1307-the roads were full of [strollers]2277-strollers : [groups of three or four men]2278-groups of three or four men dressed in pale trousers and shiny black cloth coats , following [their]2278-groups of three or four men suspicious little dogs : gangs of [youths]2279-youths slouching along , occupied with nothing , often silent , talking now and then in raucous tones on some subject of brief interest : then [the gallant husbands]2280-the gallant husbands , in [their]2280-the gallant husbands tail coats very husbandly , pushing [a jingling perambulator]2281-a jingling perambulator , admonished by [a much dressed spouse round whom [the small members of [the family]2284-the family]2283-the small members of the family gyrated]2282-a much dressed spouse round whom the small members of the family gyrated : occasionally , [two lovers]2285-two lovers walking with a space between [them]2285-two lovers , disowning [each other]4254-each other ; occasionally , [a smartly dressed mother with [two little girls in white silk frocks and much expanse of yellow hair , stepping mincingly , and , near by ,]2288-two little girls in white silk frocks and much expanse of yellow hair , stepping mincingly , and , near by , [a father]4340-a father awkwardly controlling [his]4340-a father Sunday suit]2287-a smartly dressed mother with two little girls in white silk frocks and much expanse of yellow hair , stepping mincingly , and , near by , a father awkwardly controlling his sunday suit .

To endure all this it was necessary to chatter unconcernedly . [George]108-george had to keep up the conversation behind , and [he]108-george seemed to do it with ease , discoursing on the lambs , discussing the breed when [Meg]114-meg exclaimed :

" Oh , are n't [they]5013-they black ! [They]5013-they might ha ' crept down th ' chimney . [I]108-george never saw any like [them]5013-they before . "[108-george] [He]108-george described how [he]108-george had reared two on the bottle , exciting [Meg]114-meg 's keen admiration by [his]108-george mothering of the lambs . [Lettie]116-lettie did with brevity .

After a while [we]2399-we left , promising to go again , and to see after the safety of [Sam]193-sam .

It was quite dark , and the lamps were lighted in [the houses]2302-the houses . [We]2399-we could hear the throb of the fan - house engines , and the soft whirr of the fan .

" Is n't it cruel ? "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily plaintively .

" Was n't [the man]655-the man [a wretch]4987-a wretch to marry [the woman like that]5072-the woman like that , "[116-lettie] added [Lettie]116-lettie with decision .

" Speak of [Lady Chrystabel]311-lady chrystabel , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , and then there was silence . " [I]0-i suppose [he]655-the man did not know what [he]655-the man was doing , any more than [the rest of [us]2399-we]5073-the rest of us . "[0-i]

" [I]116-lettie thought [you]108-george were going to [[your]108-george aunt]5074-your aunt 's to [the Ram Inn]5075-the ram inn , "[116-lettie] said [Lettie]116-lettie to [George]108-george when [they]2401-they came to [the cross - roads]2402-the cross - roads .

" Not now it 's too late , "[108-george] [he]108-george answered quietly . " [You]116-lettie will come round [our]2401-they way , wo n't [you]116-lettie ? "[108-george]

" Yes , "[116-lettie] [she]116-lettie said .

[We]2401-they were eating bread and milk at [the farm]1000-the farm , and [the father]465-the father was talking with vague sadness and reminiscence , lingering over the thought of [their]2401-they departure from [the old house]2405-the old house . [He]465-the father was [a pure romanticist]2406-a pure romanticist , forever seeking the colour of the past in the present 's monotony . [He]465-the father seemed settling down to an easy contented middle - age , when the unrest on [the farm]1000-the farm and development of [[his]465-the father children]2408-his children quickened [him]465-the father with fresh activity . [He]465-the father read books on [the land]4377-the land question , and modern novels . In the end [he]465-the father became [an advanced radical]2410-an advanced radical , almost [a socialist]2411-a socialist . Occasionally [his]465-the father letters appeared in the newspapers . [He]465-the father had taken a new hold on life .

Over supper [he]465-the father became enthusiastic about [Canada]17-canada , and to watch [him]465-the father , [his]465-the father ruddy face lighted up , [his]465-the father burly form straight and nerved with excitement , was to admire [him]465-the father ; to hear [him]465-the father , [his]465-the father words of thoughtful common - sense all warm with [a young man]4216-a young man 's hopes , was to love [him]465-the father . At forty - six [he]465-the father was more spontaneous and enthusiastic than [George]108-george , and far more happy and hopeful .

[Emily]109-emily would not agree to go away with [them]2413-we what should [she]109-emily do in [Canada]17-canada , [she]109-emily said and [she]109-emily did not want [the little ones]1379-the little ones " to be drudges on [a farm]5076-a farm in the end to be nothing but cattle . "[109-emily]

" And [you]2416-you , [George]108-george ? "[116-lettie] asked [Lettie]116-lettie .

" [I]486-her father 'm not going . What should [I]486-her father go for ? There 's nothing at the end of it only a long life . While [he]465-the father was speaking [Gyp]185-gyp burst into a rage of barking . [The father]465-the father got up to see what it was , and [George]108-george followed . [We]2423-we rushed forward , and there on [the sharp bank - side]2425-the sharp bank - side lay a little figure , face down , and [Trip]110-trip standing over it , looking rather puzzled .

[I]0-i picked up [the child]475-the child it was [Sam]193-sam . CHAPTER V

AN ARROW FROM [THE IMPATIENT GOD]2458-the impatient god

On an afternoon three or four days after the recovery of [Sam]193-sam , matters became complicated . [George]313-lettie , as usual , discovered that [he]313-lettie had been dawdling in the portals of [his]313-lettie desires , when the doors came to with a bang . Then [he]313-lettie hastened to knock .

" Tell [her]2454-she , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said , " [I]313-lettie will come up tomorrow after milking tell [her]2454-she [I]313-lettie 'm coming to see [her]2454-she . "[313-lettie]

On the evening of that morrow , [the first person to put in an appearance]2459-the first person to put in an appearance was [a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of [the family]2284-the family from [church]638-church]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church : " [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church said to [Elizabeth]315-elizabeth , ' Now what a thing if anything happens to [them]2284-the family just now , and the wedding is put off . ' [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church felt [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church must come and make [myself]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church sure that nothing had happened . [We]5093-we all feel so interested in [Lettie]313-lettie just now . [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church 'm sure [everybody]1611-everybody is talking of [her]2454-she , [she]2454-she seems in the air . [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church really think [we]5093-we shall have thunder : [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church hope [we]5093-we sha n't . Yes , [we]5093-we are all so glad that [Mr. Tempest]120-mr. tempest is content with [a wife from at [home]4184-home]5095-a wife from at home [the others]2370-the others , [[his]120-mr. tempest father]630-his father and [Mr. Robert]316-mr. robert and the rest [they]2370-the others were none of [them]2370-the others to be suited at [home]4184-home , though to be sure [the wives]5100-the wives [they]2370-the others brought were nothing indeed [they]2370-the others were not as many [a one]5101-a one said [Mrs. Robert]317-mrs. robert was a paltry choice neither in looks or manner had [she]317-mrs. robert anything to boast of if [[her]317-mrs. robert family]5102-her family was older than [mine]5103-mine . [Family]318-family was n't much to make up for what [she]317-mrs. robert lacked in other things , that [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church could easily have supplied [her]317-mrs. robert with ; and , oh , dear , what an object [she]317-mrs. robert is now , with [her]317-mrs. robert wisp of hair and [her]317-mrs. robert spectacles ! [She]317-mrs. robert for one has n't kept much of [her]317-mrs. robert youth . But when is the exact date , [dear]4347-dear ? [Some]463-some say this and some that , but as [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church always say , [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church never trust a ' [they]463-some say . ' It is so nice that [you]4347-dear have [that cousin]5106-that cousin [a canon]5107-a canon to come down for the service , [Mrs. Beardsall]167-mrs. beardsall , and [Sir Walter Houghton]319-sir walter houghton for [[the groom]5108-the groom 's man]5109-the groom 's man ! What ? [You]4347-dear do n't think so oh , but [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church know , [dear]4347-dear , [I]2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church know ; [you]4347-dear do like to treasure up these secrets , do n't [you]4347-dear ; [you]4347-dear are greedy for all the good things just now . "[2460-a garrulous spinster who had called ostensibly to inquire into the absence of the family from church]

[She]2463-her shook [her]2463-her head at [Lettie]313-lettie , and the jet ornaments on [her]2463-her bonnet twittered like a thousand wagging little tongues . Then [she]2463-her sighed , and was about to recommence [her]2463-her song , when [she]2463-her happened to turn [her]2463-her head and to espy [a telegraph boy coming up [the path]495-the path]2464-a telegraph boy coming up the path .

" Oh , [I]2463-her hope nothing is wrong , [dear]4347-dear [I]2463-her hope nothing is wrong ! [I]2463-her always feel so terrified of a telegram . [You]4347-dear 'd better not open it [yourself]4347-dear , [dear]4347-dear do n't now let [[your]4347-dear brother]5113-your brother go . "[2463-her]

[Lettie]313-lettie , who had turned pale , hurried to the door . The sky was very dark there was a mutter of thunder .

" It 's all right , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , trembling , " it 's only to say [he]5113-your brother 's coming to - night . "[313-lettie]

" [I]2466-the spinster 'm very thankful , very thankful , "[2466-the spinster] cried [the spinster]2466-the spinster . " It might have been so much worse . [I]2466-the spinster 'm sure [I]2466-the spinster never open a telegram without feeling as if [I]2466-the spinster was opening a death - blow . [I]2466-the spinster 'm so glad , [dear]4347-dear ; it must have upset [you]4347-dear . What news to take back to [the village]737-the village , supposing something had happened ! "[2466-the spinster] [she]2466-the spinster sighed again , and the jet drops twinkled ominously in the thunder light , as if declaring they would make something of it yet .

It was six o'clock . The air relaxed a little , and the thunder was silent . [George]313-lettie would be coming about seven ; and [the spinster]2466-the spinster showed no signs of departure ; and [Leslie]121-leslie might arrive at any moment . [Lettie]313-lettie fretted and fidgeted , and [the old woman]809-the old woman gabbled on . [I]0-i looked out of the window at [the water]429-the water and the sky .

The day had been uncertain . In the morning it was warm , and the sunshine had played and raced among the cloud - shadows on [the hills]1056-the hills . Later , great cloud masses had stalked up from the northwest and crowded thick across the sky ; in this little night , sleet and wind , and rain whirled furiously . Then the sky had laughed at [us]2471-us again . In the sunshine came [the spinster]2466-the spinster . But as [she]2466-the spinster talked , over [the hilltop]2473-the hilltop rose the wide forehead of the cloud , rearing slowly , ominously higher . A first messenger of storm passed darkly over the sky , leaving the way clear again .

" [I]313-lettie will go round to Highclose , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie . " [I]313-lettie am sure it will be stormy again . Are [you]4347-dear coming down [the road]738-the road , [Miss Slaighter]320-miss slaighter , or do [you]4347-dear mind if [I]313-lettie leave [you]4347-dear ? "[313-lettie]

" [I]2475-the gossip will go , [dear]4347-dear , if [you]4347-dear think there is going to be another storm [I]2475-the gossip dread it so . Perhaps [I]2475-the gossip had better wait "[2475-the gossip]

" Oh , it will not come over for an hour , [I]313-lettie am sure . [We]2474-we read the weather well out here , do n't [we]2474-we , [Cyril]113-cyril ? [You]4347-dear 'll come with [me]313-lettie , wo n't [you]4347-dear ? "[313-lettie]

[We]2474-we three set off , [the gossip]2475-the gossip leaning on [her]2475-the gossip toes , tripping between [us]2474-we . [She]2475-the gossip was much gratified by [Lettie]313-lettie 's information concerning the proposals for [the new home]2476-the new home . [We]2474-we left [her]2475-the gossip in a glow of congratulatory smiles on [the highway]941-the highway . But the clouds had upreared , and stretched in two great arms , reaching overhead . [The little spinster]2478-the little spinster hurried along , but the black hands of the clouds kept pace and clutched [her]2475-the gossip . A sudden gust of wind shuddered in the trees , and rushed upon [her]2475-the gossip cloak , blowing its bugles .

An icy raindrop smote into [her]2475-the gossip cheek . [She]2475-the gossip hurried on , praying fervently for [her]2475-the gossip bonnet 's sake that [she]2475-the gossip might reach [[Widow Harriman]321-widow harriman 's cottage]2479-widow harriman 's cottage before the burst came . But the thunder crashed in [her]2475-the gossip ear , and a host of hailstones flew at [her]2475-the gossip . In despair and anguish [she]2475-the gossip fled from under the ash trees ; [she]2475-the gossip reached [[the widow]1823-the widow 's garden gate]2481-the widow 's garden gate , when out leapt the lightning full at [her]2475-the gossip . " Put [me]2475-the gossip in the stair - hole ! "[2475-the gossip] [she]2475-the gossip cried . " Where is [the stair - hole]5118-the stair - hole ? "[2475-the gossip]

Glancing wildly round , [she]2475-the gossip saw a ghost . [It]2482-it was the reflection of [the sainted spinster]2483-the sainted spinster , [Hilda Slaighter]322-hilda slaighter , in [the widow]1823-the widow 's mirror ; a reflection with a bonnet fallen backwards , and to it attached a thick rope of grey - brown hair . [The author of the ghost]2485-the author of the ghost instinctively twisted to look at the back of [her]2475-the gossip head . [She]2475-the gossip saw some ends of grey hair , and fled into [the open stair - hole]2486-the open stair - hole as into [a grave]1975-a grave .

[We]2488-we had gone back [home]4184-home till the storm was over , and then , restless , afraid of the arrival of [George]313-lettie , [we]2488-we set out again into the wet evening . It was fine and chilly , and already a mist was rising from [Nethermere]1-nethermere , veiling [the farther shore]2490-the farther shore , where the trees rose loftily , suggesting [groves beyond [the Nile]57-the nile]2491-groves beyond the nile . The birds were singing riotously . The fresh green hedge glistened vividly and glowed again with intense green . Looking at [the water]429-the water , [I]0-i perceived a delicate flush from the west hiding along [it]429-the water . The mist licked and wreathed up [the shores]2493-the shores ; from the hidden white distance came the mournful cry of water fowl . [We]2488-we went slowly along behind [a heavy cart]2494-a heavy cart , which clanked and rattled under the dripping trees , with the hoofs of the horse moving with broad thuds in front . [We]2488-we passed over black patches where the ash flowers were beaten down , and under great massed clouds of green sycamore . At the sudden curve of [the road]738-the road , near [the foot of [the hill]502-the hill]2496-the foot of the hill , [I]0-i stopped to break off a spray of larch , where the soft cones were heavy as raspberries , and gay like flowers with petals . The shaken bough spattered a heavy shower on [my]0-i face , of drops so cold that they seemed to sink into [my]0-i blood and chill it .

" Hark ! "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , as [I]0-i was drying [my]0-i face . There was the quick patter of [a motor - car]2216-a motor - car coming downhill . [The heavy cart]2499-the heavy cart was drawn across [the road]738-the road to rest , and [the driver]2501-the driver hurried to turn the horse back . [It]2499-the heavy cart moved with painful slowness , and [we]2488-we stood in [the road]738-the road in suspense . Suddenly , before [we]2488-we knew it , [the car]2218-the car was dropping down on [us]2488-we , coming at [us]2488-we in a curve , having rounded [the horse and cart]2504-the horse and cart . [Lettie]313-lettie stood faced with terror . [Leslie]121-leslie saw [her]2505-her , and swung round the wheels on the sharp , curving hill - side ; looking only to see that [he]121-leslie should miss [her]2505-her . [The car]2218-the car slid sideways ; the mud crackled under the wheels , and the machine went crashing into [Nethermere]1-nethermere . [It]2218-the car caught the edge of the old stone wall with a smash . Then for a few moments [I]0-i think [I]0-i was blind . When [I]0-i saw again , [Leslie]121-leslie was lying across the broken hedge , [his]121-leslie head hanging down the bank , [his]121-leslie face covered with blood ; [the car]2218-the car rested strangely on the brink of the water , crumpled as if it had sunk down to rest .

[Lettie]313-lettie , with hands shuddering , was wiping the blood from [his]121-leslie eyes with a piece of [her]2505-her underskirt . In a moment [she]2505-her said :

" [He]121-leslie is not dead let [us]2509-us take [him]121-leslie [home]4184-home let [us]2509-us take [him]121-leslie quickly . "[2505-her]

[I]0-i ran and took the wicket gate off [its]2508-its hinges and laid [him]121-leslie on that . [His]121-leslie legs trailed down , but [we]2509-us carried [him]121-leslie thus , [she]2505-her at the feet , [I]0-i at the head . [She]2505-her made [me]0-i stop and put [him]121-leslie down . [I]0-i thought the weight was too much for [her]2505-her , but it was not that .

" [I]2505-her ca n't bear to see [his]121-leslie hand hanging , knocking against the bushes and things . "[2505-her]

It was not many yards to [the house]563-the house . [A maidservant]2511-a maidservant saw [us]2509-us , came running out , and went running back , like the frightened lapwing from the wounded cat .

[We]2509-us waited until [the doctor]840-the doctor came . There was a deep graze down the side of the head serious , but not dangerous ; there was a cut across the cheek - bone that would leave a scar ; and the collar - bone was broken . [I]0-i stayed until [he]121-leslie had recovered consciousness . " [Lettie]313-lettie , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie wanted [Lettie]313-lettie , so [she]2505-her had to remain at Highclose all night . [I]0-i went [home]4184-home to tell [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother .

When [I]0-i went to bed [I]0-i looked across at the lighted windows of Highclose , and the lights trailed mistily towards [me]0-i across [the water]429-the water . The cedar stood dark guard against [the house]563-the house ; bright the windows were , like the stars , and , like the stars , covering their torment in brightness . The sky was glittering with sharp lights they are too far off to take trouble for [us]2509-us , so little , little almost to nothingness . All the great hollow vastness roars overhead , and the stars are only sparks that whirl and spin in the restless space . [The earth]1097-the earth must listen to [us]2509-us ; [she]1097-the earth covers [her]1097-the earth face with a thin veil of mist , and is sad ; [she]1097-the earth soaks up [our]2509-us blood tenderly , in the darkness , grieving , and in the light [she]1097-the earth soothes and reassures [us]2509-us . Here on [[our]2509-us earth]2518-our earth is sympathy and hope , [the heavens]2519-the heavens have nothing but distances .

[A corn - crake]2520-a corn - crake talked to [me]0-i across [the valley]425-the valley , talked and talked endlessly , asking and answering in hoarse tones from [the sleeping , mist - hidden meadows]2522-the sleeping , mist - hidden meadows . The monotonous voice , that on past summer evenings had had pleasant notes of romance , now was intolerable to [me]0-i . Its inflexible harshness and cacophany seemed like the voice of fate speaking out its tuneless perseverance in the night .

In the morning [Lettie]313-lettie came [home]4184-home wan , sad - eyed , and self - reproachful . After a short time [they]2524-they came for [her]1097-the earth , as [he]1097-the earth wanted [her]1097-the earth again .

When in the evening [I]0-i went to see [George]313-lettie , [he]313-lettie too was very despondent .

" It 's no good now , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [You]313-lettie should have insisted and made [your]313-lettie own destiny . "[0-i]

" Yes perhaps so , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie drawled in [his]313-lettie best reflective manner .

" [I]313-lettie would have had [her]1097-the earth [she]1097-the earth 'd have been glad if [you]313-lettie 'd done as [you]313-lettie wanted with [her]1097-the earth . [She]1097-the earth wo n't leave [him]313-lettie till [he]313-lettie 's strong , and [he]313-lettie 'll marry [her]1097-the earth before then . [You]313-lettie should have had the courage to risk [yourself]313-lettie [you]313-lettie 're always too careful of [yourself]313-lettie and [your]313-lettie own poor feelings [you]313-lettie never could brace [yourself]313-lettie up to a shower - bath of contempt and hard usage , so [you]313-lettie 've saved [your]313-lettie feelings and lost not much , [I]313-lettie suppose [you]313-lettie could n't . "[313-lettie]

" But "[2525-he] [he]2525-he began , not looking up ; and [I]0-i laughed at [him]2525-he .

" Go on , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Well [she]5120-she was engaged to [him]2525-he "[313-lettie]

" Pah [you]2525-he thought [you]2525-he were too good to be rejected . "[2525-he]

[He]2525-he was very pale , and when [he]2525-he was pale , the tan on [his]2525-he skin looked sickly . [He]2525-he regarded [me]0-i with [his]2525-he dark eyes , which were now full of misery and [a child]1035-a child 's big despair .

" And nothing else , "[0-i] [I]0-i completed , with which the little , exhausted gunboat of [my]0-i anger wrecked and sank utterly . Yet no thoughts would spread sail on [the sea]2527-the sea of [my]0-i pity : [I]0-i was like water that heaves with yearning , and is still .

[Leslie]121-leslie was very ill for some time . [He]2525-he had a slight brain fever , and was delirious , insisting that [Lettie]313-lettie was leaving [him]2525-he . [She]2528-you stayed most of [her]2528-you days at [Highclose]8-highclose .

One day in June [he]2525-he lay resting on a deck chair in the shade of the cedar , and [she]2528-you was sitting by [him]2525-he . It was a yellow , sultry day , when all the atmosphere seemed inert , and all things were languid .

" Do n't [you]2525-he think , [dear]4347-dear , "[2528-you] [she]2528-you said , " it would be better for [us]5122-us not to marry ? "[2528-you]

[He]2525-he lifted [his]2525-he head nervously from the cushions ; [his]2525-he face was emblazoned with a livid red bar on a field of white , and [he]2525-he looked worn , wistful .

" Do [you]2528-you mean not yet ? "[2525-he] [he]2525-he asked .

" Yes and , perhaps , perhaps never . "[2525-he]

" Ha , "[2525-he] [he]2525-he laughed , sinking down again . " [I]2525-he must be getting like [myself]2525-he again , if [you]2528-you begin to tease [me]2525-he . "[2525-he]

" But , "[2528-you] [she]2528-you said , struggling valiantly , " [I]2528-you 'm not sure [I]2528-you ought to marry [you]2525-he . "[2528-you]

[He]2525-he laughed again , though a little apprehensively .

" Are [you]2528-you afraid [I]2525-he shall always be weak in [my]2525-he noddle ? "[2525-he] [he]2525-he asked . " But [you]2528-you wait a month . "[2525-he]

" No , that does n't bother [me]2525-he "[2525-he]

" Oh , does n't it ! "[2525-he]

" [Silly boy]5123-silly boy no , it 's [myself]2525-he . "[2525-he]

" [I]2525-he 'm sure [I]2525-he 've made no complaint about [you]2528-you . "[2525-he]

" Not likely but [I]2525-he wish [you]2525-he 'd let [me]2525-he go . "[2525-he]

" [I]2525-he 'm [a strong man]5124-a strong man to hold [you]2528-you , are n't [I]2525-he ? Look at [my]2525-he muscular paw ! "[2525-he] [he]2525-he held out [his]2525-he hands , frail and white with sickness .

" [You]2528-you know [you]2528-you hold [me]2525-he and [I]2525-he want [you]2528-you to let [me]2525-he go . [I]2525-he do n't want to "[2525-he]

" To what ? "[2525-he]

" To get married at all let [me]2525-he be , let [me]2525-he go . "[2525-he]

" Oh for [my]2525-he sake . "[2525-he]

" [You]2525-he mean [you]2525-he do n't love [me]2525-he ? "[2525-he]

" Love love [I]2525-he do n't know anything about it . But [I]2525-he ca n't [we]5125-we ca n't be do n't [you]2525-he see oh , what do [they]5126-they say , flesh of one flesh . "[2525-he]

" Why ? "[2525-he] [he]2525-he whispered , like [a child that is told some tale of mystery]2529-a child that is told some tale of mystery .

[She]2530-her looked at [him]2525-he , as [he]2525-he lay propped upon [his]2525-he elbow , turning towards [hers]2530-her [his]2525-he white face of fear and perplexity , like [a child that can not understand , and is afraid , and wants to cry]2531-a child that can not understand , and is afraid , and wants to cry . Then slowly tears gathered full in [her]2530-her eyes , and [she]2530-her wept from pity and despair .

This excited [him]2525-he terribly . [He]2525-he got up from [his]2525-he chair , and the cushions fell on to the grass :

" What 's the matter , what 's the matter ! Oh , [Lettie]313-lettie , is it [me]2525-he ? do n't [you]313-lettie want [me]2525-he now ? is that it ? tell [me]2525-he , tell [me]2525-he now , tell [me]2525-he , "[2525-he] [he]2525-he grasped [her]2530-her wrists , and tried to pull [her]2530-her hands from [her]2530-her face . The tears were running down [his]2525-he cheeks . [She]2530-her felt [him]2525-he trembling , and the sound of [his]2525-he voice alarmed [her]2530-her from [herself]2530-her . [She]2530-her hastily smeared the tears from [her]2530-her eyes , got up , and put [her]2530-her arms round [him]2525-he . [He]2525-he hid [his]2525-he head on [her]2530-her shoulder and sobbed , while [she]2530-her bent over [him]2525-he , and so [they]2532-they cried out [their]2532-they cries , till [they]2532-they were ashamed , looking round to see if [anyone]2533-anyone were near . Then [she]2530-her hurried about , picking up the cushions , making [him]2525-he lie down , and arranging [him]2525-he comfortably , so that [she]2530-her might be busy . [He]2525-he was querulous , like [a sick , indulged child]2534-a sick , indulged child . [He]2525-he would have [her]2530-her arm under [his]2525-he shoulders , and [her]2530-her face near [his]2525-he .

" Well , "[2525-he] [he]2525-he said , smiling faintly again after a time . " [You]2530-her are naughty to give [us]5127-us such rough times is it for the pleasure of making up , bad little Schnucke are n't [you]2530-her ? "[2525-he]

[She]2530-her kept close to [him]2525-he , and [he]2525-he did not see the wince and quiver of [her]2530-her lips .

" [I]2530-her wish [I]2530-her was strong again could n't [we]5127-us go boating or ride on horseback and [you]2525-he 'd have to behave then . Do [you]2525-he think [I]2530-her shall be strong in a month ? Stronger than [you]2525-he ? "[2530-her]

" [I]2530-her hope so , "[2530-her] [she]2530-her said .

" Why , [I]2530-her do n't believe [you]2525-he do , [I]2530-her believe [you]2525-he like [me]2530-her like this so that [you]2525-he can lay [me]2530-her down and smooth [me]2530-her do n't [you]2525-he , [quiet girl]5128-quiet girl ? "[2530-her]

" When [you]2525-he 're good . "[2530-her]

" Ah , well , in a month [I]2530-her shall be strong , and [we]5129-we 'll be married and go to [Switzerland]58-switzerland do [you]2525-he hear , [Schnucke]323-schnucke [you]2525-he wo n't be able to be naughty any more then . Oh do [you]2525-he want to go away from [me]2530-her again ? "[2530-her]

" No only [my]2535-she arm is dead , "[2535-she] [she]2535-she drew it from beneath [him]2536-him , standing up , swinging it , smiling because it hurt [her]2535-she .

" Oh , [[my]2530-her darling]4517-my darling what a shame ! oh , [I]2530-her am [a brute]5131-a brute , [a kiddish brute]5132-a kiddish brute . [I]2530-her wish [I]2530-her was strong again , [Lettie]313-lettie , and did n't do these things . "[2530-her]

" [You]2536-him boy it 's nothing . "[2535-she] [She]2535-she smiled at [him]2536-him again .

CHAPTER VI

THE COURTING

During [Leslie]121-leslie 's illness [I]0-i strolled down to [the mill]635-the mill one Saturday evening . [I]0-i met [George]313-lettie tramping across [the yard]457-the yard with a couple of buckets of swill , and eleven young pigs rushing squealing about [his]313-lettie legs , shrieking in an agony of suspense . [He]313-lettie poured the stuff into a trough with luscious gurgle , and instantly ten noses were dipped in , and [ten little mouths]2539-ten little mouths began to slobber . Though there was plenty of room for ten , yet [they]2540-they shouldered and shoved and struggled to capture a larger space , and [many little trotters]2541-many little trotters dabbled and spilled the stuff , and the ten sucking , clapping snouts twitched fiercely , and [twenty little eyes]2542-twenty little eyes glared askance , like so many points of wrath . [They]2540-they gave uneasy , gasping grunts in [their]2540-they haste . [The unhappy eleventh]2543-the unhappy eleventh rushed from point to point trying to push in [his]2543-the unhappy eleventh snout , but for [his]2543-the unhappy eleventh pains [he]2543-the unhappy eleventh got rough squeezing , and sharp grabs on [his]2543-the unhappy eleventh ears . Then [he]2543-the unhappy eleventh lifted up [his]2543-the unhappy eleventh face and screamed screams of grief and wrath unto the evening sky .

But [the ten little gluttons]2544-the ten little gluttons only twitched [their]2544-the ten little gluttons ears to make sure there was no danger in the noise , and [they]2544-the ten little gluttons sucked harder , with much spilling and slobbing . [George]313-lettie laughed like [a sardonic Jove]2545-a sardonic jove , but at last [he]313-lettie gave ear , and kicked the ten gluttons from the trough , and allowed the residue to [the eleventh]2546-the eleventh . [This one]2547-this one , [poor wretch]2548-poor wretch , almost wept with relief as [he]2547-this one sucked and swallowed in sobs , casting [his]2547-this one little eyes apprehensively upwards , though [he]2547-this one did not lift [his]2547-this one nose from the trough , as [he]2547-this one heard the vindictive shrieks of [ten little fiends kept at bay]2549-ten little fiends kept at bay by [George]313-lettie . [The solitary feeder]2550-the solitary feeder , shivering with apprehension , rubbed the wood bare with [his]2550-the solitary feeder snout , then , turning up to heaven [his]2550-the solitary feeder eyes of gratitude , [he]2550-the solitary feeder reluctantly left [the trough]2551-the trough . [I]0-i expected to see the ten fall upon [him]2550-the solitary feeder and devour [him]2550-the solitary feeder , but [they]2552-they did not ; [they]2552-they rushed upon [the empty trough]2553-the empty trough , and rubbed the wood still drier , shrieking with misery .

" How like life , "[0-i] [I]0-i laughed .

" Fine litter , "[313-lettie] said [George]313-lettie ; " there were fourteen , only that damned [she]5133-she - devil , [Circe]324-circe , went and ate three of ['em]5134-'em before [we]5135-we got at [her]5133-she . "[313-lettie]

[The great ugly sow]2554-the great ugly sow came leering up as [he]313-lettie spoke .

" Why do n't [you]313-lettie fatten [her]5133-she up , and devour [her]5133-she , [the old gargoyle]5136-the old gargoyle ? [She]5133-she 's an offence to [the universe]5137-the universe . "[2554-the great ugly sow]

" Nay [she]5133-she 's [a fine sow]5138-a fine sow . "[313-lettie]

[I]0-i snorted , and [he]313-lettie laughed , and [the old sow]2555-the old sow grunted with contempt , and [her]2555-the old sow little eyes twisted towards [us]2556-us with a demoniac leer as [she]2555-the old sow rolled past .

" What are [you]313-lettie going to do to - night ! "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Going out ? "[0-i]

" [I]313-lettie 'm going courting , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie replied , grinning .

" Oh ! wish [I]0-i were ! "[0-i]

" [You]313-lettie can come if [you]313-lettie like and tell [me]0-i where [I]0-i make mistakes , since [you]313-lettie 're [an expert on such matters]5139-an expert on such matters . "[0-i]

" Do n't [you]313-lettie get on very well then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Oh , all right it 's easy enough when [you]313-lettie do n't care a damn . Besides , [you]313-lettie can always have a [Johnny Walker]195-the fortunate jack . That 's the best of courting at [the Ram Inn]5075-the ram inn . [I]0-i 'll go and get ready . "[0-i]

In [the kitchen]451-the kitchen [Emily]109-emily sat grinding out some stitching from a big old hand - machine that stood on the table before [her]109-emily : [she]109-emily was making shirts for [Sam]193-sam , [I]0-i presumed . [That little fellow , who was installed at [the farm]1000-the farm]2558-that little fellow , who was installed at the farm , was seated by [her]109-emily side firing off words from a reading book . The machine rumbled and rattled on , like [a whole factory]2560-a whole factory at work , for an inch or two , during which time [Sam]193-sam shouted in shrill explosions like irregular pistol shots : " Do not pot "[193-sam] " Put ! "[109-emily] cried [Emily]109-emily from the machine ; " put "[475-the child] shrilled [the child]475-the child , " the soot on [my]475-the child boot , "[475-the child] there the machine broke down , and , frightened by the sound of [his]475-the child own voice , [the boy]798-the boy stopped in bewilderment and looked round .

" Go on ! "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , as [she]109-emily poked in the teeth of the old machine with the scissors , then pulled and prodded again . [He]798-the boy began " boot but [you]109-emily "[798-the boy] here [he]798-the boy died off again , made nervous by the sound of [his]798-the boy voice in the stillness . [Emily]109-emily sucked a piece of cotton and pushed it through the needle .

" Now go on , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , " ' but [you]798-the boy may ' . "[109-emily]

" But [you]109-emily may shoot "[798-the boy] : [he]798-the boy shouted away , reassured by the rumble of the machine : " Shoot the fox . [I]798-the boy [I]798-the boy It is at the rot "[798-the boy]

" Root , "[109-emily] shrieked [Emily]109-emily , as [she]109-emily guided the stuff through the doddering jaws of the machine .

" Root , "[798-the boy] echoed [the boy]798-the boy , and [he]798-the boy went off with these crackers : " Root of the tree . "[798-the boy]

" Next one ! "[109-emily] cried [Emily]109-emily .

" Put the ol "[798-the boy] began [the boy]798-the boy .

" What ? "[109-emily] cried [Emily]109-emily .

" Ole on "[798-the boy]

" Wait a bit ! "[109-emily] cried [Emily]109-emily , and then the machine broke down .

" Hang ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily ejaculated .

" Hang ! "[475-the child] shouted [the child]475-the child .

[She]109-emily laughed , and leaned over to [him]475-the child :

" ' Put the oil in the pan to boil , while [I]109-emily toil in the soil Oh , [Cyril]113-cyril , [I]109-emily never knew [you]475-the child were there ! Go along now , [Sam]193-sam : [David]150-david 'll be at the back somewhere . "[109-emily]

" [He]150-david 's in [the bottom garden]5141-the bottom garden , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , and [the child]475-the child ran out .

[Directly George]108-george came in from [the scullery]602-the scullery , drying [himself]108-george . [He]108-george stood on the hearthrug as [he]108-george rubbed [himself]108-george , and surveyed [his]108-george reflection in the mirror above the high mantelpiece ; [he]108-george looked at [himself]108-george and smiled . [I]0-i wondered that [he]108-george found such satisfaction in [his]108-george image , seeing that there was a gap in [his]108-george chin , and an uncertain moth - eaten appearance in one cheek . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton still held this mirror an object of dignity ; it was fairly large , and had a well - carven frame ; but it left gaps and spots and scratches in one 's countenance , and even where it was brightest , it gave one 's reflection a far - away dim aspect . " [You]108-george seem to make a good impression on [yourself]108-george , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [I]109-emily always used to think , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , " that the black spots had swallowed so many faces they were full up , and could n't take any more and the rest was misty because there were so many faces lapped one over the other reflected . "[109-emily]

" [You]108-george do see [yourself]108-george a bit ghostish "[108-george] said [he]108-george , " on a background of [[your]108-george ancestors]5142-your ancestors . "[108-george]

" [You]0-i do "[465-the father] said [the father]465-the father , turning to [me]0-i , " [you]0-i stay in one place , generation after generation , and [you]0-i seem to get proud , an ' look on things outside as foolishness . [[His]108-george father]630-his father shook [his]630-his father head , saying :

It was Saturday night , so [the bar parlour of [the Ram Inn]5075-the ram inn]2577-the bar parlour of the ram inn was fairly full .

[The room]518-the room laughed .

[They]2586-they began to tell tales about [the old landlady]2587-the old landlady . [She]2587-the old landlady had practised bone - setting , in which [she]2587-the old landlady was very skilful . [People]601-people came to [her]2587-the old landlady from long distances that [she]2587-the old landlady might divine [their]601-people trouble and make right [their]601-people limbs . [She]2587-the old landlady would accept no fee .

Once [she]2587-the old landlady had gone up to [Dr. Fullwood]326-dr. fullwood to give [him]326-dr. fullwood a piece of [her]2587-the old landlady mind , inasmuch as [he]326-dr. fullwood had let [a child]1035-a child go for three weeks with a broken collar - bone , whilst treating [him]1035-a child for dislocation . [The doctor]840-the doctor had tried the high hand with [her]2587-the old landlady , since when , wherever [he]326-dr. fullwood went [the miners]2591-the miners placed [their]2591-the miners hands on [their]2591-the miners shoulders , and groaned : ' Oh [my]0-i collar - bone ! '

Here [Meg]114-meg came in . [She]114-meg gave a bright , quick , bird like look at [George]108-george , and flushed a brighter red .

" [I]114-meg thought [you]108-george was n't cummin , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said .

" Dunna [thee]108-george bother ' e'd none stop away , "[2592-the black - whiskered man] said [the black - whiskered man]2592-the black - whiskered man .

[She]114-meg brought [us]2593-us glasses of whisky , and moved about supplying [the men]1214-the men , who chaffed with [her]114-meg honestly and good - naturedly . Then [she]114-meg went out , but [we]2593-us remained in [our]2593-us corner . [The men]1214-the men talked on the most peculiar subjects : there was a bitter discussion as to whether [London]23-london is or is not [a seaport]2596-a seaport the matter was thrashed out with heat ; then [an embryo artist]2597-an embryo artist set [the room]518-the room ablaze by declaring there were only three colours , red , yellow , and blue , and the rest were not colours , they were mixtures : this amounted almost to atheism and [one man]1657-one man asked [the artist]2600-the artist to dare to declare that [his]1657-one man brown breeches were not a colour , which [the artist]2600-the artist did , and almost had to fight for it ; next [they]2602-they came to strength , and [George]108-george won a bet of five shillings , by lifting a piano ; then [they]2602-they settled down , and talked sex , sotto voce , [one man]1657-one man giving startling accounts of [Japanese]327-japanese and [Chinese prostitutes in [Liverpool]5-liverpool]2604-chinese prostitutes in liverpool . After this the talk split up : [a farmer]4963-a farmer began to counsel [George]108-george how to manage [the farm attached to the Inn]2606-the farm attached to the inn , [another]2607-another bargained with [him]108-george about horses , and argued about cattle , [a tailor]2608-a tailor advised [him]108-george thickly to speculate , and unfolded a fine secret by which [a man]654-a man might make money , if [he]654-a man had the go to do it so on , till eleven o'clock . Then [Bill]244-will came and called " time ! "[244-will] and [the place]4141-the place was empty , and [the room]518-the room shivered as a little fresh air came in between the foul tobacco smoke , and the smell of drink , and foul breath .

[We]2612-we were both affected by the whisky [we]2612-we had drunk . [I]0-i was ashamed to find that when [I]0-i put out [my]0-i hand to take [my]0-i glass , or to strike a match , [I]0-i missed [my]0-i mark , and fumbled ; [my]0-i hands seemed hardly to belong to [me]0-i , and [my]0-i feet were not much more sure . Yet [I]0-i was acutely conscious of every change in [myself]0-i and in [him]108-george ; it seemed as if [I]0-i could make [my]0-i body drunk , but could never intoxicate [my]0-i mind , which roused itself and kept the sharpest guard . [George]108-george was frankly half drunk : [his]108-george eyelids sloped over [his]108-george eyes and [his]108-george speech was thick ; when [he]108-george put out [his]108-george hand [he]108-george knocked over [his]108-george glass , and the stuff was spilled all over the table ; [he]108-george only laughed . [I]0-i , too , felt a great prompting to giggle on every occasion , and [I]0-i marvelled at [myself]0-i .

[Meg]114-meg came into [the room]518-the room when [all the men]2614-all the men had gone .

[She]114-meg went and sat by [him]108-george , having moved the little table with its spilled liquor .

CHAPTER VII

[THE FASCINATION OF THE FORBIDDEN APPLE]329-the fascination of the forbidden apple

On the first Sunday in June , when [Lettie]313-lettie knew [she]2618-she would keep [her]2618-she engagement with [Leslie]121-leslie , and when [she]2618-she was having a day at [home]4184-home from Highclose , [she]2618-she got ready to go down to [the mill]635-the mill . [We]2622-we were in mourning for [an aunt]2623-an aunt , so [she]2623-an aunt wore a dress of fine black voile , and a black hat with long feathers . Then , when [I]0-i looked at [her]2623-an aunt fair hands , and [her]2623-an aunt arms closely covered in the long black cuffs of [her]2623-an aunt sleeves , [I]0-i felt keenly [[my]0-i old brother]2624-my old brother - love shielding , indulgent .

It was a windy , sunny day . In shelter the heat was passionate , but in the open the wind scattered its fire . Every now and then a white cloud broad based , blue shadowed , travelled slowly along [the sky - road]2625-the sky - road after the forerunner small in the distance , and trailing over [us]2622-we a chill shade , a gloom which [we]2622-we watched creep on over [the water]429-the water , over the wood and [the hill]502-the hill . These royal , rounded clouds had sailed all day along the same route , from [the harbour of [the South]59-the south]2628-the harbour of the south to [the wastes in the Northern sky]2629-the wastes in the northern sky , following the swift wild geese . [The brook]574-the brook hurried along singing , only here and there lingering to whisper to the secret bushes , then setting off afresh with a new snatch of song .

The fowls pecked staidly in [the farmyard]2631-the farmyard , with Sabbath decorum . Occasionally a lost , sportive wind - puff would wander across [the yard]457-the yard and ruffle [them]2633-them , and [they]2633-them resented it . The pigs were asleep in the sun , giving faint grunts now and then from sheer luxury . [I]0-i saw a squirrel go darting down the mossy garden wall , up into the laburnum tree , where [he]2634-he lay flat along the bough , and listened . Suddenly away [he]2634-he went , chuckling to [himself]2634-he . [Gyp]185-gyp all at once set off barking , but [I]0-i soothed [her]185-gyp down ; it was the unusual sight of [Lettie]313-lettie 's dark dress that startled [her]185-gyp , [I]0-i suppose .

[We]2635-we went quietly into [the kitchen]451-the kitchen . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton was just putting a chicken , wrapped in a piece of flannel , on the warm hob to coax it into life ; it looked very feeble . [George]313-lettie was asleep , with [his]313-lettie head in [his]313-lettie arms on the table ; [the father]465-the father was asleep on the sofa , very comfortable and admirable ; [I]0-i heard [Emily]109-emily fleeing up [stairs]2638-stairs , presumably to dress .

" [He]313-lettie stays out so late up at [the Ram Inn]5075-the ram inn , "[460-the mother] whispered [the mother]460-the mother in a high whisper , looking at [George]313-lettie , " and then [he]313-lettie 's up at five [he]313-lettie does n't get [his]313-lettie proper rest . "[460-the mother] [She]460-the mother turned to [the chicks]2640-the chicks , and continued in [her]460-the mother whisper " [the mother]460-the mother left [them]2640-the chicks just before they hatched out , so [we]5179-we 've been bringing them on here . [This one]2547-this one 's a bit weak [I]460-the mother thought [I]460-the mother 'd hot [him]2547-this one up a bit "[460-the mother] [she]460-the mother laughed with a quaint little frown of deprecation . Eight or nine yellow , fluffy little mites were cheeping and scuffling in the fender . [Lettie]313-lettie bent over [them]2640-the chicks to touch them ; they were tame , and ran among [her]460-the mother fingers .

Suddenly [[George]313-lettie 's mother]2641-george 's mother gave a loud cry , and rushed to the fire . There was a smell of singed down . The chicken had toddled into the fire , and gasped its faint gasp among the red - hot cokes . [The father]465-the father jumped from the sofa ; [George]313-lettie sat up with wide eyes ; [Lettie]313-lettie gave a little cry and a shudder ; [Trip]110-trip rushed round and began to bark . There was a smell of cooked meat .

" There goes number one ! "[460-the mother] said [the mother]460-the mother , with [her]460-the mother queer little laugh . It made [me]0-i laugh too .

" What 's a matter what 's a matter ? "[465-the father] asked [the father]465-the father excitedly .

" It 's a chicken been and walked into the fire [I]468-his wife put it on the hob to warm , "[468-his wife] explained [[his]465-the father wife]468-his wife .

" Goodness [I]465-the father could n't think what was up ! "[465-the father] [he]465-the father said , and dropped [his]465-the father head to trace gradually the border between sleeping and waking .

[George]313-lettie sat and smiled at [us]2646-us faintly , [he]313-lettie was too dazed to speak . [His]313-lettie chest still leaned against the table , and [his]313-lettie arms were spread out thereon , but [he]313-lettie lifted [his]313-lettie face , and looked at [Lettie]313-lettie with [his]313-lettie dazed , dark eyes , and smiled faintly at [her]468-his wife . [His]313-lettie hair was all ruffled , and [his]313-lettie shirt collar unbuttoned . Then [he]313-lettie got up slowly , pushing [his]313-lettie chair back with a loud noise , and stretched [himself]313-lettie , pressing [his]313-lettie arms upwards with a long , heavy stretch .

" Oh h h ! "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said , bending [his]313-lettie arms and then letting them drop to [his]313-lettie sides . " [I]313-lettie never thought [you]313-lettie 'd come to - day . "[313-lettie]

" [I]313-lettie wanted to come and see [you]313-lettie [I]313-lettie sha n't have many more chances , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , turning from [him]313-lettie and yet looking at [him]313-lettie again .

" No , [I]313-lettie suppose not , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said , subsiding into quiet . Then there was silence for some time . [The mother]460-the mother began to enquire after [Leslie]121-leslie , and kept the conversation up till [Emily]109-emily came down , blushing and smiling and glad .

" Are [you]313-lettie coming out ? "[109-emily] said [she]109-emily , " there are [two or three robins ' nests]5181-two or three robins ' nests , and a spinkie 's "[109-emily]

" [I]313-lettie think [I]313-lettie 'll leave [my]313-lettie hat , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , unpinning it as [she]109-emily spoke , and shaking [her]109-emily hair when [she]109-emily was free . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton insisted on [her]109-emily taking a long white silk scarf ; [Emily]109-emily also wrapped [her]109-emily hair in a gauze scarf , and looked beautiful .

[George]313-lettie came out with [us]2648-we , coatless , hatless , [his]313-lettie waistcoat all unbuttoned , as [he]313-lettie was . [We]2648-we crossed [the orchard]1040-the orchard , over [the old bridge]2650-the old bridge , and went to where [the slopes]2651-the slopes ran down to [the lower pond]1024-the lower pond , a bank all covered with nettles , and scattered with a hazel bush or two . Among the nettles old pans were rusting , and old coarse pottery cropped up .

[We]2648-we came upon a kettle heavily coated with lime . [Emily]109-emily bent down and looked , and then [we]2648-we peeped in . There were the robin birds with their yellow beaks stretched so wide apart [I]0-i feared they would never close them again . Among the naked little mites , that begged from [us]2648-we so blindly and confidently , were huddled three eggs .

" [They]5182-they are like [Irish children peeping out of [a cottage]5184-a cottage]5183-irish children peeping out of a cottage , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , with the family fondness for romantic similes .

[We]2648-we went on to where a tin lay with the lid pressed back , and inside it , snug and neat , was another nest , with six eggs , cheek to cheek .

" How warm they are , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , touching them , " [you]5185-you can fairly feel [the mother]460-the mother 's breast . "[313-lettie]

[He]313-lettie tried to put [his]313-lettie hand into the tin , but the space was too small , and [they]2653-they looked into [each other]4254-each other 's eyes and smiled . " [You]5185-you 'd think [the father]465-the father 's breast had marked them with red , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily .

" Look , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , " those are [[the children]4276-the children 's houses]5189-the children 's houses . [The two]2656-the two looked at [each other]4254-each other again , smiling . Up on [the pond]1010-the pond - side , in the full glitter of light , [we]2648-we looked round where the blades of clustering corn were softly healing the red bosom of [the hill]502-the hill . The larks were overhead among the sunbeams . [We]2648-we straggled away across the grass . [The field]4259-the field was all afroth with cowslips , a yellow , glittering , shaking froth on the still green of the grass . [We]2648-we trailed [our]2648-we shadows across [the fields]955-the fields , extinguishing the sunshine on the flowers as [we]2648-we went . The air was tingling with the scent of blossoms .

" Look at the cowslips , all shaking with laughter , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , and [she]109-emily tossed back [her]109-emily head , and [her]109-emily dark eyes sparkled among the flow of gauze . [Lettie]313-lettie was on in front , flitting darkly across [the field]4259-the field , bending over the flowers , stooping to the earth like a sable Persephone come into freedom . [George]313-lettie had left [her]109-emily at a little distance , hunting for something in the grass . [He]313-lettie stopped , and remained standing in one place .

Once a horse had left a hoofprint in [the soft meadow]2664-the soft meadow ; now the larks had rounded , softened the cup , and had laid there three dark - brown eggs . [Lettie]313-lettie sat down and leaned over the nest ; [he]313-lettie leaned above [her]109-emily . [We]2667-we were entering the spinney of black poplar . In the hedge was an elm tree , with myriads of dark dots pointed against the bright sky , myriads of clusters of flaky green fruit .

" Look at that elm , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , " [you]313-lettie 'd think it was in full leaf , would n't [you]313-lettie ? Do [you]313-lettie know why it 's so prolific ? "[109-emily]

" No , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said , with a curious questioning drawl of the monosyllable .

" [It]5203-it 's casting its bread upon the winds no , it is dying , so [it]5203-it puts out all its strength and loads its boughs with the last fruit . It 'll be dead next year . "[109-emily]

[She]109-emily scooped a hole in the dark soil , and snatching a handful of bluebells , threw them in on top of the dead bird . Then [she]109-emily smoothed the soil over all , and pressed [her]109-emily white hands on the black loam .

[The spinney]1218-the spinney opened out ; the ferns were serenely uncoiling , the bluebells stood grouped with blue curls mingled . In the freer spaces forget - me - nots flowered in nebula , and dog - violets gave an undertone of dark purple , with primroses for planets in the night . There was a slight drift of woodruff , sweet new - mown hay , scenting the air under the boughs . On [a wet bank]2671-a wet bank was the design of golden saxifrage , glistening unholily as if varnished by its minister , the snail . [George]313-lettie and [Lettie]313-lettie crushed the veined belles of wood - sorrel and broke the silken mosses . What did it matter to [them]2672-them what [they]2672-them broke or crushed .

Over the fence of [the spinney]1218-the spinney was [the hillside]739-the hillside , scattered with old thorn trees . There the little grey lichens held up ruby balls to [us]2675-us unnoticed . What did it matter , when all the great red apples were being shaken from the Tree to be left to rot .

" If [I]313-lettie were [a man]654-a man , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , " [I]313-lettie would go out west and be free . [I]313-lettie should love it . "[313-lettie]

[They]2693-they entered , out of curiosity . [The kitchen]451-the kitchen was indeed different . [It]451-the kitchen was clean and sparkling , warm with bright red chintzes on the sofa and on every chair cushion . Unfortunately the effect was spoiled by green and yellow antimaccassars , and by a profusion of paper and woollen flowers . There were three cases of woollen flowers , and on the wall , four fans stitched over with ruffled green and yellow paper , adorned with yellow paper roses , carnations , arum lilies , and poppies ; there were also wall pockets full of paper flowers ; while the wood outside was loaded with blossom .
