" [We]3070-we 'll go , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said , " to an hÅ°tel . "[313-lettie]

[His]313-lettie eyes dilated as [he]313-lettie said it , and [she]114-meg shrank away with delighted fear . Neither of [them]3073-they had ever been to an hÅ°tel . [She]114-meg was really afraid . [She]114-meg begged [him]313-lettie to go to [an eating house]3075-an eating house , to a cafÅ¥ . [He]313-lettie was obdurate . [His]313-lettie one idea was to do the thing that [he]313-lettie was half - afraid to do . [His]313-lettie passion and it was almost intoxication was to dare to play with life . [He]313-lettie was afraid of [the town]4475-the town . [He]313-lettie was afraid to venture into [the foreign places of life]3077-the foreign places of life , and all was foreign save [the valley of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]2937-the valley of nethermere . So [he]313-lettie crossed the borders flauntingly , and marched towards [the heart of [the unknown]3080-the unknown]3079-the heart of the unknown . [We]3081-we went to [the Victoria HÅ°tel]3082-the victoria hÅ±tel the most imposing [he]313-lettie could think of and [we]3081-we had luncheon according to the menu . [They]3083-they were like [two children]3084-two children , very much afraid , yet delighting in the adventure . [He]313-lettie dared not , however , give the orders . [He]313-lettie dared not address [anybody]4398-anybody , [waiters]3086-waiters or otherwise . [I]0-i did that for [him]313-lettie , and [he]313-lettie watched [me]0-i , absorbing , learning , wondering that things were so easy and so delightful . [I]0-i murmured them injunctions across the table and [they]3083-they blushed and laughed with [each other]4254-each other nervously . It would be hard to say whether [they]3083-they enjoyed that luncheon . [I]0-i think [Meg]114-meg did not even though [she]114-meg was with [him]313-lettie . But of [George]313-lettie [I]0-i am doubtful . [He]313-lettie suffered exquisitely from self consciousness and nervous embarrassment , but [he]313-lettie felt also the intoxication of the adventure , [he]313-lettie felt as [a man who has lived in [a small island]3089-a small island when [he]313-lettie first sets foot on [a vast continent]3090-a vast continent]3088-a man who has lived in a small island when he first sets foot on a vast continent . This was the first step into a new life , and [he]313-lettie mused delightedly upon it over [his]313-lettie brandy . Yet [he]313-lettie was nervous . [He]313-lettie could not get over the feeling that [he]313-lettie was trespassing .

" Where shall [we]3091-we go this afternoon ? "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie asked .

Several things were proposed , but [Meg]114-meg pleaded warmly for [Colwick]354-colwick .

" Let 's go on [a steamer]5337-a steamer to [Colwick Park]71-colwick park . There 'll be entertainments [there]1189-there this afternoon . It 'll be lovely . "[114-meg]

In a few moments [we]3091-we were on the top of [the car]2218-the car swinging down to [the Trent Bridges]3093-the trent bridges . It was dinner time , and [crowds of people]3094-crowds of people from [shops]3095-shops and [warehouses]3096-warehouses were hurrying in the sunshine along the pavements . [Sunblinds]355-sunblinds cast [their]355-sunblinds shadows on [the shop - fronts]3097-the shop - fronts , and in the shade streamed [the people dressed brightly for summer]3098-the people dressed brightly for summer . As [[our]3091-we car]3099-our car stood in [the great space of [the market place]3101-the market place]3100-the great space of the market place [we]3091-we could smell the mingled scent of fruit , oranges , and small apricots , and pears piled in their vividly coloured sections on [the stalls]1405-the stalls . Then away [we]3091-we sailed through the shadows of [the dark streets]3103-the dark streets , and [the open pools of sunshine]3104-the open pools of sunshine . The castle on [[its]3105-its high rock]3106-its high rock stood in the dazzling dry sunlight ; the fountain stood shadowy in the green glimmer of the lime trees that surrounded [the alms - houses]3107-the alms - houses .

There were [many people at [the Trent]72-the trent]3108-many people at the trent . [We]3091-we stood awhile on [the bridge]3109-the bridge to watch [the bright river]3110-the bright river swirling in a silent dance to [the sea]2527-the sea , while [the light pleasure - boats]3112-the light pleasure - boats lay asleep along [the banks]1946-the banks . [We]3091-we went on board [the little paddle steamer]3114-the little paddle steamer and paid [our]3091-we ' sixpence return . " After much waiting [we]3091-we set off , with great excitement , for [our]3091-we mile - long voyage . Two banjos were tumming somewhere below , and [the passengers]5339-the passengers hummed and sang to [their]5339-the passengers tunes . [A few boats]5340-a few boats dabbled on the water . Soon the river meadows with [[their]71-colwick park high thorn hedges]5341-their high thorn hedges lay green on [our]3091-we right , while the scarp of red rock rose on [our]3091-we left , covered with the dark trees of summer .[3091-we]

[We]3091-we landed at [Colwick Park]71-colwick park . It was early , and [few people]3115-few people were [there]1189-there . Dead glass fairy - lamps were slung about the trees . The grass in places was worn threadbare . [We]3091-we walked through [the avenues]3117-the avenues and [small glades of [the park]3119-the park]3118-small glades of the park till [we]3091-we came to the boundary where [the race - course]3120-the race - course stretched [its]3120-the race - course level green , [its]3120-the race - course winding white barriers running low into the distance . [They]3121-they sat in the shade for some time while [I]0-i wandered about . Then [many people]3122-many people began to arrive . It became noisy , even rowdy . [We]3091-we listened for some time to an open - air concert , given by [the pierrots]3123-the pierrots . It was rather vulgar , and very tiresome . It took [me]0-i back to [Cowes]73-cowes , to [Yarmouth]74-yarmouth . There were the same foolish over - eyebrowed faces , the same perpetual jingle from an out - of - tune piano , the restless jigging to the songs , the same choruses , the same escapading . [Meg]114-meg was well pleased . The vulgarity passed by [her]114-meg . [She]114-meg laughed , and sang the choruses half audibly , daring , but not bold . [She]114-meg was immensely pleased . " Oh , it 's [Ben]125-mr. nickie ben 's turn now . [I]114-meg like [him]125-mr. nickie ben , [he]125-mr. nickie ben 's got such a wicked twinkle in [his]125-mr. nickie ben eye . Look at [Joey]356-joey trying to be funny ! [he]125-mr. nickie ben ca n't to save [his]125-mr. nickie ben life . Does n't [he]125-mr. nickie ben look soft ! "[114-meg] [She]114-meg began to giggle in [George]313-lettie 's shoulder . [He]313-lettie saw the funny side of things for the time and laughed with [her]114-meg .

During tea , which [we]3124-we took on [the green verandah of [the degraded hall]3126-the degraded hall]3125-the green verandah of the degraded hall , [she]114-meg was constantly breaking forth into some chorus , and [he]313-lettie would light up as [she]114-meg looked at [him]313-lettie and sing with [her]114-meg , sotto voce . [He]313-lettie was not embarrassed at [Colwick]354-colwick . There [he]313-lettie had on [his]313-lettie best careless , superior air . [He]313-lettie moved about with a certain scornfulness , and ordered lobster for tea off - handedly . This also was a new walk of life . Here [he]313-lettie was not hesitating or tremulously strung ; [he]313-lettie was patronising . Both [Meg]114-meg and [he]313-lettie thoroughly enjoyed [themselves]3127-themselves .

When [we]3124-we got back into [Nottingham]16-nottingham [she]114-meg entreated [him]313-lettie not to go to [the hotel]3128-the hotel as [he]313-lettie had proposed , and [he]313-lettie readily yielded . Instead [they]3127-themselves went to [the Castle]3129-the castle . [We]3124-we stood on [the high rock]3130-the high rock in the cool of the day , and watched the sun sloping over [the great river - flats]3131-the great river - flats where [the menial town]3132-the menial town spread out , and ended , while [the river]1998-the river and [the meadows]891-the meadows continued into the distance . In [the picture galleries]3135-the picture galleries , there was a fine collection of [Arthur Melville]357-arthur melville 's paintings . [Meg]114-meg thought them very ridiculous . [I]0-i began to expound them , but [she]114-meg was manifestly bored , and [he]313-lettie was half - hearted . Outside in [the grounds]1665-the grounds was [a military band]3137-a military band playing . [Meg]114-meg longed to be [there]1189-there . [The townspeople]3139-the townspeople were dancing on the grass . [She]114-meg longed to join [them]3139-the townspeople , but [she]114-meg could not dance . So [they]3139-the townspeople sat awhile looking on .

[We]3140-we were to go to [the theatre]1181-the theatre in the evening . [The Carl Rosa Company]3142-the carl rosa company was giving " [Carmen]219-carmen "[0-i] at [the Royal]3143-the royal . [We]3140-we went into the dress circle " like [giddy dukes]5342-giddy dukes , "[0-i] as [I]0-i said to [him]313-lettie , so that [I]0-i could see [his]313-lettie eyes dilate with adventure again as [he]313-lettie laughed . In [the theatre]1181-the theatre , among [the people in evening dress]3145-the people in evening dress , [he]313-lettie became once more childish and timorous . [He]313-lettie had always the air of [one who does something forbidden , and is charmed]3146-one who does something forbidden , and is charmed , yet fearful , like [a trespassing child]3147-a trespassing child . [He]313-lettie had begun to trespass that day outside [[his]313-lettie own estates of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]3148-his own estates of nethermere .

" [Carmen]219-carmen "[313-lettie] fascinated [them]3149-they both . The gaudy , careless Southern life amazed [them]3149-they . The bold free way in which [Carmen]219-carmen played with life startled [them]3149-they with hints of freedom . [They]3149-they stared on [the stage]3150-the stage fascinated . Between the acts [they]3149-they held [each other]4254-each other 's hands , and looked full into [each other]4254-each other 's wide bright eyes , and , laughing with excitement , talked about the opera . [The theatre]1181-the theatre surged and roared dimly like a hoarse shell . Then the music rose like a storm , and swept and rattled at [their]3149-they feet . On the stage the strange storm of life clashed in music towards tragedy and futile death . [The two]2656-the two were shaken with a tumult of wild feeling . When it was all over [they]3149-they rose bewildered , stunned , [she]3155-she with tears in [her]3155-she eyes , [he]313-lettie with a strange wild beating of [his]313-lettie heart .

[They]3149-they were both in a tumult of confused emotion . [Their]3149-they ears were full of the roaring passion of life , and [their]3149-they eyes were blinded by a spray of tears and that strange quivering laughter which burns with real pain . [They]3149-they hurried along [the pavement]3156-the pavement to [the " Spread Eagle]5343-the " spread eagle , "[114-meg] [Meg]114-meg clinging to [him]313-lettie , running , clasping [her]114-meg lace scarf over [her]114-meg white frock , like a scared white butterfly shaken through the night . [We]3157-we hardly spoke as the horse was being harnessed and the lamps lighted . In [the little smoke room]3158-the little smoke room [he]313-lettie drank several whiskies , [she]3155-she sipping out of [his]313-lettie glass , standing all the time ready to go . [He]313-lettie pushed into [his]313-lettie pocket great pieces of bread and cheese , to eat on the way [home]4184-home . [He]313-lettie seemed now to be thinking with much acuteness . [His]313-lettie few orders were given sharp and terse . [He]313-lettie hired an extra light rug in which to wrap [Meg]114-meg , and then [we]3157-we were ready .

" Who drives ? "[313-lettie] said I.

[He]313-lettie looked at [me]0-i and smiled faintly .

" [You]0-i , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie answered .

[Meg]114-meg , like an impatient white flame stood waiting in the light of the lamps . [He]313-lettie covered [her]114-meg , extinguished [her]114-meg in the dark rug .

CHAPTER II

[PUFFS OF WIND]358-puffs of wind IN THE SAIL

The year burst into glory to usher [us]3157-we forth out of [the valley of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]2937-the valley of nethermere . [The cherry trees]3161-the cherry trees had been gorgeous with heavy out - reaching boughs of red and gold . Immense vegetable marrows lay prostrate in the bottom garden , their great tentacles clutching [the pond bank]439-the pond bank . Against the wall the globed crimson plums hung close together , and dropped occasionally with a satisfied plunge into the rhubarb leaves . The crop of oats was very heavy . The stalks of corn were like strong reeds of bamboo ; the heads of grain swept heavily over like tresses weighted with drops of gold .

[George]313-lettie spent [his]313-lettie time between [the Mill]635-the mill and [the Ram]3164-the ram . [The grandmother]2978-the grandmother had received [them]3166-them with much grumbling but with real gladness . [Meg]114-meg was re - installed , and [George]313-lettie slept at [the Ram]108-george . [He]313-lettie was extraordinarily bright , almost gay . The fact was that [his]313-lettie new life interested and pleased [him]313-lettie keenly . [He]313-lettie often talked to [me]0-i about [Meg]114-meg , how quaint and naive [she]114-meg was , how [she]114-meg amused [him]313-lettie and delighted [him]313-lettie . [He]313-lettie rejoiced in having [a place of [his]313-lettie own]3167-a place of his own , [a home]3168-a home , and [a beautiful wife who adored [him]313-lettie]3169-a beautiful wife who adored him . Then [the public - house]5302-the public - house was full of strangeness and interest . No hour was ever dull . If [he]313-lettie wanted company [he]313-lettie could go into [the smoke - room]3171-the smoke - room , if [he]313-lettie wanted quiet [he]313-lettie could sit with [Meg]114-meg , and [she]114-meg was such a treat , so soft and warm , and so amusing . [He]313-lettie was always laughing at [her]114-meg quaint crude notions , and at [her]114-meg queer little turns of speech . [She]114-meg talked to [him]313-lettie with a little language , [she]114-meg sat on [his]313-lettie knee and twisted [his]313-lettie mustache , finding small unreal fault with [his]313-lettie features for the delight of dwelling upon them . [He]313-lettie was , [he]313-lettie said , incredibly happy . Really [he]313-lettie could not believe it . [Meg]114-meg was , ah ! [she]114-meg was a treat . Then [he]313-lettie would laugh , thinking how indifferent [he]313-lettie had been about taking [her]114-meg . A little shadow might cross [his]313-lettie eyes , but [he]313-lettie would laugh again , and tell [me]0-i one of [[his]313-lettie wife]468-his wife 's funny little notions . [She]114-meg was quite uneducated , and such fun , [he]313-lettie said . [I]0-i looked at [him]313-lettie as [he]313-lettie sounded this note . [I]0-i remembered [his]313-lettie crude superiority of early days , which had angered [Emily]109-emily so deeply . There was in [him]313-lettie something of [the prig]3173-the prig . [I]0-i did not like [his]313-lettie amused indulgence of [[his]313-lettie wife]468-his wife .

At threshing day , when [I]0-i worked for the last time at [the Mill]635-the mill , [I]0-i noticed the new tendency in [him]313-lettie . [The Saxtons]286-the saxtons had always kept up a certain proud reserve . In former years , [the family]2284-the family had moved into [the parlour]587-the parlour on threshing day , and [an extra woman]3178-an extra woman had been hired to wait on [the men who came with the machine]3179-the men who came with the machine . This time [George]313-lettie suggested : " Let [us]5344-us have dinner with [the men in [the kitchen]451-the kitchen]5345-the men in the kitchen , [Cyril]113-cyril . [They]5345-the men in the kitchen are [a rum gang]5347-a rum gang . It 's rather good sport mixing with [them]5345-the men in the kitchen . [They]5345-the men in the kitchen 've seen a bit of life , and [I]313-lettie like to hear [them]5345-the men in the kitchen , [they]5345-the men in the kitchen 're so blunt . [They]5345-the men in the kitchen 're good studies though . "[313-lettie]

[The farmer]1094-the farmer sat at the head of the table . [The seven men]3181-the seven men trooped in , very sheepish , and took [their]3181-the seven men places . [They]3181-the seven men had not much to say at first . [They]3181-the seven men were a mixed set , some rather small , young , and furtive looking , some unshapely and coarse , with unpleasant eyes , the eyelids slack . There was [one man whom [we]3183-we called [the Parrot]3184-the parrot]3182-one man whom we called the parrot , because [he]3182-one man whom we called the parrot had a hooked nose , and put forward [his]3182-one man whom we called the parrot head as [he]3182-one man whom we called the parrot talked . [He]3182-one man whom we called the parrot had been [a very large man]3185-a very large man , but [he]3182-one man whom we called the parrot was grey , and bending at the shoulders . [His]3182-one man whom we called the parrot face was pale and fleshy , and [his]3182-one man whom we called the parrot eyes seemed dull sighted .

[George]313-lettie patronised [the men]1214-the men , and [they]1214-the men did not object . [He]313-lettie chaffed [them]1214-the men , making a good deal of demonstration in giving [them]1214-the men more beer . [He]313-lettie invited [them]1214-the men to pass up [their]1214-the men plates , called [the woman]813-the woman to bring more bread and altogether played [mine]3188-mine host of a feast of [beggars]3189-beggars . [The Parrot]359-the parrot ate very slowly .

" Come [Dad]270-dad , "[313-lettie] said [George]313-lettie " [you]270-dad 're not getting on . Not got many grinders ? "[313-lettie]

" What [I]313-lettie 've got 's in [th ' road]5348-th ' road . Is'll ' ae ter get [em]5349-em out . [I]313-lettie can manage wi ' bare gums , like [a baby]4449-a baby again . "[313-lettie]

" Second childhood , eh ? [Ah]5351-ah well , [we]5352-we must all come to it , "[313-lettie] [George]313-lettie laughed .

[The old man]663-the old man lifted [his]663-the old man head and looked at [him]313-lettie , and said slowly :

" [You'n]313-lettie got [ter]5353-ter ower th ' first afore that . "[663-the old man]

[George]313-lettie laughed , unperturbed . Evidently [he]313-lettie was well used to the thrusts of [the public - house]5302-the public - house .

" [I]313-lettie suppose [you]663-the old man soon got over [yours]663-the old man , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said .

[The old man]663-the old man raised [himself]663-the old man and [his]663-the old man eyes flickered into life . [He]663-the old man chewed slowly , then said :

" [I]663-the old man 'd married , an ' paid for it ; [I]663-the old man 'd broke [a constable]5354-a constable 's jaw an ' paid for it ; [I]663-the old man 'd deserted from [the army]5355-the army , an ' paid for that : [I]663-the old man 'd had a bullet through [my]663-the old man cheek in [India]76-india atop of it all , by [I]663-the old man was [your]313-lettie age . "[663-the old man]

" Oh ! "[313-lettie] said [George]313-lettie , with condescending interest , " [you]663-the old man 've seen a bit of life then ? "[313-lettie]

[They]3193-they drew [the old man]663-the old man out , and [he]663-the old man told [them]3193-they in [his]663-the old man slow , laconic fashion , a few brutal stories . [They]3193-they laughed and chaffed [him]663-the old man . [George]313-lettie seemed to have a thirst for tales of brutal experience , the raw gin of life . [He]313-lettie drank it all in with relish , enjoying the sensation . The dinner was over . It was time to go out again to work .

" And how old are [you]663-the old man , [Dad]270-dad ? "[313-lettie] [George]313-lettie asked . [The Parrot]359-the parrot looked at [him]313-lettie again with [his]359-the parrot heavy , tired , ironic eyes , and answered :

" If [you]313-lettie 'll be any better for knowing sixty - four . "[359-the parrot]

" It 's a bit rough on [you]313-lettie , is n't it , "[3195-the young man] continued [the young man]3195-the young man , " going round with the threshing machine and sleeping outdoors at that time of life ? [I]3195-the young man should ' a thought [you]313-lettie 'd ' a wanted a bit o ' comfort "[3195-the young man]

" How do [you]3195-the young man mean , ' rough on [me]3184-the parrot ' ? "[3184-the parrot] [the Parrot]3184-the parrot replied slowly .

" Oh , [I]313-lettie think [you]313-lettie know what [I]313-lettie mean , "[313-lettie] answered [George]313-lettie easily .

" Do n't know as [I]359-the parrot do , "[359-the parrot] said [the slow old Parrot]359-the parrot . " Well , [you]313-lettie have n't made exactly a good thing out of life , have [you]313-lettie ? "[359-the parrot]

" What d'you mean by a good thing ? [I]3184-the parrot 've had [my]3184-the parrot life , an ' [I]3184-the parrot 'm satisfied wi ' it . Is'll die with a full belly . "[3184-the parrot]

" Oh , so [you]313-lettie have saved a bit ? "[359-the parrot]

" No , "[663-the old man] said [the old man]663-the old man deliberately , " [I]663-the old man 've spent as [I]663-the old man 've gone on . An ' [I]663-the old man 've had all [I]663-the old man wish for . But [I]663-the old man pity [the angels]4647-the angels , when [the Lord]4329-the lord sets [me]663-the old man before [them]4647-the angels like a book to read . Heaven wo n't be [heaven]4507-heaven just then . "[663-the old man]

" [You]313-lettie 're [a philosopher in [your]313-lettie way]5359-a philosopher in your way , "[313-lettie] laughed [George]313-lettie .

" And [you]313-lettie , "[663-the old man] replied [the old man]663-the old man , " toddling about [[your]313-lettie back - yard]5360-your back - yard , think [yourself]313-lettie mighty wise . But [your]313-lettie wisdom 'll go with [your]313-lettie teeth . [You]313-lettie 'll learn in time to say nothing . "[663-the old man]

[The old man]663-the old man went out and began [his]663-the old man work , carrying the sacks of corn from the machine to [the chamber]3200-the chamber .

" There 's a lot in [the old Parrot]359-the parrot , "[313-lettie] said [George]313-lettie , " as [he]359-the parrot 'll never tell . "[313-lettie]

[I]0-i laughed .

" [He]359-the parrot makes [you]313-lettie feel , as well , as if [you]313-lettie 'd a lot to discover in life , "[663-the old man] [he]663-the old man continued , looking thoughtfully over the dusty straw - stack at the chuffing machine .

After the harvest was ended [the father]465-the father began to deplete [[his]465-the father farm]3202-his farm . Most of the stock was transferred to [the " Ram]108-george . "[313-lettie] [George]313-lettie was going to take over [[his]313-lettie father]630-his father 's milk business , and was going to farm enough of the land attaching to [the Inn]3204-the inn to support nine or ten cows . Until the spring , however , [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton retained [his]130-mr. saxton own milk round , and worked at improving the condition of the land ready for the valuation . [George]313-lettie , with three cows , started a little milk supply in [the neighbourhood of [the Inn]3204-the inn]3205-the neighbourhood of the inn , prepared [[his]313-lettie land]3207-his land for the summer , and helped in [the public - house]5302-the public - house .

[Emily]109-emily was the first to depart finally from [the Mill]635-the mill . [She]109-emily went to [a school in [Nottingham]16-nottingham]3210-a school in nottingham , and shortly afterwards [Mollie]114-meg , [[her]109-emily younger sister]3211-her younger sister , went to [her]109-emily . In October [I]0-i moved to [London]23-london . [Lettie]313-lettie and [Leslie]121-leslie were settled in [[their]3212-their home in [Brentwood]78-brentwood , [Yorkshire]49-yorkshire]3213-their home in brentwood , yorkshire . [We]3214-we all felt very keenly [our]3214-we exile from [Nethermere]1-nethermere . But as yet the bonds were not broken ; only use could sever them . Christmas brought [us]3214-we all [home]4184-home again , hastening to greet [each other]4254-each other . There was a slight change in [everybody]1611-everybody . [Lettie]313-lettie was brighter , more imperious , and very gay ; [Emily]109-emily was quiet , self - restrained , and looked happier ; [Leslie]121-leslie was jollier and at the same time more subdued and earnest ; [George]313-lettie looked very healthy and happy , and sounded well pleased with [himself]313-lettie ; [[my]0-i mother]515-my mother with [her]515-my mother gaiety at [our]3214-we return brought tears to [our]3214-we eyes .

[We]3214-we dined one evening at [Highclose]8-highclose with [the Tempests]3219-the tempests . It was dull as usual , and [we]3214-we left before ten o'clock . [Lettie]313-lettie had changed [her]3220-her shoes and put on a fine cloak of greenish blue . [We]3214-we walked over [the frost - bound road]3221-the frost - bound road . The ice on [Nethermere]1-nethermere gleamed mysteriously in the moonlight , and uttered strange half - audible whoops and yelps . The moon was very high in the sky , small and brilliant like a vial full of the pure white liquid of light . There was no sound in the night save the haunting movement of the ice , and the clear tinkle of [Lettie]313-lettie 's laughter .

On the drive leading to [the wood]504-the wood [we]3214-we saw [someone]1144-someone approaching . The wild grass was grey on either side , the thorn trees stood with shaggy black beards sweeping down , the pine trees were erect like [dark soldiers]3224-dark soldiers . The black shape of [the man]655-the man drew near , with a shadow running at its feet . [I]0-i recognised [George]313-lettie , obscured as [he]313-lettie was in [his]313-lettie cap and [his]313-lettie upturned collar . [Lettie]313-lettie was in front with [[her]3220-her husband]677-her husband . As [George]313-lettie was passing , [she]3220-her said , in bright clear tones :

" A Happy New Year to [you]313-lettie . "[3220-her]

[He]313-lettie stopped , swung round , and laughed .

" [I]313-lettie thought [you]313-lettie would n't have known [me]313-lettie , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said .

" What , is it [you]313-lettie [George]313-lettie ? "[313-lettie] cried [Lettie]313-lettie in great surprise " Now , what a joke ! How are [you]313-lettie ? "[3220-her] [she]3220-her put out [her]3220-her white hand from [her]3220-her draperies . [He]313-lettie took it , and answered , " [I]313-lettie am very well and [you]313-lettie ? "[313-lettie] However meaningless the words were , the tone was curiously friendly , intimate , informal .

" As [you]313-lettie see , "[3220-her] [she]3220-her replied laughing , interested in [his]313-lettie attitude " but where are [you]313-lettie going ? "[3220-her]

" [I]313-lettie am going [home]4184-home , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie answered , in a voice that meant " have [you]313-lettie forgotten that [I]313-lettie too am married ? "[313-lettie]

" Oh , of course ! "[313-lettie] cried [Lettie]313-lettie . " [You]313-lettie are now [[mine]313-lettie host of [the Ram]108-george]5362-mine host of the ram . [You]313-lettie must tell [me]313-lettie about it . May [I]313-lettie ask [him]313-lettie to come [home]4184-home with [us]5364-us for an hour , [mother]4146-mother ? It is New Year 's Eve , [you]313-lettie know . "[313-lettie]

" [You]313-lettie have asked [him]313-lettie already , "[4146-mother] laughed [mother]4146-mother .

" Will [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton spare [you]313-lettie for so long ? "[313-lettie] asked [Lettie]313-lettie of [George]313-lettie .

" [Meg]114-meg ? Oh , [she]114-meg does not order [my]313-lettie comings and goings . "[313-lettie]

" Does [she]114-meg not ? "[313-lettie] laughed [Lettie]313-lettie . " [She]114-meg is very unwise . Train up [a husband]5366-a husband in the way [he]5366-a husband should go , and in after life . [I]313-lettie never could quote a text from end to end . [I]313-lettie am full of beginnings , but as for a finish ! [Leslie]121-leslie , [my]313-lettie shoe - lace is untied shall [I]313-lettie wait till [I]313-lettie can put [my]313-lettie foot on the fence ? "[313-lettie]

[Leslie]121-leslie knelt down at [her]3228-her feet . [She]3228-her shook the hood back from [her]3228-her head , and [her]3228-her ornaments sparkled in the moonlight . [Her]3228-her face with its whiteness and its shadows was full of fascination , and in their dark recesses [her]3228-her eyes thrilled [George]313-lettie with hidden magic . [She]3228-her smiled at [him]313-lettie along [her]3228-her cheeks while [[her]3228-her husband]677-her husband crouched before [her]3228-her . Then , as [the three]3230-the three walked along towards the wood [she]3228-her flung [her]3228-her draperies into loose eloquence and there was a glimpse of [her]3228-her bosom white with the moon . [She]3228-her laughed and chattered , and shook [her]3228-her silken stuffs , sending out a perfume exquisite on the frosted air . When [we]3231-we reached [the house]563-the house [Lettie]313-lettie dropped [her]3228-her draperies and rustled into [the drawing - room]4162-the drawing - room . There the lamp was low - lit , shedding a yellow twilight from the window space . [Lettie]313-lettie stood between the firelight and the dusky lamp glow , tall and warm between the lights . As [she]3228-her turned laughing to [the two men]494-the two men , [she]3228-her let [her]3228-her cloak slide over [her]3228-her white shoulder and fall with silk splendour of a peacock 's gorgeous blue over the arm of the large settee . There [she]3228-her stood , with [her]3228-her white hand upon the peacock of [her]3228-her cloak , where it tumbled against [her]3228-her dull orange dress . [She]3228-her knew [her]3228-her own splendour , and [she]3228-her drew up [her]3228-her throat laughing and brilliant with triumph . Then [she]3228-her raised both [her]3228-her arms to [her]3228-her head and remained for a moment delicately touching [her]3228-her hair into order , still fronting [the two men]494-the two men . Then with a final little laugh [she]3228-her moved slowly and turned up the lamp , dispelling some of the witchcraft from [the room]518-the room . [She]3228-her had developed strangely in six months . [She]3228-her seemed to have discovered the wonderful charm of [her]3228-her womanhood . As [she]3228-her leaned forward with [her]3228-her arm outstretched to the lamp , as [she]3228-her delicately adjusted the wicks with mysterious fingers , [she]3228-her seemed to be moving in some alluring figure of a dance , [her]3228-her hair like a nimbus clouding the light , [her]3228-her bosom lit with wonder . The soft outstretching of [her]3228-her hand was like the whispering of strange words into the blood , and as [she]3228-her fingered a book the heart watched silently for the meaning .

" Wo n't [you]121-leslie take off [my]3228-her shoes , [darling]4721-darling ? "[3228-her] [she]3228-her said , sinking among the cushions of the settee . [Leslie]121-leslie kneeled again before [her]3228-her , and [she]3228-her bent [her]3228-her head and watched [him]121-leslie .

" [My]3228-her feet are a tiny bit cold , "[3228-her] [she]3228-her said plaintively , giving [him]121-leslie [her]3228-her foot , that seemed like gold in the yellow silk stocking . [He]121-leslie took it between [his]121-leslie hands , stroking it :

" It is quite cold , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie said , and [he]121-leslie held both [her]3228-her feet in [his]121-leslie hands .

" Ah , [[you]121-leslie dear boy]5368-you dear boy ! "[3228-her] [she]3228-her cried with sudden gentleness , bending forward and touching [his]121-leslie cheek .

" Is it great fun being [mine]3228-her host of ' [Ye]5369-ye Ramme Inne ? ' "[3228-her] [she]3228-her said playfully to [George]313-lettie . There seemed a long distance between [them]3237-them now as [she]3228-her sat , with [the man in evening dress]3238-the man in evening dress crouching before [her]3228-her putting golden shoes on [her]3228-her feet .

" It is rather , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie replied , " [the men in the smoke room]5370-the men in the smoke room say such rum things . [My]121-leslie word , [you]3228-her hear some tales there . "[121-leslie]

" Tell [us]3237-them , do ! "[3228-her] [she]3228-her pleaded .

" Oh ! [I]121-leslie could n't . [I]121-leslie never could tell a tale , and even if [I]121-leslie could well "[121-leslie]

" But [I]3228-her do long to hear , "[3228-her] [she]3228-her said , " what [the men]1214-the men say in [the smoke room]5372-the smoke room of ' [Ye]5373-ye [Ramme Inne]79-ramme inne . ' Is it quite untellable ? "[3228-her]

" Quite ! "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie laughed .

" What a pity ! See what a cruel thing it is to be [a woman]881-a woman , [Leslie]121-leslie : [we]3237-them never know what [men]562-men say in [smoke rooms]5376-smoke rooms , while [you]121-leslie read in [your]121-leslie novels everything [a woman]881-a woman ever uttered . It is a shame ! [George]313-lettie , [you]313-lettie are [a wretch]4987-a wretch , [you]313-lettie should tell [me]121-leslie . [I]121-leslie do envy [you]313-lettie . "[121-leslie]

" What do [you]3239-her envy [me]121-leslie , exactly ? "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie asked laughing always at [her]3239-her whimsical way .

" [[Your]3239-her smoke room]5379-your smoke room . The way [you]121-leslie see life or the way [you]121-leslie hear it , rather . "[121-leslie]

" But [I]121-leslie should have thought [you]3239-her saw life ten times more than [me]121-leslie , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie replied .

" [I]121-leslie ! [I]121-leslie only see manners good manners and bad manners . [You]121-leslie know ' manners maketh [a man]654-a man . ' That 's when [a woman]881-a woman 's there . But [you]121-leslie wait awhile , [you]121-leslie 'll see . "[121-leslie]

" When shall [I]313-lettie see ? "[313-lettie] asked [George]313-lettie , flattered and interested .

" When [you]121-leslie have made the fortune [you]121-leslie talked about , "[3239-her] [she]3239-her replied .

[He]121-leslie was uplifted by [her]3239-her remembering the things [he]121-leslie had said .

" But when [I]121-leslie have made it when !
