' "[121-leslie] [He]121-leslie looked at [her]3239-her , waiting for [her]3239-her to lift up [his]121-leslie hopes with [her]3239-her gay balloons .

" Oh , that does n't matter ! [Leslie]121-leslie might be landlord of [some Ram Inn]5383-some ram inn when [he]121-leslie 's at [home]4184-home , for all [anybody]4398-anybody would know might n't [you]3239-her , [hubby]5386-hubby , [dear]4347-dear ? "[3239-her]

" Thanks ! "[121-leslie] replied [Leslie]121-leslie , with good humoured sarcasm .

" [You]121-leslie ca n't tell [a publican]5388-a publican from [a peer]5389-a peer , if [he]5389-a peer 's [a rich publican]5390-a rich publican , "[3239-her] [she]3239-her continued . " [Money]361-money maketh [the man]655-the man , [you]121-leslie know . "[3239-her]

" Plus manners , "[313-lettie] added [George]313-lettie , laughing .

" Oh [they]5392-they are always there where [I]3239-her am . [I]3239-her give [you]3239-her ten years . At the end of that time [you]3239-her must invite [us]5393-us to [[your]3239-her swell place]5394-your swell place say [[the Hall]703-the hall at [Eberwich]6-eberwich]5396-the hall at eberwich and [we]5393-us will come ' with all [our]5393-us numerous array . ' "[3239-her]

[She]3239-her sat among [her]3239-her cushions smiling upon [him]313-lettie . [She]3239-her was half ironical , half sincere . [He]313-lettie smiled back at [her]3239-her , [his]313-lettie dark eyes full of trembling hope , and pleasure , and pride .

" How is [Meg]114-meg ? "[3239-her] [she]3239-her asked . " Is [she]114-meg as charming as ever or have [you]313-lettie spoiled [her]114-meg ? "[3239-her]

" Oh , [she]114-meg is as charming as ever , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie replied . " And [we]3240-we are tremendously fond of [one another]1500-one another . "[313-lettie]

" That is right ! [I]3239-her do think [men]562-men are delightful , "[3239-her] [she]3239-her added , smiling .

" [I]313-lettie am glad [you]3239-her think so , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie laughed .

[They]3240-we talked on brightly about a thousand things . [She]3239-her touched on [Paris]169-paris , and pictures , and new music , with [her]3239-her quick chatter , sounding to [George]313-lettie wonderful in [her]3239-her culture and facility . And at last [he]313-lettie said [he]313-lettie must go .

" Not until [you]3239-her have eaten a biscuit and drunk good luck with [me]3239-her , "[3239-her] [she]3239-her cried , catching [her]3239-her dress about [her]3239-her like a dim flame and running out of [the room]518-the room . [We]3240-we all drank to the New Year in the cold champagne .

" To [the Vita Nuova]80-the vita nuova ! "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , and [we]3240-we drank smiling :

" Hark ! "[313-lettie] said [George]313-lettie , " [the hooters]5399-the hooters . "[313-lettie]

[We]3240-we stood still and listened . There was a faint booing noise far away outside . It was midnight . [Lettie]313-lettie caught up a wrap and [we]3240-we went to the door . The wood , the ice , [the grey dim hills]3242-the grey dim hills lay frozen in the light of the moon . But outside [the valley]425-the valley , far away in [Derbyshire]37-derbyshire , away towards [Nottingham]16-nottingham , on every hand the distant hooters and buzzers of [mines and ironworks]3244-mines and ironworks crowed small on the borders of the night , like so many strange , low voices of cockerels bursting forth at different pitch , with different tone , warning [us]3240-we of the dawn of the New Year .

CHAPTER III

THE FIRST PAGES OF SEVERAL ROMANCES

[I]0-i found a good deal of difference in [Leslie]121-leslie since [his]121-leslie marriage . [He]121-leslie had lost [his]121-leslie assertive self - confidence . [He]121-leslie no longer pronounced emphatically and ultimately on every subject , nor did [he]121-leslie seek to dominate , as [he]121-leslie had always done , [the company in which [he]121-leslie found [himself]121-leslie]3245-the company in which he found himself . [I]0-i was surprised to see [him]121-leslie so courteous and attentive to [George]313-lettie . [He]121-leslie moved unobtrusively about [the room]518-the room while [Lettie]313-lettie was chattering , and in [his]121-leslie demeanour there was a new reserve , a gentleness and grace . It was charming to see [him]121-leslie offering the cigarettes to [George]313-lettie , or , with beautiful tact , asking with [his]121-leslie eyes only whether [he]121-leslie should refill the glass of [[his]121-leslie guest]3247-his guest , and afterward replacing it softly close to the other 's hand .

To [Lettie]313-lettie [he]121-leslie was unfailingly attentive , courteous , and undemonstrative .

Towards the end of [my]0-i holiday [he]121-leslie had to go to [London]23-london on business , and [we]3248-we agreed to take the journey together . [We]3248-we must leave [Woodside]22-woodside soon after eight o'clock in the morning . [Lettie]313-lettie and [he]121-leslie had [separate rooms]3249-separate rooms . [I]0-i thought [she]3250-she would not have risen to take breakfast with [us]3248-we , but at a quarter - past seven , just as [Rebecca]115-rebecca was bringing in the coffee , [she]3250-she came [downstairs]639-downstairs . [She]3250-she wore a blue morning gown , and [her]3250-she hair was as beautifully dressed as usual .

" Why , [[my]121-leslie darling]4517-my darling , [you]3250-she should n't have troubled to come down so early , "[121-leslie] said [Leslie]121-leslie , as [he]121-leslie kissed [her]3250-she .

" Of course , [I]3250-she should come down , "[3250-she] [she]3250-she replied , lifting back the heavy curtains and looking out on the snow where the darkness was wilting into daylight . " [I]3250-she should not let [you]121-leslie go away into the cold without having seen [you]121-leslie take a good breakfast . [I]3250-she think it is thawing . The snow on the rhododendrons looks sodden and drooping . Ah , well , [we]3252-we can keep out the dismal of the morning for another hour . "[3250-she] [She]3250-she glanced at the clock " just an hour ! "[3250-she] [she]3250-she added . [He]121-leslie turned to [her]3250-she with a swift tenderness . [She]3250-she smiled to [him]121-leslie , and sat down at the coffee - maker . [We]3252-we took [our]3252-we places at table .

" [I]121-leslie think [I]121-leslie shall come back to - night , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie said quietly , almost appealingly .

[She]3250-she watched the flow of the coffee before [she]3250-she answered . Then the brass urn swung back , and [she]3250-she lifted [her]3250-she face to hand [him]121-leslie the cup .

" [You]121-leslie will not do anything so foolish , [Leslie]121-leslie , "[3250-she] [she]3250-she said calmly .

[He]121-leslie took [his]121-leslie cup , thanking [her]3250-she , and bent [his]121-leslie face over the fragrant steam .

" [I]121-leslie can easily catch the 7:15 from [St. Pancras]81-st. pancras , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie replied , without looking up .

" Have [I]3250-she sweetened to [your]121-leslie liking [Cyril]113-cyril ? "[3250-she] [she]3250-she asked , and then , as [she]3250-she stirred [her]3250-she coffee [she]3250-she added , " It is ridiculous [Leslie]121-leslie ! [You]121-leslie catch the 7.15 and very probably miss the connection at [Nottingham]16-nottingham . [You]121-leslie ca n't have [the motor - car]2168-the motor - car [there]1189-there , because of [the roads]1307-the roads . Besides , it is absurd to come toiling [home]4184-home in the cold slushy night when [you]121-leslie may just as well stay in [London]23-london and be comfortable . "[3250-she]

" At any rate [I]121-leslie should get the 10.30 down to [Lawton Hill]82-lawton hill , "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie urged .

" But there is no need , "[3250-she] [she]3250-she replied , " there is not the faintest need for [you]121-leslie to come [home]4184-home to - night . It is really absurd of [you]121-leslie . Think of all the discomfort ! Indeed [I]3250-she should not want to come trailing dismally [home]4184-home at midnight , [I]3250-she should not indeed . [You]121-leslie would be simply wretched . Stay and have a jolly evening with [Cyril]113-cyril . "[3250-she]

[He]121-leslie kept [his]121-leslie head bent over [his]121-leslie plate and did not reply . [His]121-leslie persistence irritated [her]3250-she slightly .

" That is what [you]121-leslie can do ! "[3250-she] [she]3250-she said . " Go to the pantomime . Or wait go to [Maeterlinck]224-maeterlinck 's ' Blue Bird . ' [I]3250-she am sure that is on somewhere . [I]3250-she wonder if [Rebecca]115-rebecca has destroyed yesterday 's paper . Do [you]121-leslie mind touching the bell , [Cyril]113-cyril ? "[3250-she] [Rebecca]115-rebecca came , and the paper was discovered . [Lettie]313-lettie carefully read the notices , and planned for [us]3253-we with zest a delightful programme for the evening . [Leslie]121-leslie listened to it all in silence .

When the time had come for [our]3253-we departure [Lettie]313-lettie came with [us]3253-we into [the hall]703-the hall to see that [we]3253-we were well wrapped up . [Leslie]121-leslie had spoken very few words . [She]3250-she was conscious that [he]121-leslie was deeply offended , but [her]3250-she manner was quite calm , and [she]3250-she petted [us]3253-we both brightly .

" Good - bye [dear]4347-dear ! "[3250-she] [she]3250-she said to [him]121-leslie , when [he]121-leslie came mutely to kiss [her]3250-she . " [You]121-leslie know it would have been miserable for [you]121-leslie to sit all those hours in [the train]556-the train at night . [You]121-leslie will have ever such a jolly time . [I]3250-she know [you]121-leslie will . [I]3250-she shall look for [you]121-leslie to - morrow . Good - bye , then , Good - bye ! "[3250-she]

[He]121-leslie went down the steps and into [the car]2218-the car without looking at [her]3250-she . [She]3250-she waited in the doorway as [we]3253-we moved round . In the black - grey morning [she]3250-she seemed to harbour the glittering blue sky and the sunshine of [March]33-march in [her]3250-she dress and [her]3250-she luxuriant hair . [He]121-leslie did not look at [her]3250-she till [we]3253-we were curving to the great , snow - cumbered rhododendrons , when , at the last moment [he]121-leslie stood up in a sudden panic to wave to [her]3250-she . Almost as [he]121-leslie saw [her]3250-she the bushes came between [them]3256-them and [he]121-leslie dropped dejectedly into [his]121-leslie seat .

" Good - bye ! "[3250-she] [we]3253-we heard [her]3250-she call cheerfully and tenderly like a blackbird .

" Good - bye ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , and : " Good - bye Darling , Good - bye ! "[121-leslie] [he]121-leslie cried , suddenly starting up in a passion of forgiveness and tenderness .

[The car]2218-the car went cautiously down [the soddened white path]3258-the soddened white path , under the trees .

[I]0-i suffered acutely the sickness of exile in [Norwood]83-norwood . For weeks [I]0-i wandered [the streets of [the suburb]3260-the suburb]3259-the streets of the suburb , haunted by the spirit of [some part of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]3261-some part of nethermere . As [I]0-i went along [the quiet roads]3262-the quiet roads where the lamps in yellow loneliness stood among the leafless trees of the night [I]0-i would feel the feeling of the dark , wet bit of path between [the wood meadow]3263-the wood meadow and [the brooks]1476-the brooks . The spirit of [that wild little slope to [the Mill]84-the mill]3265-that wild little slope to the mill would come upon [me]0-i , and there in [the suburb of [London]23-london]3266-the suburb of london [I]0-i would walk wrapt in the sense of [a small wet place in [the valley of Nethermere]2937-the valley of nethermere]3267-a small wet place in the valley of nethermere . A strange voice within [me]0-i rose and called for [the hill path]3269-the hill path ; again [I]0-i could feel the wood waiting for [me]0-i , calling and calling , and [I]0-i crying for the wood , yet the space of many miles was between [us]3270-us . Since [I]0-i left [the valley]425-the valley of [home]4184-home [I]0-i have not much feared any other loss . [The hills of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]3273-the hills of nethermere had been [[my]0-i walls]3274-my walls , and the sky of [Nethermere]1-nethermere [my]0-i roof overhead . It seemed almost as if , at [home]4184-home , [I]0-i might lift [my]0-i hand to the ceiling of [the valley]425-the valley , and touch [my]0-i own beloved sky , whose familiar clouds came again and again to visit [me]0-i , whose stars were constant to [me]0-i , born when [I]0-i was born , whose sun had been all [[my]0-i father]4253-my father to [me]0-i . But now the skies were strange over [my]0-i head , and [Orion]276-orion walked past [me]0-i unnoticing , [he]276-orion who night after night had stood over [the woods]600-the woods to spend with [me]0-i a wonderful hour . When does day now lift up the confines of [[my]0-i dwelling place]3279-my dwelling place , when does the night throw open [her]3280-her vastness for [me]0-i , and send [me]0-i the stars for company ? There is no night in [a city]3281-a city . How can [I]0-i lose [myself]0-i in [the magnificent forest of darkness]3282-the magnificent forest of darkness when night is only a thin scattering of the trees of shadow with barrenness of lights between !

[I]0-i could never lift [my]0-i eyes save to [the Crystal Palace]3283-the crystal palace , crouching , cowering wretchedly among the yellow - grey clouds , pricking up [its]3283-the crystal palace two round towers like pillars of anxious misery . [No landmark]3284-no landmark could have been more foreign to [me]0-i , more depressing , than [the great dilapidated palace which lay forever prostrate above [us]3286-us , fretting because of [its]3283-the crystal palace own degradation and ruin]3285-the great dilapidated palace which lay forever prostrate above us , fretting because of its own degradation and ruin .

[I]0-i watched the buds coming on the brown almond trees ; [I]0-i heard the blackbirds , and [I]0-i saw [the restless starlings]3287-the restless starlings ; in [the streets]1639-the streets were many heaps of violets , and [men]562-men held forward to [me]0-i snowdrops whose white mute lips were pushed upwards in a bunch : but these things had no meaning for [me]0-i , and little interest .

Most eagerly [I]0-i waited for [my]0-i letters . [Emily]109-emily wrote to [me]0-i very constantly :

" Do n't [you]0-i find it quite exhilarating , almost intoxicating , to be so free ? [I]109-emily think it is quite wonderful . At [home]4184-home [you]0-i can not live [your]0-i own life . [You]0-i have to struggle to keep even a little apart for [yourself]0-i . It is so hard to stand aloof from [[our]5410-our mothers]5411-our mothers , and yet [they]5411-our mothers are only hurt and insulted if [you]0-i tell [them]5411-our mothers what is in [your]0-i heart . It is such a relief not to have to be anything to [anybody]4398-anybody , but just to please [yourself]0-i . [I]109-emily am sure [mother]4146-mother and [I]109-emily have suffered a great deal from trying to keep up [our]5410-our old relations . Yet [she]4146-mother would not let [me]109-emily go . When [I]109-emily come [home]4184-home in the evening and think that [I]109-emily need n't say anything to [anybody]4398-anybody , nor do anything for [anybody]4398-anybody , but just have the evening for [myself]109-emily , [I]109-emily am overjoyed .[109-emily]

" [I]109-emily have begun to write a story "[109-emily]

Again , a little later , [she]3290-i wrote :

" As [I]3290-i go to [school]497-school by [Old Brayford village]5418-old brayford village in the morning the birds are thrilling wonderfully and everything seems stirring . Very likely there will be a set - back , and after that spring will come in truth .[3290-i]

" When shall [you]0-i come and see [me]3290-i ? [I]3290-i can not think of a spring without [you]0-i . [The railways]5419-the railways are the only fine exciting things here one is only a few yards away from [school]497-school . All day long [I]3290-i am watching [the great Midland trains]5421-the great midland trains go south . [They]5421-the great midland trains are very lucky to be able to rush southward through the sunshine .[3290-i]

" The crows are very interesting . [They]5421-the great midland trains flap past all the time [we]5422-we 're out in [the yard]457-the yard . [The railways]5419-the railways and the crows make the charm of [my]3290-i life in [Brayford]85-brayford . The other day [I]3290-i saw no end of pairs of crows . Do [you]0-i remember what [they]5421-the great midland trains say at [home]4184-home ? ' One for sorrow . ' Very often [one solitary creature]5426-one solitary creature sits on the telegraph wires . [I]3290-i almost hate [him]5426-one solitary creature when [I]3290-i look at [him]5426-one solitary creature . [I]3290-i think [my]3290-i badge for life ought to be one crow . "[3290-i]

Again , a little later :

" [I]3290-i have been [home]4184-home for the week - end . Is n't it nice to be made much of , to be [an important cherished person]5428-an important cherished person for a little time ? It is quite a new experience for [me]3290-i .[3290-i]

" The snowdrops are full out among the grass in [the front garden]447-the front garden and such a lot . [I]3290-i imagined [you]0-i must come in the sunshine of the Sunday afternoon to see [them]5421-the great midland trains . It did not seem possible [you]0-i should not . [The winter aconites]5430-the winter aconites are out along the hedge . [I]3290-i knelt and kissed [them]5430-the winter aconites . [I]3290-i have been so glad to go away , to breathe the free air of life , but [I]3290-i felt as if [I]3290-i could not come away from [the aconites]5431-the aconites . [I]3290-i have sent [you]0-i some are [they]5430-the winter aconites much withered ?[3290-i]

" Now [I]3290-i am in [[my]3290-i lodgings]5432-my lodgings , [I]3290-i have the quite unusual feeling of being contented to stay [here]4302-here a little while not long not above a year , [I]3290-i am sure . But even to be contented for a little while is enough for [me]3290-i . "[3290-i]

In the beginning of March [I]0-i had a letter from [the father]465-the father :

" [You]0-i 'll not see [us]5434-we again in [the old place]5435-the old place . [We]5434-we shall be gone in a fortnight . The things are most of them gone already . [George]313-lettie has got [Bob]335-bob and [Flower]312-flower . [I]465-the father have sold three of the cows , [Stafford]362-stafford , and [Julia]215-julia and [Hannah]111-annie . [The place]4141-the place looks very empty . [I]465-the father do n't like going past [the cowsheds]2733-the cowsheds , and [we]5434-we miss hearing the horses stamp at night . But [I]465-the father shall not be sorry when [we]5434-we have really gone . [I]465-the father begin to feel as if [we]5434-we 'd stagnated [here]4302-here . [I]465-the father begin to feel as if [I]465-the father was settling and getting narrow and dull . It will be a new lease of life to get away .[465-the father]

" But [I]3290-i 'm wondering how [we]5434-we shall be over [there]1189-there . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton feels very nervous about going . But at the worst [we]5434-we can but come back . [I]3290-i feel as if [I]3290-i must go somewhere , it 's stagnation and starvation for [us]5434-we here . [I]3290-i wish [George]313-lettie would come with [me]3290-i . [I]3290-i never thought [he]313-lettie would have taken to public - house keeping , but [he]313-lettie seems to like it all right . [He]313-lettie was down with [Meg]114-meg on Sunday . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton says [he]313-lettie 's getting a public - house tone . [He]313-lettie is certainly much livelier , more full of talk than [he]313-lettie was . [Meg]114-meg and [he]313-lettie seem very comfortable , [I]3290-i 'm glad to say . [He]313-lettie 's got a good milk - round , and [I]3290-i 've no doubt but what [he]313-lettie 'll do well . [He]313-lettie is very cautious at the bottom ; [he]313-lettie 'll never lose much if [he]313-lettie never makes much .[3290-i]

" [Sam]193-sam and [David]150-david are [very great friends]5440-very great friends . [I]465-the father 'm glad [I]465-the father 've got [the boy]798-the boy . [We]465-the father often talk of [you]798-the boy . It would be very lonely if it was n't for the excitement of selling things and so on . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton hopes [you]798-the boy will stick by [George]313-lettie . [She]131-mrs. saxton worries a bit about [him]313-lettie , thinking [he]313-lettie may go wrong . [I]465-the father do n't think [he]313-lettie will ever go far . But [I]465-the father should be glad to know [you]798-the boy were keeping [friends]1105-friends . [Mrs. Saxton]131-mrs. saxton says [she]131-mrs. saxton will write to [you]798-the boy about it . "[465-the father]

[George]313-lettie was [a very poor correspondent]3292-a very poor correspondent . [I]0-i soon ceased to expect a letter from [him]313-lettie . [I]0-i received one directly after [the father]465-the father 's .

" [[My]465-the father Dear]4165-my dear [Cyril]113-cyril ,[465-the father]

" Forgive [me]465-the father for not having written [you]113-cyril before , but [you]113-cyril see , [I]465-the father can not sit down and write to [you]113-cyril any time . If [I]465-the father can not do it just when [I]465-the father am in the mood , [I]465-the father can not do it at all . And it so often happens that the mood comes upon [me]465-the father when [I]465-the father am in the fields at work , when it is impossible to write . Last night [I]465-the father sat by [myself]465-the father in [the kitchen]451-the kitchen on purpose to write to [you]113-cyril , and then [I]465-the father could not . All day , at [Greymede]39-greymede , when [I]465-the father was drilling in the fallow at the back of [the church]4201-the church , [I]465-the father had been thinking of [you]113-cyril , and [I]465-the father could have written there if [I]465-the father had had materials , but [I]465-the father had not , and at night [I]465-the father could not .[465-the father]

" [I]465-the father am sorry to say that in [my]465-the father last letter [I]465-the father did not thank [you]113-cyril for the books . [I]465-the father have not read them both , but [I]465-the father have nearly finished [Evelyn Innes]210-eve . [I]465-the father get a bit tired of it towards the end . [I]465-the father do not do much reading now . There seems to be hardly any chance for [me]465-the father , either [somebody]4142-somebody is crying for [me]465-the father in [the smoke room]5372-the smoke room , or there is some business , or else [Meg]114-meg wo n't let [me]465-the father . [She]114-meg does n't like [me]465-the father to read at night , [she]114-meg says [I]465-the father ought to talk to [her]114-meg , so [I]465-the father have to .[465-the father]

" It is half - past seven , and [I]465-the father am sitting ready dressed to go and talk to [Harry Jackson]363-harry jackson about a young horse [he]363-harry jackson wants to sell to [me]465-the father . [He]363-harry jackson is in pretty low water , and it will make a pretty good horse . But [I]465-the father do n't care much whether [I]465-the father have it or not . The mood seized [me]465-the father to write to [you]5448-you . Somehow at the bottom [I]465-the father feel miserable and heavy , yet there is no need . [I]465-the father am making pretty good money , and [I]465-the father 've got all [I]465-the father want . But when [I]465-the father 've been ploughing and getting the oats in [those fields on [the hillside]739-the hillside at the back of [Greymede church]39-greymede]5449-those fields on the hillside at the back of greymede church , [I]465-the father 've felt as if [I]465-the father did n't care whether [I]465-the father got on or not . It 's very funny . Last week [I]465-the father made over five pounds clear , one way and another , and yet now [I]465-the father 'm as restless , and discontented as [I]465-the father can be , and [I]465-the father seem eager for something , but [I]465-the father do n't know what it is . Sometimes [I]465-the father wonder where [I]465-the father am going . Yesterday [I]465-the father watched broken white masses of cloud sailing across the sky in a fresh strong wind . [They]5451-they all seemed to be going somewhere . [I]465-the father wondered where the wind was blowing them . [I]465-the father do n't seem to have hold on anything , do [I]465-the father ? Can [you]5452-you tell [me]465-the father what [I]465-the father want at the bottom of [my]465-the father heart ? [I]465-the father wish [you]5452-you were here , then [I]465-the father think [I]465-the father should not feel like this . But generally [I]465-the father do n't , generally [I]465-the father am quite jolly , and busy .[465-the father]

" By jove , here 's [Harry Jackson]363-harry jackson come for [me]465-the father . [I]465-the father will finish this letter when [I]465-the father get back .[465-the father]

" [I]465-the father have got back , [we]5453-we have turned out , but [I]465-the father can not finish . [I]465-the father can not tell [you]5452-you all about it . [I]465-the father 've had a little row with [Meg]114-meg . Oh , [I]465-the father 've had a rotten time . But [I]465-the father can not tell [you]5452-you about it to - night , it is late , and [I]465-the father am tired , and have a headache . Some other time perhaps[465-the father]

[GEORGE SAXTON]108-george . "[108-george]

The spring came bravely , even in south [London]23-london , and [the town]4475-the town was filled with magic . [I]0-i never knew the sumptuous purple of evening till [I]0-i saw the round arc - lamps fill with light , and roll like golden bubbles along the purple dusk of [the high road]939-the high road . Everywhere at night [the city]3006-the city is filled with the magic of lamps : over [the river]1998-the river [they]3298-they pour in golden patches their floating luminous oil on the restless darkness ; the bright lamps float in and out of [the cavern of [London Bridge Station]87-london bridge station]3299-the cavern of london bridge station like round shining bees in and out of a black hive ; in [the suburbs the street]3300-the suburbs the street lamps glimmer with the brightness of lemons among the trees . [I]0-i began to love [the town]4475-the town .

In the mornings [I]0-i loved to move in [the aimless street]3302-the aimless street 's procession , watching the faces come near to [me]0-i , with the sudden glance of dark eyes , watching the mouths of [the women blossom with talk]3303-the women blossom with talk as [they]3303-the women blossom with talk passed , watching the subtle movements of the shoulders of [men]562-men beneath [their]562-men coats , and the naked warmth of [their]562-men necks that went glowing along [the street]1645-the street . [I]0-i loved [the city]3006-the city intensely for its movement of [men]562-men and [women]561-women , the soft , fascinating flow of the limbs of [men]562-men and [women]561-women , and the sudden flash of eyes and lips as [they]3303-the women blossom with talk pass . Among all the faces of [the street]1645-the street [my]0-i attention roved like a bee which clambers drunkenly among blue flowers . [I]0-i became intoxicated with the strange nectar which [I]0-i sipped out of the eyes of [the passers - by]3312-the passers - by .

[I]0-i did not know how time was hastening by on still bright wings , till [I]0-i saw the scarlet hawthorn flaunting over [the road]738-the road , and the lime - buds lit up like wine drops in the sun , and the pink scarves of the lime - buds pretty as louse - wort a - blossom in the gutters , and a silver - pink tangle of almond boughs against the blue sky . The lilacs came out , and in the pensive stillness of [the suburb]3260-the suburb , at night , came the delicious tarry scent of lilac flowers , wakening a silent laughter of romance .

Across all this , strangely , came the bleak sounds of [home]4184-home . [Alice]218-alice wrote to [me]0-i at the end of May :

" [Cyril]113-cyril dear , prepare [yourself]113-cyril . [Meg]114-meg has got [twins]5454-twins yesterday . [I]218-alice went up to see how [she]114-meg was this afternoon , not knowing anything , and there [I]218-alice found a pair of bubs in the nest , and [old ma Stainwright]364-old ma stainwright bossing the show . [I]218-alice nearly fainted . [Sybil]133-sybil dear , [I]218-alice hardly knew whether to laugh or to cry when [I]218-alice saw those two rummy little round heads , like two larch cones cheek by cheek on a twig . One is a darkie , with lots of black hair , and the other is red , would [you]133-sybil believe it , just lit up with thin red hair like a flicker of firelight . [I]218-alice gasped . [I]218-alice believe [I]218-alice did shed a few tears , though what for , [I]218-alice do n't know .[218-alice]

" [The old grandma]5455-the old grandma is [a perfect old wretch]5456-a perfect old wretch over it . [She]5455-the old grandma lies chuckling and passing audible remarks in [the next room]2237-the next room , as pleased as punch really , but so mad because [ma Stainwright]364-old ma stainwright would n't have them taken in to [her]5455-the old grandma . [You]133-sybil should have heard [her]5455-the old grandma when [we]5458-we took [them]5459-them in at last . [They]5459-them are [both boys]5460-both boys . [She]5455-the old grandma did make a fuss , [poor old woman]5461-poor old woman . [I]218-alice think [she]5455-the old grandma 's going a bit funny in the head . [She]5455-the old grandma seemed sometimes to think they were hers , and [you]133-sybil should have heard [her]5455-the old grandma , the way [she]5455-the old grandma talked to [them]5459-them , it made [me]218-alice feel quite funny . [She]5455-the old grandma wanted them lying against [her]5455-the old grandma on the pillow , so that [she]5455-the old grandma could feel them with [her]5455-the old grandma face . [I]218-alice shed a few more tears , [Sybil]133-sybil . [I]218-alice think [I]218-alice must be going dotty also . But [she]5455-the old grandma came round when [we]5462-we took them away , and began to chuckle to [herself]5455-the old grandma , and talk about the things [she]5455-the old grandma 'd say to [George]108-george when [he]108-george came awful shocking things , [Sybil]133-sybil , made [me]218-alice blush dreadfully .[218-alice]

" [Georgie]108-george did n't know about it then . [He]108-george was down at [Bingham]88-bingham , buying some horses , [I]218-alice believe . [He]108-george seems to have got a craze for buying horses . [He]108-george got in with [Harry Jackson]363-harry jackson and [[Mayhew]365-mayhew 's sons]5463-mayhew 's sons [you]133-sybil know , [they]5463-mayhew 's sons were [horse dealers]5464-horse dealers at least [[their]5463-mayhew 's sons father]5465-their father was . [You]133-sybil remember [he]108-george died bankrupt about three years ago . There are [Fred]340-cresswell and [Duncan]366-duncan left , and [they]5463-mayhew 's sons pretend to keep on the old business . [They]5463-mayhew 's sons are always up at [the Ram]108-george , and [Georgie]108-george is always driving about with [them]5463-mayhew 's sons . [I]218-alice do n't like it they are a loose lot , rather common , and poor enough now .[218-alice]

" Well , [I]218-alice thought [I]218-alice 'd wait and see [Georgie]108-george . [He]108-george came about half - past five . [Meg]114-meg had been fidgeting about [him]108-george , wondering where [he]108-george was , and how [he]108-george was , and so on . Bless [me]218-alice if [I]218-alice 'd worry and whittle about [a man]654-a man . [The old grandma]5455-the old grandma heard the cart , and before [he]108-george could get down [she]5455-the old grandma shouted [you]108-george know [[her]5455-the old grandma room]1890-her room is in the front ' Hi , [George]108-george , [ma lad]5306-ma lad , sharpen [thy]5455-the old grandma shins an ' com ' an ' a'e a look at ['em]5470-'em [thee'r]5471-thee'r 's two on 'em , two on 'em ! ' and [she]5455-the old grandma laughed something awful .[218-alice]

" "[218-alice] [Ello Granma]367-ello granma , what art [ter]3316-ter shoutin ' about ? ' [he]3317-he said , and at the sound of [his]3317-he voice [Meg]114-meg turned to [me]0-i so pitiful , and said :

" ' [He]3317-he 's been wi ' [them]5472-them Mayhews . "[114-meg]

" ' [Tha]3316-ter 's gotten [twins]5454-twins , a couple at a go [ma lad]5306-ma lad ! ' shouted [the old woman]809-the old woman , and [you]5306-ma lad know how [she]809-the old woman gives squeal before [she]809-the old woman laughs ! [She]809-the old woman made the horse shy , and [he]3317-he swore at it something awful . Then [Bill]244-will took it , and [Georgie]108-george came [upstairs]532-upstairs . [I]114-meg saw [Meg]114-meg seem to shrink when [she]114-meg heard [him]3317-he kick at the stairs as [he]3317-he came up , and [she]114-meg went white . When [he]3317-he got to the top [he]3317-he came in . [He]3317-he fairly reeked of whisky and horses . Bah , [a man]654-a man is hateful when [he]654-a man reeks of drink ! [He]3317-he stood by the side of the bed grinning like [a fool]4191-a fool , and saying , quite thick :[114-meg]

" ' [You]114-meg 've bin in a bit of a ' urry , ' aven't [you]114-meg [Meg]114-meg . An ' how are [ter]114-meg feelin ' then ? '[114-meg]

" ' Oh , [I]114-meg 'm a ' right , ' said [Meg]114-meg .[114-meg]

" ' Is it twins , straight ? ' [he]3317-he said , ' wheer is 'em ? '[114-meg]

" [Meg]114-meg looked over at the cradle , and [he]3317-he went round the bed to it , holding to the bed - rail . [He]3317-he had never kissed [her]114-meg , nor anything . When [he]3317-he saw [the twins]5479-the twins , asleep with [their]5479-the twins fists shut tight as wax , [he]3317-he gave a laugh as if [he]3317-he was amused , and said :[114-meg]

" ' Two right enough an ' one on 'em red ! Which is [the girl]604-the girl , [Meg]114-meg , [the black un]5481-the black un ? '[114-meg]

" ' [They]5479-the twins 're [both boys]5460-both boys , ' said [Meg]114-meg , quite timidly .[114-meg]

" [He]3317-he turned round , and [his]3317-he eyes went little .[114-meg]

" ' Blast 'em then ! ' [he]3317-he said . [He]3317-he stood there looking like a devil . [Sybil dear]133-sybil , [I]114-meg did not know [[our]5483-our [George]108-george]4148-our george could look like that . [I]114-meg thought [he]108-george could only look like a faithful dog or a wounded stag . But [he]108-george looked fiendish . [He]108-george stood watching [the poor little twins]5485-the poor little twins , scowling at [them]5485-the poor little twins , till at last [the little red one]5486-the little red one began to whine a bit . [Ma Stainwright]364-old ma stainwright came pushing [her]364-old ma stainwright fat carcass in front of [him]3317-he and bent over [the baby]1267-the baby , saying :[114-meg]

" ' Why , [[my]114-meg pretty]5488-my pretty , what are [they]5485-the poor little twins doin' to [thee]5488-my pretty , what are [they]5485-the poor little twins ? what are [they]5485-the poor little twins doin' to [thee]5488-my pretty ? '[114-meg]

" [Georgie]108-george scowled blacker than ever , and went out , lurching against the wash - stand and making the pots rattle till [my]114-meg heart jumped in [my]114-meg throat .[114-meg]

" ' Well , if [you]3317-he do n't call [that scandylos]5489-that scandylos ! ' said [old Ma Stainwright]364-old ma stainwright , and [Meg]114-meg began to cry . [You]3317-he do n't know , [Cyril]113-cyril ! [She]114-meg sobbed fit to break [her]114-meg heart . [I]114-meg felt as if [I]114-meg could have killed [him]108-george .[114-meg]

" [That old gran'ma]352-gran'ma began talking to [him]108-george , and [he]108-george laughed at [her]352-gran'ma . [I]114-meg do hate to hear [a man]654-a man laugh when [he]108-george 's half drunk . It makes [my]114-meg blood boil all of a sudden . [That old grandmother]5491-that old grandmother backs [him]108-george up in everything , [she]5491-that old grandmother 's a regular nuisance . [Meg]114-meg has cried to [me]114-meg before over [the pair of [them]5492-the pair of them]5492-the pair of them . The wicked , vulgar old thing that [she]5491-that old grandmother is "[114-meg]

[I]0-i went [home]4184-home to [Woodside]22-woodside early in September . [Emily]109-emily was staying at [the Ram]108-george . It was strange that everything was so different . [Nethermere]1-nethermere even had changed . [Nethermere]1-nethermere was no longer [a complete , wonderful little world]3319-a complete , wonderful little world that held [us]3320-us [charmed inhabitants]3321-charmed inhabitants . [It]1-nethermere was [a small , insignificant valley lost in the spaces of [the earth]1097-the earth]3322-a small , insignificant valley lost in the spaces of the earth . The tree that had drooped over [the brook]574-the brook with such delightful , romantic grace was a ridiculous thing when [I]0-i came [home]4184-home after a year of absence in [the south]1388-the south . The old symbols were trite and foolish .

[Emily]109-emily and [I]0-i went down one morning to [Strelley Mill]2-strelley mill . [The house]563-the house was occupied by [a labourer]1708-a labourer and [[his]1708-a labourer wife]468-his wife , [strangers from [the north]2203-the north]3330-strangers from the north . [He]1708-a labourer was tall , very thin , and silent , strangely suggesting kinship with [the rats of [the place]4141-the place]3332-the rats of the place . [She]109-emily was small and very active , like some ragged domestic fowl run wild . Already [Emily]109-emily had visited [her]109-emily , so [she]109-emily invited [us]3334-us into [the kitchen of [the mill]635-the mill]3335-the kitchen of the mill , and set forward the chairs for [us]3334-us . [The large room]3337-the large room had the barren air of [a cell]3338-a cell . There was a small table stranded towards the fireplace , and a few chairs by the walls ; for the rest , desert spaces of flagged floor retreating into shadow . On the walls by the windows were [five cages of canaries]3339-five cages of canaries , and the small sharp movements of the birds made [the room]518-the room more strange in [its]518-the room desolation . When [we]3334-us began to talk the birds began to sing , till [we]3334-us were quite bewildered , for [the little woman]900-the little woman spoke [Glasgow Scotch]368-glasgow scotch , and [she]900-the little woman had a hare lip . [She]900-the little woman rose and ran toward [the cages]3342-the cages , crying [herself]900-the little woman like some wild fowl , and flapping a duster at the warbling canaries .

" Stop it , stop it ! "[900-the little woman] [she]900-the little woman cried , shaking [her]900-the little woman thin weird body at [them]3343-them . " [Silly little devils]5493-silly little devils , [fools]5092-fools , [fools]5092-fools , [fools]5092-fools ! ! "[900-the little woman] and [she]900-the little woman flapped the duster till the birds were subdued . Then [she]900-the little woman brought [us]3334-us delicious scones and apple jelly , urging [us]3334-us , almost nudging [us]3334-us with [her]900-the little woman thin elbows to make [us]3334-us eat .

" Do n't [you]3334-us like 'em , do n't [you]3334-us ? Well eat 'em , eat 'em then . Go on [Emily]109-emily , go on , eat some more . Only do n't tell [Tom]365-mayhew do n't tell [Tom]365-mayhew when [']365-mayhew [e]365-mayhew comes in , "[900-the little woman] [she]900-the little woman shook [her]900-the little woman head and laughed [her]900-the little woman shrilling , weird laughter .

As [we]3334-us were going [she]900-the little woman came out with [us]3334-us , and went running on in front . [We]3334-us could not help noting how ragged and unkempt was [her]900-the little woman short black skirt . But [she]900-the little woman hastened around [us]3334-us , hither and thither like an excited fowl , talking in [her]900-the little woman high - pitched , unintelligible manner . [I]0-i could not believe [the brooding mill]3344-the brooding mill was in [her]900-the little woman charge . [I]0-i could not think this was [the Strelley Mill]3345-the strelley mill of a year ago . [She]900-the little woman fluttered up [the steep orchard bank]3346-the steep orchard bank in front of [us]3334-us . Happening to turn round and see [Emily]109-emily and [me]0-i smiling at [each other]4254-each other [she]900-the little woman began to laugh [her]900-the little woman strident , weird laughter saying , with a leer :

" [Emily]109-emily , [he]5497-he 's [[your]109-emily sweetheart]5498-your sweetheart , [[your]109-emily sweetheart]5498-your sweetheart [Emily]109-emily ! [You]109-emily never told [me]900-the little woman ! "[900-the little woman] and [she]900-the little woman laughed aloud .

[We]3334-us blushed furiously . [She]900-the little woman came away from [the edge of [the sluice gully]3349-the sluice gully]3348-the edge of the sluice gully , nearer to [us]3334-us , crying :

" [You]109-emily 've been here o ' nights , have n't [you]109-emily [Emily]109-emily have n't [you]109-emily ? "[900-the little woman] and [she]900-the little woman laughed again . Then [she]900-the little woman sat down suddenly , and pointing above [our]3334-us heads , shrieked :

" Ah , look there "[900-the little woman] [we]3334-us looked and saw the mistletoe . " Look at [her]900-the little woman , look at [her]900-the little woman ! How many kisses a night , [Emily]109-emily ? Ha ! Ha ! kisses all the year ! Kisses o ' nights in a lonely place . "[900-the little woman]

[She]900-the little woman went on wildly for a short time , then [she]900-the little woman dropped [her]900-the little woman voice and talked in low , pathetic tones . [She]900-the little woman pressed on [us]3334-us scones and jelly and oat - cakes , and [we]3334-us left [her]900-the little woman .

When [we]3334-us were out on [the road]738-the road by [the brook]574-the brook [Emily]109-emily looked at [me]0-i with shamefaced , laughing eyes . [I]0-i noticed a small movement of [her]900-the little woman lips , and in an instant [I]0-i found [myself]0-i kissing [her]900-the little woman , laughing with some of [the little woman]900-the little woman 's wildness .

CHAPTER III

DOMESTIC LIFE AT [THE RAM

George]108-george was very anxious to receive [me]0-i at [[his]108-george home]3353-his home . [The Ram]3164-the ram had as yet only a six days licence , so on Sunday afternoon [I]0-i walked over to tea . It was very warm and still and sunny as [I]0-i came through [Greymede]39-greymede . [A few sweethearts]3355-a few sweethearts were sauntering under the horse - chestnut trees , or crossing [the road]738-the road to go into [the fields that lay smoothly carpeted after the hay - harvest]3357-the fields that lay smoothly carpeted after the hay - harvest .

As [I]0-i came round [the flagged track]3358-the flagged track to [the kitchen door of [the Inn]3204-the inn]3359-the kitchen door of the inn [I]0-i heard the slur of a baking tin and the bang of the oven door , and [Meg]114-meg saying crossly :

" No , do n't [you]0-i take [him]3361-one of the babies [Emily]109-emily naughty little thing ! Let [[his]3361-one of the babies father]630-his father hold [him]3361-one of the babies ! "[114-meg]

[One of the babies]3361-one of the babies was crying .

[I]0-i entered , and found [Meg]114-meg all flushed and untidy , wearing a large white apron , just rising from the oven . [Emily]109-emily , in a cream dress , was taking [a red - haired , crying baby from out of the cradle]3362-a red - haired , crying baby from out of the cradle . [George]108-george sat in the small arm - chair , smoking and looking cross .

" [I]114-meg ca n't shake hands , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg , rather flurried . " [I]114-meg am all floury . Sit down , will [you]0-i "[114-meg] and [she]114-meg hurried out of [the room]518-the room . [Emily]109-emily looked up from [the complaining baby]3364-the complaining baby to [me]0-i and smiled [a woman]881-a woman 's rare , intimate smile , which says : " See , [I]109-emily am engaged thus for a moment , but [I]109-emily keep [my]109-emily heart for [you]0-i all the time . "[109-emily]

[George]108-george rose and offered [me]0-i the round arm - chair . It was the highest honour [he]108-george could do [me]0-i . [He]108-george asked [me]0-i what [I]0-i would drink . When [I]0-i refused everything , [he]108-george sat down heavily on the sofa , frowning , and angrily cudgelling [his]108-george wits for something to say in vain .

[The room]518-the room was large and comfortably furnished with rush - chairs , a glass - knobbed dresser , a cupboard with glass doors , perched on a shelf in the corner , and the usual large sofa whose cosy loose - bed and pillows were covered with red cotton stuff . There was a peculiar reminiscence of victuals and drink in [the room]518-the room ; beer , and a touch of spirits , and bacon . [Teenie]369-teenie , [the sullen , black - browed servant girl]3368-the sullen , black - browed servant girl came in carrying [the other baby]3369-the other baby , and [Meg]114-meg called from [the scullery]602-the scullery to ask [her]114-meg if [the child]475-the child were asleep . [Meg]114-meg was evidently in a bustle and a flurry , a most uncomfortable state .

" No , "[369-teenie] replied [Teenie]369-teenie , " [he]475-the child 's not for sleep this day . "[369-teenie]

" Mend the fire and see to the oven , and then put [him]475-the child [his]475-the child frock on , "[114-meg] replied [Meg]114-meg testily . [Teenie]369-teenie set [the black - haired baby]3372-the black - haired baby in the second cradle . Immediately [he]3372-the black - haired baby began to cry , or rather to shout [his]3372-the black - haired baby remonstrance . [George]108-george went across to [him]3372-the black - haired baby and picked up a white furry rabbit , which [he]108-george held before [the child]475-the child :

" Here , look at bun - bun ! Have [your]3372-the black - haired baby nice rabbit ! Hark at it squeaking ! "[108-george]

[The baby]1267-the baby listened for a moment , then , deciding that this was only a put - off , began to cry again . [George]108-george threw down the rabbit and took [the baby]1267-the baby , swearing inwardly . [He]108-george dandled [the child]475-the child on [his]108-george knee .

" What 's up then ? What 's up wi ' [thee]475-the child ? Have a ride then dee - de - dee - de - dee ! "[108-george]

But [the baby]1267-the baby knew quite well what was [the father]465-the father 's feeling towards [him]108-george , and [he]1267-the baby continued to cry .

" Hurry up , [Teenie]369-teenie ! "[108-george] said [George]108-george as [the maid]470-the maid rattled the coal on the fire . [Emily]109-emily was walking about hushing [her]109-emily charge , and smiling at [me]0-i , so that [I]0-i had a peculiar pleasure in gathering for [myself]0-i the honey of endearment which [she]109-emily shed on the lips of [the baby]1267-the baby . [George]108-george handed over [[his]108-george child]3381-his child to [the maid]470-the maid , and said to [me]0-i with patient sarcasm :

" Will [you]0-i come in [the garden]444-the garden ? "[108-george]

[I]0-i rose and followed [him]108-george across [the sunny flagged yard]3383-the sunny flagged yard , along [the path]495-the path between the bushes . [He]108-george lit [his]108-george pipe and sauntered along as [a man on [[his]108-george own estate]3386-his own estate does , feeling as if [he]108-george were untrammeled by laws or conventions]3385-a man on his own estate does , feeling as if he were untrammeled by laws or conventions .

" [You]0-i know , "[108-george] [he]108-george said , ' [she]3387-she 's [a dam rotten manager]3388-a dam rotten manager . "[108-george]

[I]0-i laughed , and remarked how full of plums the trees were .

" Yes ! "[108-george] [he]108-george replied heedlessly " [you]0-i know [she]3387-she ought to have sent [the girl]604-the girl out with [the kids]4152-the kids this afternoon , and have got dressed directly . But no , [she]3387-she must sit gossiping with [Emily]109-emily all the time [they]4152-the kids were asleep , and then as soon as [they]4152-the kids wake up [she]3387-she begins to make cake "[108-george]

" [I]0-i suppose [she]3387-she felt [she]3387-she 'd enjoy a pleasant chat , all quiet , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" But [she]3387-she knew quite well [you]0-i were coming , and what it would be . But [a woman]881-a woman 's no dam foresight . "[108-george]

" Nay , what does it matter ! "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Sunday 's the only day [we]5505-we can have a bit of peace , so [she]3387-she might keep 'em quiet then . "[108-george]

" [I]0-i suppose it was the only time , too , that [she]3387-she could have a quiet gossip , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .

" But [you]0-i do n't know , "[3389-i] [he]3389-i said , " there seems to be never a minute of freedom . [Teenie]369-teenie sleeps in now , and lives with [us]5505-we in [the kitchen Oswald]5506-the kitchen oswald as well so [I]3389-i never know what it is to have a moment private . There does n't seem a single spot anywhere where [I]3389-i can sit quiet . It 's [the kids]4152-the kids all day , and [the kids]4152-the kids all night , and [the servants]5509-the servants , and then [all the men in [the house]563-the house]5510-all the men in the house [I]3389-i sometimes feel as if [I]3389-i should like to get away . [I]3389-i shall leave [the pub]5512-the pub as soon as [I]3389-i can only [Meg]114-meg does n't want to . "[3389-i]

" But if [you]3389-i leave [the public - house]5302-the public - house what then ? "[108-george]

" [I]3389-i should like to get back on [a farm]5076-a farm . This is no sort of a place , really , for farming . [I]3389-i 've always got some business on hand , there 's [a traveller]5515-a traveller to see , or [I]3389-i 've got to go to [the brewers]5516-the brewers , or [I]3389-i 've [somebody]4142-somebody to look at a horse , or something . [Your]3389-i life 's all messed up . If [I]3389-i had [a place of [my]3389-i own]5518-a place of my own , and farmed [it]5518-a place of my own in peace "[3389-i]

" [You]3390-i 'd be as miserable as [you]3390-i could be , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Perhaps so , "[3390-i] [he]3390-i assented , in [his]3390-i old reflective manner . " Perhaps so ! Anyhow , [I]3390-i need n't bother , for [I]3390-i feel as if [I]3390-i never shall go back to [the land]4377-the land . "[3390-i]

" Which means at the bottom of [your]3390-i heart [you]3390-i do n't intend to , "[0-i] [I]0-i said laughing .

" Perhaps so ! "[3390-i] [he]3390-i again yielded . " [You]3389-i see [I]3390-i 'm doing pretty well here apart from [the public - house]5302-the public - house : [I]3390-i always think that 's [Meg]114-meg 's . Come and look in [the stable]1138-the stable . [I]3390-i 've got a shire mare and two nags : pretty good . [I]3390-i went down to [Melton Mowbray]89-melton mowbray with [Tom Mayhew]365-mayhew , to [a chap [they]3391-they 've had dealings with]5522-a chap they 've had dealings with . [Tom]365-mayhew 's all right , and [he]365-mayhew knows how to buy , but [he]365-mayhew is such [a lazy careless devil]5523-a lazy careless devil , too lazy to be bothered to sell "[3390-i]

[George]108-george was evidently interested . As [we]3391-they went round to [the stables]3392-the stables , [Emily]109-emily came out with [the baby]1267-the baby , which was dressed in a new silk frock . [She]109-emily advanced , smiling to [me]0-i with dark eyes :

" See , now [he]1267-the baby is good ! Does n't [he]1267-the baby look pretty ? "[109-emily]

[She]109-emily held the baby for [me]0-i to look at . [I]0-i glanced at it , but [I]0-i was only conscious of the near warmth of [her]109-emily cheek , and of the scent of [her]109-emily hair .

" Who is [he]1267-the baby like ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , looking up and finding [myself]0-i full in [her]109-emily eyes . The question was quite irrelevant : [her]109-emily eyes spoke a whole clear message that made [my]0-i heart throb ; yet [she]109-emily answered .

" Who is [he]1267-the baby ? Why , [nobody]4176-nobody , of course ! But [he]1267-the baby will be like [father]4145-father , do n't [you]0-i think ? "[109-emily]

The question drew [my]0-i eyes to [hers]109-emily again , and again [we]3394-we looked [each other]4254-each other the strange intelligence that made [her]109-emily flush and [me]0-i breathe in as [I]0-i smiled .

" Ay ! Blue eyes like [[your]0-i father]4164-your father 's not like [yours]0-i "[109-emily]

Again the wild messages in [her]109-emily looks .

" No ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily answered very softly . " And [I]109-emily think [he]1267-the baby 'll be jolly , like [father]4145-father [they]5528-they have neither of [them]5528-they [our]3394-we eyes , have [they]5528-they ? "[109-emily]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , overcome by a sudden hot flush of tenderness . " No not vulnerable . To have such soft , vulnerable eyes as [you]0-i used makes [one]606-one feel nervous and irascible . But [you]0-i have clothed over the sensitiveness of [yours]0-i , have n't [you]0-i ? like naked life , naked defenceless protoplasm [they]5528-they were , is it not so ? "[0-i]

[She]109-emily laughed , and at the old painful memories [she]109-emily dilated in the old way , and [I]0-i felt the old tremor at seeing [her]109-emily soul flung quivering on [my]0-i pity .

" And were [mine]108-george like that ? "[108-george] asked [George]108-george , who had come up .

[He]108-george must have perceived the bewilderment of [my]0-i look as [I]0-i tried to adjust [myself]0-i to [him]108-george . A slight shadow , a slight chagrin appeared on [his]108-george face .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " yes but not so bad . [You]108-george never gave [yourself]108-george away so much [you]108-george were most cautious : but just as defenceless . "[0-i]

" And am [I]108-george altered ? "[108-george] [he]108-george asked , with quiet irony , as if [he]108-george knew [I]0-i was not interested in [him]108-george .

" Yes , more cautious . [You]0-i keep in the shadow . But [Emily]109-emily has clothed [herself]109-emily , and can now walk among [the crowd]2318-the crowd at [her]109-emily own gait . "[108-george]

It was with an effort [I]0-i refrained from putting [my]0-i lips to kiss [her]3396-she at that moment as [she]3396-she looked at [me]0-i with womanly dignity and tenderness . Then [I]0-i remembered , and said :

" But [you]3396-she are taking [me]0-i to [the stable]1138-the stable [George]108-george ! Come and see the horses too , [Emily]109-emily . "[0-i]

" [I]3396-she will . [I]3396-she admire [them]3399-them so much , "[3396-she] [she]3396-she replied , and thus [we]3397-we both indulged [him]3398-he .

[He]3398-he talked to [his]3398-he horses and of [them]3399-them , laying [his]3398-he hand upon them , running over [their]3399-them limbs . The glossy , restless animals interested [him]3398-he more than anything . [He]3398-he broke into a little flush of enthusiasm over [them]3399-them . [They]3399-them were [his]3398-he new interest . [They]3399-them were quiet and yet responsive ; [he]3398-he was [[their]3399-them master]3400-their master and [owner]3401-owner . This gave [him]3398-he real pleasure .

But [the baby]1267-the baby became displeased again . [Emily]109-emily looked at [me]0-i for sympathy with [him]3398-he .

" [He]3398-he is [a little wanderer]5532-a little wanderer , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , " [he]3398-he likes to be always moving . Perhaps [he]3398-he objects to the ammonia of [stables]5533-stables too , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily added , frowning and laughing slightly , " it is not very agreeable , is it ? "[109-emily]

" Not particularly , "[0-i] [I]0-i agreed , and as [she]109-emily moved off [I]0-i went with [her]109-emily , leaving [him]3398-he in [the stables]3392-the stables . When [Emily]109-emily and [I]0-i were alone [we]3404-we sauntered aimlessly back to [the garden]444-the garden . [She]109-emily persisted in talking to [the baby]1267-the baby , and in talking to [me]0-i about [the baby]1267-the baby , till [I]0-i wished [the child]475-the child in [Jericho]90-jericho . This made [her]109-emily laugh , and [she]109-emily continued to tantalise [me]0-i . The holly - hock flowers of the second whorl were flushing to the top of the spires . The bees , covered with pale crumbs of pollen , were swaying a moment outside the wide gates of the florets , then [they]3409-they swung in with excited hum , and clung madly to the fury white capitols , and worked riotously round the waxy bases . [Emily]109-emily held out [the baby]1267-the baby to watch , talking all the time in low , fond tones . [The child]475-the child stretched towards the bright flowers . The sun glistened on [his]475-the child smooth hair as on bronze dust , and the wondering blue eyes of [the baby]1267-the baby followed the bees . Then [he]475-the child made small sounds , and suddenly waved [his]475-the child hands , like rumpled pink holly - hock buds .

" Look ! "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily , " look at the little bees ! Ah , but [you]475-the child must n't touch them , [they]3409-they bite . [They]3409-they 're coming ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily cried , with sudden laughing apprehension , drawing [the child]475-the child away . [He]475-the child made noises of remonstrance . [She]109-emily put [him]475-the child near to the flowers again till [he]475-the child knocked the spire with [his]475-the child hand and two indignant bees came sailing out . [Emily]109-emily drew back quickly crying in alarm , then laughing with excited eyes at [me]0-i , as if [she]109-emily had just escaped a peril in [my]0-i presence . Thus [she]109-emily teased [me]0-i by flinging [me]0-i all kinds of bright gages of love while [she]109-emily kept [me]0-i aloof because of [the child]475-the child . [She]109-emily laughed with pure pleasure at this state of affairs , and delighted the more when [I]0-i frowned , till at last [I]0-i swallowed [my]0-i resentment and laughed too , playing with the hands of [the baby]1267-the baby , and watching [his]475-the child blue eyes change slowly like a softly sailing sky .

[Presently Meg]114-meg called [us]3416-we in to tea . [She]109-emily wore a dress of fine blue stuff with cream silk embroidery , and [she]109-emily looked handsome , for [her]109-emily hair was very hastily dressed .

" What , have [you]0-i had [that child]5534-that child all this time ? "[109-emily] [she]109-emily exclaimed , on seeing [Emily]109-emily . " Where is [[his]5534-that child father]630-his father ? "[109-emily]

" [I]109-emily do n't know [we]3416-we left [him]630-his father in [the stable]1138-the stable , did n't [we]3416-we [Cyril]113-cyril ? But [I]109-emily like nursing [him]630-his father , [Meg]114-meg . [I]109-emily like it ever so much , "[109-emily] replied [Emily]109-emily .

" Oh , yes , [you]0-i may be sure [George]108-george would get off it if [he]108-george could . [He]108-george 's always in [the stable]1138-the stable . As [I]109-emily tell [him]108-george , [he]108-george fair stinks of horses . [He]108-george 's not that fond of [the children]4276-the children , [I]109-emily can tell [you]0-i . Come on , [[my]109-emily pet]5047-my pet why , come to its mammy . "[109-emily]

[She]109-emily took [the baby]1267-the baby and kissed [it]1267-the baby passionately , and made extravagant love to it . [A clean shaven young man with thick bare arms]3418-a clean shaven young man with thick bare arms went across [the yard]457-the yard .

" Here , just look and tell [George]108-george as tea is ready , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg .

" Where is [he]108-george ? "[370-oswald] asked [Oswald]370-oswald , [the sturdy youth who attended to the farm business]3420-the sturdy youth who attended to the farm business .

" [You]0-i know where to find [him]108-george , "[114-meg] replied [Meg]114-meg , with that careless freedom which was so subtly derogatory to [[her]114-meg husband]677-her husband .

[George]108-george came hurrying from [the out - building]3422-the out - building . " What , is it tea already ? "[108-george] [he]108-george said .

" It 's a wonder [you]0-i have n't been crying out for it this last hour , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg .

" It 's a marvel [you]0-i 've got dressed so quick , "[108-george] [he]108-george replied .

" Oh , is it ? "[114-meg] [she]114-meg answered " well , it 's not with any of [your]0-i help that [I]470-the maid 've done it , that is a fact . Where 's [Teenie]369-teenie ? "[470-the maid]

[The maid]470-the maid , short , stiffly built , very dark and sullen looking , came forward from the gate .

" Can [you]0-i take [Alfy]340-cresswell as well , just while [we]5540-we have tea ? "[470-the maid] [she]470-the maid asked . [Teenie]369-teenie replied that [she]369-teenie should think [she]369-teenie could , whereupon [she]369-teenie was given [the ruddy - haired baby]3424-the ruddy - haired baby , as well as [the dark one]3425-the dark one . [She]369-teenie sat with [them]3426-them on a seat at the end of [the yard]457-the yard . [We]3428-we proceeded to tea .

It was a very great spread . There were hot cakes , three or four kinds of cold cakes , tinned apricots , jellies , tinned lobster , and trifles in the way of jam , cream , and rum .

" [I]114-meg do n't know what those cakes are like , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg . " [I]114-meg made them in such a fluster . Really , [you]5541-you have to do things as best [you]5541-you can when [you]5541-you 've got [children]1260-children especially when there 's two . [I]114-meg never seem to have time to do [my]114-meg hair up even look at it now . "[114-meg]

[She]114-meg put up [her]114-meg hands to [her]114-meg head , and [I]0-i could not help noticing how grimy and rough were [her]114-meg nails .

The tea was going on pleasantly when one of [the babies]3429-the babies began to cry . [Teenie]369-teenie bent over it crooning gruffly . [I]0-i leaned back and looked out of the door to watch [her]369-teenie . [I]0-i thought of [the girl in [Tchekoff]371-tchekoff 's story]3430-the girl in tchekoff 's story , who smothered [her]3430-the girl in tchekoff 's story charge , and [I]0-i hoped [the grim Teenie]3431-the grim teenie would not be driven to such desperation . [The other child]3432-the other child joined in this chorus . " It 's a funny thing , but whenever [anybody]4398-anybody comes [they]4398-anybody 're sure to be cross , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg , beginning to simmer .

" No , it is not ! "[114-meg] cried [Meg]114-meg in a sudden passion : " Is it now , [Emily]109-emily ? Of course , [he]108-george has to say something ! " Come then ! " [He]1267-the baby 's got a bit of wind , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said .

[We]3440-we tried to continue the meal , but everything was awkward and difficult .

" [I]114-meg wonder if [he]1267-the baby 's hungry , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg , " let 's try [him]1267-the baby . "[114-meg]

[She]114-meg turned away and gave [him]1267-the baby [her]114-meg breast . Then [he]1267-the baby was still , so [she]114-meg covered [herself]114-meg as much as [she]114-meg could , and sat down again to tea . [We]3440-we had finished , so [we]3440-we sat and waited while [she]114-meg ate . This disjointing of the meal , by reflex action , made [Emily]109-emily and [me]0-i more accurate . [We]3440-we were exquisitely attentive , and polite to a nicety . [Our]3440-we very speech was clipped with precision , as [we]3440-we drifted to a discussion of [Strauss]372-strauss and [Debussy]373-debussy . This of course put a breach between [us]3440-we two and [[our]3440-we hosts]3441-our hosts , but [we]3440-we could not help it ; it was [our]3440-we only way of covering over the awkwardness of the occasion . [George]108-george sat looking glum and listening to [us]3440-we . [Meg]114-meg was quite indifferent . [She]114-meg listened occasionally , but [her]114-meg position as [mother]4146-mother made [her]114-meg impregnable . [She]114-meg sat eating calmly , looking down now and again at [[her]114-meg baby]3443-her baby , holding [us]3440-we in slight scorn , babblers that [we]3440-we were . [She]114-meg was secure in [her]114-meg high maternity ; [she]114-meg was [mistress]3444-mistress and sole authority . [George]108-george , as [father]4145-father , was [first servant]3446-first servant ; as [an indifferent father]3447-an indifferent father , [she]114-meg humiliated [him]108-george and was hostile to [his]108-george wishes . [Emily]109-emily and [I]0-i were [mere intruders]3448-mere intruders , feeling [ourselves]3440-we such . After tea [we]3440-we went [upstairs]532-upstairs to wash [our]3440-we hands . [The grandmother]2978-the grandmother had had a second stroke of paralysis , and lay inert , almost stupified . [Her]2978-the grandmother large bulk upon the bed was horrible to [me]0-i , and [her]2978-the grandmother face , with the muscles all slack and awry , seemed like some cruel cartoon . [She]2978-the grandmother spoke a few thick words to [me]0-i . [George]108-george asked [her]2978-the grandmother if [she]2978-the grandmother felt all right , or should [he]108-george rub [her]2978-the grandmother . [She]2978-the grandmother turned [her]2978-the grandmother old eyes slowly to [him]108-george .

" [My]2978-the grandmother leg [my]2978-the grandmother leg a bit , "[2978-the grandmother] [she]2978-the grandmother said in [her]2978-the grandmother strange guttural .

[He]108-george took off [his]108-george coat , and pushing [his]108-george hand under the bed - clothes , sat rubbing [the poor old woman]855-the poor old woman 's limb patiently , slowly , for some time . [She]2978-the grandmother watched [him]108-george for a moment , then without [her]2978-the grandmother turning [her]2978-the grandmother eyes from [him]108-george , [he]108-george passed out of [her]2978-the grandmother vision and [she]2978-the grandmother lay staring at nothing , in [his]108-george direction .

" There , "[108-george] [he]108-george said at last , " is that any better then , [mother]4146-mother ? "[108-george]

" Ay , that 's a bit better , "[2978-the grandmother] [she]2978-the grandmother said slowly .

" Should [I]108-george gi'e [thee]2978-the grandmother a drink ? "[108-george] [he]108-george asked , lingering , wishing to minister all [he]108-george could to [her]2978-the grandmother before [he]108-george went .

[She]2978-the grandmother looked at [him]108-george , and [he]108-george brought the cup . [She]2978-the grandmother swallowed a few drops with difficulty .

" Does n't it make [you]108-george miserable to have [her]2978-the grandmother always [there]1189-there ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]108-george , when [we]3452-we were in [the next room]2237-the next room . [He]108-george sat down on the large white bed and laughed shortly .

" [We]3452-we 're used to it [we]3452-we never notice [her]2978-the grandmother , [poor old gran'ma]5549-poor old gran'ma . "[108-george]

" But [she]2978-the grandmother must have made a difference to [you]108-george [she]2978-the grandmother must make a big difference at the bottom , even if [you]108-george do n't know it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" [She]2978-the grandmother 'd got such a strong character , "[108-george] [he]108-george said musing , " [she]2978-the grandmother seemed to understand [me]108-george . [He]108-george smiled at [me]0-i peculiarly , " it seems to take the shine off things , "[108-george] [he]108-george added , and then , smiling again with ugly irony " [She]2978-the grandmother 's [our]5551-our skeleton in the closet . "[108-george] [He]108-george indicated [her]3454-her large bulk .

The church bells began to ring . [The grey church]3455-the grey church stood on a rise among [the fields not far away]3456-the fields not far away , like a handsome old stag looking over towards [the inn]3204-the inn . The five bells began to play , and the sound came beating upon the window .

" [I]108-george hate Sunday night , "[108-george] [he]108-george said restlessly .

" Because [you]108-george 've nothing to do ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]108-george do n't know , "[108-george] [he]108-george said . " It seems like a gag , and [you]0-i feel helpless . [I]108-george do n't want to go to [church]638-church , and hark at the bells , they make [you]0-i feel uncomfortable . "[108-george]

" What do [you]108-george generally do ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Feel miserable [I]108-george 've been down to [Mayhew]365-mayhew 's these last two Sundays , and [Meg]114-meg 's been pretty mad . [She]114-meg says it 's the only night [I]108-george could stop with [her]114-meg , or go out with [her]114-meg .
