When [we]3458-we went [downstairs]639-downstairs , the table was cleared , and [Meg]114-meg was bathing [the dark baby]3460-the dark baby . Thus [she]114-meg was perfect . [She]114-meg handled [the bonny , naked child]3461-the bonny , naked child with beauty of gentleness . [She]114-meg kneeled over [him]3461-the bonny , naked child nobly . [Her]114-meg arms and [her]114-meg bosom and [her]114-meg throat had a nobility of roundness and softness . [She]114-meg drooped [her]114-meg head with the grace of a Madonna , and [her]114-meg movements were lovely , accurate and exquisite , like an old song perfectly sung . [Her]114-meg voice , playing and soothing round the curved limbs of [the baby]1267-the baby , was like water , soft as wine in the sun , running with delight .

[We]3458-we watched humbly , sharing the wonder from afar .

[Emily]109-emily was very envious of [Meg]114-meg 's felicity . [She]109-emily begged to be allowed to bathe [the second baby]3463-the second baby . [Meg]114-meg granted [her]109-emily bounteous permission :

" Yes , [you]109-emily can wash [him]475-the child if [you]109-emily like , but what about [your]109-emily frock ? "[114-meg]

[Emily]109-emily , delighted , began to undress [the baby whose hair was like crocus petals]3464-the baby whose hair was like crocus petals . [Her]109-emily fingers trembled with pleasure as [she]109-emily loosed the little tapes . [I]0-i always remember the inarticulate delight with which [she]109-emily took [the child]475-the child in [her]109-emily hands , when at last [his]475-the child little shirt was removed , and felt [his]475-the child soft white limbs and body . A distinct , glowing atmosphere seemed suddenly to burst out around [her]109-emily and [the child]475-the child , leaving [me]0-i outside . The moment before [she]109-emily had been very near to [me]0-i , [her]109-emily eyes searching [mine]0-i , [her]109-emily spirit clinging timidly about [me]0-i . Now [I]0-i was put away , quite alone , neglected , forgotten , outside the glow which surrounded [the woman]813-the woman and [the baby]1267-the baby .

" Ha ! Ha - a - a ! "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said with a deep throated vowel , as [she]109-emily put [her]109-emily face against [the child]475-the child 's small breasts , so round , almost like [a girl]4168-a girl 's , silken and warm and wonderful . [She]109-emily kissed [him]475-the child , and touched [him]475-the child , and hovered over [him]475-the child , drinking in [his]475-the child baby sweetnesses , the sweetness of the laughing little mouth 's wide , wet kisses , of the round , waving limbs , of the little shoulders so winsomely curving to the arms and the breasts , of the tiny soft neck hidden very warm beneath the chin , tasting deliciously with [her]109-emily lips and [her]109-emily cheeks all the exquisite softness , silkiness , warmth , and tender life of [the baby]1267-the baby 's body .

[A woman]881-a woman is so ready to disclaim the body of [a man]654-a man 's love ; [she]109-emily yields [him]654-a man [her]109-emily own soft beauty with so much gentle patience and regret ; [she]109-emily clings to [his]654-a man neck , to [his]654-a man head and [his]654-a man cheeks , fondling them for the soul 's meaning that is there , and shrinking from [his]654-a man passionate limbs and [his]654-a man body . It was with some perplexity , some anger and bitterness that [I]0-i watched [Emily]109-emily moved almost to ecstasy by [[the baby]1267-the baby 's small , innocuous person]3475-the baby 's small , innocuous person .

" [Meg]114-meg never found any pleasure in [me]108-george as [she]114-meg does in [the kids]4152-the kids , "[108-george] said [George]108-george bitterly , for [himself]108-george .

[The child , laughing and crowing]3476-the child , laughing and crowing , caught [his]3476-the child , laughing and crowing hands in [Emily]109-emily 's hair and pulled dark tresses down , while [she]109-emily cried out in remonstrance , and tried to loosen the small fists that were shut so fast . [She]109-emily took [him]654-a man from the water and rubbed [him]654-a man dry , with marvellous gentle little rubs , [he]654-a man kicking and expostulating . [She]109-emily brought [his]654-a man fine hair into one silken up - springing of ruddy gold like an aureole . [She]109-emily played with [his]654-a man tiny balls of toes , like wee pink mushrooms , till at last [she]109-emily dare detain [him]654-a man no longer , when [she]109-emily put on [his]654-a man flannel and [his]654-a man night - gown and gave [him]654-a man to [Meg]114-meg .

Before carrying [him]654-a man to [bed]3477-bed [Meg]114-meg took [him]654-a man to feed [him]654-a man . [His]654-a man mouth was stretched round the nipple as [he]654-a man sucked , [his]654-a man face was pressed close and closer to the breast , [his]654-a man fingers wandered over the fine white globe , blue veined and heavy , trying to hold it . [Meg]114-meg looked down upon [him]654-a man with a consuming passion of tenderness , and [Emily]109-emily clasped [her]109-emily hands and leaned forward to [him]654-a man . Even thus [they]3478-they thought [him]654-a man exquisite .

When [the twins]5479-the twins were both asleep , [I]0-i must tiptoe [upstairs]532-upstairs to see [them]5479-the twins . [They]5479-the twins lay cheek by cheek in the crib next the large white bed , breathing little , ruffling breaths , out of unison , so small and pathetic with [their]5479-the twins tiny shut fingers . [I]0-i remembered [the two larks]3481-the two larks .

From [the next room]2237-the next room came a heavy sound of [the old woman]809-the old woman 's breathing . [Meg]114-meg went in to [her]809-the old woman . As in passing [I]0-i caught sight of [the large , prone figure in the bed]3484-the large , prone figure in the bed , [I]0-i thought of [Guy de Maupassant]374-guy de maupassant 's " Toine , "[374-guy de maupassant] who acted as [an incubator]3485-an incubator .

CHAPTER IV

[THE DOMINANT MOTIF OF SUFFERING]3486-the dominant motif of suffering

[The old woman]809-the old woman lay still another year , then [she]809-the old woman suddenly sank out of life . [George]108-george ceased to write to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i learned [his]108-george news elsewhere . [He]108-george became more and more intimate with [the Mayhews]375-the mayhews . After [old Mayhew]365-mayhew 's bankruptcy , [the two sons]3488-the two sons had remained on in [the large dark house that stood off the [Nottingham Road]91-nottingham road in [Eberwich]6-eberwich]3489-the large dark house that stood off the nottingham road in eberwich . [This house]3490-this house had been bequeathed to [the oldest daughter]3491-the oldest daughter by [the mother]460-the mother . [Maud Mayhew]376-maud mayhew , who was married and separated from [[her]376-maud mayhew husband]677-her husband , kept house for [[her]376-maud mayhew brothers]3494-her brothers . [She]376-maud mayhew was [a tall , large woman with high cheek - bones and oily black hair]3495-a tall , large woman with high cheek - bones and oily black hair looped over [her]376-maud mayhew ears . [Tom Mayhew]365-mayhew was also [a handsome man , very dark and ruddy , with insolent bright eyes]3496-a handsome man , very dark and ruddy , with insolent bright eyes .

[[The Mayhews]375-the mayhews ' house]3497-the mayhews ' house was called [the " Hollies]5554-the " hollies . "[375-the mayhews] [It]3497-the mayhews ' house was [a solid building , of old red brick , standing fifty yards back from [the Eberwich highroad]3499-the eberwich highroad]3498-a solid building , of old red brick , standing fifty yards back from the eberwich highroad . Between [it]3497-the mayhews ' house and [the road]738-the road was an unkempt lawn , surrounded by very high black holly trees . [The house]563-the house seemed to be imprisoned among [the bristling hollies]3502-the bristling hollies . Passing through the large gate , one came immediately upon the bare side of [the house]563-the house and upon [the great range of stables]3504-the great range of stables . [Old Mayhew]377-old mayhew had in [his]377-old mayhew day stabled thirty or more horses [there]1189-there . Now grass was between the red bricks , and all the bleaching doors were shut , save perhaps two or three which were open for [George]108-george 's horses .

[The " Hollies]5554-the " hollies "[5554-the " hollies] became [a kind of club for [the disconsolate , " better - off "[5554-the " hollies] men of [the district]3508-the district]3507-the disconsolate , " better - off " men of the district]3506-a kind of club for the disconsolate , " better - off " men of the district . [The large dining - room]3509-the large dining - room was gloomily and sparsely furnished , [the drawing - room]4162-the drawing - room was [a desert]3511-a desert , but [the smaller morning - room]3512-the smaller morning - room was comfortable enough , with wicker arm - chairs , heavy curtains , and a large sideboard . In [this room]3513-this room [George]108-george and [the Mayhews]375-the mayhews met with [several men]3514-several men two or three times a week . There [they]3515-they discussed horses and made mock of the authority of [women]561-women . [George]108-george provided the whisky , and [they]3515-they all gambled timidly at cards . These bachelor parties were the source of great annoyance to [the wives of [the married men who attended [them]3519-them]3518-the married men who attended them]3517-the wives of the married men who attended them .

" [He]108-george 's quite unbearable when [he]108-george 's been at those Mayhews ' , "[114-meg] said [Meg]114-meg . " [I]114-meg 'm sure [they]3521-the women of eberwich do nothing but cry [us]3515-they down . "[114-meg]

[Maud Mayhew]376-maud mayhew kept apart from these meetings , watching over [[her]376-maud mayhew two children]3520-her two children . [She]376-maud mayhew had been very unhappily married , and now was reserved , silent . [The women of [Eberwich]6-eberwich]3521-the women of eberwich watched [her]376-maud mayhew as [she]376-maud mayhew went swiftly along [the street]1645-the street in the morning with [her]376-maud mayhew basket , and [they]3521-the women of eberwich gloried a little in [her]376-maud mayhew overthrow , because [she]376-maud mayhew was too proud to accept consolation , yet [they]3521-the women of eberwich were sorry in [their]3521-the women of eberwich hearts for [her]376-maud mayhew , and [she]376-maud mayhew was never touched with calumny . [George]108-george saw [her]376-maud mayhew frequently , but [she]376-maud mayhew treated [him]108-george coldly as [she]376-maud mayhew treated [the other men]1570-the other men , so [he]108-george was afraid of [her]376-maud mayhew .

[He]108-george had more facilities now for [his]108-george horse - dealing . When [the grandmother]2978-the grandmother died , in the October two years after the marriage of [George]108-george [she]2978-the grandmother left [him]108-george seven hundred pounds . To [Meg]114-meg [she]2978-the grandmother left [the Inn]3204-the inn , and [the two houses [she]2978-the grandmother had built in [Newerton]92-newerton]3526-the two houses she had built in newerton , together with brewery shares to the value of nearly a thousand pounds . [George]108-george and [Meg]114-meg felt [themselves]3527-them to be [people of property]3528-people of property . The result , however , was only a little further coldness between [them]3527-them . [He]108-george was very careful that [she]2978-the grandmother had all that was [hers]2978-the grandmother . [She]2978-the grandmother said to [him]108-george once when [they]3527-them were quarrelling , that [he]108-george need n't go feeding [the Mayhews]375-the mayhews on the money that came out of [her]2978-the grandmother business . Thenceforward [he]108-george kept strict accounts of all [his]108-george affairs , and [she]2978-the grandmother must audit them , receiving [her]2978-the grandmother exact dues . This was a mortification to [[her]2978-the grandmother woman]3529-her woman 's capricious soul of generosity and cruelty .

The Christmas after [the grandmother]2978-the grandmother 's death [another son]3531-another son was born to [them]3527-them . For the time [George]108-george and [Meg]114-meg became [very good friends]3532-very good friends again .

When in the following March [I]0-i heard [he]108-george was coming down to [London]23-london with [Tom Mayhew]365-mayhew on business , [I]0-i wrote and asked [him]108-george to stay with [me]0-i . [Meg]114-meg replied , saying [she]114-meg was so glad [I]0-i had asked [him]108-george : [she]114-meg did not want [him]108-george going off with [that fellow]5255-that fellow again ; [he]108-george had been such a lot better lately , and [she]114-meg was sure it was only [those men at [Mayhew]365-mayhew 's]3534-those men at mayhew 's made [him]108-george what [he]108-george was .

[He]108-george consented to stay with [me]0-i . [I]0-i wrote and told [him]108-george [Lettie]313-lettie and [Leslie]121-leslie were in [London]23-london , and that [we]3535-we should dine with [them]3536-them one evening . [I]0-i met [him]108-george at [[King]225-john 's Cross]3537-king 's cross and [we]3535-we all three drove west . [Mayhew]365-mayhew was [a remarkably handsome , well - built man]3538-a remarkably handsome , well - built man ; [he]365-mayhew and [George]313-lettie made [a notable couple]3539-a notable couple . [They]3539-a notable couple were both in breeches and gaiters , but [George]313-lettie still looked like [a yeoman]3540-a yeoman , while [Mayhew]365-mayhew had all the braggadocio of [the stable]1138-the stable . [We]3535-we made an impossible trio . [Mayhew]365-mayhew laughed and jested broadly for a short time , then [he]365-mayhew grew restless and fidgety . [He]365-mayhew felt restrained and awkward in [my]0-i presence . Later , [he]365-mayhew told [George]313-lettie [I]0-i was [a damned parson]3542-a damned parson . On the other hand , [I]0-i was content to look at [his]365-mayhew rather vulgar beauty [his]365-mayhew teeth were blackened with smoking and to listen to [his]365-mayhew ineffectual talk , but [I]0-i could find absolutely no response . [George]313-lettie was go - between . To [me]0-i [he]313-lettie was cautious and rather deferential , to [Mayhew]365-mayhew [he]313-lettie was careless , and [his]313-lettie attitude was tinged with contempt .

When [the son of [the horse - dealer]3544-the horse - dealer]3543-the son of the horse - dealer at last left [us]3545-we to go to [some of [[his]3543-the son of the horse - dealer father 's old cronies]3547-his father 's old cronies]3546-some of his father 's old cronies , [we]3545-we were glad . Very uncertain , very sensitive and wavering , [our]3545-we old intimacy burned again like the fragile burning of alcohol . Closed together in the same blue flames , [we]3545-we discovered and watched the pageant of life in [the town]4475-the town revealed wonderfully to [us]3545-we . [We]3545-we laughed at the tyranny of old romance . [We]3545-we scorned the faded procession of old years , and made mock of the vast pilgrimage of by - gone romances travelling farther into the dim distance . Were [we]3545-we not in the midst of the bewildering pageant of modern life , with all its confusion of bannerets and colours , with its infinite interweaving of sounds , the screech of the modern toys of haste striking like keen spray , the heavy boom of busy mankind gathering its bread , earnestly , forming the bed of all other sounds ; and between these two the swiftness of songs , the triumphant tilt of the joy of life , the hoarse oboes of privation , the shuddering drums of tragedy , and the eternal scraping of the two deep - toned strings of despair ?

[We]3545-we watched [the taxicabs]3549-the taxicabs coursing with [their]3549-the taxicabs noses down to [the street]1645-the street , [we]3545-we watched the rocking hansoms , and the lumbering stateliness of [buses]3551-buses . In [the silent green cavern of [the park]3119-the park]3552-the silent green cavern of the park [we]3545-we stood and listened to the surging of the ocean of life . [They]3559-their came near to [us]3545-we , and [we]3545-we thrilled a little as [we]3545-we watched the muscles of [their]3559-their white smooth thighs answering the movement of the horses , and [their]3559-their cheeks and [their]3559-their chins bending with proud manliness to the rhythm of the march . [We]3545-we watched the exquisite rhythm of the body of [men]562-men moving in scarlet and silver further down [the leafless avenue]3561-the leafless avenue , like a slightly wavering spark of red life blown along . At [the Marble Arch Corner]3562-the marble arch corner [we]3545-we listened to [a little socialist who was flaring fiercely under a plane tree]3563-a little socialist who was flaring fiercely under a plane tree . [I]0-i felt a great terror of [the little man]3570-the little man , lest [he]3570-the little man should make [me]0-i see all mud , as [I]0-i had seen before . [George]313-lettie listened intently to [the speaker]3571-the speaker , very much moved by [him]3571-the speaker .

At night , after [the theatre]1181-the theatre , [we]3573-we saw [the outcasts]3574-the outcasts sleep in a rank under [the Waterloo bridge]3575-the waterloo bridge , [their]3574-the outcasts heads to the wall , [their]3574-the outcasts feet lying out on [the pavement]3156-the pavement : a long , black , ruffled heap at the foot of the wall . [All the faces]3577-all the faces were covered but two , that of [a peaked , pale little man]3578-a peaked , pale little man , and that of [a brutal woman]3579-a brutal woman . It was raining . [Some men]3584-some men stood at the edge of [the causeway]3016-the causeway fixed in dreary misery , finding no room to sleep . [She]881-a woman lurched forward in [her]881-a woman sleep , started , and one of [her]881-a woman hands fell out of [her]881-a woman bosom . [She]881-a woman sank again to sleep . [George]313-lettie gripped [my]0-i arm .

[Lettie]313-lettie and [Leslie]121-leslie were staying up at [Hampstead]95-hampstead with [a friend of [the Tempests]237-the tempests]3593-a friend of the tempests , [one of the largest shareholders in [the firm of [Tempest]336-marie]3595-the firm of tempest , [Wharton Co. [They]3601-they invited [George]313-lettie and [me]0-i to dinner on the Friday evening . [Lettie]313-lettie wore a black lace dress in mourning for [one of [[Leslie]121-leslie 's maternal aunts]3608-leslie 's maternal aunts]3607-one of leslie 's maternal aunts . This made [her]3598-her look older , otherwise there seemed to be no change in [her]3598-her . [She]3598-her was , however , excited by the company in which [she]3598-her found [herself]3598-her , therefore [she]3598-her overflowed with clever speeches and rapid , brilliant observations . [The rest of [the company]3611-the company]3610-the rest of the company formed , as it were , the orchestra which accompanied [her]3598-her .

[George]313-lettie was exceedingly quiet . [He]313-lettie spoke a few words now and then to [Mrs Raphael]378-mrs raphael , but on the whole [he]313-lettie was altogether silent , listening .

" Really ! "[313-lettie] [Lettie]313-lettie was saying , " [I]313-lettie do n't see that one thing is worth doing any more than another . It 's like dessert : [you]5556-you are equally indifferent whether [you]5556-you have grapes , or pears , or pineapple . "[313-lettie]

" Too devoted , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie replied .

" There ! "[3616-she] [she]3616-she exclaimed in triumph " When [I]3616-she have to sign [my]3616-she name and occupation in [a visitor]1396-a visitor 's book , it will be ' [Mother]4146-mother ' . [I]3616-she hope [my]3616-she business will flourish , "[3616-she] [she]3616-she concluded , smiling .

There was a touch of ironical brutality in [her]3616-she now . [She]3616-she was , at the bottom , quite sincere . Having reached that point in [a woman]881-a woman 's career when most , perhaps all of the things in life seem worthless and insipid , [she]3616-she had determined to put up with it , to ignore [her]3616-she own self , to empty [her]3616-she own potentialities into the vessel of another or [others]3618-others , and to live [her]3616-she life at second hand . This peculiar abnegation of self is the resource of [a woman]881-a woman for the escaping of the responsibilities of [her]881-a woman own development . Like [a nun]3620-a nun , [she]3616-she puts over [her]3616-she living face a veil , as a sign that [the woman]813-the woman no longer exists for [herself]813-the woman : [she]3616-she is [the servant of [God]171-god , of [some man]3623-some man , of [[her]3616-she children]3624-her children]3622-the servant of god , of some man , of her children , or may be of some cause . As [a servant]3625-a servant , [she]3616-she is no longer responsible for [her]3616-she self , which would make [her]3616-she terrified and lonely . Service is light and easy . To be responsible for the good progress of one 's life is terrifying . It is the most insufferable form of loneliness , and the heaviest of responsibilities . So [Lettie]313-lettie indulged [[her]3616-she husband]677-her husband , but did not yield [her]3616-she independence to [him]677-her husband ; rather it was [she]3616-she who took much of the responsibility of [him]677-her husband into [her]3616-she hands , and therefore [he]677-her husband was so devoted to [her]3616-she . [She]3616-she had , however , now determined to abandon the charge of [herself]3616-she to serve [[her]3616-she children]3624-her children . When [the children]4276-the children grew up , either [they]4276-the children would unconsciously fling [her]3616-she away , back upon [herself]3616-she again in bitterness and loneliness , or [they]4276-the children would tenderly cherish [her]3616-she , chafing at [her]3616-she love - bonds occasionally .

[George]313-lettie looked and listened to all the flutter of conversation , and said nothing . It seemed to [him]313-lettie like so much unreasonable rustling of pieces of paper , of leaves of books , and so on . Later in the evening [Lettie]313-lettie sang , no longer Italian folk songs , but the fragmentary utterances of [Debussy]373-debussy and [Strauss]372-strauss . These also to [George]313-lettie were quite meaningless , and rather wearisome . It made [him]313-lettie impatient to see [her]3616-she wasting [herself]3616-she upon [them]3629-them .

" [I]3636-he could do with a brandy , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he replied , looking at [me]0-i slowly .

[We]3639-we sat in [the restaurant]3640-the restaurant listening to the jigging of the music , watching the changing flow of [the people]1647-the people . [I]0-i like to sit a long time by the hollyhocks watching the throng of varied bees which poise and hesitate outside the wild flowers , then swing in with a hum which sets everything aquiver . But still more fascinating it is to watch the come and go of [people]601-people weaving and intermingling in the complex mesh of [their]601-people intentions , with all the subtle grace and mystery of [their]601-people moving , shapely bodies .

[I]0-i sat still , looking out across [the amphitheatre]3643-the amphitheatre . [George]313-lettie looked also , but [he]313-lettie drank glass after glass of brandy .

" [I]0-i like to watch [the people]1647-the people , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Ay and does n't it seem an aimless , idiotic business look at [them]1647-the people ! "[3636-he] [he]3636-he replied in tones of contempt . [I]0-i looked instead at [him]3636-he , in some surprise and resentment [His]3636-he face was gloomy , stupid and unrelieved . " Shall [we]5574-we be going ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . [I]0-i did not want [him]3636-he to get drunk in [his]3636-he present state of mind .

" Ay in half a minute , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he finished the brandy , and rose . Although [he]3636-he had drunk a good deal , [he]3636-he was quite steady , only there was a disagreeable look always on [his]3636-he face , and [his]3636-he eyes seemed smaller and more glittering than [I]0-i had seen them . [We]3644-we took [a bus]3645-a bus to [Victoria]96-victoria . [He]3636-he sat swaying on [his]3636-he seat in [the dim , clumsy vehicle]3646-the dim , clumsy vehicle , saying not a word . In [the vast cavern of [the station]555-the station [the theatre - goers]3649-the theatre - goers]3647-the vast cavern of the station the theatre - goers were hastening , crossing the pale grey strand , small creatures scurrying hither and thither in the space beneath the lonely lamps . As [the train]556-the train crawled over [the river]1998-the river [we]3644-we watched the far - flung hoop of diamond lights curving slowly round and striping with bright threads the black water . [He]3636-he sat looking with heavy eyes , seeming to shrink from the enormous unintelligible lettering of the poem of [London]23-london .

[The town]4475-the town was too large for [him]3636-he , [he]3636-he could not take in [its]4475-the town immense , [its]4475-the town stupendous poetry . What did come [home]4184-home to [him]3636-he was [its]4475-the town flagrant discords . The unintelligibility of [the vast city]3654-the vast city made [him]3636-he apprehensive , and the crudity of [its]4475-the town big , coarse contrasts wounded [him]3636-he unutterably .

" What is the matter ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]3636-he as [we]3644-we went along [the silent pavement]3655-the silent pavement at [Norwood]83-norwood .

" Nothing , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he replied . " Nothing ! "[3636-he] and [I]0-i did not trouble [him]3636-he further .

[We]3644-we occupied [a large , two - bedded room]3656-a large , two - bedded room that looked down [the hill]502-the hill and over to [the far woods of [Kent]98-kent]3658-the far woods of kent . [He]3636-he was morose and untalkative . [I]0-i brought up a soda - syphon and whisky , and [we]3644-we proceeded to undress . When [he]3636-he stood in [his]3636-he pajamas [he]3636-he waited as if uncertain .

" Do [you]0-i want a drink ? "[3636-he] [he]3636-he asked .

[I]0-i did not . [He]3636-he crossed to the table , and as [I]0-i got into [my]0-i bed [I]0-i heard the brief fizzing of the syphon . [He]3636-he drank [his]3636-he glass at one draught , then switched off the light . In the sudden darkness [I]0-i saw [his]3636-he pale shadow go across to the sofa in the window - space . The blinds were undrawn , and the stars looked in . [He]3636-he gazed out on [the great bay of darkness wherein , far away and below]3659-the great bay of darkness wherein , far away and below , floated a few sparks of lamps like [herring boats]3660-herring boats at [sea]3661-sea .

" Are n't [you]3636-he coming to bed ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]3636-he 'm not sleepy [you]0-i go to sleep , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he answered , resenting having to speak at all .

" Then put on a dressing gown there 's one in that corner turn the light on . "[3636-he]

[He]3636-he did not answer , but fumbled for the garment in the darkness . When [he]3636-he had found it , [he]3636-he said :

" Do [you]0-i mind if [I]3636-he smoke ? "[3636-he]

[I]0-i did not . [He]3636-he fumbled again in [his]3636-he pockets for cigarettes , always refusing to switch on the light . [I]0-i watched [his]3636-he face bowed to the match as [he]3636-he lighted [his]3636-he cigarette . [He]3636-he was still handsome in the ruddy light , but [his]3636-he features were coarser . [I]0-i felt very sorry for [him]3636-he , but [I]0-i saw that [I]0-i could get no nearer to [him]3636-he , to relieve [him]3636-he . For some time [I]0-i lay in the darkness watching the end of [his]3636-he cigarette like a ruddy , malignant insect hovering near [his]3636-he lips , putting the timid stars immensely far away . [He]3636-he sat quite still , leaning on the sofa arm . Occasionally there was a little glow on [his]3636-he cheeks as the cigarette burned brighter , then again [I]0-i could see nothing but the dull red bee .

[I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must have dropped asleep . Suddenly [I]0-i started as something fell to the floor . [I]0-i heard [him]3636-he cursing under [his]3636-he breath .

" What 's the matter ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]3636-he 've only knocked something down cigarette case or something , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he replied , apologetically .

" Are n't [you]3636-he coming to bed ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Yes , [I]3636-he 'm coming , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he answered quite docile .

[He]3636-he seemed to wander about and knock against things as [he]3636-he came . [He]3636-he dropped heavily into bed .

" Are [you]3636-he sleepy now ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]3636-he dunno [I]3636-he shall be directly , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he replied .

" What 's up with [you]3636-he ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]3636-he dunno , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he answered . " [I]3636-he am like this sometimes , when there 's nothing [I]3636-he want to do , and nowhere [I]3636-he want to go , and [nobody]4176-nobody [I]3636-he want to be near . Then [you]3636-he feel so rottenly lonely , [Cyril]113-cyril . "[3636-he]

" Good gracious ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , rousing [myself]0-i in bed . " That sounds bad ! "[0-i]

[He]3636-he laughed slightly .

" It 's all right , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he said , " it 's only the excitement of [London]23-london , and [that little man in [the park]3119-the park]5576-that little man in the park , and [that woman on the seat]5578-that woman on the seat [I]3636-he wonder where [she]5578-that woman on the seat is to - night , [poor devil]4315-poor devil and then [Lettie]313-lettie . " What ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , as [he]3636-he hesitated .

" [I]3636-he do n't know , "[3636-he] [he]3636-he replied slowly , " [a poet]2015-a poet or something , like [Burns]382-burns [I]3636-he do n't know . [I]3636-he wanted something [I]3636-he had n't got . [I]3636-he 'm something short . [I]3636-he 'm like corn in a wet harvest full , but pappy , no good . Is'll rot . [I]3636-he came too soon ; or [I]3636-he wanted something that would ha ' made [me]3636-he grow fierce . That 's why [I]3636-he wanted [Lettie]313-lettie [I]3636-he think . But am [I]3636-he talking damn rot ? What am [I]3636-he saying ? What are [you]3662-you making [me]3636-he talk for ? What are [you]3662-you listening for ? "[3636-he]

[I]0-i rose and went across to [him]3662-you , saying : " [I]0-i do n't want [you]3662-you to talk ! If [you]3662-you sleep till morning things will look different . "[0-i]

[I]0-i sat on [his]3662-you bed and took [his]3662-you hand . [He]3662-you lay quite still .

" [I]3662-you 'm only [a kid]5581-a kid after all , [Cyril]113-cyril , "[3662-you] [he]3662-you said , a few moments later .

" [We]5582-we all are , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , still holding [his]3662-you hand . Presently [he]3662-you fell asleep .

When [I]0-i awoke the sunlight was laughing with the young morning in [the room]518-the room . The large blue sky shone against the window , and the birds were calling in [the garden below]3664-the garden below , shouting to [one another]1500-one another and making fun of life . [I]0-i felt glad to have opened [my]0-i eyes . [I]0-i lay for a moment looking out on the morning as on a blue bright sea in which [I]0-i was going to plunge .

Then [my]0-i eyes wandered to the little table near the couch . [I]0-i noticed the glitter of [George]313-lettie 's cigarette case , and then , with a start , the whisky decanter . It was nearly empty . [He]313-lettie must have drunk three - quarters of a pint of liquor while [I]0-i was dozing . [I]0-i could not believe it . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i must have been mistaken as to the quantity the bottle contained . [I]0-i leaned out to see what it was that had startled [me]0-i by its fall the night before . It was the large , heavy drinking glass which [he]313-lettie had knocked down but not broken . [I]0-i could see no stain on the carpet .

[George]313-lettie was still asleep . [He]313-lettie lay half uncovered , and was breathing quietly . [His]313-lettie face looked inert like a mask . The pallid , uninspired clay of [his]313-lettie features seemed to have sunk a little out of shape , so that [he]313-lettie appeared rather haggard , rather ugly , with grooves of ineffectual misery along [his]313-lettie cheeks . [I]0-i wanted [him]313-lettie to wake , so that [his]313-lettie inert , flaccid features might be inspired with life again . [I]0-i could not believe [his]313-lettie charm and [his]313-lettie beauty could have forsaken [him]313-lettie so , and left [his]313-lettie features dreary , sunken clay .

As [I]0-i looked [he]313-lettie woke . [His]313-lettie eyes opened slowly . [He]313-lettie looked at [me]0-i and turned away , unable to meet [my]0-i eyes . [He]313-lettie pulled the bedclothes up over [his]313-lettie shoulders , as though to cover [himself]313-lettie from [me]0-i , and [he]313-lettie lay with [his]313-lettie back to [me]0-i , quite still , as if [he]313-lettie were asleep , although [I]0-i knew [he]313-lettie was quite awake ; [he]313-lettie was suffering the humiliation of lying waiting for [his]313-lettie life to crawl back and inhabit [his]313-lettie body . As it was , [his]313-lettie vitality was not yet sufficient to inform the muscles of [his]313-lettie face and give [him]313-lettie an expression , much less to answer by challenge .

CHAPTER V

PISGAH

When [[her]3666-her eldest boy]3667-her eldest boy was three years old [Lettie]313-lettie returned to live at [Eberwich]6-eberwich . [Old Mr. Tempest]120-mr. tempest died suddenly , so [Leslie]121-leslie came down to inhabit " Highclose . "[121-leslie] [He]121-leslie was [a very much occupied man]3668-a very much occupied man . Very often [he]121-leslie was in [Germany]99-germany or in [the South of]3669-the south of [England]47-england engaged on business . At [home]4184-home [he]121-leslie was unfailingly attentive to [[his]121-leslie wife]468-his wife and [[his]121-leslie two children]3672-his two children . [He]121-leslie had cultivated a taste for public life . In spite of [his]121-leslie pressure of business [he]121-leslie had become [a County Councillor]3673-a county councillor , and [one of [the prominent members of the Conservative Association]3675-the prominent members of the conservative association]3674-one of the prominent members of the conservative association . [He]121-leslie was very fond of answering or proposing toasts at some public dinner , of entertaining [political men]3676-political men at " Highclose , "[3673-a county councillor] of taking the chair at political meetings , and finally , of speaking on this or that platform . [His]121-leslie name was fairly often seen in the newspapers . As [a mine owner]3677-a mine owner , [he]121-leslie spoke as an authority on the employment of labour , on royalties , land - owning and so on .

At [home]4184-home [he]121-leslie was quite tame . [He]121-leslie treated [[his]121-leslie wife]468-his wife with respect , romped in [the nursery]3680-the nursery , and domineered [the servants]5509-the servants royally . [They]5509-the servants liked [him]121-leslie for it [her]468-his wife [they]5509-the servants did not like . [He]121-leslie was noisy , but unobservant , [she]468-his wife was quiet and exacting . [He]121-leslie would swear and bluster furiously , but when [he]121-leslie was round the corner [they]5509-the servants smiled . [She]468-his wife gave [her]468-his wife orders and passed very moderate censure , but [they]5509-the servants went away cursing to [themselves]5509-the servants . As [Lettie]313-lettie was always [a very good wife]3682-a very good wife , [Leslie]121-leslie adored [her]468-his wife when [he]121-leslie had the time , and when [he]121-leslie had not , forgot [her]468-his wife comfortably .

[She]468-his wife was very contradictory . At times [she]468-his wife would write to [me]0-i in terms of passionate dissatisfaction : [she]468-his wife had nothing at all in [her]468-his wife life , it was a barren futility .

" [I]468-his wife hope [I]468-his wife shall have [another child]5583-another child next spring , "[468-his wife] [she]468-his wife would write , " there is only that to take away the misery of this torpor . [I]468-his wife seem full of passion and energy , and it all fizzles out in day to day domestics "[468-his wife]

When [I]0-i replied to [her]468-his wife urging [her]468-his wife to take some work that [she]468-his wife could throw [her]468-his wife soul into , [she]468-his wife would reply indifferently . Then later :

" [You]0-i charge [me]468-his wife with contradiction . Well , naturally . [You]0-i see [I]468-his wife wrote that screeching letter in a mood which wo n't come again for some time . Generally [I]468-his wife am quite content to take the rain and the calm days just as they come , then something flings [me]468-his wife out of [myself]468-his wife and [I]468-his wife am a trifle demented : very , very blue , as [I]468-his wife tell [Leslie]121-leslie . "[468-his wife]

Like [so many women]3683-so many women , [she]468-his wife seemed to live , for the most part contentedly , a small indoor existence with artificial light and padded upholstery . Only occasionally , hearing the winds of life outside , [she]468-his wife clamoured to be out in the black , keen storm . [She]468-his wife was driven to the door , [she]468-his wife looked out and called into the tumult wildly , but feminine caution kept [her]468-his wife from stepping over the threshold .

[George]313-lettie was flourishing in [his]313-lettie horse - dealing .

In the morning , processions of splendid shire horses , tied tail and head , would tramp grandly along [the quiet lanes of [Eberwich]6-eberwich]3684-the quiet lanes of eberwich , led by [[George]313-lettie 's man]3685-george 's man , or by [Tom Mayhew]365-mayhew , while in the fresh clean sunlight [George]313-lettie would go riding by , [two restless nags]3686-two restless nags dancing beside [him]313-lettie .

When [I]0-i came [home]4184-home from [France]45-france five years after [our]3688-our meeting in [London]23-london [I]0-i found [him]313-lettie installed in the " Hollies . "[313-lettie] [He]313-lettie had rented [the house]563-the house from [the Mayhews]375-the mayhews , and had moved [there]1189-there with [[his]313-lettie family]3691-his family , leaving [Oswald]370-oswald in charge of [[the " Ram . "]5584-the " ram . "]5584-the " ram . "[0-i] [I]0-i called at [the large house]445-the large house one afternoon , but [George]313-lettie was out . [[His]313-lettie family]3691-his family surprised [me]0-i . [The twins]5479-the twins were [tall lads of six]3695-tall lads of six . [Meg]114-meg , who was growing stouter , indulged the little creature in every way .

" How is [George]313-lettie ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [her]114-meg .

" Oh , [he]313-lettie 's very well , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg replied . " [He]313-lettie 's always got something on hand . [He]313-lettie hardly seems to have a spare moment ; what with [his]313-lettie socialism , and one thing and another . "[114-meg]

It was true , the outcome of [his]313-lettie visit to [London]23-london had been a wild devotion to the cause of the down - trodden . [I]0-i saw a picture of [Watt]383-watt 's " [Mammon]384-mammon , "[383-watt] on the walls of [the morning - room]3701-the morning - room , and the works of [Blatchford]385-blatchford , [Masterman]3702-masterman , and [Chiozza Money]361-money on the side table . [Meg]114-meg did not care for [these earnest souls]3705-these earnest souls .

" [They]3705-these earnest souls 're not [[my]114-meg sort]5586-my sort , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said , " too jerky and bumptious . " Why ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " Have [you]114-meg had much trouble that way ? "[0-i]

[She]114-meg lowered [her]114-meg voice to a pitch which was sufficiently mysterious to attract the attention of [the boys]3019-the boys .

" [I]114-meg should n't say anything if it was n't that [you]0-i were like [brothers]5588-brothers , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said . " But [he]5589-he did begin to have dreadful drinking bouts . " [You]0-i could n't imagine what it 's like , [Cyril]113-cyril , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said . " But [he]5589-he 's better now ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Oh , yes since [Gertie]387-gertie came , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg looked fondly at [the baby]1267-the baby in [her]114-meg arms " [He]5589-he 's a lot better now . "[114-meg]

[The baby]1267-the baby turned with sudden coy shyness , and clung to [[her]1267-the baby mother]476-her mother 's neck . [Meg]114-meg kissed [her]1267-the baby fondly , then [the child]475-the child laid [her]475-the child cheek against [[her]1267-the baby mother]476-her mother 's . [The mother]460-the mother 's dark eyes , and [the baby]1267-the baby 's large , hazel eyes looked at [me]0-i serenely . [The two]2656-the two were very calm , very complete and triumphant together . In [their]2656-the two completeness was a security which made [me]0-i feel alone and ineffectual . [A woman who has [[her]3716-a woman who has her child in her arms child in [her]3716-a woman who has her child in her arms arms]3717-her child in her arms]3716-a woman who has her child in her arms is a tower of strength , a beautiful , unassailable tower of strength that may in its turn stand quietly dealing death .

[I]0-i told [Meg]114-meg [I]0-i would call again to see [George]313-lettie . Two evenings later [I]0-i asked [Lettie]313-lettie to lend [me]0-i [a dog - cart]3718-a dog - cart to drive over to the " Hollies . "[313-lettie] [Leslie]121-leslie was away on one of [his]121-leslie political jaunts , and [she]3719-she was restless . [She]3719-she proposed to go with [me]0-i . [She]3719-she had called on [Meg]114-meg twice before in [the new large home]3720-the new large home .

[We]3721-we started about six o'clock . The night was dark and muddy . [Lettie]313-lettie wanted to call in [Eberwich village]3722-eberwich village , so [she]3719-she drove the long way round [Selsby]13-selsby . The horse was walking through the gate of [the " Hollies "]5597-the " hollies "[470-the maid] at about seven o'clock . [Meg]114-meg was [upstairs]532-upstairs in [the nursery]3680-the nursery , [the maid]470-the maid told [me]0-i , and [George]313-lettie was in [the dining - room]511-the dining - room getting [baby]4805-baby to sleep .

" All right ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [we]3721-we will go in to [him]655-the man . Do n't bother to tell [him]655-the man . "[0-i]

As [we]3721-we stood in [the gloomy , square hall]3728-the gloomy , square hall [we]3721-we heard the rumble of a rocking - chair , the stroke coming slow and heavy to the tune of " [Henry Martin]389-henry martin , "[655-the man] one of [our]3721-we Strelley Mill folk songs . Then , through [the man]655-the man 's heavily - accented singing floated the long light crooning of [the baby]1267-the baby as [she]1267-the baby sang , in [her]1267-the baby quaint little fashion , a mischievous second to [[her]1267-the baby father]486-her father 's lullaby . [He]655-the man waxed a little louder ; and without knowing why , [we]3721-we found [ourselves]3721-we smiling with piquant amusement . [The baby]1267-the baby grew louder too , till there was a shrill ring of laughter and mockery in [her]1267-the baby music . [He]655-the man sang louder and louder , [the baby]1267-the baby shrilled higher and higher , the chair swung in long , heavy beats . Then suddenly [he]655-the man began to laugh . The rocking stopped , and [he]655-the man said , still with laughter and enjoyment in [his]655-the man tones :

" Now that is very wicked ! Ah , [naughty Girlie]5598-naughty girlie go to boh , go to bohey ! at once . "[655-the man]

[The baby]1267-the baby chuckled [her]1267-the baby small , insolent mockery .

" Come , [Mamma]388-mamma ! "[655-the man] [he]655-the man said , " come and take [Girlie]390-girlie to bohey ! "[655-the man]

[The baby]1267-the baby laughed again , but with an uncertain touch of appeal in [her]1267-the baby tone . [We]3721-we opened the door and entered . [He]655-the man looked up very much startled to see [us]3721-we . [He]655-the man was sitting in a tall rocking - chair by the fire , coatless , with white shirtsleeves . [The baby]1267-the baby , in [her]1267-the baby high - waisted , tight little night - gown , stood on [his]655-the man knee , [her]1267-the baby wide eyes fixed on [us]3721-we , wild wisps of [her]1267-the baby brown hair brushed across [her]1267-the baby forehead and glinting like puffs of bronze dust over [her]1267-the baby ears . Quickly [she]1267-the baby put [her]1267-the baby arms round [his]655-the man neck and tucked [her]1267-the baby face under [his]655-the man chin , [her]1267-the baby small feet poised on [his]655-the man thigh , the night - gown dropping upon them . [He]655-the man shook [his]655-the man head as the puff of soft brown hair tickled [him]655-the man . [He]655-the man smiled at [us]3721-we , saying :

" [You]3721-we see [I]655-the man 'm busy ! "[655-the man]

Then [he]655-the man turned again to the little brown head tucked under [his]655-the man chin , blew away the luminous cloud of hair , and rubbed [his]655-the man lips and [his]655-the man moustache on the small white neck , so warm and secret . [The baby]1267-the baby put up [her]1267-the baby shoulders , and shrank a little , bubbling in [his]655-the man neck with hidden laughter . [She]1267-the baby did not lift [her]1267-the baby face or loosen [her]1267-the baby arms .

" [She]1267-the baby thinks [she]1267-the baby is shy , "[655-the man] [he]655-the man said . " Look up , [young hussy]5599-young hussy , and see [the lady]4749-the lady and [gentleman]5601-gentleman . [She]1267-the baby is a positive owl , [she]1267-the baby wo n't go to bed will [you]5599-young hussy , [young brown - owl]5602-young brown - owl ? "[655-the man]

[He]655-the man tickled [her]1267-the baby neck again with [his]655-the man moustache , and [the child]475-the child bubbled over with naughty , merry laughter .

[The room]518-the room was very warm , with a red bank of fire up the chimney mouth . [It]518-the room was half lighted from a heavy bronze chandelier , black and gloomy , in the middle of [the room]518-the room . There was the same sombre , sparse furniture that [the Mayhews]3741-the mayhews had had . [George]313-lettie looked large and handsome , the glossy black silk of [his]313-lettie waistcoat fitting close to [his]313-lettie sides , the roundness of the shoulder muscle filling the white linen of [his]313-lettie sleeves .

Suddenly [the baby]1267-the baby lifted [her]1267-the baby head and stared at [us]3743-us , thrusting into [her]1267-the baby mouth the dummy that was pinned to the breast of [her]1267-the baby night - gown . The faded pink sleeves of the night - gown were tight on [her]1267-the baby fat little wrists . [She]1267-the baby stood thus sucking [her]1267-the baby dummy , one arm round [[her]1267-the baby father]486-her father 's neck , watching [us]3743-us with hazel solemn eyes . Then [she]1267-the baby pushed [her]1267-the baby fat little fist up among the bush of small curls , and began to twist [her]1267-the baby fingers about [her]1267-the baby ear that was white like a camelia flower .

" [She]1267-the baby is really sleepy , "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie .

" Come then ! "[486-her father] said [he]486-her father , folding [her]1267-the baby for sleep against [his]486-her father breast . " Come and go to boh . "[486-her father]

But [the young rascal]3745-the young rascal immediately began to cry [her]3745-the young rascal remonstrance . [She]1267-the baby stiffened [herself]1267-the baby , freed [herself]1267-the baby , and stood again on [his]486-her father knee , watching [us]3743-us solemnly , vibrating the dummy in [her]1267-the baby mouth as [she]1267-the baby suddenly sucked at it , twisting [[her]1267-the baby father]486-her father 's ear in [her]1267-the baby small fingers till [he]486-her father winced .

" [Her]1267-the baby nails are sharp , "[486-her father] [he]486-her father said , smiling .

[He]486-her father began asking and giving the small information that pass between [friends who have not met for a long time]3747-friends who have not met for a long time . [The baby]1267-the baby laid [her]1267-the baby head on [his]486-her father shoulder , keeping [her]1267-the baby tired , owl - like eyes fixed darkly on [us]3743-us . Then gradually the lids fluttered and sank , and [she]1267-the baby dropped on to [his]486-her father arm .

" [She]1267-the baby is asleep , "[313-lettie] whispered [Lettie]313-lettie .

Immediately the dark eyes opened again . [We]3743-us looked significantly at [one another]1500-one another , continuing [our]3743-us subdued talk . After a while [the baby]1267-the baby slept soundly .

Presently [Meg]114-meg came [downstairs]639-downstairs . [She]114-meg greeted [us]3743-us in breathless whispers of surprise , and then turned to [[her]114-meg husband]677-her husband .

" Has [she]1267-the baby gone ? "[114-meg] [she]114-meg whispered , bending over [the sleeping child]3753-the sleeping child in astonishment . " [My]114-meg , this is wonderful , is n't it ! "[114-meg]

[She]114-meg took [the sleeping drooping baby]3754-the sleeping drooping baby from [his]486-her father arms , putting [her]114-meg mouth close to [its]3754-the sleeping drooping baby forehead , murmuring with soothing , inarticulate sounds .

[We]3743-us stayed talking for some time when [Meg]114-meg had put [the baby]1267-the baby to bed . [George]313-lettie had a new tone of assurance and authority . In the first place [he]313-lettie was [an established man]3756-an established man , living in [a large house]3757-a large house , having [altogether three men working for [him]313-lettie]3758-altogether three men working for him . In [the second place]3759-the second place [he]313-lettie had ceased to value the conventional treasures of social position and ostentatious refinement . Very , very many things [he]313-lettie condemned as flummery and sickly waste of time . The life of [an ordinary well - to - do person]3760-an ordinary well - to - do person [he]313-lettie set down as adorned futility , almost idiocy . [He]313-lettie spoke passionately of the monstrous denial of life to the many by [the fortunate few]3761-the fortunate few . [He]313-lettie talked at [Lettie]313-lettie most flagrantly .

" Of course , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said , " [I]114-meg have read [Mr. Wells]391-mr. wells and [Mr. Shaw]392-mr. shaw , and even [Niel Lyons]393-niel lyons and [a Dutchman]5603-a dutchman what is [his]5603-a dutchman name , [Querido]394-querido ? But what can [I]114-meg do ? [I]114-meg think [the rich]5604-the rich have as much misery as [the poor]3564-the poor , and of quite as deadly a sort . What can [I]114-meg do ? It is a question of life and the development of [the human race]1932-the human race . [Society]5607-society and [its]5607-society regulations is not a sort of drill that [endless Napoleons]174-napoleons have forced on [us]5608-we : it is the only way [we]5608-we have yet found of living together . "[114-meg]

" Pah ! "[3762-his] said [he]3762-his , " that is rank cowardice . It is feeble and futile to the last degree . "[3762-his]

" [We]5608-we ca n't grow consumption - proof in a generation , nor can [we]5608-we grow poverty - proof . "[3763-i]

" [We]5608-we can begin to take active measures , "[3762-his] [he]3762-his replied contemptuously .

" [We]5608-we can [all]2924-all go into [a sanatorium]5610-a sanatorium and live miserably and dejectedly warding off death , "[3763-i] [she]3763-i said , " but life is full of goodliness for all that . "[3763-i]

" It is fuller of misery , "[3762-his] [he]3762-his said .

Nevertheless , [she]3763-i had shaken [him]3762-his . [She]3763-i still kept [her]3763-i astonishing power of influencing [his]3762-his opinions . All [his]3762-his passion , and heat , and rude speech , analysed out , was only [his]3762-his terror at [her]3763-i threatening of [his]3762-his life - interest .

[She]3763-i was rather piqued by [his]3762-his rough treatment of [her]3763-i , and by [his]3762-his contemptuous tone . Moreover , [she]3763-i could never quite let [him]3762-his be . [She]3763-i felt a driving force which impelled [her]3763-i almost against [her]3763-i will to interfere in [his]3762-his life . [She]3763-i invited [him]3762-his to dine with [them]3764-them at Highclose . [He]3762-his was now quite possible . [He]3762-his had , in the course of [his]3762-his business , been sufficiently in the company of [gentlemen]3765-gentlemen to be altogether " comme it faut "[3763-i] at a private dinner , and after dinner .

[She]3763-i wrote [me]0-i concerning [him]3762-his occasionally :

" [George Saxton]108-george was here to dinner yesterday . [He]108-george and [Leslie]121-leslie had frightful battles over the nationalisation of industries . [George]108-george is rather more than a match for [Leslie]121-leslie , which , in [his]108-george secret heart , makes [[our]3764-them friend]5611-our friend gloriously proud . It is very amusing . [I]3763-i , of course , have to preserve the balance of power , and , of course , to bolster [[my]3763-i husband]5056-my husband 's dignity . " [We]5615-we happened to be motoring from [Derby]100-derby on Sunday morning , and as [we]5615-we came to [the top of [the hill]502-the hill]5616-the top of the hill , [we]5615-we had to thread [our]5615-we way through [quite a large crowd]5618-quite a large crowd . Almost a year later [I]0-i heard from [her]3767-i again on the same subject .

" [I]3767-i have had such a lark . Two or three times [I]3767-i have been to [the ' Hollies ']5627-the ' hollies ' ; to socialist meetings . [Leslie]121-leslie does not know . They are great fun . [The people]1647-the people are so earnest , [they]1647-the people make [me]0-i sad . Gradually [George]108-george fell out of [the socialist movement]3775-the socialist movement . It wearied [him]108-george . [It]3776-it did not feed [him]108-george altogether . [He]108-george began by mocking [[his]108-george friends of [the confraternity]3778-the confraternity]3777-his friends of the confraternity . Finally the meetings at the ' Hollies ' ceased , and [[my]0-i friend]432-my friend dropped all connection with [[his]432-my friend former associates]3781-his former associates .

[He]432-my friend began to speculate in land . [A hosiery factory]3782-a hosiery factory moved to [Eberwich]6-eberwich , giving [the place]4141-the place a new stimulus to growth . [George]108-george happened to buy a piece of land at the end of [the street of [the village]737-the village]3784-the street of the village . When [he]108-george got it , [it]3786-it was laid out in [allotment gardens]3787-allotment gardens . These were becoming valueless owing to the encroachment of [houses]3788-houses . [He]108-george took it , divided [it]3786-it up , and offered it as sites for [a new row of shops]3789-a new row of shops . [He]108-george sold at a good profit .

Altogether [he]108-george was becoming very well off . [I]0-i heard from [Meg]114-meg that [he]108-george was flourishing , that [he]108-george did not drink " anything to speak of , "[114-meg] but that [he]108-george was always out , [she]114-meg hardly saw anything of [him]108-george . " [Nobody]4176-nobody comes here to see [me]108-george twice , "[108-george] [he]108-george said . " Because [Meg]114-meg receives [them]5631-them in such an off - hand fashion . Thus [their]3791-their natures contradicted each other . [He]3792-he tried hard to gain a footing in [Eberwich]6-eberwich . [George]108-george voted [the women]669-the women loud - mouthed , vulgar , and narrow not without some cause . [Meg]114-meg , however , persisted . [She]114-meg visited when [she]114-meg thought fit , and entertained when [he]3792-he was out . [He]3792-he made acquaintance after acquaintance : [Dr. Francis]398-dr. francis ; [Mr. Cartridge]399-mr. cartridge , [the veterinary surgeon]3798-the veterinary surgeon ; [Toby Heswall]400-toby heswall , [[the brewer]3799-the brewer 's son]3800-the brewer 's son ; [the Curtisses]3801-the curtisses , [farmers of good standing]3802-farmers of good standing from [Everley Hall]101-everley hall . But it was no good . [George]108-george was by nature [a family man]3803-a family man . [He]108-george wanted to be private and secure in [[his]108-george own rooms]3804-his own rooms , then [he]108-george was at ease . As [Meg]114-meg never went out with [him]3792-he , and as every attempt to entertain at the " Hollies "[114-meg] filled [him]3792-he with shame and mortification , [he]3792-he began to give up trying to place [himself]3792-he , and remained suspended in social isolation at the " Hollies . "[114-meg]

The friendship between [Lettie]313-lettie and [himself]3792-he had been kept up , in spite of all things . [Leslie]121-leslie was sometimes jealous , but [he]121-leslie dared not show it openly , for fear of [[his]121-leslie wife]468-his wife 's scathing contempt . [George]313-lettie went to " Highclose "[313-lettie] perhaps once in a fortnight , perhaps not so often . [Lettie]313-lettie never went to the " Hollies , "[313-lettie] as [Meg]114-meg 's attitude was too antagonistic .

[Meg]114-meg complained very bitterly of [[her]114-meg husband]677-her husband . [He]3792-he often made a beast of [himself]3792-he drinking , [he]3792-he thought more of [himself]3792-he than [he]3792-he ought , [home]4184-home was not good enough for [him]3792-he , [he]3792-he was selfish to the back - bone , [he]3792-he cared neither for [her]114-meg nor [the children]4276-the children , only for [himself]3792-he .

[I]0-i happened to be at [home]4184-home for [Lettie]313-lettie 's thirty - first birthday . [George]313-lettie was then thirty - five . [Lettie]313-lettie had allowed [[her]114-meg husband]677-her husband to forget [her]114-meg birthday . [He]677-her husband was now very much immersed in politics , foreseeing a general election in the following year , and intending to contest the seat in parliament . [The division]3811-the division was [an impregnable Liberal stronghold]3812-an impregnable liberal stronghold , but [Leslie]121-leslie had hopes that [he]677-her husband might capture the situation . Therefore [he]677-her husband spent a great deal of time at [the conservative club]3813-the conservative club , and among [the men of influence]3814-the men of influence in [the southern division]3815-the southern division . [Lettie]313-lettie encouraged [him]677-her husband in these affairs . It relieved [her]114-meg of [him]677-her husband . It was thus that [she]114-meg let [him]677-her husband forget [her]114-meg birthday , while , for some unknown reason , [she]114-meg let the intelligence slip to [George]313-lettie . [He]313-lettie was invited to dinner , as [I]0-i was at [home]4184-home .

[George]313-lettie came at seven o'clock . There was a strange feeling of festivity in [the house]563-the house , although there were no evident signs . [Lettie]313-lettie had dressed with some magnificence in a blackish purple gauze over soft satin of lighter tone , nearly the colour of double violets . [She]114-meg wore vivid green azurite ornaments on the fairness of [her]114-meg bosom , and [her]114-meg bright hair was bound by a band of the same colour . It was rather startling . [She]114-meg was conscious of [her]114-meg effect , and was very excited . Immediately [George]313-lettie saw [her]114-meg [his]313-lettie eyes wakened with a dark glow . [She]114-meg stood up as [he]313-lettie entered , [her]114-meg hand stretched straight out to [him]313-lettie , [her]114-meg body very erect , [her]114-meg eyes bright and rousing , like two blue pennants .

" Thank [you]313-lettie so much , "[114-meg] [she]114-meg said softly , giving [his]313-lettie hand a last pressure before [she]114-meg let it go . [He]313-lettie could not answer , so [he]313-lettie sat down , bowing [his]313-lettie head , then looking up at [her]114-meg in suspense . [She]114-meg smiled at [her]114-meg .

Presently [the children]4276-the children came in . [They]4276-the children looked very quaint , like [acolytes]3819-acolytes , in [their]4276-the children long straight dressing - gowns of quilted blue silk . [The boy]798-the boy , particularly , looked as if [he]798-the boy were going to light the candles in [some childish church in [paradise]3822-paradise]3821-some childish church in paradise . [He]798-the boy was very tall and slender and fair , with a round fine head , and serene features . [Both children]3823-both children looked remarkably , almost transparently clean : it is impossible to consider anything more fresh and fair . [The girl]604-the girl was [a merry , curly headed puss of six]3825-a merry , curly headed puss of six . [She]604-the girl played with [[her]604-the girl mother]476-her mother 's green jewels and prattled prettily , while [the boy]798-the boy stood at [[his]798-the boy mother]453-his mother 's side , [a slender and silent acolyte in [his]798-the boy pale blue gown]3829-a slender and silent acolyte in his pale blue gown . [I]0-i was impressed by [his]798-the boy patience and [his]798-the boy purity . When [the girl]604-the girl had bounded away into [George]313-lettie 's arms , [the lad]4273-the lad laid [his]4273-the lad hand timidly on [Lettie]313-lettie 's knee and looked with a little wonder at [her]604-the girl dress .

" How pretty those green stones are , [mother]4146-mother ! "[4273-the lad] [he]4273-the lad said .

" Yes , "[313-lettie] replied [Lettie]313-lettie brightly , lifting them and letting their strange pattern fall again on [her]604-the girl bosom . " [I]313-lettie like them . "[313-lettie]

" Are [you]313-lettie going to sing , [mother]4146-mother ? "[4273-the lad] [he]4273-the lad asked .

" Perhaps . But why ? "[313-lettie] said [Lettie]313-lettie , smiling .

" Because [you]313-lettie generally sing when [Mr. Saxton]130-mr. saxton comes . "[4273-the lad]

[He]4273-the lad bent [his]4273-the lad head and stroked [Lettie]313-lettie 's dress shyly .

" Do [I]604-the girl , "[604-the girl] [she]604-the girl said , laughing , " Can [you]4273-the lad hear ? "[604-the girl]

" Just a little , "[4273-the lad] [he]4273-the lad replied . " Quite small , as if it were nearly lost in the dark . "[4273-the lad]

[He]4273-the lad was hesitating , shy as [boys]4691-boys are . [Lettie]313-lettie laid [her]604-the girl hand on [his]4273-the lad head and stroked [his]4273-the lad smooth fair hair .

" Sing a song for [us]5638-us before [we]5638-us go , [mother]4146-mother "[4273-the lad] [he]4273-the lad asked , almost shamefully . [She]604-the girl kissed [him]4273-the lad .

" [You]4273-the lad shall sing with [me]604-the girl , "[604-the girl] [she]604-the girl said . " What shall it be ? "[604-the girl]

[She]604-the girl played without a copy of the music . [He]4273-the lad stood at [her]604-the girl side , while [Lucy]288-lucy , [the little mouse]3833-the little mouse , sat on [[her]288-lucy mother]476-her mother 's skirts , pressing [Lettie]313-lettie 's silk slippers in turn upon the pedals . " [Gaily the troubadour]401-gaily the troubadour touched [his]401-gaily the troubadour guitar As [he]401-gaily the troubadour was hastening from the war . "[460-the mother]

[The boy]798-the boy had a pure treble , clear as the flight of swallows in the morning . The light shone on [his]798-the boy lips . Under the piano [the girl child]3839-the girl child sat laughing , pressing [[her]3839-the girl child mother]476-her mother 's feet with all [her]3839-the girl child strength , and laughing again . At last [they]3837-their kissed [us]3841-we a gentle " good - night , "[604-the girl] and flitted out of [the room]518-the room . [The girl]604-the girl popped [her]604-the girl curly head round the door again . [Lucy]288-lucy was withdrawn for a moment ; then [we]3841-we heard [her]288-lucy , " Just a tick , [nurse]5641-nurse , just half - a - tick ! "[288-lucy]

" And [one teenie sweetie]5642-one teenie sweetie , "[288-lucy] [she]288-lucy suggested , " only one ! "[288-lucy]

[George]313-lettie and [Lettie]313-lettie smiled at [each other]4254-each other when [the children]4276-the children had gone . " It is ten years to - day since [my]288-lucy party at Woodside , "[288-lucy] [she]288-lucy said , reaching for the small Roman salt - cellar of green jade that [she]288-lucy used as an ash - tray .

" [[My]313-lettie Lord]5645-my lord ten years ! "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie exclaimed bitterly . " It seems a hundred . "[313-lettie]

" It does and it does n't , "[288-lucy] [she]288-lucy answered , smiling .

[CHAPTER VI

THE SCARP SLOPE

Leslie]405-chapter vi the scarp slope leslie won the conservative victory in the general election which took place a year or so after [my]0-i last visit to " Highclose . "[405-chapter vi the scarp slope leslie]

In the interim [the Tempests]237-the tempests had entertained [a continuous stream of [people]601-people]3860-a continuous stream of people . [I]0-i heard occasionally from [Lettie]405-chapter vi the scarp slope leslie how [she]405-chapter vi the scarp slope leslie was busy , amused , or bored . [She]405-chapter vi the scarp slope leslie told [me]0-i that [George]313-lettie had thrown [himself]313-lettie into the struggle on behalf of [the candidate of [the Labour Party]3863-the labour party]3862-the candidate of the labour party ; that [she]405-chapter vi the scarp slope leslie had not seen [him]313-lettie , except in [the streets]1639-the streets , for a very long time .

When [I]0-i went down to [Eberwich]6-eberwich in the March succeeding the election , [I]0-i found [several people]3865-several people staying with [[my]0-i sister]637-my sister . [She]637-my sister had under [her]637-my sister wing [a young literary fellow who affected the " [Doady]406-doady "[637-my sister] style [Dora Copperfield]407-dora copperfield 's " [Doady]406-doady]5671-a young literary fellow who affected the " doady " style dora copperfield 's " doady . "[313-lettie] [He]313-lettie had bunches of half - curly hair , and a romantic black cravat ; [he]313-lettie played the impulsive part , but was really as calculating as [any man on the stock - exchange]3867-any man on the stock - exchange . It delighted [Lettie]313-lettie to " mother "[313-lettie] [him]313-lettie . [He]313-lettie was so shrewd as to be less than harmless . [[His]313-lettie fellow guests]3868-his fellow guests , [a woman much experienced in music]3869-a woman much experienced in music and [an elderly man who was in the artistic world without being of it]3870-an elderly man who was in the artistic world without being of it , were interesting for a time . Bubble after bubble of floating fancy and wit [we]3871-we blew with [our]3871-we breath in the evenings . [I]0-i rose in the morning loathing the idea of more bubble - blowing .

[I]0-i wandered around [Nethermere]1-nethermere , which had now forgotten [me]0-i . The daffodils under [the boat - house]2273-the boat - house continued [their]3873-their golden laughter , and nodded to [one another]1500-one another in gossip , as [I]0-i watched [them]3873-their , never for a moment pausing to notice [me]0-i . The yellow reflection of daffodils among the shadows of grey willow in [the water]429-the water trembled faintly as they told haunted tales in the gloom . [I]0-i felt like [a child]1035-a child left out of [the group of [[my]0-i playmates]3878-my playmates]3877-the group of my playmates . There was a wind running across [Nethermere]1-nethermere , and on [the eager water]3879-the eager water blue and glistening grey shadows changed places swiftly . Along [the shore]575-the shore the wild birds rose , flapping in expostulation as [I]0-i passed , peewits mewing fiercely round [my]0-i head , while two white swans lifted [their]3881-their glistening feathers till [they]3881-their looked like grand double water - lilies , laying back [their]3881-their orange beaks among the petals , and fronting [me]0-i with haughty resentment , charging towards [me]0-i insolently .

[I]0-i wanted to be recognised by something . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that the dryads were looking out for [me]0-i from the wood 's edge . But as [I]0-i advanced [they]3882-they shrank , and glancing wistfully , turned back like pale flowers falling in the shadow of [the forest]3883-the forest . [I]0-i was [a stranger]715-a stranger , [an intruder]3885-an intruder . Among the bushes a twitter of lively birds exclaimed upon [me]0-i . Finches went leaping past in bright flashes , and [a robin]3886-a robin sat and asked rudely : " Hello ! Who are [you]0-i ? "[3886-a robin]

The bracken lay sere under the trees , broken and chavelled by the restless wild winds of the long winter .

The trees caught the wind in their tall netted twigs , and the young morning wind moaned at its captivity . As [I]0-i trod the discarded oak - leaves and the bracken [they]3882-they uttered their last sharp gasps , pressed into oblivion . The wood was roofed with a wide young sobbing sound , and floored with a faint hiss like the intaking of the last breath . Between , was all the glad out - peeping of buds and anemone flowers and the rush of birds . [I]0-i , wandering alone , felt them all , the anguish of the bracken fallen face - down in defeat , the careless dash of the birds , the sobbing of the young wind arrested in its haste , the trembling , expanding delight of the buds . [I]0-i alone among [them]3882-they could hear the whole succession of chords .

[The brooks]1476-the brooks talked on just the same , just as gladly , just as boisterously as [they]1476-the brooks had done when [I]0-i had netted small , glittering fish in the rest - pools . At [Strelley Mill]2-strelley mill [a servant girl in a white cap , and white apron - bands]3888-a servant girl in a white cap , and white apron - bands , came running out of [the house]563-the house with purple prayer - books , which [she]3888-a servant girl in a white cap , and white apron - bands gave to [the elder of two finicking girls who sat disconsolately with [[their]3890-the elder of two finicking girls who sat disconsolately with their black - silked mother in the governess cart at the gate , ready to go to church black - silked mother]3891-their black - silked mother in [the governess cart at the gate , ready to go to [church]638-church]3892-the governess cart at the gate , ready to go to church]3890-the elder of two finicking girls who sat disconsolately with their black - silked mother in the governess cart at the gate , ready to go to church . Near Woodside there was barbed - wire along [the path]495-the path , and at the end of every riding it was tarred on the tree - trunks , " Private . "[0-i]

[I]0-i had done with [the valley of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]2937-the valley of nethermere . [The valley of [Nethermere]1-nethermere]2937-the valley of nethermere had cast [me]0-i out many years before , while [I]0-i had fondly believed it cherished [me]0-i in memory .

[I]0-i went along [the road]738-the road to [Eberwich]6-eberwich . The church bells were ringing boisterously , with the careless boisterousness of the brooks and the birds and the rollicking coltsfoots and celandines .

[A few people]3898-a few people were hastening blithely to service . [Miners]3899-miners and [other labouring men]3900-other labouring men were passing in aimless gangs , walking nowhere in particular , so long as [they]3901-they reached [a sufficiently distant public house]3902-a sufficiently distant public house .

[I]0-i reached the ' Hollies . ' [It]3903-it was much more spruce than [it]3903-it had been . [The yard]457-the yard , however , and [the stables]3392-the stables had again a somewhat abandoned air . [I]0-i asked [the maid]470-the maid for [George]313-lettie .

" Oh , [master]1393-master 's not up yet , "[470-the maid] [she]470-the maid said , giving a little significant toss of [her]470-the maid head , and smiling . [I]0-i waited a moment .

" But [he]313-lettie rung for a bottle of beer about ten minutes since , so [I]470-the maid should think "[470-the maid] [she]470-the maid emphasised the word with some ironical contempt , " [he]313-lettie wo n't be very long , "[470-the maid] [she]470-the maid added , in tones which conveyed that [she]470-the maid was not by any means sure . [I]0-i asked for [Meg]114-meg .

" Oh , [Missis]164-missis is gone to [church]638-church and [the children]4276-the children But [Miss Saxton]5675-miss saxton is in , [she]5675-miss saxton might "[470-the maid]

" [Emily]109-emily ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed .

[The maid]470-the maid smiled .

" [She]109-emily 's in [the drawing - room]4162-the drawing - room . [She]109-emily 's engaged , but perhaps if [I]470-the maid tell [her]109-emily "[470-the maid]

" Yes , do , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , sure that [Emily]109-emily would receive [me]0-i .

[I]0-i found [[my]0-i old sweetheart]3908-my old sweetheart sitting in a low chair by the fire , [a man standing on the hearthrug]3909-a man standing on the hearthrug pulling [his]3909-a man standing on the hearthrug moustache . [Emily]109-emily and [I]0-i both felt a thrill of old delight at meeting .

" [I]109-emily can hardly believe it is really [you]0-i , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , laughing [me]0-i one of the old intimate looks . [She]109-emily had changed a great deal . [She]109-emily was very handsome , but [she]109-emily had now a new self - confidence , a fine , free indifference .

" Let [me]109-emily introduce [you]0-i . [Mr. Renshaw]408-mr. renshaw , [Cyril]113-cyril . [Tom]218-alice , [you]0-i know who it is [you]0-i have heard [me]109-emily speak often enough of [Cyril]113-cyril . [I]109-emily am going to marry [Tom]218-alice in three weeks ' time , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , laughing .

" [The devil]4305-the devil [you]0-i are ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed involuntarily .

" If [he]113-cyril will have [me]109-emily , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily added , quite as a playful afterthought .

[Tom]218-alice was [a well - built fair man]3910-a well - built fair man , smoothly , almost delicately tanned . There was something soldierly in [his]218-alice bearing , something self - conscious in the way [he]218-alice bent [his]218-alice head and pulled [his]218-alice moustache , something charming and fresh in the way [he]218-alice laughed at [Emily]109-emily 's last preposterous speech .

" Why did n't [you]109-emily tell [me]0-i ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Why did n't [you]0-i ask [me]109-emily ? "[109-emily] [she]109-emily retorted , arching [her]109-emily brows .

" [Mr. Renshaw]408-mr. renshaw , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [You]109-emily have out - manoeuvred [me]0-i all unawares , quite indecently . "[0-i]

" [I]218-alice am very sorry , "[218-alice] [he]218-alice said , giving one more twist to [his]218-alice moustache , then breaking into a loud , short laugh at [his]218-alice joke .

" Do [you]218-alice really feel cross ? "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily to [me]0-i , knitting [her]109-emily brows and smiling quaintly .

" [I]0-i do ! "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , with truthful emphasis .

[She]109-emily laughed , and laughed again , very much amused .

" It is such a joke , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said . " To think [you]0-i should feel cross now , when it is how long is it ago ?[109-emily]

" [I]0-i will not count up , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" Are [you]409-tom not sorry for [me]0-i ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked of [Tom Renshaw]409-tom .

[He]409-tom looked at [me]0-i with [his]409-tom young blue eyes , eyes so bright , so naively inquisitive , so winsomely meditative . [He]409-tom did not know quite what to say , or how to take it .

" Very ! "[409-tom] [he]409-tom replied in another short burst of laughter , quickly twisting [his]409-tom moustache again and looking down at [his]409-tom feet .

[He]409-tom was twenty - nine years old ; had been [a soldier in [China]102-china]3911-a soldier in china for five years , was now farming [[[his]409-tom father]630-his father 's farm at [Papplewick]103-papplewick]3913-his father 's farm at papplewick , where [Emily]109-emily was [schoolmistress]3914-schoolmistress . [He]409-tom had been at [home]4184-home eighteen months . [[His]409-tom father]630-his father was [an old man of seventy who had had [his]630-his father right hand chopped to bits in the chopping machine]3917-an old man of seventy who had had his right hand chopped to bits in the chopping machine . So [they]3918-they told [me]0-i . [I]0-i liked [Tom]409-tom for [his]409-tom handsome bearing and [his]409-tom fresh , winsome way . [He]409-tom was exceedingly manly : that is to say [he]409-tom did not dream of questioning or analysing anything . All that came [his]409-tom way was ready labelled nice or nasty , good or bad . [He]409-tom did not imagine that anything could be other than just what it appeared to be : and with this appearance , [he]409-tom was quite content . [He]409-tom looked up to [Emily]109-emily as one wiser , nobler , nearer to [God]171-god than [himself]409-tom .

" [I]109-emily am a thousand years older than [he]409-tom , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said to [me]0-i , laughing . " Just as [you]409-tom are centuries older than [I.]109-emily "[109-emily]

" Yes , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily replied . " For that and [he]409-tom is wonderfully sagacious and so gentle . "[109-emily]

" And [I]0-i was never gentle , was [I]0-i ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" No ! As restless and as urgent as the wind , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said , and [I]0-i saw a last flicker of the old terror .

" Where is [George]313-lettie ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" In bed , "[109-emily] [she]109-emily replies briefly . " [He]313-lettie 's recovering from one of [his]313-lettie orgies . If [I]109-emily were [Meg]114-meg [I]109-emily would not live with [him]313-lettie . "[109-emily]

" And how are [you]470-the maid going on ? "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie asked [me]0-i .

" [I]313-lettie ? Oh , very well ! And [you]470-the maid ? "[313-lettie]

" As [I]0-i am very sorry to see , "[0-i] [I]0-i rejoined .

[He]313-lettie sat forward with [his]313-lettie elbows on [his]313-lettie knees , tapping the back of [his]313-lettie hand with one finger , in monotonous two - pulse like heart - beats .

" Are n't [you]313-lettie going to have breakfast ? "[0-i] [I]0-i urged . The clock at that moment began to ring a sonorous twelve . [He]313-lettie looked up at it with subdued irritation .

" Ay , [I]313-lettie suppose so , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie answered [me]0-i , when the clock had finished striking . [He]313-lettie rose heavily and went to the table . As [he]313-lettie poured out a cup of tea [he]313-lettie spilled it on the cloth , and stood looking at the stain . It was still some time before [he]313-lettie began to eat . [He]313-lettie poured vinegar freely over the hot fish , and ate with an indifference that made eating ugly , pausing now and again to wipe the tea off [his]313-lettie moustache , or to pick a bit of fish from off [his]313-lettie knee .

" [You]0-i are not married , [I]313-lettie suppose ? "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie said in one of [his]313-lettie pauses .

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " [I]0-i expect [I]0-i shall have to be looking round . "[0-i]

" [You]0-i 're wiser not , "[313-lettie] [he]313-lettie replied , quiet and bitter .
