But [he]313-lettie ate no more breakfast , even after [the maid]470-the maid had brought the knife and [his]313-lettie slippers , and though [he]313-lettie had had but a few mouthfuls .

[The maid]470-the maid , however , folded the cloth and went out without approaching the windows .

[Meg]114-meg had grown stouter , and there was a certain immovable confidence in [her]114-meg . [She]114-meg was authoritative , amiable , calm . " But come ! "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

[His]3962-he eyes were heavy and as [he]3962-he lifted them to [me]0-i , seemed to recoil in an agony of shame .

CHAPTER VII

[A PROSPECT AMONG THE MARSHES OF LETHE

George]414-a prospect among the marshes of lethe george steadily declined from this time . [I]0-i went to see [him]3962-he two years later . [He]3962-he was not at [home]4184-home . [Meg]114-meg wept to [me]0-i as [she]114-meg told [me]0-i of [him]3962-he , how [he]3962-he let the business slip , how [he]3962-he drank , what a brute [he]3962-he was in drink , and how unbearable afterwards . [He]3962-he was ruining [his]3962-he constitution , [he]3962-he was ruining [her]114-meg life and [the children]4276-the children 's . [I]0-i felt very sorry for [her]114-meg as [she]114-meg sat , large and ruddy , brimming over with bitter tears . [She]114-meg asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i did not think [I]0-i might influence [him]3962-he . [He]3962-he was , [she]114-meg said , at the " Ram . As soon as [I]0-i could , after reading [Alice]218-alice 's letter , [I]0-i went down to [Eberwich]6-eberwich to see how things were . Memories of the old days came over [me]0-i again till [my]0-i heart hungered for [its old people]4015-its old people .

[They]4015-its old people told [me]0-i at the " Hollies "[4015-its old people] that , after a bad attack of delirium tremens , [George]108-george had been sent to [Papplewick]103-papplewick in [the lonely country]4016-the lonely country to stay with [Emily]109-emily . [I]0-i borrowed [a bicycle]4017-a bicycle to ride the nine miles . The summer had been wet , and everything was late . At the end of September the foliage was heavy green , and the wheat stood dejectedly in stook . [I]0-i rode through the still sweetness of an autumn morning . The mist was folded blue along the hedges ; the elm trees loomed up along the dim walls of the morning , the horse - chestnut trees at hand flickered with a few yellow leaves like bright blossoms . As [I]0-i rode through the tree tunnel by [the church]4201-the church where , on [his]4019-his last night , [the keeper]1156-the keeper had told [me]0-i [his]4019-his story , [I]0-i smelled the cold rotting of the leaves of the cloudy summer .

[I]0-i passed silently through [the lanes]1638-the lanes , where the chill grass was weighed down with grey - blue seed - pearls of dew in the shadow , where the wet woollen spider - cloths of autumn were spread as on a loom . [I]0-i heard the far - off hooting of the " loose - all "[0-i] at [the pits]4022-the pits , telling [me]0-i it was half - past eleven , that [the men]1214-the men and [boys]4691-boys would be sitting in the narrow darkness of [the mines]4025-the mines eating [their]1214-the men ' snap , " while shadowy mice darted for the crumbs , and [the boys]3019-the boys laughed with red mouths rimmed with grime , as the bold little creatures peeped at [them]3019-the boys in the dim light of the lamps . A small smile of relief came on [his]108-george face , and [he]108-george put out [his]108-george hand from the bed . [He]108-george lay with the disorderly clothes pulled up to [his]108-george chin . [His]108-george face was discoloured and rather bloated , [his]108-george nose swollen .

" Do n't [you]108-george feel so well this morning ? "[109-emily] asked [Emily]109-emily , softening with pity when [she]109-emily came into contact with [his]108-george sickness .

" Oh , all right , "[108-george] [he]108-george replied , wishing only to get rid of [us]4069-us .

" [You]108-george should try to get up a bit , it 's a beautiful morning , warm and soft "[109-emily] [she]109-emily said gently . [He]108-george did not reply , and [she]109-emily went [downstairs]639-downstairs .

[I]0-i looked round to [the cold , whitewashed room]4071-the cold , whitewashed room , with [its]4071-the cold , whitewashed room ceiling curving and sloping down the walls . [It]4071-the cold , whitewashed room was sparsely furnished , and bare of even the slightest ornament . The only things of warm colour were the cow and horse skins on the floor . All the rest was white or grey or drab . On one side , the roof sloped down so that the window was below [my]0-i knees , and nearly touching the floor , on the other side was a larger window , breast high . Through [it]4072-it one could see the jumbled , ruddy roofs of [the sheds]4073-the sheds and the skies . The tiles were shining with patches of vivid orange lichen . Beyond was [the corn - field]4074-the corn - field , and [the men]1214-the men , small in the distance , lifting the sheaves on [the cart]1628-the cart .

" [You]108-george will come back to farming again , wo n't [you]108-george ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]108-george , turning to the bed . [He]108-george smiled .

" [I]108-george do n't know , "[108-george] [he]108-george answered dully .

" Would [you]108-george rather [I]0-i went [downstairs]639-downstairs ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" No , [I]108-george 'm glad to see [you]0-i , "[108-george] [he]108-george replied , in the same uneasy fashion .

" [I]0-i 've only just come back from [France]45-france , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Ah ! "[108-george] [he]108-george replied , indifferent .

" [I]0-i am sorry [you]108-george 're ill , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

[He]108-george stared unmovedly at the opposite wall . [I]0-i went to the window and looked out . After some time , [I]0-i compelled [myself]0-i to say , in a casual manner :

" Wo n't [you]108-george get up and come out a bit ? "[0-i]

" [I]108-george suppose Is'll have to , "[108-george] [he]108-george said , gathering [himself]108-george slowly together for the effort . [He]108-george pushed [himself]108-george up in bed .

When [he]108-george took off the jacket of [his]108-george pajamas to wash [himself]108-george [I]0-i turned away . [His]108-george arms seemed thin , and [he]108-george had bellied , and was bowed and unsightly . [I]0-i remembered the morning [we]4077-we swam in [the mill - pond]422-the mill - pond . [I]0-i remembered that [he]108-george was now in the prime of [his]108-george life . [I]0-i looked at [his]108-george bluish feeble hands as [he]108-george laboriously washed [himself]108-george . The soap once slipped from [his]108-george fingers as [he]108-george was picking it up , and fell , rattling the pot loudly . It startled [us]4077-we , and [he]108-george seemed to grip the sides of the washstand to steady [himself]108-george . Then [he]108-george went on with [his]108-george slow , painful toilet . As [he]108-george combed [his]108-george hair [he]108-george looked at [himself]108-george with dull eyes of shame .

[The men]1214-the men were coming in from [the scullery]602-the scullery when [we]4077-we got [downstairs]639-downstairs . Dinner was smoking on the table . [I]0-i shook hands with [Tom Renshaw]409-tom , and with [the old man]663-the old man 's hard , fierce left hand . Then [I]0-i was introduced to [Arthur Renshaw]420-arthur , [a clean - faced , large , bashful lad of twenty]4083-a clean - faced , large , bashful lad of twenty . [I]0-i nodded to [the man]655-the man , [Jim]396-jim , and to [[Jim]396-jim 's wife]4085-jim 's wife , [Annie]111-annie . [We]4077-we all sat down to table .

" Well , an ' ' ow are [ter]108-george feelin ' by now , like ? "[663-the old man] asked [the old man]663-the old man heartily of [George]108-george . Receiving no answer , [he]663-the old man continued , " [Tha]108-george should ' a gor up an ' com ' an ' gen [us]4077-we a ' and wi ' th ' wheat , it ' ud ' a done [thee]108-george good . "[663-the old man]

" [You]663-the old man will have a bit of this mutton , wo n't [you]663-the old man ? "[409-tom] [Tom]409-tom asked [him]663-the old man , tapping the joint with the carving knife . [George]108-george shook [his]108-george head .

" It 's quite lean and tender , "[108-george] [he]108-george said gently .

" No , thanks , "[108-george] said [George]108-george .

" Gi'e ' [i]663-the old man m a bit , gi'e ' [i]663-the old man m a bit ! "[663-the old man] cried [the old man]663-the old man . " It 'll do ' [i]663-the old man m good it 's what ' [e]108-george wants , a bit o ' strengthenin ' nourishment . "[663-the old man]

" It 's no good if [his]108-george stomach wo n't have it , "[409-tom] said [Tom]409-tom , in mild reproof , as if [he]409-tom were speaking of [a child]1035-a child . [Arthur]420-arthur filled [George]108-george 's glass with beer without speaking . [The two young men]4089-the two young men were full of kind , gentle attention .

" Let ' [i]663-the old man m ' a'e a spoonful o ' tonnup then , "[663-the old man] persisted [the old man]663-the old man . " [I]663-the old man canna eat while ' is plate stands there emp'y . "[663-the old man]

So [they]4089-the two young men put turnip and onion sauce on [George]108-george 's plate , and [he]108-george took up [his]108-george fork and tasted a few mouthfuls . [The men]1214-the men ate largely , and with zest . The sight of [their]1214-the men grand satisfaction , amounting almost to gusto , sickened [him]108-george .

When at last [the old man]663-the old man laid down the dessert spoon which [he]663-the old man used in place of a knife and fork , [he]663-the old man looked again at [George]108-george 's plate , and said :

" Why tha ' asna aten a smite , not a smite ! [Tha]5750-tha non goos th ' raight road to be better . "[663-the old man]

[George]108-george maintained a stupid silence .

" Do n't bother [him]108-george , [father]4145-father , "[109-emily] said [Emily]109-emily .

" Tha art an Å²wd whittle , [feyther]5752-feyther , "[409-tom] added [Tom]409-tom , smiling good - naturedly . [He]409-tom spoke to [[his]409-tom father]630-his father in dialect , but to [Emily]109-emily in good English . Whatever [she]109-emily said had [Tom]409-tom 's immediate support . Before serving [us]4094-us with pie , [Emily]109-emily gave [[her]109-emily brother]479-her brother junket and damsons , setting the plate and the spoon before [him]479-her brother as if [he]479-her brother were [a child]1035-a child . For this act of grace [Tom]409-tom looked at [her]109-emily lovingly , and stroked [her]109-emily hand as [she]109-emily passed .

After dinner , [George]108-george said , with a miserable struggle for an indifferent tone :

" Are n't [you]409-tom going to give [Cyril]113-cyril a glass of whisky ? "[108-george]

[He]108-george looked up furtively , in a conflict of shame and hope . A silence fell on [the room]518-the room .

" Ay ! "[663-the old man] said [the old man]663-the old man softly . " Let ' [i]663-the old man m ' ave a drop . "[663-the old man]

" Yes ! "[409-tom] added [Tom]409-tom , in submissive pleading .

[All the men in [the room]518-the room]4099-all the men in the room shrank a little , awaiting the verdict of [the woman]813-the woman .

" [I]813-the woman do n't know , "[813-the woman] [she]813-the woman said clearly , " that [Cyril]113-cyril wants a glass . "[813-the woman]

" [I]0-i do n't mind . "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , feeling [myself]0-i blush . [I]0-i had not the courage to counteract [her]813-the woman will directly . Not even [the old man]663-the old man had that courage . [We]4103-we waited in suspense . After keeping [us]4103-we so for a few minutes , while [we]4103-we smouldered with mortification , [she]813-the woman went into [another room]5707-another room , and [we]4103-we heard [her]813-the woman unlocking a door . [She]813-the woman returned with a decanter containing rather less than half a pint of liquor . [She]813-the woman put out five tumblers .

" [Tha]328-tha nedna gi'e [me]663-the old man none , "[663-the old man] said [the old man]663-the old man . " Ah'm non [a proud chap]5753-a proud chap . [Ah'm]328-tha not . "[663-the old man]

" Nor [me]420-arthur neither , "[420-arthur] said [Arthur]420-arthur .

" [You]663-the old man will [Tom]409-tom ? "[813-the woman] [she]813-the woman asked .

" Do [you]409-tom want [me]663-the old man to ? "[663-the old man] [he]663-the old man replied , smiling .

" [I]813-the woman do n't , "[813-the woman] [she]813-the woman answered sharply . " [I]813-the woman want [nobody]4176-nobody to have it , when [you]409-tom look at the results of it . But if [Cyril]113-cyril is having a glass , [you]409-tom may as well have one with [him]113-cyril . "[813-the woman]

[Tom]409-tom was pleased with [her]813-the woman . [She]813-the woman gave [[her]813-the woman husband]677-her husband and [me]0-i fairly stiff glasses .

" Steady , steady ! "[663-the old man] [he]663-the old man said . " Give that [George]108-george , and give [me]663-the old man not so much . Two fingers , two of [your]663-the old man fingers , [you]663-the old man know . "[663-the old man]

But [she]813-the woman passed [him]663-the old man the glass . When [George]108-george had had [his]108-george share , there remained but a drop in the decanter .

[Emily]109-emily watched [the drunkard]4107-the drunkard coldly as [he]4107-the drunkard took this remainder .

[George]108-george and [I]0-i talked for a time while [the men]1214-the men smoked . [He]663-the old man , from [his]663-the old man glum stupidity , broke into a harsh , almost imbecile loquacity .

" Have [you]0-i seen [[my]663-the old man family]5755-my family lately ? "[663-the old man] [he]663-the old man asked , continuing . " Yes ! Not badly set up , are [they]5755-my family , [the children]4276-the children ? But [the little devils]5757-the little devils are soft , mard - soft , every one of 'em . It 's [[their]5757-the little devils mother]1446-their mother 's bringin ' up [she]1446-their mother marded ['em]5759-'em till [they]5757-the little devils were soft , an ' would never let [me]663-the old man have a say in it . [I]663-the old man should ' a brought 'em up different , [you]0-i know [I]663-the old man should . "[663-the old man]

[Tom]409-tom looked at [Emily]109-emily , and , remarking [her]109-emily angry contempt , suggested that [she]109-emily should go out with [him]663-the old man to look at [the stacks]4109-the stacks . [I]0-i watched [the tall , square - shouldered man]4110-the tall , square - shouldered man leaning with deference and tenderness towards [[his]4110-the tall , square - shouldered man wife]468-his wife as [she]468-his wife walked calmly at [his]4110-the tall , square - shouldered man side . [She]468-his wife was [the mistress]4112-the mistress , quiet and self - assured , [he]4110-the tall , square - shouldered man [[her]468-his wife rejoiced husband]4113-her rejoiced husband and [servant]4114-servant .

[George]108-george was talking about [himself]108-george . If [I]0-i had not seen [him]108-george , [I]0-i should hardly have recognised the words as [his]108-george . [He]108-george was lamentably decayed . [He]108-george talked stupidly , with vulgar contumely of [others]3618-others , and in weak praise of [himself]108-george .

[The old man]663-the old man rose , with a :

" Well , [I]1214-the men suppose [we]4119-we mun ma'e another dag at it , "[1214-the men] and [the men]1214-the men left [the house]563-the house .

[George]108-george continued [his]108-george foolish , harsh monologue , making gestures of emphasis with [his]108-george head and [his]108-george hands . [He]108-george continued when [we]4119-we were walking round [the buildings]1136-the buildings into [the fields]955-the fields , the same babble of bragging and abuse . [I]0-i was wearied and disgusted . [He]108-george looked , and [he]108-george sounded , so worthless .

Across [the empty cornfield]4122-the empty cornfield the partridges were running . [We]4119-we walked through the September haze slowly , because [he]108-george was feeble on [his]108-george legs . As [he]108-george became tired [he]108-george ceased to talk . [We]4119-we leaned for some time on a gate , in the brief glow of the transient afternoon , and [he]108-george was stupid again . [He]108-george did not notice the brown haste of the partridges , [he]108-george did not care to share with [me]0-i the handful of ripe blackberries , and when [I]0-i pulled the bryony ropes off the hedges , and held the great knots of red and green berries in [my]0-i hand , [he]108-george glanced at them without interest or appreciation .

" Poison - berries , are n't they ? "[108-george] [he]108-george said dully .

Like a tree that is falling , going soft and pale and rotten , clammy with small fungi , [he]108-george stood leaning against the gate , while the dim afternoon drifted with a flow of thick sweet sunshine past [him]108-george , not touching [him]108-george .

In [the stackyard]4034-the stackyard , the summer 's splendid monuments of wheat and grass were reared in gold and grey . The wheat was littered brightly round the rising stack . [The loaded wagon]4124-the loaded wagon clanked slowly up the incline , drew near , and rode like [a ship]4125-a ship at anchor against the scotches , brushing the stack with a crisp , sharp sound . [Tom]409-tom climbed the ladder and stood a moment there against the sky , amid the brightness and fragrance of the gold corn , and waved [his]409-tom arm to [[his]409-tom wife who was passing in the shadow of [the building]1401-the building]4126-his wife who was passing in the shadow of the building . Then [Arthur]420-arthur began to lift the sheaves to the stack , and [the two men]494-the two men worked in an exquisite , subtle rhythm , [their]494-the two men white sleeves and [their]494-the two men dark heads gleaming , moving against the mild sky and the corn . The silence was broken only by the occasional lurch of the body of [the wagon]4129-the wagon , as [the teamer]4130-the teamer stepped to the front , or again to the rear of the load . Occasionally [I]0-i could catch the blue glitter of the prongs of the forks . [Tom]409-tom , now lifted high above the small wagon load , called to [[his]409-tom brother]4289-his brother some question about [the stack]4132-the stack . The sound of [his]409-tom voice was strong and mellow .

[I]0-i turned to [George]108-george , who also was watching , and said :

" [You]409-tom ought to be like that . "[108-george]

[We]4133-we heard [Tom]409-tom calling , " All right ! "[409-tom] and saw [him]409-tom standing high up on the tallest corner of the stack , as on the prow of [a ship]4125-a ship .

[George]108-george watched , and [his]108-george face slowly gathered expression . [He]108-george turned to [me]0-i , [his]108-george dark eyes alive with horror and despair .

" [I]108-george shall soon be out of [everybody]1611-everybody 's way ! "[108-george] [he]108-george said . [His]108-george moment of fear and despair was cruel . [I]0-i cursed [myself]0-i for having roused [him]108-george from [his]108-george stupor .

" [You]108-george will be better , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

[He]108-george watched again the handsome movement of [the men at the stack]4135-the men at the stack .

" [I]108-george could n't team ten sheaves , "[108-george] [he]108-george said .

" [You]108-george will in a month or two , "[0-i] [I]0-i urged .

[He]108-george continued to watch , while [Tom]409-tom got on the ladder and came down the front of the stack .

" Nay , the sooner [I]108-george clear out , the better , "[108-george] [he]108-george repeated to [himself]108-george .

When [we]4136-we went in to tea , [he]108-george was , as [Tom]409-tom said , " downcast . "[409-tom] [The men]1214-the men talked uneasily with abated voices . [Emily]109-emily attended to [him]108-george with a little , palpitating solicitude . [We]4136-we were all uncomfortably impressed with the sense of [our]4136-we alienation from [him]108-george . [He]108-george sat apart and obscure among [us]4136-we , like [a condemned man]4138-a condemned man .

[[THE END]4139-the end]4139-the end
